title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: And they made their sons and their daughters go through the fire, and they made use of secret arts and unnatural powers, and gave themselves up to doing evil in the eyes of the Lord, till he was moved to wrath.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: So the Lord was very angry with Israel, and his face was turned away from them: only the tribe of Judah kept its place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: (But even Judah did not keep the orders of the Lord their God, but were guided by the rules which Israel had made.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: So the Lord would have nothing to do with all the offspring of Israel, and sent trouble on them, and gave them up into the hands of their attackers, till he had sent them away from before his face.)

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 21
text: For Israel was broken off from the family of David, and they made Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, king, who, driving them away from the laws of the Lord, made them do a great sin.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: And the children of Israel went on with all the sins which Jeroboam did; they did not keep themselves from them;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: Till the Lord put Israel away from before his face, as he had said by all his servants the prophets. So Israel was taken away from their land to Assyria, to this day.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: Then the king of Assyria took men from Babylon and from Cuthah and Avva and Hamath and Sepharvaim, and put them in the towns of Samaria in place of the children of Israel; so they got Samaria for their heritage, living in its towns.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 25
text: Now when first they were living there they did not give worship to the Lord. So the Lord sent lions among them, causing the death of some of them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 26
text: So they said to the king of Assyria, The nations whom you have taken as prisoners and put in the towns of Samaria, have no knowledge of the way of the god of the land: so he has sent lions among them, causing their death, because they have no knowledge of his way.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 27
text: Then the king of Assyria gave orders, saying, Send there one of the priests whom you took away, and let him be living there and teaching the people the way of the god of the land.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 28
text: So one of the priests whom they had taken away as a prisoner from Samaria came back, and, living in Beth-el, became their teacher in the worship of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 29
text: And every nation made gods for themselves, and put them in the houses of the high places which the Samaritans had made, every nation in the towns where they were living.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 30
text: The men of Babylon made Succoth-benoth, and the men of Cuth made Nergal, and the men of Hamath made Ashima,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 31
text: The Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak, and the Sepharvites gave their children to be burned in the fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 32
text: So they went on worshipping the Lord, and made for themselves, from among all the people, priests for the high places, to make offerings for them in the houses of the high places.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 33
text: They gave worship to the Lord, but they gave honour to their gods like the nations did from whom they had been taken as prisoners.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 34
text: So to this day they go on in their old ways, not worshipping the Lord or keeping his orders or his ways or the law and the rule which the Lord gave to the children of Jacob, to whom he gave the name Israel;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 35
text: And the Lord made an agreement with them and gave them orders, saying, You are to have no other gods; you are not to give worship to them or be their servants or make them offerings:

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 36
text: But the Lord, who took you out of the land of Egypt with his great power and his outstretched arm, he is your God, to whom you are to give worship and make offerings:

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 37
text: And the rules and the orders and the law which he put in writing for you, you are to keep and do for ever; you are to have no other gods.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 38
text: And you are to keep in memory the agreement which I have made with you; and you are to have no other gods.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 39
text: And you are to give worship to the Lord your God; for it is he who will give you salvation from the hands of all who are against you.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 40
text: But they gave no attention, but went on in their old way.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 17 Verse 41
text: So these nations, worshipping the Lord, still were servants to the images they had made; their children and their children's children did the same; as their fathers did, so do they, to this day.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: Now in the third year of Hoshea, son of Elah, king of Israel, Hezekiah, the son of Ahaz, became king of Judah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, ruling in Jerusalem for twenty-nine years; his mother's name was Abi, the daughter of Zechariah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord as David his father had done.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: He had the high places taken away, and the stone pillars broken to bits, and the Asherah cut down; and the brass snake which Moses had made was crushed to powder at his order, because in those days the children of Israel had offerings burned before it, and he gave it the name Nehushtan.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: He had faith in the Lord, the God of Israel; so that there was no one like him among all the kings of Judah who were before him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: For his heart was fixed on the Lord, not turning from his ways, and he did his orders which the Lord gave to Moses.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: And the Lord was with him; he did well in all his undertakings: and he took up arms against the king of Assyria and was his servant no longer.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: He overcame the Philistines as far as Gaza and its limits, from the tower of the watchman to the walled town.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: Now in the fourth year of King Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of Hoshea, son of Elah, king of Israel, Shalmaneser, king of Assyria, came up against Samaria, shutting it in with his armies.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: And at the end of three years they took it; in the sixth year of Hezekiah's rule, which was the ninth year of Hoshea, king of Israel, Samaria was taken.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: And the king of Assyria took Israel away as prisoners into Assyria, placing them in Halah and in Habor on the river Gozan, and in the towns of the Medes;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: Because they did not give ear to the voice of the Lord their God, but went against his agreement, even against everything ordered by Moses, the servant of the Lord, and they did not give ear to it or do it.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, Sennacherib, king of Assyria, came up against all the walled towns of Judah and took them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: And Hezekiah, king of Judah, sent to Lachish, to the king of Assyria, saying, I have done wrong; give up attacking me, and whatever you put on me I will undergo. And the payment he was to make was fixed by the king of Assyria at three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: So Hezekiah gave him all the silver in the house of the Lord, and in the king's store-house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: And at that time Hezekiah had the gold from the doors of the Lord's house, and from the door-pillars plated by him, cut off and gave it to the king of Assyria.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: Then the king of Assyria sent the Tartan and the Rab-saris and the Rab-shakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem, to King Hezekiah, with a strong force. And they went up and came to Jerusalem, and took up their position by the stream of the higher pool, by the highway of the washerman's field.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: And they sent for the king, and Eliakim, the son of Hilkiah, who was over the house, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder, came out to them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: And the Rab-shakeh said to them, Say now to Hezekiah, These are the words of the great king, the king of Assyria: In what are you placing your hope?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: You say you have a design, and strength for war, but these are only words. Now to whom are you looking for support, that you have gone against my authority?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: See, now, you are basing your hope on that broken rod of Egypt, which will go through a man's hand if he makes use of it for a support; for so is Pharaoh, king of Egypt, to all who put their faith in him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: And if you say to me, Our hope is in the Lord our God: is it not he, whose high places and altars Hezekiah has taken away, saying to Judah and Jerusalem that worship may only be given before this altar in Jerusalem?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: And now, take a chance with my master, the king of Assyria, and I will give you two thousand horses, if you are able to put horsemen on them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: How then may you put to shame the least of my master's servants? and you have put your hope in Egypt for war-carriages and horsemen:

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: And have I now come up to send destruction on this place without the Lord's authority? It was the Lord himself who said to me, Go up against this land and make it waste.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: Then Eliakim, the son of Hilkiah, and Shebna and Joah said to the Rab-shakeh, Will you kindly make use of the Aramaean language in talking to your servants, for we are used to it, and do not make use of the Jews' language in the hearing of the people on the wall.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: But the Rab-shakeh said to them, Is it to your master or to you that my master has sent me to say these words? has he not sent me to the men seated on the wall? for they are the people who will be short of food with you when the town is shut in.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: Then the Rab-shakeh got up and said with a loud voice in the Jews' language, Give ear to the words of the great king, the king of Assyria;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: This is what the king says: Do not be tricked by Hezekiah, for there is no salvation for you in him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: And do not let Hezekiah make you put your faith in the Lord, saying, The Lord will certainly keep us safe, and this town will not be given into the hands of the king of Assyria.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 31
text: Do not give ear to Hezekiah, for this is what the king of Assyria says: Make peace with me and come out to me; and everyone will be free to take the fruit of his vine and of his fig-tree, and the water of his spring;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 32
text: Till I come and take you away to a land like yours, a land of grain and wine, a land of bread and vine-gardens, a land of oil-giving olives and of honey, so that life and not death may be your fate. Give no attention to Hezekiah when he says to you, The Lord will keep us safe.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 33
text: Has any one of the gods of the nations kept his land from falling into the hands of the king of Assyria?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 34
text: Where are the gods of Hamath and of Arpad? where are the gods of Sepharvaim, of Hena and Ivvah? have they kept Samaria out of my hands?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 35
text: Who among all the gods of these countries have kept their country from falling into my hands, to give cause for the thought that the Lord will keep Jerusalem from falling into my hands?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 36
text: But the people kept quiet and gave him no answer: for the king's order was, Give him no answer.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 18 Verse 37
text: Then Eliakim, the son of Hilkiah, who was over the house, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder, came to Hezekiah, with their clothing parted as a sign of grief, and gave him an account of what the Rab-shakeh had said.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: And on hearing it, King Hezekiah took off his robe, and put on haircloth, and went into the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And he sent Eliakim, who was over the house, and Shebna the scribe, and the chief priests, dressed in haircloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: And they said to him, Hezekiah says, This day is a day of trouble and punishment and shame; for the children are ready to come to birth, but there is no strength to give birth to them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: It may be that the Lord your God will give ear to the words of the Rab-shakeh, whom the king of Assyria, his master, sent to say evil things against the living God, and will make his words come to nothing: so then make your prayer for the rest of the people.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: So the servants of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: And Isaiah said to them, This is what you are to say to your master: The Lord says, Be not troubled by the words which the servants of the king of Assyria have said against me in your hearing.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: See, I will put a spirit into him, and bad news will come to his ears, and he will go back to his land; and there I will have him put to death by the sword.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: So the Rab-shakeh went back, and when he got there the king of Assyria was making war against Libnah, for it had come to his ears that he had gone away from Lachish.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: And when news came to him that Tirhakah, king of Ethiopia, had made an attack on him, he sent representatives to Hezekiah again, saying,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: This is what you are to say to Hezekiah, king of Judah: Let not your God, in whom is your faith, give you a false hope, saying, Jerusalem will not be given into the hands of the king of Assyria.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: No doubt the story has come to your ears of what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands, putting them to the curse; and will you be kept safe?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: Did the gods of the nations keep safe those on whom my fathers sent destruction, Gozan and Haran and Rezeph and the children of Eden who were in Telassar?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the town of Sepharvaim, of Hena and of Ivvah?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: And Hezekiah took the letter from the hands of those who had come with it; and after reading it, Hezekiah went up to the house of the Lord, opening the letter there before the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: And Hezekiah made his prayer to the Lord, saying, O Lord, the God of Israel, seated between the winged ones, you only are the God of all the kingdoms of the earth; you have made heaven and earth.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: Let your ear be turned to us, O Lord, and let your eyes be open, O Lord, and see; take note of all the words of Sennacherib who has sent men to say evil against the living God.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: Truly, O Lord, the kings of Assyria have made waste the nations and their lands,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: And have given their gods to the fire; for they were no gods, but wood and stone, the work of men's hands; so they have given them to destruction.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: But now, O Lord our God, give us salvation from his hands, so that it may be clear to all the kingdoms of the earth that you and only you, O Lord, are God.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: Then Isaiah, the son of Amoz, sent to Hezekiah, saying, The Lord, the God of Israel, says, The prayer which you have made to me against Sennacherib, king of Assyria, has come to my ears.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: This is the word which the Lord has said about him: In the eyes of the virgin daughter of Zion you are shamed and laughed at; the daughter of Jerusalem has made sport of you.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: Against whom have you said evil and bitter things? against whom has your voice been loud and your eyes lifted up? even against the Holy One of Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: You have sent your servants with evil words against the Lord, and have said, With all my war-carriages I have come up to the top of the mountains, to the inmost parts of Lebanon; its tall cedars will be cut down, and the best trees of its woods; I will come up into his highest places, into his thick woods.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: I have made water-holes and taken their waters, and with my foot I have made all the rivers of Egypt dry.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: Has it not come to your ears how I did it long before, purposing it in times long past? Now I have given effect to my design, so that by you strong towns might be turned into masses of broken walls.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 26
text: This is why their townsmen had no power, they were broken and put to shame; they were like the grass of the field and the green plant, like grass on the house-tops.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 27
text: But I have knowledge of your getting up and your resting, of your going out and your coming in.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 28
text: Because your wrath against me and your words of pride have come up to my ears, I will put my hook in your nose and my cord in your lips, and I will make you go back by the way you came.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 29
text: And this will be the sign to you: you will get your food this year from what comes up of itself; and in the second year from the produce of the same; and in the third year you will put in your seed and get in the grain and make vine-gardens and take of their fruit.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 30
text: And those of Judah who are still living will again take root in the earth and give fruit.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 31
text: For from Jerusalem those who have been kept safe will go out, and those who are still living will go out of Mount Zion: by the fixed purpose of the Lord of armies this will be done.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 32
text: For this cause the Lord says about the king of Assyria, He will not come into this town, or send an arrow against it; he will not come before it with arms, or put up an earthwork against it;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 33
text: By the way he came he will go back, and he will not get into this town, says the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 34
text: For I will keep this town safe, for my honour, and for the honour of my servant David.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 35
text: And that night the angel of the Lord went out and put to death in the army of the Assyrians a hundred and eighty-five thousand men; and when the people got up early in the morning, there was nothing to be seen but dead bodies.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 36
text: So Sennacherib, king of Assyria, went back to his place at Nineveh.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 19 Verse 37
text: And it came about, when he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer put him to death with the sword; and they went in flight into the land of Ararat. And Esar-haddon his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: In those days Hezekiah was ill and near death. And Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, came to him, and said to him, The Lord says, Put your house in order, for your death is near.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: Then, turning his face to the wall, he made his prayer to the Lord, saying,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: O Lord, keep in mind how I have been true to you with all my heart, and have done what is good in your eyes. And Hezekiah gave way to bitter weeping.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: Now before Isaiah had gone out of the middle of the town, the word of the Lord came to him, saying,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: Go back and say to Hezekiah, the ruler of my people, The Lord, the God of David your father, says, Your prayer has come to my ears, and I have seen your weeping; see, I will make you well: on the third day you will go up to the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: I will give you fifteen more years of life; and I will keep you and this town safe from the hands of the king of Assyria; I will keep this town safe, for my honour, and for the honour of my servant David.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: Then Isaiah said, Take a cake of figs. So they took it and put it on his wound, and he got better.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: And Hezekiah said to Isaiah, What is to be the sign that the Lord will make me well, and that I will go up to the house of the Lord on the third day?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: And Isaiah said, This is the sign the Lord will give you, that he will do what he has said; will the shade go forward ten degrees or back?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: And Hezekiah said in answer, It is a simple thing for the shade to go forward; but let it go back ten degrees.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: Then Isaiah the prophet made prayer to the Lord, and he made the shade go back ten degrees from its position on the steps of Ahaz.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: At that time, Merodach-baladan, the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters with an offering to Hezekiah, because he had news that Hezekiah had been ill.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: And Hezekiah was glad at their coming and let them see all his store of wealth, the silver and the gold and the spices and the oil of great price, and the house of his arms, and everything there was in his stores; there was nothing in all his house or his kingdom which Hezekiah did not let them see.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: Then Isaiah the prophet came to King Hezekiah and said to him, What did these men say and where did they come from? And Hezekiah said, They came from a far country, even from Babylon.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: And he said, What have they seen in your house? And Hezekiah said in answer, They saw everything in my house: there is nothing among my stores which I did not let them see.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: And Isaiah said to Hezekiah, Give ear to the word of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: Truly, days are coming when everything in your house, and whatever your fathers have put in store till this day, will be taken away to Babylon: all will be gone, says the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: And your sons, the offspring of your body, they will take away to be unsexed servants in the house of the king of Babylon.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, Good is the word of the Lord which you have said. Then he said, ... if in my time there is peace and righteousness?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and his power, and how he made the pool and the stream, to take water into the town, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Judah?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: And Hezekiah went to rest with his fathers; and Manasseh his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: Manasseh was twelve years old when he became king; for fifty-five years he was ruling in Jerusalem; and his mother's name was Hephzi-bah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, copying the disgusting ways of those nations whom the Lord had sent out before the children of Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: He put up again the high places which had been pulled down by Hezekiah his father; he made altars for Baal, and an Asherah, as Ahab, king of Israel, had done; he was a worshipper and servant of all the stars of heaven.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: And he put up altars in the house of the Lord, of which the Lord had said, In Jerusalem will I put my name.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: And he put up altars for all the stars of heaven in the two outer squares of the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: And he made his son go through the fire, and made use of secret arts and signs for reading the future; he gave positions to those who had control of spirits and to wonder-workers; he did much evil in the eyes of the Lord, moving him to wrath.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: He put the image of Asherah which he had made in the house of which the Lord had said to David and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, the town which I have made mine out of all the tribes of Israel, I will put my name for ever.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: And never again will I send the feet of Israel wandering from the land which I gave to their fathers; if only they will take care to do all my orders, and keep all the law which my servant Moses gave them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: But they did not give ear; and Manasseh made them do more evil than those nations did, whom the Lord gave up to destruction before the children of Israel.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: And the Lord said, by his servants the prophets,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: Because Manasseh, king of Judah, has done these disgusting things, doing more evil than all the Amorites before him, and making Judah do evil with his false gods,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: For this cause, says the Lord, the God of Israel, I will send such evil on Jerusalem and Judah that the ears of all to whom the news comes will be burning.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: And over Jerusalem will be stretched the line of Samaria and the weight of Ahab; Jerusalem will be washed clean as a plate is washed, and turned over on its face.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: And I will put away from me the rest of my heritage, and give them up into the hands of their haters, who will take their property and their goods for themselves;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: Because they have done evil in my eyes, moving me to wrath, from the day when their fathers came out of Egypt till this day.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: More than this, Manasseh took the lives of upright men, till Jerusalem from one end to the other was full of blood; in addition to his sin in making Judah do evil in the eyes of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and all he did, and his sins, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Judah?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: So Manasseh went to rest with his fathers, and was put into the earth in the garden of his house, in the garden of Uzza; and Amon his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: Amon was twenty-two years old when he became king, ruling in Jerusalem for two years; his mother's name was Meshullemeth, the daughter of Haruz of Jotbah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, as Manasseh his father had done.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: He went in all the ways of his father, being a servant and worshipper of the false gods to which his father had been a servant;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: Turning away from the Lord, the God of his fathers, and not walking in his ways.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: And the servants of Amon made a secret design against him, and put the king to death in his house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: But the people of the land put to death all those who had taken part in the design against the king, and made Josiah his son king in his place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: Now the rest of the acts which Amon did, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Judah?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 21 Verse 26
text: He was put in his last resting-place in the garden of Uzza, and Josiah his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: Josiah was eight years old when he became king; and he was ruling in Jerusalem for thirty-one years; his mother's name was Jedidah, daughter of Adaiah of Bozkath.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, walking in the ways of David his father, without turning to the right hand or to the left.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: Now in the eighteenth year after he became king, Josiah sent Shaphan, the son of Azaliah, the son of Meshullam, the scribe, to the house of the Lord, saying to him,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: Go up to Hilkiah, the chief priest, and let him give out the money which is taken into the house of the Lord, which the keepers of the door have got together from the people;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: And let it be given to the overseers of the work of the Lord's house, to give to the workmen who are making good what was damaged in the house of the Lord;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: To the woodworkers and the builders and the stone-cutters; and for getting wood and cut stones for the building up of the house.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: They did not have to give any account of the money which was handed to them, for they made use of it with good faith.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: Then Hilkiah, the chief priest, said to Shaphan the scribe, I have made discovery of the book of the law in the house of the Lord. So Hilkiah gave it to Shaphan;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: Then, after reading it, Shaphan the scribe went in to the king and gave him an account of what had been done, saying, Your servants have given out the money which was in the house, and have given it to the overseers of the work of the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: Then Shaphan the scribe said to the king, Hilkiah the priest has given me a book; and he was reading it before the king.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: And the king, hearing the words of the book of the law, took his robe in his hands, violently parting it as a sign of his grief;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: And he gave orders to Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, and Achbor, the son of Micaiah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah the king's servant, saying,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: Go and get directions from the Lord for me and for the people and for all Judah, about the words of this book which has come to light; for great is the wrath of the Lord which is burning against us, because our fathers have not given ear to the words of this book, to do all the things which are recorded in it.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: So Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam and Achbor and Shaphan and Asaiah, went to Huldah the woman prophet, the wife of Shallum, the son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, keeper of the robes, (now she was living in Jerusalem, in the second part of the town;) and they had talk with her.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: And she said to them, The Lord, the God of Israel, says, Say to the man who sent you to me,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: These are the words of the Lord: See, I will send evil on this place and on its people, even everything which the king of Judah has been reading in the book;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: Because they have given me up, burning offerings to other gods and moving me to wrath by all the work of their hands; so my wrath will be on fire against this place, and will not be put out.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: But to the king of Judah who sent you to get directions from the Lord, say, This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said: As to the words which have come to your ears,

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: Because your heart was soft, and you made yourself low before me, when you had word of what I said against this place and its people, that they would become a waste and a curse, and you gave signs of grief, weeping before me: truly, I have given ear to you, says the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: For this cause I will let you go to your fathers and be put in your last resting-place in peace, and your eyes will not see all the evil which I will send on this place. So they took this news back to the king.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: Then the king sent and got together all the responsible men of Judah and of Jerusalem.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: And the king went up to the house of the Lord, with all the men of Judah and all the people of Jerusalem, and the priests and the prophets and all the people, small and great; and they were present at his reading of the book of the law which had come to light in the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: And the king took his place by the pillar, and made an agreement before the Lord, to go in the way of the Lord, and keep his orders and his decisions and his rules with all his heart and all his soul, and to keep the words of the agreement recorded in the book; and all the people gave their word to keep the agreement.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: Then the king gave orders to Hilkiah, the chief priest, and to the priests of the second order, and to the keepers of the door, to take out of the house of the Lord all the vessels made for Baal and for the Asherah and for all the stars of heaven; and he had them burned outside Jerusalem in the fields of Kidron, and took the dust of them to Beth-el.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: And he put an end to the false priests, who had been put in their positions by the kings of Judah to see to the burning of offerings in the high places in the towns of Judah and the outskirts of Jerusalem, and all those who made offerings to Baal and to the sun and the moon and the twelve signs and all the stars of heaven.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: And he took the Asherah from the house of the Lord, outside Jerusalem to the stream Kidron, burning it by the stream and crushing it to dust, and he put the dust on the place where the bodies of the common people were put to rest.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: And he had the houses pulled down of those who were used for sex purposes in the house of the Lord, where women were making robes for the Asherah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: And he made all the priests from the towns of Judah come into Jerusalem, and he made unclean the high places where the priests had been burning offerings, from Geba to Beer-sheba; and he had the high places of the evil spirits pulled down which were by the doorway of Joshua, the ruler of the town, on the left side of the way into the town.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: Still the priests of the high places never came up to the altar of the Lord in Jerusalem; but they took their food of unleavened bread among their brothers.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: And Topheth, in the valley of the sons of Hinnom, he made unclean, so that no man might make his son or his daughter go through the fire to Molech.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: And he took away the horses which the kings of Judah had given to the sun, at the way into the house of the Lord, by the room of Nathan-melech, the unsexed servant, which was in the outer part of the building, and the carriages of the sun he put on fire.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: And the altars on the roof of the high room of Ahaz, which the kings of Judah had made, and the altars which Manasseh had made in the two outer squares of the house of the Lord, were pulled down and crushed to bits, and the dust of them was put into the stream Kidron.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: And the high places before Jerusalem, on the south side of the mountain of destruction, which Solomon, king of Israel, had made for Ashtoreth, the disgusting god of the Zidonians, and for Chemosh, the disgusting god of Moab, and for Milcom, the disgusting god of the children of Ammon, the king made unclean.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: The stone pillars were broken to bits and the wood pillars cut down, and the places where they had been were made full of the bones of the dead.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: And the altar at Beth-el, and the high place put up by Jeroboam, the son of Nebat, who made Israel do evil, that altar and that high place were pulled down; and the high place was burned and crushed to dust and the Asherah was burned.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: Then Josiah, turning round, saw on the mountain the places of the dead, and he sent and had the bones taken out of their places and burned on the altar, so making it unclean, as the Lord had said by the man of God when Jeroboam was in his place by the altar on that feast-day. And he, turning his eyes to the resting-place of the man of God who had given word of these things, said:

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 17
text: What is that headstone I see over there? And the men of the town said to him, It is the resting-place of the man of God who came from Judah and gave word of all these things which you have done to the altar of Beth-el.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 18
text: So he said, Let him be; let not his bones be moved. So they let his bones be with the bones of the prophet who came from Samaria.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 19
text: Then Josiah took away all the houses of the high places in the towns of Samaria, which the kings of Israel had put up, moving the Lord to wrath, and he did with them as he had done in Beth-el.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 20
text: And all the priests of the high places there he put to death on the altars, burning the bones of the dead on them; and then he went back to Jerusalem.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 21
text: And the king gave orders to all the people, saying, Keep the Passover to the Lord your God, as it says in this book of the law.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 22
text: Truly, such a Passover had not been kept in all the days of the judges of Israel or of the kings of Israel or the kings of Judah;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 23
text: In the eighteenth year of the rule of King Josiah this Passover was kept to the Lord in Jerusalem.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 24
text: And all those who had control of spirits, and the wonder-workers, and the images, and the false gods, and all the disgusting things which were seen in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem, Josiah put away, so that he might give effect to the words of the agreement recorded in the book which Hilkiah the priest made discovery of in the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 25
text: Never before had there been a king like him, turning to the Lord with all his heart and with all his soul and with all his power, as the law of Moses says; and after him there was no king like him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 26
text: But still the heat of the Lord's wrath was not turned back from Judah, because of all Manasseh had done in moving him to wrath.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 27
text: And the Lord said, I will send Judah away from before my face, as I have sent Israel; I will have nothing more to do with this town, which I had made mine, even Jerusalem, and the holy house of which I said, My name will be there.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 28
text: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all he did, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Judah?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 29
text: In his days, Pharaoh-necoh, king of Egypt, sent his armies against the king of Assyria to the river Euphrates; and King Josiah went out against him; and he put him to death at Megiddo, when he had seen him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 30
text: And his servants took his body in a carriage from Megiddo to Jerusalem, and put him into the earth there. And the people of the land took Jehoahaz, the son of Josiah, and put the holy oil on him and made him king in place of his father.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 31
text: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he became king, ruling in Jerusalem for three months; his mother's name was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 32
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, as his fathers had done.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 33
text: And Pharaoh-necoh put him in chains at Riblah in the land of Hamath, so that he might not be king in Jerusalem; and took from the land a tax of a hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 34
text: Then Pharaoh-necoh made Eliakim, the son of Josiah, king in place of Josiah his father, changing his name to Jehoiakim; but Jehoahaz he took away to Egypt, where he was till his death.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 35
text: And Jehoiakim gave the silver and gold to Pharaoh, taxing the land by his orders to get the money; the people of the land had to give silver and gold, everyone as he was taxed, to make the payment to Pharaoh-necoh.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 36
text: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he became king; he was ruling in Jerusalem for eleven years; his mother's name was Zebidah, the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 23 Verse 37
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord as his fathers had done.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: In his days, Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, came up and Jehoiakim was his servant for three years; then he took up arms against him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: And the Lord sent against him bands of the Chaldaeans and of the Edomites and of the Moabites and of the children of Ammon; sending them against Judah for its destruction, as he had said by his servants the prophets.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: Only by the word of the Lord did this fate come on Judah, to take them away from before his face; because of the sins of Manasseh and all the evil he did;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: And because of the death of those who had done no wrong, for he made Jerusalem full of the blood of the upright; and the Lord had no forgiveness for it.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and all he did, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Judah?

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: So Jehoiakim went to rest with his fathers; and Jehoiachin his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: And the king of Egypt did not come out of his land again, for the king of Babylon had taken all his country, from the stream of Egypt to the river Euphrates.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he became king, he was ruling in Jerusalem for three months, and his mother's name was Nehushta, the daughter of Elnathan of Jerusalem.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, as his father had done.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: At that time the armies of Nebuchadnezzar came up to Jerusalem and the town was shut in on every side.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: And Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, came there, while his servants were shutting in the town;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: Then Jehoiachin, king of Judah, went out to the king of Babylon, with his mother and his servants and his chiefs and his unsexed servants; and in the eighth year of his rule the king of Babylon took him.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: And he took away all the stored wealth of the Lord's house, and the goods from the king's store-house, cutting up all the gold vessels which Solomon, king of Israel, had made in the house of the Lord, as the Lord had said.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: And he took away all the people of Jerusalem and all the chiefs and all the men of war, ten thousand prisoners; and all the expert workmen and the metal-workers; only the poorest sort of the people of the land were not taken away.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: He took Jehoiachin a prisoner to Babylon, with his mother and his wives and his unsexed servants and the great men of the land; he took them all as prisoners from Jerusalem to Babylon.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: And all the men of war, seven thousand of them, and a thousand expert workmen and metal-workers, all of them strong and able to take up arms, the king of Babylon took away as prisoners into Babylon.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: And the king of Babylon made Mattaniah, his father's brother, king in place of Jehoiachin, changing his name to Zedekiah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he was king in Jerusalem for eleven years; his mother's name was Hamutal, daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, as Jehoiakim had done.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: And because of the wrath of the Lord, this came about in Jerusalem and Judah, till he had sent them all away from before him: and Zedekiah took up arms against the king of Babylon.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: Now in the ninth year of his rule, on the tenth day of the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, came against Jerusalem with all his army and took up his position before it, building earthworks all round the town.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: And the town was shut in by their forces till the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: Now on the ninth day of the fourth month, the store of food in the town was almost gone, so that there was no food for the people of the land.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: So an opening was made in the wall of the town, and all the men of war went in flight by night through the doorway between the two walls which was by the king's garden; (now the Chaldaeans were stationed round the town:) and the king went by the way of the Arabah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: But the Chaldaean army went after the king, and overtook him in the lowlands of Jericho, and all his army went in flight from him in every direction.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: And they made the king a prisoner and took him up to the king of Babylon at Riblah to be judged.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 7
text: And they put the sons of Zedekiah to death before his eyes, and then they put out his eyes, and chaining him with iron bands, took him to Babylon.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 8
text: Now in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, in the nineteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, a servant of the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 9
text: And he had the house of the Lord and the king's house and all the houses of Jerusalem, even every great house, burned with fire;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 10
text: And the walls round Jerusalem were broken down by the Chaldaean army which was with the captain.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 11
text: And the rest of the people who were still in the town, and all those who had given themselves up to the king of Babylon, and all the rest of the workmen, Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, took away as prisoners;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 12
text: But he let the poorest of the land go on living there, to take care of the vines and the fields.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 13
text: And the brass pillars in the house of the Lord, and the wheeled bases, and the great brass water-vessel in the house of the Lord, were broken up by the Chaldaeans, who took the brass to Babylon.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 14
text: And the pots and the spades and the scissors for the lights and the spoons, and all the brass vessels used in the Lord's house, they took away.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 15
text: And the fire-trays and the basins; the gold of the gold vessels and the silver of the silver vessels, were all taken away by the captain of the armed men.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 16
text: The two pillars, the great water-vessel and the wheeled bases, which Solomon had made for the house of the Lord: the brass of all these vessels was without weight.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 17
text: One of the pillars was eighteen cubits high, with a crown of brass on it; the crown was three cubits high, circled with a network and apples all of brass; and the second pillar had the same.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 18
text: And the captain of the armed men took Seraiah, the chief priest, and Zephaniah, the second priest, and the three door-keepers;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 19
text: And from the town he took the unsexed servant who was over the men of war, and five of the king's near friends who were in the town, and the scribe of the captain of the army, who was responsible for getting the people of the land together in military order, and sixty men of the people of the land who were in the town.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 20
text: These Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, took with him to the king of Babylon at Riblah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 21
text: And the king of Babylon put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was taken away prisoner from his land.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 22
text: As for the people who were still living in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, did not take away, he made Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, ruler over them.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 23
text: Now the captains of the armed forces, hearing that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah ruler, came with their men to Gedaliah at Mizpah; Ishmael, the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan, the son of Kareah, and Seraiah, the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah, the son of the Maacathite, came with all their men.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 24
text: Then Gedaliah gave his oath to them and their men, saying, Have no fear because of the servants of the Chaldaeans; go on living in the land under the rule of the king of Babylon, and all will be well.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 25
text: But in the seventh month, Ishmael, the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the king's seed, came with ten men and made an attack on Gedaliah, causing his death and the death of the Jews and the Chaldaeans who were with him at Mizpah.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 26
text: Then all the people, small and great, and the captains of the forces, got up and went away to Egypt, for fear of the Chaldaeans.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 27
text: And in the thirty-seventh year after Jehoiachin, king of Judah, had been taken prisoner, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, Evil-merodach, king of Babylon, in the first year of his rule, took Jehoiachin, king of Judah, out of prison;

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 28
text: And said kind words to him, and put his seat higher than the seats of the other kings who were with him in Babylon.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 29
text: And his prison clothing was changed, and he was a guest at the king's table every day for the rest of his life.

title: 2 Kings Chapter 25 Verse 30
text: And for his food, the king gave him a regular amount every day for the rest of his life.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Adam, Seth, Enosh;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer and Magog and Madai and Javan and Tubal and Meshech and Tiras.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz and Diphath and Togarmah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And the sons of Javan: Elishah and Tarshish, Kittim and Rodanim.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: The sons of Ham: Cush and Egypt, Put and Canaan.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And the sons of Cush: Seba and Havilah and Sabta and Raama and Sabteca. And the sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: And Cush was the father of Nimrod: he was the first to be a great man in the earth.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: And Egypt was the father of the Ludim and the Anamim and the Lehabim and the Naphtuhim

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And the Pathrusim and the Casluhim and the Caphtorim (from whom came the Philistines).

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And Canaan was the father of Zidon, his oldest son, and Heth,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And the Jebusite and the Amorite and the Girgashite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And the Hivite and the Arkite and the Sinite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And the Arvadite and the Zemarite and the Hamathite.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: The sons of Shem: Elam and Asshur and Arpachshad and Lud and Aram and Uz and Hul and Gether and Meshech.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And Arpachshad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah was the father of Eber.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: And Eber had two sons: the name of the one was Peleg, because in his days a division was made of the earth; and his brother's name was Joktan.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: And Joktan was the father of Almodad and Sheleph and Hazarmaveth and Jerah

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: And Hadoram and Uzal and Diklah

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And Ebal and Abimael and Sheba

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: And Ophir and Havilah and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: Serug, Nahor, Terah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: Abram (that is Abraham).

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 29
text: These are their generations: the oldest son of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar and Adbeel and Mibsam,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 30
text: Mishma and Dumah, Massa, Hadad and Tema,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 31
text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 32
text: And the sons of Keturah, Abraham's servant-wife: she was the mother of Zimran and Jokshan and Medan and Midian and Ishbak and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 33
text: And the sons of Midian: Ephah and Epher and Hanoch and Abida and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 34
text: And Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 35
text: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel and Jeush and Jalam and Korah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 36
text: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman and Omar, Zephi and Gatam, Kenaz and Timna and Amalek.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 37
text: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 38
text: And the sons of Seir: Lotan and Shobal and Zibeon and Anah and Dishon and Ezer and Dishan.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 39
text: And the sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam; and Timna was Lotan's sister.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 40
text: The sons of Shobal: Alian and Manahath and Ebal, Shephi and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 41
text: The sons of Anah: Dishon. And the sons of Dishon: Hamran and Eshban and Ithran and Cheran.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 42
text: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan and Zaavan, Jaakan. The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 43
text: Now these are the kings who were ruling in the land of Edom, before there was any king over Israel: Bela, the son of Beor; his town was named Dinhabah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 44
text: At his death, Jobab, the son of Zerah of Bozrah, became king in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 45
text: At the death of Jobab, Husham, from the land of the Temanites, became king in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 46
text: And at the death of Husham, Hadad, the son of Bedad, who overcame Midian in the field of Moab, became king; his town was named Avith.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 47
text: And at the death of Hadad, Samlah of Masrekah became king in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 48
text: And at the death of Samlah, Shaul of Rehoboth by the river became king in his place,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 49
text: And at the death of Shaul, Baal-hanan, the son of Achbor, became king in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 50
text: And at the death of Baal-hanan, Hadad became king in his place; his town was named Pai, and his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-zahab.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 51
text: And Hadad came to his end. Now the chiefs of Edom were: the chief of Timna, the chief of Aliah, the chief of Jetheth,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 52
text: The chief of Oholibamah, the chief of Elah, the chief of Pinon,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 53
text: The chief of Kenaz, the chief of Teman, the chief of Mibzar,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 1 Verse 54
text: The chief of Magdiel, the chief of Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi and Judah, Issachar and Zebulun;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: Dan, Joseph and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad and Asher.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: The sons of Judah: Er and Onan and Shelah; these three were his sons by Bathshua, the Canaanite woman. And Er, Judah's oldest son, did evil in the eyes of the Lord; and he put him to death.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And Tamar, his daughter-in-law, had Perez and Zerah by him. All the sons of Judah were five.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And the sons of Zerah: Zimri and Ethan and Heman and Calcol and Dara; five of them.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And the sons of Carmi: Achan, the troubler of Israel, who did wrong about the cursed thing.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And the son of Ethan: Azariah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And the sons of Hezron, the offspring of his body: Jerahmeel and Ram and Chelubai.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And Ram was the father of Amminadab; and Amminadab was the father of Nahshon, chief of the children of Judah;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And Nahshon was the father of Salma, and Salma was the father of Boaz,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And Boaz was the father of Obed, and Obed was the father of Jesse,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And Jesse was the father of Eliab, his oldest son, and Abinadab, the second, and Shimea, the third,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: Nethanel, the fourth, Raddai, the fifth,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: Ozem, the sixth, David, the seventh;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. And Zeruiah had three sons: Abishai and Joab and Asahel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And Abigail was the mother of Amasa; and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And Caleb, the son of Hezron, had children by Azubah his wife, the daughter of Jerioth; and these were her sons: Jesher and Shobab and Ardon.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And after the death of Azubah, Caleb took as his wife Ephrath, who was the mother of Hur.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: And Hur was the father of Uri; and Uri was the father of Bezalel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: And after that, Hezron had connection with the daughter of Machir, the father of Gilead, whom he took as his wife when he was sixty years old; and she had Segub by him.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: And Segub was the father of Jair, who had twenty-three towns in the land of Gilead.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: And Geshur and Aram took the tent-towns of Jair from them, with Kenath and the small places round it, even sixty towns. All these were the sons of Machir, the father of Gilead.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: And after the death of Hezron, Caleb had connection with Ephrath, his father Hezron's wife, and she gave birth to his son Asshur, the father of Tekoa.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: And the sons of Jerahmeel, the oldest son of Hezron, were Ram, the oldest, and Bunah and Oren and Ozem and Ahijah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: And Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah: she was the mother of Onam.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 27
text: And the sons of Ram, the oldest son of Jerahmeel, were Maaz and Jamin and Eker.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 28
text: And the sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada; and the sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 29
text: And the name of Abishur's wife was Abihail; and she had Ahban and Molid by him.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 30
text: And the sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim; but Seled came to his end without sons.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 31
text: And the sons of Appaim: Ishi. And the sons of Ishi: Sheshan. And the sons of Sheshan: Ahlai.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 32
text: And the sons of Jada, the brother of Shammai: Jether and Jonathan; and Jether came to his end without sons.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 33
text: And the sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 34
text: Now Sheshan had no sons, but only daughters. And Sheshan had an Egyptian servant, whose name was Jarha.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 35
text: And Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha, his servant, as a wife; and she had Attai by him.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 36
text: And Attai was the father of Nathan, and Nathan was the father of Zabad,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 37
text: And Zabad was the father of Ephlal, and Ephlal was the father of Obed,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 38
text: And Obed was the father of Jehu, and Jehu was the father of Azariah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 39
text: And Azariah was the father of Helez, and Helez was the father of Eleasah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 40
text: And Eleasah was the father of Sismai, and Sismai was the father of Shallum,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 41
text: And Shallum was the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah was the father of Elishama.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 42
text: And the sons of Caleb, the brother of Jerahmeel, were Mareshah, his oldest son, who was the father of Ziph and Hebron.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 43
text: And the sons of Hebron: Korah and Tappuah and Rekem and Shema.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 44
text: And Shema was the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam, and Rekem was the father of Shammai.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 45
text: And the son of Shammai was Maon; and Maon was the father of Beth-zur.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 46
text: And Ephah, Caleb's servant-wife, had Haran and Moza and Gazez; and Haran was the father of Gazez.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 47
text: And the sons of Jahdai: Regem and Jotham and Geshan and Pelet and Ephah and Shaaph.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 48
text: Maacah, Caleb's servant-wife, was the mother of Sheber and Tirhanah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 49
text: And Shaaph, the father of Madmannah, Sheva, the father of Machbena and the father of Gibea; and Caleb's daughter was Achsah. These were the sons of Caleb.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 50
text: The sons of Hur, the oldest son of Ephrathah; Shobal, the father of Kiriath-jearim,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 51
text: Salma, the father of Beth-lehem, Hareph, the father of Beth-gader.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 52
text: And Shobal, the father of Kiriath-jearim, had sons: Haroeh, half of the Manahathites.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 53
text: And the families of Kiriath-jearim: the Ithrites and the Puthites and the Shumathites and the Mishraites; from them came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 54
text: The sons of Salma: Beth-lehem and the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-Joab and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 2 Verse 55
text: And the families of scribes who were living at Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, the Sucathites. These are the Kenites, the offspring of Hammath, the father of the family of Rechab.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Now these were David's sons, whose birth took place in Hebron: the oldest Amnon, by Ahinoam of Jezreel; the second Daniel, by Abigail the Carmelite woman;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: The third Absalom, the son of Maacah, the daughter of Talmai, king of Geshur; the fourth Adonijah, the son of Haggith;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: The fifth Shephatiah, by Abital; the sixth Ithream, by Eglah his wife.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: He had six sons in Hebron; he was ruling there for seven years and six months, and in Jerusalem for thirty-three years.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And in Jerusalem he had four sons, Shimea and Shobab and Nathan and Solomon, by Bath-shua, the daughter of Ammiel;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And Ibhar and Elishama and Eliphelet

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And Nogah and Nepheg and Japhia

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And Elishama and Eliada and Eliphelet, nine.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: All these were the sons of David, in addition to the sons of his servant-wives; and Tamar was their sister.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And Solomon's son was Rehoboam, Abijah was his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: Amon his son, Josiah his son.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And the sons of Josiah: the oldest Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: And the sons of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son, Zedekiah his son.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And the sons of Jeconiah, who was taken prisoner: Shealtiel his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: And Malchiram and Pedaiah and Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama and Nedabiah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: And the sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel and Shimei; and the sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam and Hananiah; and Shelomith was their sister;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: And Hashubah and Ohel and Berechiah and Hasadiah, Jushab-hesed, five.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: And the sons of Hananiah: Pelatiah and Jeshaiah; the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shecaniah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: And the sons of Shecaniah: Shemaiah; and the sons of Shemaiah: Hattush and Igal and Bariah and Neariah and Shaphat, six.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: And the sons of Neariah: Elioenai and Hizkiah and Azrikam, three.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: And the sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah and Eliashib and Pelaiah and Akkub and Johanan and Delaiah and Anani, seven.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: The sons of Judah: Perez, Hezron and Carmi and Hur and Shobal.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And Reaiah, the son of Shobal, was the father of Jahath; and Jahath was the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These are the families of the Zorathites.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And these were the sons of Hur, the father of Etam: Jezreel and Ishma and Idbash, and the name of their sister was Hazzelelponi;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And Penuel, the father of Gedor, and Ezer, the father of Hushah. These are the sons of Hur, the oldest son of Ephrathah, the father of Beth-lehem.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: And Ashhur, the father of Tekoa, had two wives, Helah and Naarah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And Naarah had Ahuzzam by him, and Hepher and Temeni and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And the sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar and Ethnan.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And Koz was the father of Anub and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And Jabez was honoured more than his brothers; but his mother had given him the name Jabez, saying, Because I gave birth to him with sorrow.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: And Jabez made a prayer to the God of Israel, saying, If only you would truly give me a blessing, and make wider the limits of my land, and let your hand be with me, and keep me from evil, so that I may not be troubled by it! And God gave him his desire.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And Chelub, the brother of Shuhah, was the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And Eshton was the father of Bethrapha and Paseah and Tehinnah, the father of Ir-nahash. These are the men of Recah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And the sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah; and the sons of Othniel: Hathath.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: And Meonothai was the father of Ophrah; and Seraiah was the father of Joab, the father of Ge-harashim; they were expert workmen.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: And the sons of Caleb, the son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam; and the son of Elah: Kenaz.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: And the sons of Jehallelel: Ziph and Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: And the sons of Ezrah: Jether and Mered and Epher and Jalon; and these are the sons of Bithiah, the daughter of Pharaoh, the wife of Mered. And she became the mother of Miriam and Shammai and Ishbah, the father of Eshtemoa.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: And his wife, a woman of the tribe of Judah, became the mother of Jered, the father of Gedor, and Heber, the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel, the father of Zanoah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: And the sons of the wife of Hodiah, the sister of Naham, were the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: And the sons of Shimon: Amnon and Rinnah, Ben-hanan and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi: Zoheth; and the son of Zoheth. ...

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: The sons of Shelah, the son of Judah: Er, the father of Lecah, and Laadah, the father of Mareshah, and the families of those who made delicate linen, of the family of Ashbea;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: And Jokim, and the men of Cozeba, and Joash and Saraph, who were rulers in Moab, and went back to Beth-lehem. And the records are very old.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: These were the potters, and the people living among planted fields with walls round them; they were there to do the king's work.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: The sons of Simeon: Nemuel and Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: And the sons of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son, Shimei his son.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: And Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers had only a small number of children, and their family was not as fertile as the children of Judah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 28
text: And they were living at Beer-sheba and Moladah and Hazar-shual,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 29
text: And at Bilhah, and at Ezem, and at Tolad,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 30
text: And at Bethuel, and at Hormah, and at Ziklag,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 31
text: And at Beth-marcaboth, and at Hazarsusim, and at Beth-biri, and at Shaaraim. These were their towns till David became king.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 32
text: And their small towns were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, and Tochen and Ashan, five towns;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 33
text: And all the small places round these towns, as far as Baalath-beer, the high place of the South. These were their living-places, and they have lists of their generations.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 34
text: And Meshobab and Jamlech and Joshah, the son of Amaziah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 35
text: And Joel and Jehu, the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 36
text: And Elioenai and Jaakobah and Jeshohaiah and Asaiah and Adiel and Jesimiel and Benaiah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 37
text: And Ziza, the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 38
text: These, whose names are given, were chiefs in their families, and their families became very great in number.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 39
text: And they went to the opening into Gedor, as far as the east side of the valley, in search of grass-land for their flocks.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 40
text: And they came to some good fertile grass-land, in a wide quiet country of peace-loving people; for the people who were living there before were of the offspring of Ham.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 41
text: And these whose names are given came in the days of Hezekiah, king of Judah, and made an attack on the Meunim who were living there, and put an end to them to this day, and took their place, because there was grass there for their flocks.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 42
text: And some of them, five hundred of the sons of Simeon, went to the hill-country of Seir, with Pelatiah and Neariah and Rephaiah and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, at their head.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 4 Verse 43
text: And they put to death the rest of the Amalekites who had got away safely, and made it their living-place to this day.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: And the sons of Reuben, the oldest son of Israel, (for he was the oldest son, but, because he made his father's bride-bed unclean, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph, the son of Israel; but he is not to be given the place of the oldest.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: Though Judah became stronger than his brothers, and from him came the ruler, the birthright was Joseph's:)

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: The sons of Reuben, the oldest son of Israel: Hanoch and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: The sons of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: Beerah his son, whom Tiglath-pileser, king of Assyria, took away as a prisoner: he was chief of the Reubenites.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: And his brothers by their families, when the list of their generations was made up: the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: And Bela, the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who was living in Aroer, as far as Nebo and Baal-meon;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: And to the east his limits went as far as the starting point of the waste land, ending at the river Euphrates, because their cattle were increased in number in the land of Gilead.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And in the days of Saul they made war on the Hagarites, and overcame them; and they put up their tents through all the land east of Gilead.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: And the sons of Gad were living opposite to them, in the land of Bashan as far as Salecah:

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: Joel the chief, and Shapham the second, and Janai and Shaphat in Bashan;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: And their brothers, the men of their family: Michael and Meshullam and Sheba and Jorai and Jacan and Zia and Eber, seven of them.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: These were the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: Ahi, the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, head of their families.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: And they were living in Gilead in Bashan, in its small towns and in all the grass-land of Sirion as far as its limits.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: All these were listed under the names of their families, in the time of Jotham, king of Judah, and in the time of Jeroboam, king of Israel.
