title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: There were forty-four thousand, seven hundred and sixty of the sons of Reuben and of the Gadites and of the half-tribe of Manasseh, all strong men, expert in the use of the body-cover, the sword, and the bow, and in the art of war, all able to take up arms.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: And they went to war against the Hagarites, with Jetur and Naphish and Nodab.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: And they were helped against them, so that the Hagarites, and those with them, were given into their power. For they sent up prayers to God in the fight, and he gave ear to them, because they put their faith in him.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: And they took away their cattle: fifty thousand camels, two hundred and fifty thousand sheep, and two thousand asses, and a hundred thousand men.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: And a very great number went to their death, because the war was God's purpose. And they went on living in their place till they were taken away as prisoners.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: And the men of the half-tribe of Manasseh were living in the land: and their numbers were increased till all the land from Bashan to Baal-hermon and Senir and the mountain Hermon was theirs.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: And these were the heads of their families: Epher and Ishi and Eliel and Azriel and Jeremiah and Hodaviah and Jahdiel, men of war, of great name, heads of families.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: And they did evil against the God of their fathers, worshipping the gods of the people of the land, whom God had put to destruction before them.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: And the God of Israel put an impulse into the heart of Pul, king of Assyria, and of Tiglath-pileser, king of Assyria, who took them away as prisoners, all the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh, to Halah and Habor and Hara and to the river of Gozan, to this day.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: And the sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: And the sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses and Miriam. And the sons of Aaron: Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: Eleazar was the father of Phinehas; Phinehas was the father of Abishua;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And Abishua was the father of Bukki, and Bukki was the father of Uzzi,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: And Uzzi was the father of Zerahiah, and Zerahiah was the father of Meraioth;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: Meraioth was the father of Amariah, and Amariah was the father of Ahitub,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: And Ahitub was the father of Zadok, and Zadok was the father of Ahimaaz,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And Ahimaaz was the father of Azariah, and Azariah was the father of Johanan,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And Johanan was the father of Azariah, (he was priest in the house which Solomon put up in Jerusalem:)

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And Azariah was the father of Amariah, and Amariah was the father of Ahitub,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And Ahitub was the father of Zadok, and Zadok was the father of Shallum,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And Shallum was the father of Hilkiah, and Hilkiah was the father of Azariah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And Azariah was the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah was the father of Jehozadak;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: And Jehozadak went as a prisoner when the Lord took away Judah and Jerusalem by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: The sons of Levi; Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: And these are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: And the sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. And these are the families of the Levites listed by the names of their fathers.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, Jeatherai his son.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: The sons of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: Elkanah his son, and Ebiasaph his son, and Assir his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: And the sons of Elkanah: Amasai and Ahimoth.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: Elkanah his son: Zophai his son, and Nahath his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son, Samuel his son.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: And the sons of Samuel: the oldest Joel, and the second Abiah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: The sons of Merari: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, Asaiah his son.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 31
text: And these are those whom David made responsible for the music in the house of the Lord, after the ark had rest.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 32
text: They gave worship with songs before the House of the Tent of meeting, till Solomon put up the house of the Lord in Jerusalem; and they took their places for their work in their regular order.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 33
text: And these are those who did this work, and their sons. Of the sons of the Kohathites: Heman, who made melody, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 34
text: The son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 35
text: The son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 36
text: The son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 37
text: The son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 38
text: The son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 39
text: And his brother Asaph, whose place was at his right hand, Asaph, the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 40
text: The son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 41
text: The son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 42
text: The son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 43
text: The son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 44
text: And on the left their brothers, the sons of Merari: Ethan, the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 45
text: The son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 46
text: The son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 47
text: The son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 48
text: And their brothers the Levites were responsible for all the work of the Tent of the house of God.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 49
text: But Aaron and his sons made offerings on the altar of burned offering, and on the altar of perfume, for all the work of the most holy place, and to take away the sin of Israel, doing everything ordered by Moses, the servant of God.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 50
text: And these are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 51
text: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 52
text: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 53
text: Zadok his son, Ahimaaz his son.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 54
text: Now these are their living-places, the limits inside which they were to put up their tents: to the sons of Aaron, of the families of the Kohathites, because they had the first selection,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 55
text: To them they gave Hebron and its outskirts in the land of Judah;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 56
text: But the open country of the town, and the small places round it, they gave to Caleb, the son of Jephunneh.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 57
text: And to the sons of Aaron they gave Hebron, the town to which men might go in flight and be safe, and Libnah with its outskirts, and Jattir, and Eshtemoa with its outskirts,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 58
text: And Hilen with its outskirts, Debir with its outskirts,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 59
text: And Ashan with its outskirts, and Beth-shemesh with its outskirts;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 60
text: And from the tribe of Benjamin: Geba with its outskirts, and Alemeth with its outskirts, and Anathoth with its outskirts. All their towns among their families were thirteen towns.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 61
text: And to the rest of the sons of Kohath there were given by the Lord's decision ten towns out of the families of the tribe of Ephraim and out of the tribe of Dan and out of the half-tribe of Manasseh.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 62
text: And to the sons of Gershom, by their families, out of the tribe of Issachar, and out of the tribe of Asher, and out of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen towns.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 63
text: And to the sons of Merari, by their families, twelve towns were given by the Lord's decision, out of the tribe of Reuben, and out of the tribe of Gad, and out of the tribe of Zebulun.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 64
text: And the children of Israel gave to the Levites the towns with their outskirts.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 65
text: And they gave by the Lord's decision out of the tribe of the children of Judah, and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon, and out of the tribe of the children of Benjamin, these towns whose names are given.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 66
text: And to the families of the sons of Kohath were given towns by the Lord's decision out of the tribe of Ephraim.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 67
text: And they gave them the town to which men might go in flight and be safe, Shechem in the hill-country of Ephraim with its outskirts, and Gezer with its outskirts,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 68
text: And Jokmeam with its outskirts, and Beth-horon with its outskirts,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 69
text: And Aijalon with its outskirts, and Gath-rimmon with its outskirts;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 70
text: And out of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Aner with its outskirts, and Bileam with its outskirts, for the rest of the family of the sons of Kohath.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 71
text: To the sons of Gershom were given, out of the family of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan with its outskirts, and Ashtaroth with its outskirts;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 72
text: And out of the tribe of Issachar, Kedesh with its outskirts, and Daberath with its outskirts,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 73
text: And Ramoth with its outskirts, and Anem with its outskirts;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 74
text: And out of the tribe of Asher, Mashal with its outskirts, and Abdon with its outskirts,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 75
text: And Hukok with its outskirts, and Rehob with its outskirts;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 76
text: And out of the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with its outskirts, and Hammon with its outskirts, and Kiriathaim with its outskirts.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 77
text: To the rest of the Levites, the sons of Merari, were given, out of the tribe of Zebulun, Rimmono with its outskirts, Tabor with its outskirts;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 78
text: And on the other side of Jordan, at Jericho, on the east side of Jordan, were given them, out of the tribe of Reuben, Bezer in the waste land with its outskirts, and Jahzah with its outskirts,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 79
text: And Kedemoth with its outskirts, and Mephaath with its outskirts;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 80
text: And out of the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead with its outskirts, and Mahanaim with its outskirts,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 6 Verse 81
text: And Heshbon with its outskirts, and Jazer with its outskirts.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: And of the sons of Issachar: Tola and Puah, Jashub and Shimron, four.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And the sons of Tola: Uzzi and Rephaiah and Jeriel and Jahmai and Ibsam and Shemuel, heads of their families; they were men of war; in the record of their generations their number in the time of David was twenty-two thousand, six hundred.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: And the sons of Uzzi; Izrahiah; and the sons of Izrahiah: Michael and Obadiah and Joel and Isshiah, five; all of them chiefs.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: And with them, recorded in generations by their families, were bands of fighting-men, thirty-six thousand of them, for they had a great number of wives and sons.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: And there were recorded among all the families of Issachar, great men of war, eighty-seven thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: The sons of Benjamin: Bela and Becher and Jediael, three.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: And the sons of Bela: Ezbon and Uzzi and Uzziel and Jerimoth and Iri, five; heads of their families, great men of war; there were twenty-two thousand and thirty-four of them recorded by their families.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: And the sons of Becher: Zemirah and Joash and Eliezer and Elioenai and Omri and Jerimoth and Abijah and Anathoth and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Becher.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: And they were recorded by their generations, heads of their families, great men of war, twenty thousand, two hundred.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And the sons of Jediael: Bilhan; and the sons of Bilhan: Jeush and Benjamin and Ehud and Chenaanah and Zethan and Tarshish and Ahishahar.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: All these were the sons of Jediael, by the heads of their families, seventeen thousand, two hundred men of war, able to go out with the army for war.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: And Shuppim and Huppim. The sons of Dan, Hushim his son, one.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel and Guni and Jezer and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: The sons of Manasseh by his servant-wife, the Aramaean woman: she gave birth to Machir, the father of Gilead;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: (And Gilead took a wife, whose name was Maacah, and his sister's name was Hammoleketh;) and the name of his brother was Zelophehad, who was the father of daughters.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: And Maacah, the wife of Gilead, gave birth to a son to whom she gave the name Peresh; and his brother was named Sheresh; and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: And the son of Ulam: Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead, the son of Machir the son of Manasseh.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: And his sister Hammoleketh was the mother of Ishhod and Abiezer and Mahlah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: And the sons of Shemida were Ahian and Shechem and Likhi and Aniam.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: And the sons of Ephraim: Shuthelah and Bered his son, and Tahath his son, and Eleadah his son, and Tahath his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: And Zabad his son, and Shuthelah his son, and Ezer and Elead, whom the men of Gath, who had been living in the land from their birth, put to death, because they came down to take away their cattle.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: And for a long time Ephraim their father went on weeping for them, and his brothers came to give him comfort.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: After that, he had connection with his wife, and she became with child and gave birth to a son, to whom his father gave the name of Beriah, because trouble had come on his family.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: And his daughter was Sheerah, the builder of Beth-horon the lower and the higher, and Uzzen-sheerah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: And Rephah was his son, and Resheph; his son was Telah, and his son was Tahan;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: Ladan was his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: Nun his son, Joshua his son.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: Their heritage and their living-places were Beth-el and its daughter-towns, and Naaran to the east, and Gezer to the west, with its daughter-towns, as well as Shechem and its daughter-towns as far as Azzah and its daughter-towns;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: And by the limits of the children of Manasseh, Beth-shean and its daughter-towns, Taanach, Megiddo, and Dor, with their daughter-towns. In these the children of Joseph, the son of Israel, were living.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 30
text: The sons of Asher: Imnah and Ishvah and Ishvi and Beriah and Serah, their sister.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 31
text: And the sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 32
text: And Heber was the father of Japhlet and Shomer and Hotham and Shua, their sister.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 33
text: And the sons of Japhlet: Pasach and Bimhal and Ashvath. These are the sons of Japhlet.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 34
text: And the sons of Shomer: Ahi and Rohgah, Jehubbah and Aram.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 35
text: And the sons of Hotham, his brother: Zophah and Imna and Shelesh and Amal.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 36
text: The sons of Zophah: Suah and Harnepher and Shual and Beri and Imrah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 37
text: Bezer and Hod and Shamma and Shilshah and Ithran and Beera.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 38
text: And the sons of Jether: Jephunneh and Pispah and Ara.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 39
text: And the sons of Ulla: Arah and Hanniel and Rizia.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 7 Verse 40
text: All these were the children of Asher, heads of their families, specially strong men of war, chiefs of the rulers. They were recorded in the army for war, twenty-six thousand men in number.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And Benjamin was the father of Bela his oldest son, Ashbel the second, and Aharah the third,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And Bela had sons, Addar and Gera, the father of Ehud,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: And Abishua and Naaman and Ahoah

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And Gera and Shephuphan and Huram.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: And these are the sons of Ehud, heads of families of those living in Geba: Iglaam and Alemeth

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And Naaman and Ahijah and Gera; and Iglaam was the father of Uzza and Ahihud.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And Shaharaim became the father of children in the country of the Moabites after driving out Hushim and Beerah his wives;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: And by Hodesh his wife he became the father of Jobab and Zibia and Mesha and Malcam.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And Jeuz and Shachia and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of families.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And Hushim became the father of Abitub and Elpaal.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And the sons of Elpaal: Eber and Misham and Shemed (he was the builder of Ono and Lod and their daughter-towns);

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And Beriah and Shema, who were heads of the families of those who were living in Aijalon, who put to flight the people living in Gath;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And their brothers Shashak and Jeremoth.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And Zebadiah and Arad and Eder

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: And Michael and Ishpah and Joha, the sons of Beriah;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: And Zebadiah and Meshullam and Hizki and Heber

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: And Ishmerai and Izliah and Jobab, the sons of Elpaal;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: And Jakim and Zichri and Zabdi

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: And Elienai and Zillethai and Eliel

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: And Adaiah and Beraiah and Shimrath, the sons of Shimei;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: And Ishpan and Eber and Eliel

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: And Abdon and Zichri and Hanan

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: And Hananiah and Elam and Anathothijah

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: And Iphdeiah and Penuel, the sons of Shashak;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: And Shamsherai and Shehariah and Athaliah

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: And Jaareshiah and Elijah and Zichri, the sons of Jeremoth.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: These were heads of families in their generations; chief men: these were living in Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: And in Gibeon was living the father of Gibeon, Jeiel, whose wife's name was Maacah;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: And his oldest son Abdon, and Zur and Kish and Baal and Ner and Nadab

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: And Gedor and Ahio and Zechariah and Mikloth.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: And Mikloth was the father of Shimeah. And they were living with their brothers in Jerusalem opposite their brothers.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 33
text: And Ner was the father of Abner, and Kish was the father of Saul, and Saul was the father of Jonathan and Malchi-shua and Abinadab and Eshbaal.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 34
text: And the son of Jonathan was Merib-baal; and Merib-baal was the father of Micah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 35
text: And the sons of Micah: Pithon and Melech and Tarea and Ahaz.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 36
text: And Ahaz was the father of Jehoaddah; and Jehoaddah was the father of Alemeth and Azmaveth and Zimri; and Zimri was the father of Moza;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 37
text: And Moza was the father of Binea: Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 38
text: And Azel had five sons, whose names are: Azrikam, his oldest, and Ishmael and Sheariah and Obadiah and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 39
text: And the sons of Eshek his brother: Ulam his oldest son, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Verse 40
text: And the sons of Ulam were men of war, bowmen, and had a great number of sons and sons' sons, a hundred and fifty. All these were the sons of Benjamin.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: So all Israel was listed by their families; and, truly, they are recorded in the book of the kings of Israel. And Judah was taken away as prisoners to Babylon because of their sin.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: Now the first to take up their heritage in their towns were: Israel, the priests, the Levites, and the Nethinim.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And in Jerusalem there were living some of the sons of Judah, and of Benjamin, and of Ephraim and Manasseh;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: Uthai, the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the sons of Perez, the son of Judah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And of the Shilonites: Asaiah the oldest, and his sons.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: And of the sons of Zerah: Jeuel, and their brothers, six hundred and ninety.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: And of the sons of Benjamin: Sallu, the son of Meshullam, Judah, the son of Hassenuah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And Ibneiah, the son of Jeroham, and Elah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri, and Meshullam, the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And their brothers, in the list of their generations, nine hundred and fifty-six. All these men were heads of families, listed by the names of their fathers.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And of the priests: Jedaiah and Jehoiarib and Jachin

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: And Azariah, the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the ruler of the house of God;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And Adaiah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasai, the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: And their brothers, heads of their families, a thousand and seven hundred and sixty: able men, doing the work of the house of God.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: And of the Levites: Shemaiah, the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: And Bakbakkar, Heresh, and Galal, and Mattaniah, the son of Mica, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: And Obadiah, the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah, the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who were living in the small towns of the Netophathites.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And the door-keepers: Shallum and Akkub and Talmon and Ahiman and their brothers: Shallum was the chief.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: Up till then they had been at the king's door to the east. They were door-keepers for the tents of the sons of Levi.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: And Shallum, the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brothers, of his family, the Korahites, were responsible for everything which had to be done in connection with the order of worship, keepers of the doors of the Tent; their fathers had had the care of the tents of the Lord, being keepers of the doorway.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: In the past Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, had been ruler over them; may the Lord be with him!

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: Zechariah, the son of Meshelemiah, was keeper of the door of the Tent of meeting.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: There were two hundred and twelve whose business it was to keep the doorway. These were listed by families in the country places where they were living, whom David and Samuel the seer put in their responsible positions.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: So they and their sons had the care of the doors of the house of the Lord, the house of the Tent, as watchers.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: There were keepers of the doors on the four sides, to the east, west, north, and south.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: And their brothers, in the country places where they were living, were to come in every seven days to be with them from time to time.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: For the four chief door-keepers, who were Levites, had a special position, looking after the rooms and the store-houses of the house of God.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: Their sleeping-rooms were round the house of God, for they had the care of it, and were responsible for opening it morning by morning.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: Certain of them had the care of the vessels used in worship, to keep an account of them when they came in and when they were taken out again.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: And some of them were responsible for the holy things and for the vessels of the holy place, and the meal and the wine and the oil and the perfume and the spices.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 30
text: And some of the sons of the priests were responsible for crushing the spices.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 31
text: And Mattithiah, one of the Levites, the oldest son of Shallum the Korahite, was responsible for cooking the flat cakes.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 32
text: And some of their brothers, sons of the Kohathites, were responsible for the holy bread which was put in order before the Lord, to get it ready every Sabbath.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 33
text: And these were those who had the ordering of the music and songs, heads of families of the Levites, who were living in the rooms, and were free from other work, for their work went on day and night.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 34
text: These were heads of families of the Levites in their generations, chief men; they were living at Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 35
text: And in Gibeon was living the father of Gibeon, Jeiel, whose wife's name was Maacah;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 36
text: And Abdon his oldest son, and Zur and Kish and Baal and Ner and Nadab

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 37
text: And Gedor and Ahio and Zechariah and Mikloth

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 38
text: Mikloth was the father of Shimeam. They were living with their brothers in Jerusalem opposite their brothers.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 39
text: And Ner was the father of Kish; and Kish was the father of Saul; and Saul was the father of Jonathan and Malchi-shua and Abinadab and Eshbaal.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 40
text: And the son of Jonathan was Merib-baal; and Merib-baal was the father of Micah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 41
text: And the sons of Micah: Pithon and Melech and Tahrea and Ahaz.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 42
text: And Ahaz was the father of Jarah; and Jarah was the father of Alemeth and Azmaveth and Zimri; and Zimri was the father of Moza.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 43
text: And Moza was the father of Binea; and Rephaiah was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 9 Verse 44
text: And Azel had five sons, whose names are: Azrikam, his oldest son, and Ishmael and Sheariah and Obadiah and Hanan: these were the sons of Azel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Now the Philistines were fighting against Israel; and the men of Israel went in flight before the Philistines, falling down wounded in Mount Gilboa.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: And the Philistines went hard after Saul and his sons, and put to death Jonathan and Abinadab and Malchi-shua, the sons of Saul.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: And the fight was going against Saul, and the archers came across him, and he was wounded by the archers.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: Then Saul said to the servant who had the care of his arms, Take your sword and put it through me, before these men without circumcision come and make sport of me. But his servant, full of fear, would not do so. Then Saul took out his sword, falling on it himself.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: And when his servant saw that Saul was dead, he did the same, and came to his death.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: So death overtook Saul and his three sons; all his family came to an end together.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And when all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that the men of Israel had gone in flight and that Saul and his sons were dead, they went in flight away from their towns; and the Philistines came and took them for themselves.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: Now the day after, when the Philistines came to take their goods from the dead, they saw Saul and his sons dead in Mount Gilboa.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: And they took everything off him, and took his head and his war-dress, and sent word into the land of the Philistines round about to give the news to their gods and to the people.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And they put his war-dress in the house of their gods, and put up his head in the house of Dagon.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: And when the news came to Jabesh-gilead of what the Philistines had done to Saul,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: All the fighting-men came up and took away Saul's body and the bodies of his sons, and took them to Jabesh, and put their bones to rest under the oak-tree in Jabesh, and took no food for seven days.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: So death came to Saul because of the sin which he did against the Lord, that is, because of the word of the Lord which he kept not; and because he went for directions to one who had an evil spirit,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: And not to the Lord: for this reason, he put him to death and gave the kingdom to David, the son of Jesse.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Then all Israel came together to David at Hebron, and said, Truly, we are your bone and your flesh.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: In the past, when Saul was king, it was you who went at the head of Israel when they went out or came in; and the Lord your God said to you, You are to be the keeper of my people Israel, and their ruler.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: So all the responsible men of Israel came to the king at Hebron; and David made an agreement with them in Hebron before the Lord; and they put the holy oil on David and made him king over Israel, as the Lord had said by Samuel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: Then David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (which is Jebus); and the Jebusites, the people of the land, were there.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And the people of Jebus said to David, You will not come in here. But still, David took the strong place of Zion, which is the town of David.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And David said, The first to overcome the Jebusites will be chief and captain. And Joab, the son of Zeruiah, went up first, and became chief.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: And David took the strong tower for his living-place, so it was named the town of David.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: And he took in hand the building of the town all round, starting from the Millo; and Joab put the rest of the town in order.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And David became greater and greater in power, because the Lord of armies was with him.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: Now these are the chief of David's men of war who were his strong supporters in the kingdom, and, with all Israel, made him king, as the Lord had said about Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: This is the list of David's men of war: Ishbaal, the son of a Hachmonite, the chief of the three: he put to death three hundred at one time with his spear.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And after him was Eleazar, the son of Dodo the Ahohite, who was one of the three great fighters.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: He was with David at Pas-dammim, where the Philistines had come together for the fight, near a bit of land full of barley; and the people went in flight before the Philistines.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And he took up his position in the middle of the bit of land, and kept back their attack, and overcame the Philistines; and the Lord gave a great salvation.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: And three of the thirty went down to David, to the rock, into the strong place of Adullam; and the army of the Philistines had taken up their position in the valley of Rephaim.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: At that time David had taken cover in the strong place, and an armed force of the Philistines was in Beth-lehem.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: And David, moved by a strong desire, said, If only someone would give me a drink of the water from the water-hole of Beth-lehem by the doorway into the town!

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: So the three, forcing a way through the Philistine army, got water from the water-hole of Beth-lehem, by the doorway into the town, and took it back to David; but David would not take it, but made an offering of it, draining it out to the Lord,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: Saying, By my God, far be it from me to do this! How may I take as drink the life-blood of these men who have put their lives in danger? so he did not take it. These things did the three great men of war.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: And Abishai, the brother of Joab, was chief of the thirty, for he put to death three hundred with his spear, but he had not a name among the three.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: Of the thirty, he was the noblest, and was made their captain, but he was not equal to the first three.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, a fighting-man of Kabzeel, had done great acts; he put to death two young lions going into their secret place; and he went down into a hole and put a lion to death in time of snow.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: And he made an attack on an Egyptian, a very tall man about five cubits high, armed with a spear like a cloth-worker's rod; he went down to him with a stick, and pulling his spear out of the hand of the Egyptian, put him to death with that same spear.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: These were the acts of Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, who had a great name among the thirty men of war.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: He was honoured over the thirty, but he was not equal to the first three: and David put him over his servants.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: And these were the great men of war: Asahel, the brother of Joab, Elhanan, the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: Shammoth the Harodite, Helez the Pelonite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: Ira, the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled, the son of Baanah the Netophathite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: Ithai, the son of Ribai of Gibeah, of the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: Hurai of Nahale-gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: Azmaveth of Bahurim, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 34
text: The sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan, the son of Shage the Hararite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 35
text: Ahiam, the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal, the son of Ur,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 36
text: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 37
text: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai, the son of Ezbai,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 38
text: Joel, the brother of Nathan, Mibhar, the son of Hagri,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 39
text: Zelek the Ammonite, and Naharai the Berothite, the servant who had the care of the arms of Joab, the son of Zeruiah;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 40
text: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 41
text: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad, the son of Ahlai,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 42
text: Adina, the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a chief of the Reubenites, and thirty with him;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 43
text: Hanan, the son of Maacah, and Joshaphat the Mithnite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 44
text: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel, the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 45
text: Jediael, the son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 46
text: Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Verse 47
text: Eliel and Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: Now these are the men who came to David at Ziklag, while he was still shut up, because of Saul, the son of Kish; they were among the strong men, his helpers in war.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: They were armed with bows, and were able to send stones, and arrows from the bow, with right hand or left: they were Saul's brothers, of Benjamin.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: Ahiezer was their chief, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; and Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; and Beracah and Jehu the Anathothite;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: And Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a great man among the thirty, and their chief; and Jeremiah and Jehaziel and Johanan and Jozabad the Gederathite;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Eluzai and Jerimoth and Bealiah and Shemariah and Shephatiah the Haruphite;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: Elkanah and Isshiah and Azarel and Joezer and Jashobeam, the Korahites;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: And Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: And some of the Gadites, siding with David, went to his strong place in the waste land, great and strong men, trained for war, expert in the use of arms, whose faces were like the faces of lions, and they were quick-footed like roes on the mountains;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: Ezer their chief, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: Jeremiah the tenth, Machbannai the eleventh.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: These Gadites were captains of the army; the least of them was captain over a hundred men, and the greatest over a thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: It was they who went over Jordan in the first month, when the river was overflowing, and put to flight all the people of the valleys, to the east and to the west.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: And some of the children of Benjamin and Judah came to David in his strong place.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: And David went out to them, and said to them, If you have come in peace to give me help, my heart will be united with yours; but if you have come to give me up to those who would take my life, though my hands are clean from wrongdoing, then may the God of our fathers see it and give you punishment.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: Then the spirit came on Amasai, who was chief of the captains, and he said, We are yours, David, we are on your side, O son of Jesse: may peace be with you and peace be with your helpers; for God is your helper. Then David took them into his army and made them captains of the band.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: And some of the men of Manasseh came over to David, when he went with the Philistines to the war against Saul, but he gave them no help: for the lords of the Philistines, after discussion, sent him away, saying, He will go back to his master Saul, at the price of our lives.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: Then when he went back to Ziklag, there came over to him, of the men of Manasseh, Adnah and Jozabad and Jediael and Michael and Jozabad and Elihu and Zillethai, captains of thousands from the armies of Manasseh.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: And they gave David help against the armed bands, for they were all great men of war, and captains in the army.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: And from day to day more supporters came to David, till he had a great army like the army of God.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: These are the numbers of the chiefs of the armed men, ready for war, who came to David at Hebron, to give the kingdom of Saul into his hands, as the Lord had said.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: There were six thousand, eight hundred spearmen of the children of Judah, armed for war;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: Seven thousand, one hundred of the children of Simeon, great men of war;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: Of the children of Levi, four thousand, six hundred.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: And Jehoiada, chief of the family of Aaron, and with him three thousand, seven hundred men;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: And Zadok, a young man, great and strong in war, with twenty-two captains from his father's people.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 29
text: And of the children of Benjamin, the brothers of Saul, three thousand; for up to that time the greater part of them had been true to Saul.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 30
text: And of the children of Ephraim, twenty thousand, eight hundred great men of war, men of great name in their families.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 31
text: And from the half-tribe of Manasseh, eighteen thousand, listed by name, came to make David king.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 32
text: And of the children of Issachar, there were two hundred chiefs, men who had expert knowledge of the times and what it was best for Israel to do, and all their brothers were under their orders.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 33
text: Of Zebulun, there were fifty thousand men, who went out with the army, expert in ordering the fight, to give help with all sorts of arms; true-hearted men.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 34
text: And of Naphtali, a thousand captains with thirty-seven thousand spearmen.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 35
text: And of the Danites, twenty-eight thousand, six hundred, expert in ordering the fight.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 36
text: And of Asher, forty thousand who went out with the army, expert in ordering the fight.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 37
text: From the other side of Jordan, there were a hundred and twenty thousand of the Reubenites and the Gadites and the men of the half-tribe of Manasseh, armed with every sort of instrument of war.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 38
text: All these men of war, expert in ordering the fight, came to Hebron with the full purpose of making David king over all Israel; and all the rest of Israel were united in their desire to make David king.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 39
text: For three days they were there with David, feasting at his table, for their brothers had made ready food for them.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 12 Verse 40
text: And those who were near, as far as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, came with food on asses and camels and mules and oxen, with meal for food and cakes of figs and masses of grapes, and wine and oil and oxen and sheep in great numbers, for there was joy in Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: Then David had discussions with the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds and with every chief.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: And David said to all the men of Israel who had come together there, If it seems good to you and if it is the purpose of the Lord our God, let us send to all the rest of our brothers, everywhere in the land of Israel, and to the priests and the Levites in their towns and the country round them, and get them to come together here to us;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: And let us get back for ourselves the ark of our God: for in the days of Saul we did not go to it for directions.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: And all the people said they would do so, for it seemed right to them.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: So David sent for all Israel to come together, from Shihor, the river of Egypt, as far as the way into Hamath, to get the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: And David went up, with all Israel, to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath-jearim in Judah, to get up from there the ark of God, over which the holy Name is named, the name of the Lord whose place is between the winged ones.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: And they put the ark of God on a new cart, and took it out of the house of Abinadab; and Uzza and Ahio were the drivers of the cart.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: Then David and all Israel made melody before God with all their strength, with songs and corded instruments of music, and with brass instruments and horns.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: And when they came to the grain-floor of Chidon, Uzza put out his hand to keep the ark in its place, for the oxen were slipping.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: And the wrath of the Lord, burning against Uzza, sent destruction on him because he had put his hand on the ark, and death came to him there before God.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: And David was angry because of the Lord's outburst of wrath against Uzza, and he gave that place the name Perez-uzza, to this day.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: And so great was David's fear of God that day, that he said, How may I let the ark of God come to me?

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: So David did not let the ark come back to him to the town of David, but had it turned away and put into the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: And the ark of God was in the house of Obed-edom for three months; and the Lord sent a blessing on the house of Obed-edom and on all he had.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: And Hiram, king of Tyre, sent men to David with cedar-trees, and stoneworkers and woodworkers for the building of his house.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: And David saw that the Lord had made his position safe as king over Israel, lifting up his kingdom on high because of his people Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: And while he was living in Jerusalem, David took more wives and became the father of more sons and daughters.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: These are the names of the children he had in Jerusalem: Shammua and Shobab, Nathan and Solomon

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: And Ibhar and Elishua and Elpelet

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: And Nogah and Nepheg and Japhia

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: And Elishama and Beeliada and Eliphelet.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: And when the Philistines had news that David had been made king over all Israel, they went up in search of David, and David, hearing of it, went out against them.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: Now the Philistines had come, and had gone out in every direction in the valley of Rephaim.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: And David, desiring directions from God, said, Am I to go up against the Philistines? and will you give them into my hands? And the Lord said, Go up; for I will give them into your hands.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: So they went up to Baal-perazim, and David overcame them there, and David said, God has let the forces fighting against me be broken by my hand, as a wall is broken down by rushing water; so they gave that place the name of Baal-perazim.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: And the Philistines did not take their images with them in their flight; and at David's orders they were burned with fire.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: Then the Philistines again went out in every direction in the valley.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: And David went for directions to God; and God said to him, You are not to go up after them; but, turning away from them, come face to face with them opposite the spice-trees.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: And at the sound of footsteps in the tops of the trees, go out to the fight, for God has gone out before you to overcome the army of the Philistines.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: And David did as the Lord had said; and they overcame the army of the Philistines, attacking them from Gibeon as far as Gezer.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: And David's name was honoured in all lands; and the Lord put the fear of him on all nations.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: And David made houses for himself in the town of David; and he got ready a place for the ark of God, and put up a tent for it.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: Then David said, The ark of God may not be moved by any but the Levites, for they have been marked out by God to take the ark of God, and to do his work for ever.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: And David made all Israel come together at Jerusalem, to take the ark of the Lord to its place, which he had got ready for it.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: And David got together the sons of Aaron, and the Levites;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: Of the sons of Kohath: Uriel the chief, and his brothers, a hundred and twenty;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: Of the sons of Merari: Asaiah the chief, and his brothers, two hundred and twenty;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: Of the sons of Gershom: Joel the chief, and his brothers, a hundred and thirty;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: Of the sons of Elizaphan: Shemaiah the chief, and his brothers, two hundred;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: Of the sons of Hebron: Eliel the chief, and his brothers, eighty;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: Of the sons of Uzziel: Amminadab the chief, and his brothers, a hundred and twelve.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: And David sent for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites, Uriel, Asaiah and Joel, Shemaiah and Eliel and Amminadab,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: And said to them, You are the heads of the families of the Levites: make yourselves holy, you and your brothers, so that you may take the ark of the Lord, the God of Israel, to the place which I have made ready for it.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: For because you did not take it at the first, the Lord our God sent punishment on us, because we did not get directions from him in the right way.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: So the priests and the Levites made themselves holy to take up the ark of the Lord, the God of Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: And the sons of the Levites took up the ark of God, lifting it by its rods, as the Lord had said to Moses.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: And David gave orders to the chief of the Levites to put their brothers the music-makers in position, with instruments of music, corded instruments and brass, with glad voices making sounds of joy.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: So Heman, the son of Joel, and, of his brothers, Asaph, the son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari their brothers, Ethan, the son of Kushaiah, were put in position by the Levites;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: And with them their brothers of the second order, Zechariah, Bani and Jaaziel and Shemiramoth and Jehiel and Unni, Eliab and Benaiah and Maaseiah and Mattithiah and Eliphelehu and Mikneiah, and Obed-edom and Jeiel, the door-keepers.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: So those who made melody, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were put in position, with brass instruments, sounding loudly;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: And Zechariah and Aziel and Shemiramoth and Jehiel, Unni and Eliab and Maaseiah and Benaiah, with corded instruments put to Alamoth.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: And Mattithiah and Eliphelehu and Mikneiah and Obed-edom and Jeiel and Azaziah, with corded instruments on the octave, to give the first note of the song.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: And Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was master of the music: he gave directions about the song, because he was expert.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: And Berechiah and Elkanah were door-keepers for the ark.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: And Shebaniah and Joshaphat and Nethanel and Amasai and Zechariah and Benaiah and Eliezer, the priests, made music on the horns before the ark of God; and Obed-edom and Jehiah were door-keepers for the ark.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: So David, and the responsible men of Israel, and the captains over thousands, went with joy to get the ark of the agreement of the Lord out of the house of Obed-edom.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: And when God gave help to the Levites who were lifting up the ark of the agreement of the Lord, they made an offering of seven oxen and seven sheep.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: And David was clothed with a robe of fair linen, as were all the Levites who took up the ark, and those who made melody, and Chenaniah the master of those who made melody; and David had on a linen ephod;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: So all Israel took up the ark of the agreement of the Lord, with loud cries and with horns and brass and corded instruments sounding loudly.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: And when the ark of the agreement of the Lord came into the town of David, Michal, the daughter of Saul, looking out of the window, saw King David dancing and playing; and to her mind he seemed foolish.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: Then they took in the ark of God and put it inside the tent which David had put up for it; and they made offerings, burned offerings and peace-offerings before God.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: And when David had come to an end of making the burned offerings and peace-offerings, he gave the people a blessing in the name of the Lord.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: And he gave to everyone, every man and woman of Israel, a cake of bread, some meat, and a cake of dry grapes.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: And he put some of the Levites before the ark of the Lord as servants, to keep the acts of the Lord in memory, and to give worship and praise to the Lord, the God of Israel:

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: Asaph the chief, and second to him Zechariah, Uzziel and Shemiramoth and Jehiel and Mattithiah and Eliab and Benaiah and Obed-edom and Jeiel, with corded instruments of music; and Asaph, with brass instruments sounding loudly;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: And Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests, blowing horns all the time before the ark of the agreement of God.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: Then on that day David first made the giving of praise to the Lord the work of Asaph and his brothers.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: O give praise to the Lord; give honour to his name, talking of his doings among the peoples.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: Let your voice be sounded in songs and melody; let all your thoughts be of the wonder of his works.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: Have glory in his holy name; let the hearts of those who are searching after the Lord be glad.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: Let your search be for the Lord and for his strength; let your hearts ever be turned to him.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: Keep in mind the great works which he has done; his wonders, and the decisions of his mouth;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: O you seed of Israel his servant, you children of Jacob, his loved ones.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: He is the Lord our God: he is judge of all the earth.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: He has kept his agreement in mind for ever, the word which he gave for a thousand generations;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: The agreement which he made with Abraham, and his oath to Isaac;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: And he gave it to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an eternal agreement;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: Saying, To you will I give the land of Canaan, the measured line of your heritage:

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: When you were still small in number, and strange in the land;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: When they went about from one nation to another, and from one kingdom to another people;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: He would not let anyone do them wrong; he even kept back kings because of them,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: Saying, Put not your hand on those who have been marked with my holy oil, and do my prophets no wrong.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: Make songs to the Lord, all the earth; give the good news of his salvation day by day.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 24
text: Make clear his glory to the nations, and his wonders to all the peoples.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: For the Lord is great, and greatly to be praised; and he is more to be feared than all other gods.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: For all the gods of the nations are false gods; but the Lord made the heavens.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: Honour and glory are before him: strength and joy are in his holy place.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 28
text: Give to the Lord, O you families of the peoples, give to the Lord glory and strength.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 29
text: Give to the Lord the glory of his name; take with you an offering and come before him; give worship to the Lord in holy robes.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 30
text: Be in fear before him, all the earth: the world is ordered so that it may not be moved.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 31
text: Let the heavens have joy and let the earth be glad; let them say among the nations, The Lord is King.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 32
text: Let the sea be thundering with all its waters; let the field be glad, and everything which is in it;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 33
text: Then let all the trees of the wood be sounding with joy before the Lord, for he is come to be the judge of the earth.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 34
text: O give praise to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy is unchanging for ever.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 35
text: And say, Be our saviour, O God of our salvation, and let us come back, and give us salvation from the nations, so that we may give honour to your holy name and have glory in your praise.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 36
text: Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, for ever and for ever. And all the people said, So be it; and gave praise to the Lord.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 37
text: So he made Asaph and his brothers keep their places there before the ark of the agreement of the Lord, to do whatever had to be done before the ark at all times day by day:

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 38
text: And Obed-edom, the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah, with their brothers, sixty-eight of them, to be door-keepers:

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 39
text: And Zadok the priest, with his brothers the priests, before the House of the Lord in the high place at Gibeon;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 40
text: To give burned offerings to the Lord on the altar of burned offerings morning and evening, every day, as it is ordered in the law of the Lord which he gave to Israel;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 41
text: And with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest who were marked out by name to give praise to the Lord, for his mercy is unchanging for ever;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 42
text: And Heman and Jeduthun had horns and brass instruments sounding loudly, and instruments of music for the songs of God; and the sons of Jeduthun were to be at the door.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 16 Verse 43
text: And all the people went away, every man to his house; and David went back to give a blessing to his family.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: Now when David was living in his house, he said to Nathan the prophet, See, I am living in a house of cedar-wood, but the ark of the Lord's agreement is under the curtains of a tent.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: And Nathan said to David, Do whatever is in your heart, for God is with you.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: But that same night, the word of God came to Nathan, saying,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: Go and say to David my servant, The Lord says, You are not to make me a house for my living-place:

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: For from the day when I took Israel up, till this day, I have had no house, but have gone from tent to tent, and from living-place to living-place.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: In all the places where I have gone with all Israel, did I ever say to any of the judges of Israel, whom I made the keepers of my people, Why have you not made for me a house of cedar?

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: So now, say to my servant David, The Lord of armies says, I took you from the fields, from keeping sheep, so that you might be a ruler over my people Israel;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: And I have been with you wherever you went, cutting off before you all those who were against you; and I will make your name like the name of the greatest ones of the earth.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: And I will make a resting-place for my people Israel, planting them there, so that they may be in the place which is theirs and never again be moved; and never again will they be made waste by evil men, as they were at first,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: From the time when I put judges over my people Israel; and I will overcome all those who are against you; and I will make you great and the head of a line of kings.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: And when the time comes for you to go to your fathers, I will put in your place your seed after you, one of your sons, and I will make his kingdom strong.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: He will be the builder of my house, and I will make the seat of his authority certain for ever.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: I will be to him a father and he will be to me a son; and I will not take my mercy away from him as I took it from him who was before you;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: But I will make his place in my house and in my kingdom certain for ever; and the seat of his authority will never be overturned.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: So Nathan gave David an account of all these words and this vision.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: Then David the king went in and took his seat before the Lord, and said, Who am I, O Lord God, and what is my family, that you have been my guide till now?

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: And this was only a small thing to you, O God; but your words have even been about the far-off future of your servant's family, looking on me as on one of high position, O Lord God.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: What more may David say to you? for you have knowledge of your servant.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: O Lord, because of your servant, and from your heart, you have done all these great things and let them be seen.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: O Lord, there is no one like you, and no other God but you, as is clear from everything which has come to our ears.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 21
text: And what other nation in the earth, like your people Israel, did a god go out to take for himself, to be his people, making his name great and to be feared, driving out the nations from before your people whom you made free and took out of Egypt?

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: For your people Israel you made yours for ever; and you, Lord, became their God.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: And now, Lord, let your words about your servant and about his family be made certain for ever, and do as you have said.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: So let your words be made certain and your name be made great, when men say, The Lord of armies is the God of Israel; and when the family of David your servant is made strong before you.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 25
text: For you, O my God, have let your servant see that you will make him head of a line of kings; and so it has come into your servant's heart to make his prayer to you.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 26
text: And now, O Lord, you are God, and you have said you will give this good thing to your servant:

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 17 Verse 27
text: And now you have been pleased to give your blessing to the family of your servant, so that it may go on for ever before you; you, O Lord, have given your blessing, and a blessing will be on it for ever.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: And it came about after this that David made an attack on the Philistines and overcame them, and took Gath with its daughter-towns out of the hands of the Philistines.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: And he overcame Moab, and the Moabites became his servants and gave him offerings.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: Then David overcame Hadadezer, king of Zobah, near Hamath, when he was going to make his power seen by the river Euphrates.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: And David took from him a thousand war-carriages and seven thousand horsemen and twenty thousand footmen: and he had the leg-muscles of all the horses cut, keeping only enough of them for a hundred war-carriages.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: And when the Aramaeans of Damascus came to the help of Hadadezer, king of Zobah, David put to the sword twenty-two thousand Aramaeans.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: Then David put armed forces in Damascus, and the Aramaeans became his servants and gave him offerings. And the Lord made David overcome wherever he went.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: And the gold body-covers of the servants of Hadadezer, David took to Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: And from Tibhath and from Cun, towns of Hadadezer, David took a great store of brass, of which Solomon made the great brass water-vessel and the brass pillars and vessels.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: Now when Tou, king of Hamath, had news that David had overcome all the army of Hadadezer, king of Zobah,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: He sent his son Hadoram to King David, to give him words of peace and blessing, because he had overcome Hadadezer in the fight, for Hadadezer had been at war with Tou; and he gave him all sorts of vessels of gold and silver and brass.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: These King David made holy to the Lord, together with the silver and gold he had taken from all nations; from Edom and Moab and from the children of Ammon and from the Philistines and from Amalek.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: And when he came back from putting to the sword eighteen thousand of the Edomites in the Valley of Salt,

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: David put armed forces in all the towns of Edom; and all the Edomites became servants to David. The Lord made David overcome wherever he went.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: So David was king over all Israel, judging and giving right decisions for all his people.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: And Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief of the army; and Jehoshaphat, son of Ahilud, was keeper of the records.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: And Zadok, the son of Ahitub; and Ahimelech, the son of Abiathar, were priests; and Shavsha was the scribe;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: And Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were chief of those whose places were at the king's side.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: Now it came about after this that death came to Nahash, the king of the children of Ammon, and his son became king in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And David said, I will be a friend to Hanun, the son of Nahash, because his father was a friend to me. So David sent men to him, to give him words of comfort on account of his father. And the servants of David came to Hanun, to the land of the children of Ammon, offering him comfort.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: But the chiefs of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, Does it seem to you that David is honouring your father, by sending comforters to you? is it not clear that these men have only come to go through the land and to make secret observation of it so that they may overcome it?

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: So Hanun took David's servants, and cutting off their hair and the skirts of their robes up to the middle, sent them away.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: Then certain men went and gave David word of what had been done to them. And he sent out with the purpose of meeting them; for the men were greatly shamed. And the king said, Keep where you are at Jericho till your hair is long again, and then come back.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves hated by David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver as payment for war-carriages and horsemen from Mesopotamia and Aram-maacah and Zobah.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: So with this money they got thirty-two thousand war-carriages, and the help of the king of Maacah and his people, who came and took up their position in front of Medeba. And the children of Ammon came together from their towns for the fight.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: And David, hearing of it, sent Joab with all the army of fighting-men.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: So the children of Ammon came out and put their forces in position on the way into the town; and the kings who had come were stationed by themselves in the field.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: Now when Joab saw that their forces were in position against him in front and at his back, he took all the best men of Israel, and put them in line against the Aramaeans;

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: And the rest of the people he put in position against the children of Ammon with Abishai, his brother, at their head.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: And he said, If the Aramaeans are stronger and get the better of me, then come to my help; and if the children of Ammon get the better of you, I will come to your help.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: Take heart, and let us be strong for our people and for the towns of our God; and may the Lord do what seems good to him.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: So Joab and the people who were with him went forward into the fight against the Aramaeans, and they went in flight before him.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: And when the children of Ammon saw the flight of the Aramaeans, they themselves went in flight from Abishai, his brother, and came into the town. Then Joab came back to Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: And when the Aramaeans saw that Israel had overcome them, they sent men to get the Aramaeans who were on the other side of the River, with Shophach, the captain of Hadadezer's army, at their head.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: And word of this was given to David; and he got all Israel together and went over Jordan and came to Helam and put his forces in position against them. And when David's forces were in position against the Aramaeans, the fight was started.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: And the Aramaeans went in flight before Israel; and David put to the sword the men of seven thousand Aramaean war-carriages and forty thousand footmen, and put to death Shophach, the captain of the army.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: And when the servants of Hadadezer saw that they were overcome by Israel, they made peace with David and became his servants: and the Aramaeans would give no more help to the children of Ammon.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: Now in the spring, at the time when kings go out to war, Joab went out at the head of the armed forces and made waste all the land of the Ammonites and put his men in position before Rabbah, shutting it in. But David was still at Jerusalem. And Joab took Rabbah and made it waste.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: And David took the crown of Milcom from off his head; its weight was a talent of gold and it had stones of great price in it; and it was put on David's head, and he took a great store of goods from the town.

title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 20 Verse 3
