text: You say, See, I have overcome Edom; and your heart is lifted up with pride: now keep in your country; why do you make causes of trouble, putting yourself, and Judah with you, in danger of downfall?

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Verse 20
text: But Amaziah gave no attention; and this was the purpose of God, so that he might give them up into the hands of Joash, because they had gone after the gods of Edom.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Verse 21
text: And so Joash, king of Israel, went up; and he and Amaziah, king of Judah, came face to face at Beth-shemesh in Judah.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Verse 22
text: And Judah was overcome before Israel, and they went in flight, every man to his tent.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Verse 23
text: And Joash, king of Israel, made Amaziah, king of Judah, the son of Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, prisoner at Beth-shemesh, and took him to Jerusalem; and he had the wall of Jerusalem pulled down from the doorway of Ephraim to the doorway in the angle, four hundred cubits.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Verse 24
text: And he took all the gold and silver and all the vessels which were in the house of the Lord, under the care of Obed-edom, and all the wealth from the king's house, as well as those whose lives would be the price of broken faith, and went back to Samaria.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Verse 25
text: Amaziah, son of Joash, king of Judah, went on living for fifteen years after the death of Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, king of Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Verse 26
text: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, first and last, are they not recorded in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel?

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Verse 27
text: Now from the time when Amaziah gave up worshipping the Lord, they made secret designs against him in Jerusalem; and he went in flight to Lachish: but they sent to Lachish after him and put him to death there.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 25 Verse 28
text: And they took his body on horseback and put it into the earth with his fathers in the town of David.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: Then all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amaziah.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: He was the builder of Eloth, which he got back for Judah after the death of the king.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: Uzziah was sixteen years old when he became king, and he was ruling in Jerusalem for fifty-two years; his mother's name was Jechiliah of Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as his father Amaziah had done.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: He gave himself to searching after God in the days of Zechariah, who made men wise in the fear of God; and as long as he was true to the Lord, God made things go well for him.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: He went out and made war against the Philistines, pulling down the walls of Gath and Jabneh and Ashdod, and building towns in the country round Ashdod and among the Philistines.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: And God gave him help against the Philistines, and against the Arabians living in Gur-baal, and against the Meunim.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: The Ammonites gave offerings to Uzziah: and news of him went out as far as the limit of Egypt; for he became very great in power.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: Uzziah made towers in Jerusalem, at the doorway in the angle and at the doorway in the valley and at the turn of the wall, arming them.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: And he put up towers in the waste land and made places for storing water, for he had much cattle, in the low hills and in the table land; and he had farmers and vine-keepers in the mountains and in the fertile land, for he was a lover of farming.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: In addition, Uzziah had an army of fighting-men who went out to war in bands, as they had been listed by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the ruler, under the authority of Hananiah, one of the king's captains.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: The heads of families, the strong men of war, were two thousand, six hundred.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 13
text: And under their orders was a trained army of three hundred and seven thousand, five hundred, of great strength in war, helping the king against any who came against him.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 14
text: And Uzziah had all these forces armed with body-covers and spears and head-covers and coats of metal and bows and stones for sending from leather bands.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 15
text: And in Jerusalem he made machines, the invention of expert men, to be placed on the towers and angles of the walls for sending arrows and great stones. And his name was honoured far and wide; for he was greatly helped till he was strong.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 16
text: But when he had become strong, his heart was lifted up in pride, causing his destruction; and he did evil against the Lord his God; for he went into the Temple of the Lord for the purpose of burning perfumes on the altar of perfumes.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 17
text: And Azariah the priest went in after him, with eighty of the Lord's priests, who were strong men;

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 18
text: And they made protests to Uzziah the king, and said to him, The burning of perfumes, Uzziah, is not your business but that of the priests, the sons of Aaron, who have been made holy for this work: go out of the holy place, for you have done wrong, and it will not be to your honour before God.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 19
text: Then Uzziah was angry; and he had in his hand a vessel for burning perfume; and while his wrath was bitter against the priests, the mark of the leper's disease came out on his brow, before the eyes of the priests in the house of the Lord by the altar of perfumes.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 20
text: And Azariah, the chief priest, and all the priests, looking at him, saw the mark of the leper on his brow, and they sent him out quickly and he himself went out straight away, for the Lord's punishment had come on him.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 21
text: So King Uzziah was a leper till the day of his death, living separately in his private house; for he was cut off from the house of God; and Jotham his son was ruling over his house, judging the people of the land.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 22
text: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, were recorded by Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 26 Verse 23
text: So Uzziah went to rest with his fathers; and they put his body into the earth in the field used for the resting-place of the kings, for they said, He is a leper: and Jotham his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: Jotham was twenty-five years old when he became king; and he was ruling in Jerusalem for sixteen years; and his mother's name was Jerushah, the daughter of Zadok.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as his father Uzziah had done; but he did not go into the Temple of the Lord. And the people still went on in their evil ways.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: He put up the higher doorway of the house of the Lord, and did much building on the wall of the Ophel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Verse 4
text: In addition, he made towns in the hill-country of Judah, and strong buildings and towers in the woodlands.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Verse 5
text: He went to war with the king of the children of Ammon and overcame them. That year, the children of Ammon gave him a hundred talents of silver, and ten thousand measures of grain and ten thousand measures of barley. And the children of Ammon gave him the same amount the second year and the third.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Verse 6
text: So Jotham became strong, because in all his ways he made the Lord his guide.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Verse 7
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all his wars and his ways, are recorded in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Verse 8
text: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he was ruling in Jerusalem for sixteen years.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 27 Verse 9
text: And Jotham went to rest with his fathers, and they put his body into the earth in the town of David; and Ahaz his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 1
text: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he was ruling in Jerusalem for sixteen years; he did not do what was right in the eyes of the Lord, like David his father:

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 2
text: But he went in the ways of the kings of Israel and made images of metal for the Baals.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 3
text: More than this, he had offerings burned in the valley of the son of Hinnom, and made his children go through fire, copying the disgusting ways of the nations whom the Lord had sent out of the land before the children of Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 4
text: And he made offerings and had perfumes burned in the high places and on the hills and under every green tree.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 5
text: So the Lord his God gave him up into the hands of the king of Aram; and they overcame him, and took away a great number of his people as prisoners to Damascus. Then he was given into the hands of the king of Israel, who sent great destruction on him.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 6
text: For Pekah, the son of Remaliah, in one day put to death a hundred and twenty thousand men of Judah, all of them good fighting-men; because they had given up the Lord, the God of their fathers.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 7
text: And Zichri, a great fighting-man of Ephraim, put to death Maaseiah, the king's son, and Azrikam, the controller of his house, and Elkanah, who was second in authority to the king.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 8
text: And the children of Israel took away as prisoners from their brothers, two hundred thousand, women and sons and daughters, and a great store of their goods, and took them to Samaria.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 9
text: But a prophet of the Lord was there, named Oded; and he went out in front of the army which was coming into Samaria and said to them, Truly, because the Lord, the God of your fathers, was angry with Judah, he gave them up into your hands, and you have put them to death in an outburst of wrath stretching up to heaven.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 10
text: And now your purpose is to keep the children of Judah and Jerusalem as men-servants and women-servants under your yoke: but are there no sins against the Lord your God to be seen among yourselves?

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 11
text: And now give ear to me, and send back the prisoners whom you have taken from your brothers: for the wrath of the Lord is burning against you.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 12
text: Then certain of the heads of the children of Ephraim, Azariah, the son of Johanan, Berechiah, the son of Meshillemoth Jehizkiah, the son of Shallum, and Amasa the son of Hadlai, put themselves against those who had come from the war,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 13
text: And said to them, You are not to let these prisoners come here; for what you are designing to do will be a cause of sin against the Lord to us, making even greater our sin and our wrongdoing, which now are great enough, and his wrath is burning against Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 14
text: So the armed men gave up the prisoners and the goods they had taken to the heads and the meeting of the people.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 15
text: And those men who have been named went up and took the prisoners, clothing those among them who were uncovered, with things from the goods which had been taken in the war, and putting robes on them and shoes on their feet; and they gave them food and drink and oil for their bodies, and seating all the feeble among them on asses, they took them to Jericho, the town of palm-trees, to their people, and then went back to Samaria.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 16
text: At that time King Ahaz sent for help to the king of Assyria.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 17
text: For the Edomites had come again, attacking Judah and taking away prisoners.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 18
text: And the Philistines, forcing their way into the towns of the lowlands and the south of Judah, had taken Beth-shemesh and Aijalon and Gederoth and Soco, with their daughter-towns, as well as Timnah and Gimzo and their daughter-towns, and were living there.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 19
text: For the Lord made Judah low, because of Ahaz, king of Israel; for he had given up all self-control in Judah, sinning greatly against the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 20
text: Then Tiglath-pileser, king of Assyria, came to him, but was a cause of trouble and not of strength to him.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 21
text: For Ahaz took a part of the wealth from the house of the Lord, and from the house of the king and of the great men, and gave it to the king of Assyria; but it was no help to him.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 22
text: And in the time of his trouble, this same King Ahaz did even more evil against the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 23
text: For he made offerings to the gods of Damascus, who were attacking him, and said, Because the gods of the kings of Aram are giving them help, I will make offerings to them so that they may give me help. But they were the cause of his downfall, and of that of all Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 24
text: And Ahaz got together the vessels of the house of God, cutting up all the vessels of the house of God, and shutting the doors of the Lord's house; and he made altars in every part of Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 25
text: And in every town of Judah he made high places where perfumes were burned to other gods, awaking the wrath of the Lord, the God of his fathers.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 26
text: Now the rest of his acts and all his ways, first and last, are recorded in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 28 Verse 27
text: And Ahaz went to rest with his fathers, and they put his body into the earth in Jerusalem; but they did not put him in the resting-place of the kings of Israel: and Hezekiah his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 1
text: Hezekiah became king when he was twenty-five years old; and he was king in Jerusalem for twenty-nine years; and his mother's name was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 2
text: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as his father David had done.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 3
text: In the first year of his rule, in the first month, opening the doors of the Lord's house, he made them strong.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 4
text: And he sent for the priests and the Levites, and got them together in the wide place on the east side,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 5
text: And said to them, Give ear to me, O Levites: now make yourselves holy, and make holy the house of the Lord, the God of your fathers, and take away everything unclean from the holy place.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 6
text: For our fathers have done evil, sinning in the eyes of the Lord our God, and have given him up, turning away their faces from the house of the Lord, and turning their backs on him.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 7
text: The doors of his house have been shut and the lights put out; no perfumes have been burned or offerings made to the God of Israel in his holy place.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 8
text: And so the wrath of the Lord has come on Judah and Jerusalem, and he has given them up to be a cause of fear and wonder and shame, as your eyes have seen.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 9
text: For see, our fathers have been put to death with the sword, and our sons and daughters and wives have been taken away prisoners because of this.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 10
text: Now it is my purpose to make an agreement with the Lord, the God of Israel, so that the heat of his wrath may be turned away from us.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 11
text: My sons, take care now: for you have been marked out by the Lord to come before him and to be his servants, burning offerings to him.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 12
text: Then the Levites took their places; Mahath, the son of Amasai, and Joel, the son of Azariah, among the Kohathites; and of the sons of Merari, Kish, the son of Abdi, and Azariah, the son of Jehallelel; and of the Gershonites, Joah, the son of Zimmah, and Eden, the son of Joah;

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 13
text: And of the sons of Elizaphan, Shimri and Jeuel; and of the sons of Asaph, Zechariah and Mattaniah;

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 14
text: And of the sons of Heman, Jehuel and Shimei; and of the sons of Jeduthun, Shemaiah and Uzziel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 15
text: And they got their brothers together and made themselves holy, and went in, as the king had said by the word of the Lord, to make the house of the Lord clean.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 16
text: And the priests went into the inner part of the house of the Lord to make it clean, and everything unclean which was to be seen in the Temple of the Lord they took out into the outer square of the Lord's house, and the Levites got it together and took it away to the stream Kidron.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 17
text: On the first day of the first month the work of making the house holy was started, and on the eighth day they came to the covered way of the Lord; in eight days they made the Lord's house holy, and on the sixteenth day of the first month the work was done.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 18
text: Then they went in to King Hezekiah and said, We have made all the house of the Lord clean, as well as the altar of burned offerings with all its vessels, and the table for the holy bread, with all its vessels.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 19
text: And all the vessels which were turned out by King Ahaz in his sin while he was king, we have put in order and made holy, and now they are in their places before the altar of the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 20
text: Then Hezekiah the king got up early, and got together the great men of the town, and went up to the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 21
text: And they took with them seven oxen and seven male sheep and seven lambs and seven he-goats as a sin-offering for the kingdom and for the holy house and for Judah. And he gave orders to the sons of Aaron, the priests, that these were to be offered on the altar of the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 22
text: So they put the oxen to death and their blood was given to the priests to be drained out against the altar; then they put the male sheep to death, draining out their blood against the altar, and they put the lambs to death, draining out their blood against the altar.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 23
text: Then they took the he-goats for the sin-offering, placing them before the king and the meeting of the people, and they put their hands on them:

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 24
text: And the priests put them to death, and made a sin-offering with their blood on the altar, to take away the sin of all Israel: for the king gave orders that the burned offering and the sin-offering were for all Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 25
text: Then he put the Levites in their places in the house of the Lord, with brass and corded instruments of music as ordered by David and Gad, the king's seer, and Nathan the prophet: for the order was the Lord's, given by his prophets.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 26
text: So the Levites took their places with David's instruments, and the priests with their horns.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 27
text: And Hezekiah gave the word for the burned offering to be offered on the altar. And when the burned offering was started, then the song of the Lord was started, with the blowing of horns and with all the instruments of David, king of Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 28
text: And all the people gave worship, to the sound of songs and the blowing of horns; and this went on till the burned offering was ended.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 29
text: And at the end of the offering, the king and all who were present with him gave worship with bent heads.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 30
text: Then King Hezekiah and the captains gave orders to the Levites to give praise to God in the words of David and Asaph the seer. And they made songs of praise with joy, and with bent heads gave worship.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 31
text: Then Hezekiah made answer and said, Now that you have given yourselves to the Lord, come near and take offerings and praise-offerings into the house of the Lord. So all the people took in offerings and praise-offerings: and those whose hearts were moved, took in burned offerings.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 32
text: The number of burned offerings which the people took in was seventy oxen, a hundred male sheep, and two hundred lambs: all these were for burned offerings to the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 33
text: And the holy things were six hundred oxen and three thousand sheep.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 34
text: There were not enough priests for the work of cutting up all the burned offerings; so their brothers the Levites gave them help till the work was done and the priests had made themselves holy: for the Levites were more upright in heart to make themselves holy than the priests.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 35
text: And there was a great amount of burned offerings, with the fat of the peace-offerings and the drink offerings for every burned offering. So the work of the Lord's house was put in order.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 29 Verse 36
text: And Hezekiah and all the people were full of joy, because God had made the people ready: for the thing was done suddenly.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 1
text: Then Hezekiah sent word to all Israel and Judah, and sent letters to Ephraim and Manasseh, requesting them to come to the house of the Lord at Jerusalem, to keep the Passover to the Lord, the God of Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 2
text: For the king, after discussion with his chiefs and all the body of the people in Jerusalem, had made a decision to keep the Passover in the second month.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 3
text: It was not possible to keep it at that time, because not enough priests had made themselves holy, and the people had not come together in Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 4
text: And the thing was right in the eyes of the king and all the people.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 5
text: So it was ordered that word was to be sent out through all Israel, from Beer-sheba to Dan, that they were to come to keep the Passover to the Lord, the God of Israel, at Jerusalem: because they had not kept it in great numbers in agreement with the law.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 6
text: So runners went with letters from the king and his chiefs through all Israel and Judah, by the order of the king, saying, O children of Israel, come back again to the Lord, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, so that he may come again to that small band of you which has been kept safe out of the hands of the kings of Assyria.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 7
text: Do not be like your fathers and your brothers, who were sinners against the Lord, the God of their fathers, so that he made them a cause of fear, as you see.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 8
text: Now do not be hard-hearted, as your fathers were; but give yourselves to the Lord, and come into his holy place, which he has made his for ever, and be the servants of the Lord your God, so that the heat of his wrath may be turned away from you.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 9
text: For if you come back to the Lord, those who took away your brothers and your children will have pity on them, and let them come back to this land: for the Lord your God is full of grace and mercy, and his face will not be turned away from you if you come back to him.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 10
text: So the runners went from town to town through all the country of Ephraim and Manasseh as far as Zebulun: but they were laughed at and made sport of.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 11
text: However, some of Asher and Manasseh and Zebulun put away their pride and came to Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 12
text: And in Judah the power of God gave them one heart to do the orders of the king and the captains, which were taken as the word of the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 13
text: So a very great number of people came together at Jerusalem to keep the feast of unleavened bread in the second month.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 14
text: And they got to work and took away all the altars in Jerusalem, and they put all the vessels for burning perfumes into the stream Kidron.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 15
text: Then on the fourteenth day of the second month they put the Passover lambs to death: and the priests and the Levites were shamed, and made themselves holy and took burned offerings into the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 16
text: And they took their places in their right order, as it was ordered in the law of Moses, the man of God: the priests draining out on the altar the blood given them by the Levites.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 17
text: For there were still a number of the people there who had not made themselves holy: so the Levites had to put Passover lambs to death for those who were not clean, to make them holy to the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 18
text: For a great number of the people from Ephraim and Manasseh, Issachar and Zebulun, had not made themselves clean, but they took the Passover meal, though not in the right way. For Hezekiah had made prayer for them, saying, May the good Lord have mercy on everyone

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 19
text: Who, with all his heart, is turned to God the Lord, the God of his fathers, even if he has not been made clean after the rules of the holy place.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 20
text: And the Lord gave ear to Hezekiah, and made the people well.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 21
text: So the children of Israel who were present in Jerusalem kept the feast of unleavened bread for seven days with great joy: and the Levites and the priests gave praise to the Lord day by day, making melody to the Lord with loud instruments.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 22
text: And Hezekiah said kind words to the Levites who were expert in the ordering of the worship of the Lord: so they kept the feast for seven days, offering peace-offerings and praising the Lord, the God of their fathers.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 23
text: And by the desire of all the people, the feast went on for another seven days, and they kept the seven days with joy.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 24
text: For Hezekiah, king of Judah, gave to the people for offerings, a thousand oxen and seven thousand sheep; and the rulers gave a thousand oxen and ten thousand sheep; and a great number of priests made themselves holy.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 25
text: And all the people of Judah, with the priests and the Levites, and those who had come from Israel, and men from other lands who had come from Israel or who were living in Judah, were glad with great joy.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 26
text: So there was great joy in Jerusalem: for nothing like this had been seen in Jerusalem from the time of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 30 Verse 27
text: Then the priests and the Levites gave the people a blessing: and the voice of their prayer went up to the holy place of God in heaven.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 1
text: Now when all this was over, all the men of Israel who were present went out into the towns of Judah, causing the stone pillars to be broken up and the wood pillars to be cut down, pulling down the high places and the altars in all Judah and Benjamin, as well as in Ephraim and Manasseh, till all were gone. Then all the children of Israel went back to their towns, every man to his property.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 2
text: Then Hezekiah put in order the divisions of the priests and Levites, every man in his division, in relation to his work, for the burned offerings and peace-offerings, and for the ordering of worship and for giving praise at the doors of the Lord's house.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 3
text: And he gave the king's part of his private property for the burned offerings, that is, for the morning and evening offerings, and the offerings for the Sabbath and the new moons and the regular feasts, as it is recorded in the law of the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 4
text: In addition, he gave orders to the people of Jerusalem to give to the priests and Levites that part which was theirs by right, so that they might be strong in keeping the law of the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 5
text: And when the order was made public, straight away the children of Israel gave, in great amounts, the first-fruits of their grain and wine and oil and honey, and of the produce of their fields; and they took in a tenth part of everything, a great store.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 6
text: And the children of Israel and Judah, who were living in the towns of Judah came with the tenth part of their oxen and sheep, and a tenth of all the holy things which were to be given to the Lord their God, and put them in great masses.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 7
text: The first store of things was put down in the third month, and in the seventh month the masses were complete.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 8
text: And when Hezekiah and the rulers came and saw all the store of goods, they gave praise to the Lord and to his people Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 9
text: Then Hezekiah put questions to the priests and Levites about the store of goods.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 10
text: And Azariah, the chief priest, of the family of Zadok, said in answer, From the time when the people first came with their offerings into the house of the Lord, we have had food enough, and more than enough: for the blessing of the Lord is on his people; and there is this great store which has not been used.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 11
text: Then Hezekiah said that store-rooms were to be made ready in the house of the Lord; and this was done.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 12
text: And in them they put all the offerings and the tenths and the holy things, keeping nothing back, and over them was Conaniah the Levite, with Shimei his brother second to him.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 13
text: And Jehiel and Azaziah and Nahath and Asahel and Jerimoth and Jozabad and Eliel and Ismachiah and Mahath and Benaiah were overseers, under the directions of Conaniah and Shimei his brother, by the order of Hezekiah the king and Azariah, the ruler of the house of God.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 14
text: And Kore, the son of Imnah the Levite, the keeper of the east door, had control of the offerings freely given to God, and the distribution of the offerings of the Lord and the most holy things.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 15
text: And under him were Eden and Miniamin and Jeshua and Shemaiah and Amariah and Shecaniah, in the towns of the priests, who were made responsible for giving it to all their brothers, by divisions, to small and great:

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 16
text: As well as to all the males, of three years old and over, listed by their families, who went into the house of the Lord to do what was needed day by day, for their special work with their divisions.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 17
text: And the families of the priests were listed by their fathers' names, but the Levites, of twenty years old and over, were listed in relation to their work in their divisions;

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 18
text: And in the lists were all their little ones and their wives and their sons and daughters, through all the people: they made themselves holy in the positions which they were given.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 19
text: And as for the sons of Aaron, the priests, living in the country on the outskirts of their towns, every different town there were men, marked out by name, to give their part of the goods to all the males among the priests, and to all who were listed among the Levites.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 20
text: This Hezekiah did through all Judah; he did what was good and right and true before the Lord his God.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 31 Verse 21
text: And for everything he undertook, in connection with the work of the house of God and his law and orders, he got directions from God and did it with serious purpose; and things went well for him.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 1
text: Now after these things and this true-hearted work, Sennacherib, king of Assyria, came into Judah, and put his army in position before the walled towns of Judah, designing to make his way into them by force.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 2
text: And when Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib had come for the purpose of fighting against Jerusalem,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 3
text: He took up with his rulers and men of war the question of stopping up the water-springs outside the town; and they gave him their support.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 4
text: So they got together a great number of people, and had all the water-springs and the stream flowing through the land stopped up, saying, Why let the kings of Assyria come and have much water?

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 5
text: Then he took heart, building up the wall where it was broken down, and making its towers higher, and building another wall outside; and he made strong the Millo in the town of David, and got together a great store of all sorts of instruments of war.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 6
text: And he put war chiefs over the people, and sent for them all to come together to him in the wide place at the doorway into the town, and to give them heart he said to them,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 7
text: Be strong and take heart; have no fear, and do not be troubled on account of the king of Assyria and all the great army with him: for there is a greater with us.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 8
text: With him is an arm of flesh; but we have the Lord our God, helping us and fighting for us. And the people put their faith in what Hezekiah, king of Judah, said.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 9
text: After this, Sennacherib, king of Assyria, sent his servants to Jerusalem (at that time he was stationed with all his army in front of Lachish), to say to Hezekiah and all the men of Judah in Jerusalem,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 10
text: Sennacherib, king of Assyria, says, In what are you placing your hope, waiting here in the walled town of Jerusalem?

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 11
text: Is it not Hezekiah who has got you to do it, causing your death from need of food and water, by saying, The Lord our God will give us salvation out of the hands of the king of Assyria?

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 12
text: Has not this same Hezekiah taken away his high places and his altars, saying to Judah and Jerusalem, Give worship before one altar only, burning offerings on it?

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 13
text: Have you no knowledge of what I and my fathers have done to all the peoples of every land? were the gods of the nations of those lands able to keep their land from falling into my hands?

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 14
text: Who was there among all the gods of those nations, which my fathers put to destruction, who was able to keep his people safe from my hands? and is it possible that your God will keep you safe from my hands?

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 15
text: So do not be tricked by Hezekiah or let him get you to do this, and do not put any faith in what he says: for no god of any nation or kingdom has been able to keep his people safe from my hands, or the hands of my fathers: how much less will your God keep you safe from my hands!

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 16
text: And his servants said even more against the Lord God and against his servant Hezekiah.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 17
text: And he sent letters, in addition, to put shame on the Lord, the God of Israel, and to say evil against him, saying, As the gods of the nations of other lands have not been able to keep their people safe from my hands, no more will the God of Hezekiah keep his people safe from my hands.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 18
text: These things they said, crying out with a loud voice in the Jews' language, to the people of Jerusalem who were on the wall, with the purpose of troubling them and putting fear into them, so that they might take the town;

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 19
text: Talking of the God of Jerusalem as if he was like the gods of the peoples of the earth, the work of men's hands.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 20
text: And Hezekiah the king, and Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, made prayer because of this, crying out to heaven.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 21
text: And the Lord sent an angel who put to death all the men of war and the chiefs and the captains in the army of the king of Assyria. So he went back to his country in shame. And when he came into the house of his god, his sons, the offspring of his body, put him to death there with the sword.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 22
text: So the Lord gave Hezekiah and the people of Jerusalem salvation from the power of Sennacherib, the king of Assyria, and from all others, giving them rest on every side.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 23
text: And great numbers came to Jerusalem with offerings for the Lord, and things of great price for Hezekiah, king of Judah: so that he was honoured among all nations from that time.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 24
text: In those days Hezekiah was ill and near death; and he made prayer to the Lord, and the Lord in answer gave him a sign.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 25
text: But Hezekiah did not do as had been done to him; for his heart was lifted up in pride; and so wrath came on him and on Judah and Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 26
text: But then, Hezekiah, in sorrow for what he had done, put away his pride; and he and all Jerusalem made themselves low, so that the wrath of the Lord did not come on them in Hezekiah's life-time.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 27
text: And Hezekiah had very great wealth and honour; and he made himself store-houses for his gold and silver and jewels and spices, and for body-covers and all sorts of beautiful vessels.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 28
text: And store-houses for the produce of grain and wine and oil; and buildings for all sorts of beasts and flocks.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 29
text: And he made towns for himself, and got together much property in flocks and herds: for God had given him great wealth.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 30
text: It was Hezekiah who had the higher spring of the water of Gihon stopped, and the water taken down on the west side of the town of David. In everything he undertook, Hezekiah did well.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 31
text: However, in the business of the representatives sent by the rulers of Babylon to get news of the wonder which had taken place in the land, God gave up guiding him, testing him to see what was in his heart.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 32
text: Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and the good he did, are recorded in the vision of Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, and in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 32 Verse 33
text: So Hezekiah went to rest with his fathers, and they put his body into the higher part of the resting-places of the sons of David: and all Judah and the people of Jerusalem gave him honour at his death. And Manasseh his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 1
text: Manasseh was twelve years old when he became king, and he was ruling for fifty-five years in Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 2
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, copying the disgusting ways of the nations whom the Lord had sent out of the land before the children of Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 3
text: For he put up again the high places which had been pulled down by his father Hezekiah; and he made altars for the Baals, and pillars of wood, and was a worshipper and servant of all the stars of heaven;

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 4
text: And he made altars in the house of the Lord, of which the Lord had said, In Jerusalem will my name be for ever.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 5
text: And he made altars for all the stars of heaven in the two outer squares of the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 6
text: More than this, he made his children go through the fire in the valley of the son of Hinnom; and he made use of secret arts, and signs for reading the future, and unnatural powers, and gave positions to those who had control of spirits and to wonder-workers: he did much evil in the eyes of the Lord, moving him to wrath.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 7
text: And he put the image he had made in the house of God, the house of which God had said to David and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, the town which I have made mine out of all the tribes of Israel, will I put my name for ever:

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 8
text: And never again will I let the feet of Israel be moved out of the land which I have given to their fathers; if only they will take care to do all my orders, even all the law and the orders and the rules given to them by Moses.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 9
text: And Manasseh made Judah and the people of Jerusalem go out of the true way, so that they did more evil than those nations whom the Lord gave up to destruction before the children of Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 10
text: And the word of the Lord came to Manasseh and his people, but they gave no attention.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 11
text: So the Lord sent against them the captains of the army of Assyria, who made Manasseh a prisoner and took him away in chains to Babylon.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 12
text: And crying out to the Lord his God in his trouble, he made himself low before the God of his fathers,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 13
text: And made prayer to him; and in answer to his prayer God let him come back to Jerusalem and to his kingdom. Then Manasseh was certain that the Lord was God.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 14
text: After this he made an outer wall for the town of David, on the west side of Gihon in the valley, as far as the way into the town by the fish doorway; and he put a very high wall round the Ophel; and he put captains of the army in all the walled towns of Judah.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 15
text: He took away the strange gods and the image out of the house of the Lord, and all the altars he had put up on the hill of the Lord's house and in Jerusalem, and put them out of the town.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 16
text: And he put the altar of the Lord in order, offering peace-offerings and praise-offerings on it, and said that all Judah were to be servants of the Lord, the God of Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 17
text: However, the people still made offerings in the high places, but only to the Lord their God.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 18
text: Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and his prayer to his God, and the words which the seers said to him in the name of the Lord, the God of Israel, are recorded among the acts of the kings of Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 19
text: And the prayer which he made to God, and how God gave him an answer, and all his sin and his wrongdoing, and the places where he made high places and put up pillars of wood and images, before he put away his pride, are recorded in the history of the seers.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 20
text: So Manasseh went to rest with his fathers, and they put his body to rest in his house, and Amon his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 21
text: Amon was twenty-two years old when he became king; and he was ruling for two years in Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 22
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, as Manasseh his father had done; and Amon made offerings to all the images which his father Manasseh had made, and was their servant.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 23
text: He did not make himself low before the Lord, as his father Manasseh had done, but went on sinning more and more.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 24
text: And his servants made a secret design against him, and put him to death in his house.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 33 Verse 25
text: But the people of the land put to death all those who had taken part in the design against King Amon, and made his son Josiah king in his place.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 1
text: Josiah was eight years old when he became king; he was ruling in Jerusalem for thirty-one years.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 2
text: And he did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, walking in the ways of his father David, without turning to the right hand or to the left.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 3
text: In the eighth year of his rule, while he was still young, his heart was first turned to the God of his father David; and in the twelfth year he undertook the clearing away of all the high places and the pillars and the images of wood and metal from Judah and Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 4
text: He had the altars of the Baals broken down, while he himself was present; and the sun-images which were placed on high over them he had cut down; and the pillars of wood and the metal images he had broken up and crushed to dust, dropping the dust over the resting-places of the dead who had made offerings to them.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 5
text: And he had the bones of the priests burned on their altars, and so he made Judah and Jerusalem clean.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 6
text: And in all the towns of Manasseh and Ephraim and Simeon as far as Naphtali, he made waste their houses round about.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 7
text: He had the altars and the pillars of wood pulled down and the images crushed to dust, and all the sun-images cut down, through all the land of Israel, and then he went back to Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 8
text: Now in the eighteenth year of his rule, when the land and the house had been made clean, he sent Shaphan, the son of Azaliah, and Maaseiah, the ruler of the town, and Joah, the son of Joahaz, the recorder, to make good what was damaged in the house of the Lord his God.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 9
text: And they came to Hilkiah, the chief priest, and gave him all the money which had been taken into the house of God, which the Levites, the keepers of the door, had got from Manasseh and Ephraim and those of Israel who had not been taken away as prisoners, and from all Judah and Benjamin and the people of Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 10
text: And they gave it to the overseers of the work of the Lord's house, and the overseers gave it to the workmen working in the house, for building it up and making good what was damaged;

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 11
text: Even to the woodworkers and builders to get cut stone and wood for joining the structure together and for making boards for the houses which the kings of Judah had given up to destruction.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 12
text: And the men did the work well; and those who had authority over them were Jahath and Obadiah, Levites of the sons of Merari, and Zechariah and Meshullam, of the sons of the Kohathites, who were to be responsible for seeing that the work was done; and others of the Levites, who were expert with instruments of music,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 13
text: Had authority over the transport workers, giving directions to all who were doing any sort of work; and among the Levites there were scribes and overseers and door-keepers.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 14
text: Now when they were taking out the money which had come into the Lord's house, Hilkiah the priest came across the book of the law of the Lord, which he had given by the mouth of Moses.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 15
text: Then Hilkiah said to Shaphan the scribe, I have made discovery of the book of the law in the house of the Lord. And Hilkiah gave the book to Shaphan.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 16
text: And Shaphan took the book to the king; and he gave him an account of what had been done, saying, Your servants are doing all they have been given to do;

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 17
text: They have taken out all the money which was in the Lord's house and have given it to the overseers and to the workmen.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 18
text: Then Shaphan the scribe said to the king, Hilkiah the priest has given me a book; and he made a start at reading some of it to the king.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 19
text: And the king, hearing the words of the law, took his robe in his hands, violently parting it as a sign of his grief.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 20
text: And he gave orders to Hilkiah and to Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, and Abdon, the son of Micah, and Shaphan the scribe and Asaiah, the king's servant, saying,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 21
text: Go and get directions from the Lord for me and for those who are still in Israel and for Judah, about the words of this book which has come to light; for great is the wrath of the Lord which has been let loose on us, because our fathers have not kept the word of the Lord or done what is recorded in this book.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 22
text: So Hilkiah, and those whom the king sent, went to Huldah the woman prophet, the wife of Shallum, the son of Tokhath, the son of Hasrah, the keeper of the robes (now she was living in Jerusalem, in the second part of the town); and they had talk with her about this thing.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 23
text: And she said to them, The Lord, the God of Israel, has said, Say to the man who sent you to me,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 24
text: These are the words of the Lord: See, I will send evil on this place and on its people, even all the curses in the book which they have been reading before the king of Judah;

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 25
text: Because they have given me up, burning offerings to other gods and moving me to wrath by all the works of their hands; so my wrath is let loose on this place and will not be put out.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 26
text: But to the king of Judah who sent you to get directions from the Lord, say, This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said: Because you have given ear to my words,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 27
text: And your heart was soft, and you made yourself low before God, on hearing his words about this place and its people, and with weeping and signs of grief have made yourself low before me, I have given ear to you, says the Lord God.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 28
text: See, I will let you go to your fathers, and be put in your last resting-place in peace, and your eyes will not see all the evil which I will send on this place and on its people. So they took this news back to the king.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 29
text: Then the king sent and got together all the responsible men of Judah and of Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 30
text: And the king went up to the house of the Lord, with all the men of Judah and the people of Jerusalem, and the priests and the Levites and all the people, small and great; and they were present at his reading of the book of the law which had come to light in the house of the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 31
text: Then the king, taking his place by the pillar, made an agreement before the Lord, to go in the way of the Lord, and to keep his orders and his decisions and his rules with all his heart and with all his soul, and to keep the words of the agreement recorded in this book.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 32
text: And he made all the people in Jerusalem and Benjamin give their word to keep it. And the people of Jerusalem kept the agreement of God, the God of their fathers.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 34 Verse 33
text: Josiah took away all the disgusting things out of all the lands of the children of Israel, and made all who were in Israel servants of the Lord their God. And as long as he was living they were true to the Lord, the God of their fathers.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 1
text: And Josiah kept a Passover to the Lord in Jerusalem; on the fourteenth day of the first month they put the Passover lamb to death.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 2
text: And he gave the priests their places, making them strong for the work of the house of God.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 3
text: And he said to the Levites, the teachers of all Israel, who were holy to the Lord, See, the holy ark is in the house which Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel, made; it will no longer have to be transported on your backs: now be the servants of the Lord your God and his people Israel,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 4
text: And make yourselves ready in your divisions, by your families, as it is ordered in the writings of David, king of Israel, and of Solomon his son;

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 5
text: And take your positions in the holy place, grouped in the families of your brothers, the children of the people, and for every division let there be a part of a family of the Levites.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 6
text: And put the Passover lamb to death, and make yourselves holy, and make it ready for your brothers, so that the orders given by the Lord through Moses may be done.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 7
text: And Josiah gave lambs and goats from the flock as Passover offerings for all the people who were present, to the number of thirty thousand, and three thousand oxen: these were from the king's private property.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 8
text: And his captains freely gave an offering to the people, the priests, and the Levites. Hilkiah and Zechariah and Jehiel, the rulers of the house of God, gave to the priests for the Passover offerings two thousand, six hundred small cattle and three hundred oxen.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 9
text: And Conaniah and Shemaiah and Nethanel, his brothers, and Hashabiah and Jeiel and Jozabad, the chiefs of the Levites, gave to the Levites for the Passover offerings five thousand small cattle and five hundred oxen.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 10
text: So everything was made ready and the priests took their places with the Levites in their divisions, as the king had said.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 11
text: And they put the Passover lambs to death, the blood being drained out by the priests when it was given to them, and the Levites did the skinning.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 12
text: And they took away the burned offerings, so that they might give them to be offered to the Lord for the divisions of the families of the people, as it is recorded in the book of Moses. And they did the same with the oxen.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 13
text: And the Passover lamb was cooked over the fire, as it says in the law; and the holy offerings were cooked in pots and basins and vessels, and taken quickly to all the people.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 14
text: And after that, they made ready for themselves and for the priests; for the priests, the sons of Aaron, were offering the burned offerings and the fat till night; so the Levites made ready what was needed for themselves and for the priests, the sons of Aaron.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 15
text: And the sons of Asaph, the makers of melody, were in their places, as ordered by David and Asaph and Heman and Jeduthun, the king's seer; and the door-keepers were stationed at every door: there was no need for them to go away from their places, for their brothers the Levites made ready for them.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 16
text: So everything needed for the worship of the Lord was made ready that same day, for the keeping of the Passover and the offering of burned offerings on the altar of the Lord, as King Josiah had given orders.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 17
text: And all the children of Israel who were present kept the Passover and the feast of unleavened bread at that time for seven days.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 18
text: No Passover like it had been kept in Israel from the days of Samuel the prophet; and not one of the kings of Israel had ever kept a Passover like the one kept by Josiah and the priests and the Levites and all those of Judah and Israel who were present, and the people of Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 19
text: In the eighteenth year of the rule of Josiah this Passover was kept.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 20
text: After all this, and after Josiah had put the house in order, Neco, king of Egypt, went up to make war at Carchemish by the river Euphrates; and Josiah went out against him.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 21
text: But he sent representatives to him, saying, What have I to do with you, O king of Judah? I have not come against you this day, but against those with whom I am at war; and God has given me orders to go forward quickly: keep out of God's way, for he is with me, or he will send destruction on you.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 22
text: However, Josiah would not go back; but keeping to his purpose of fighting against him, and giving no attention to the words of Neco, which came from God, he went forward to the fight in the valley of Megiddo.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 23
text: And the bowmen sent their arrows at King Josiah, and the king said to his servants, Take me away, for I am badly wounded.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 24
text: So his servants took him out of the line of war-carriages, and put him in his second carriage and took him to Jerusalem, where he came to his end, and they put his body in the resting-place of his fathers. And in all Judah and Jerusalem there was great weeping for Josiah.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 25
text: And Jeremiah made a song of grief for Josiah; and to this day Josiah is named by all the makers of melody, men and women, in their songs of grief; they made it a rule in Israel; and the songs are recorded among the songs of grief.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 26
text: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and the good he did, in keeping with what is recorded in the law of the Lord,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Verse 27
text: And all his acts, first and last, are recorded in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 1
text: Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz, the son of Josiah, and made him king in Jerusalem in place of his father.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 2
text: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he became king; he was ruling in Jerusalem for three months.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 3
text: Then the king of Egypt took the kingdom from him in Jerusalem, and put on the land a tax of a hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 4
text: And the king of Egypt made Eliakim his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem, changing his name to Jehoiakim. And Neco took his brother Jehoahaz away to Egypt.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 5
text: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he became king; he was ruling in Jerusalem for eleven years, and he did evil in the eyes of the Lord his God.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 6
text: Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, came up against him, and took him away in chains to Babylon.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 7
text: And Nebuchadnezzar took away some of the vessels of the Lord's house, and put them in the house of his god in Babylon.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 8
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim and the disgusting things he did, and all there is to be said against him, are recorded in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah; and Jehoiachin his son became king in his place.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 9
text: Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he became king; he was ruling in Jerusalem for three months and ten days, and he did evil in the eyes of the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 10
text: In the spring of the year King Nebuchadnezzar sent and took him away to Babylon, with the beautiful vessels of the house of the Lord, and made Zedekiah, his father's brother, king over Judah and Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 11
text: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king; he was ruling in Jerusalem for eleven years.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 12
text: He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, and did not make himself low before Jeremiah the prophet who gave him the word of the Lord.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 13
text: And he took up arms against King Nebuchadnezzar, though he had made him take an oath by God; but he made his neck stiff and his heart hard, turning away from the Lord, the God of Israel.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 14
text: And more than this, all the great men of Judah and the priests and the people made their sin great, turning to all the disgusting ways of the nations; and they made unclean the house of the Lord which he had made holy in Jerusalem.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 15
text: And the Lord, the God of their fathers, sent word to them by his servants, sending early and frequently, because he had pity on his people and on his living-place;

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 16
text: But they put shame on the servants of God, making sport of his words and laughing at his prophets, till the wrath of God was moved against his people, till there was no help.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 17
text: So he sent against them the king of the Chaldaeans, who put their young men to death with the sword in the house of their holy place, and had no pity for any, young man or virgin, old man or white-haired: God gave them all into his hands.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 18
text: And all the vessels of the house of God, great and small, and the stored wealth of the Lord's house and the wealth of the king and his chiefs, he took away to Babylon.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 19
text: And the house of God was burned and the wall of Jerusalem broken down; all its great houses were burned with fire and all its beautiful vessels given up to destruction.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 20
text: And all who had not come to death by the sword he took away prisoners to Babylon; and they became servants to him and to his sons till the kingdom of Persia came to power:

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 21
text: So that the words of the Lord, which he said by the mouth of Jeremiah, might come true, till the land had had pleasure in her Sabbaths; for as long as she was waste the land kept the Sabbath, till seventy years were complete.

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 22
text: Now in the first year of Cyrus, king of Persia, in order that the words which the Lord had said by the mouth of Jeremiah might come true, the spirit of Cyrus, king of Persia, was moved by the Lord, and he made a public statement and had it given out through all his kingdom and put in writing, saying,

title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 36 Verse 23
text: Cyrus, king of Persia, has said, All the kingdoms of the earth have been given to me by the Lord, the God of heaven; and he has made me responsible for building a house for him in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. Whoever there is among you of all his people, may the Lord his God be with him and let him go up.

title: Ezra Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Now in the first year of Cyrus, king of Persia, in order that the word of the Lord given by the mouth of Jeremiah might come true, the spirit of Cyrus, king of Persia, was moved by the Lord, so that he made a public statement through all his kingdom, and put it in writing, saying,

title: Ezra Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: These are the words of Cyrus, king of Persia: The Lord God of heaven has given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and he has made me responsible for building a house for him in Jerusalem, which is in Judah.

title: Ezra Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Whoever there is among you of his people, may his God be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem, which is in Judah, and take in hand the building of the house of the Lord, the God of Israel; he is the God who is in Jerusalem.

title: Ezra Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And whoever there may be of the rest of Israel, living in any place, let the men of that place give him help with offerings of silver and gold and goods and beasts, in addition to the offering freely given for the house of God in Jerusalem.

title: Ezra Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Then the heads of families of Judah and Benjamin, with the priests and the Levites, got ready, even all those whose spirits were moved by God to go up and take in hand the building of the Lord's house in Jerusalem.

title: Ezra Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And all their neighbours gave them help with offerings of vessels of silver and gold and goods and beasts and things of great value, in addition to what was freely offered.

title: Ezra Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And Cyrus the king got out the vessels of the house of the Lord which Nebuchadnezzar had taken from Jerusalem and put in the house of his gods;

title: Ezra Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Even these Cyrus made Mithredath, the keeper of his wealth, get out, and he gave them, after numbering them, to Sheshbazzar, the ruler of Judah.

title: Ezra Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And this is the number of them: there were thirty gold plates, a thousand silver plates, twenty-nine knives,

title: Ezra Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Thirty gold basins, four hundred and ten silver basins, and a thousand other vessels.

title: Ezra Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: There were five thousand, four hundred gold and silver vessels. All these were taken back by Sheshbazzar, when those who had been taken prisoner went up from Babylon to Jerusalem.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Now these are the people of the divisions of the kingdom, among those who had been made prisoners by Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, and taken away to Babylon, who went back to Jerusalem and Judah, everyone to his town;

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: Who went with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispar, Bigvai, Rehum, Baanah, The number of the men of the people of Israel:

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: The children of Parosh, two thousand, one hundred and seventy-two.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: The children of Shephatiah, three hundred and seventy-two.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: The children of Arah, seven hundred and seventy-five.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: The children of Pahath-moab, of the children of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand, eight hundred and twelve.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: The children of Elam, a thousand, two hundred and fifty-four.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: The children of Zattu, nine hundred and forty-five.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: The children of Zaccai, seven hundred and sixty.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: The children of Bani, six hundred and forty-two.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: The children of Bebai, six hundred and twenty-three.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: The children of Azgad, a thousand, two hundred and twenty-two.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: The children of Adonikam, six hundred and sixty-six.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: The children of Bigvai, two thousand and fifty-six.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: The children of Adin, four hundred and fifty-four.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: The children of Ater, of Hezekiah, ninety-eight.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: The children of Bezai, three hundred and twenty-three.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: The children of Jorah, a hundred and twelve.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: The children of Hashum, two hundred and twenty-three.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: The children of Gibbar, ninety-five.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: The children of Beth-lehem, a hundred and twenty-three.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: The men of Netophah, fifty-six.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: The men of Anathoth, a hundred and twenty-eight.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: The children of Azmaveth, forty-two.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: The children of Kiriath-arim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred and forty-three.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: The children of Ramah and Geba, six hundred and twenty-one.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 27
text: The men of Michmas, a hundred and twenty-two.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 28
text: The men of Beth-el and Ai, two hundred and twenty-three.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 29
text: The children of Nebo, fifty-two.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 30
text: The children of Magbish, a hundred and fifty-six.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 31
text: The children of the other Elam, a thousand, two hundred and fifty-four.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 32
text: The children of Harim, three hundred and twenty.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 33
text: The children of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred and twenty-five.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 34
text: The children of Jericho, three hundred and forty-five.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 35
text: The children of Senaah, three thousand, six hundred and thirty.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 36
text: The priests: the children of Jedaiah, of the house of Jeshua, nine hundred and seventy-three.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 37
text: The children of Immer, a thousand and fifty-two.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 38
text: The children of Pashhur, a thousand, two hundred and forty-seven.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 39
text: The children of Harim, a thousand and seventeen.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 40
text: The Levites: the children of Jeshua and Kadmiel, of the children of Hodaviah, seventy-four.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 41
text: The music-makers: the children of Asaph, a hundred and twenty-eight

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 42
text: The children of the door-keepers: the children of Shallum, the children of Ater, the children of Talmon, the children of Akkub, the children of Hatita, the children of Shobai, a hundred and thirty-nine.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 43
text: The Nethinim: the children of Ziha, the children of Hasupha, the children of Tabbaoth,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 44
text: The children of Keros, the children of Siaha, the children of Padon,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 45
text: The children of Lebanah, the children of Hagabah, the children of Akkub,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 46
text: The children of Hagab, the children of Shamlai, the children of Hanan,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 47
text: The children of Giddel, the children of Gahar, the children of Reaiah,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 48
text: The children of Rezin, the children of Nekoda, the children of Gazzam,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 49
text: The children of Uzza, the children of Paseah, the children of Besai,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 50
text: The children of Asnah, the children of Meunim, the children of Nephisim,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 51
text: The children of Bakbuk, the children of Hakupha, the children of Harhur,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 52
text: The children of Bazluth, the children of Mehida, the children of Harsha,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 53
text: The children of Barkos, the children of Sisera, the children of Temah,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 54
text: The children of Neziah, the children of Hatipha.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 55
text: The children of Solomon's servants: the children of Sotai, the children of Hassophereth, the children of Peruda,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 56
text: The children of Jaalah, the children of Darkon, the children of Giddel,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 57
text: The children of Shephatiah, the children of Hattil, the children of Pochereth-hazzebaim, the children of Ami.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 58
text: All the Nethinim, and the children of Solomon's servants, were three hundred and ninety-two.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 59
text: And these were the people who went up from Tel-melah, Tel-harsha, Cherub, Addan, and Immer. But having no knowledge of their fathers' families or offspring, it was not certain that they were Israelites;

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 60
text: The children of Delaiah, the children of Tobiah, the children of Nekoda, six hundred and fifty-two.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 61
text: And of the children of the priests: the children of Habaiah, the children of Hakkoz, the children of Barzillai, who was married to one of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and took their name.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 62
text: They made search for their record among the lists of families, but their names were nowhere to be seen; so they were looked on as unclean and no longer priests.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 63
text: And the Tirshatha said that they were not to have the most holy things for their food, till a priest came to give decision by Urim and Thummim.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 64
text: The number of all the people together was forty-two thousand, three hundred and sixty,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 65
text: As well as their men-servants and their women-servants, of whom there were seven thousand, three hundred and thirty-seven: and they had two hundred men and women to make music.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 66
text: They had seven hundred and thirty-six horses, two hundred and forty-five transport beasts,

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 67
text: Four hundred and thirty-five camels, six thousand, seven hundred and twenty asses.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 68
text: And some of the heads of families, when they came to the house of the Lord which is in Jerusalem, gave freely of their wealth for the building up of the house of God in its place:

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 69
text: Every one, as he was able, gave for the work sixty-one thousand darics of gold, five thousand pounds of silver and a hundred priests' robes.

title: Ezra Chapter 2 Verse 70
text: So the priests and the Levites and the people and the music-makers and the door-keepers and the Nethinim, took up their places in their towns; even all Israel in their towns.

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: And when the seventh month came, and the children of Israel were in the towns, the people came together like one man to Jerusalem.

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: Then Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and his brothers the priests, and Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, with his brothers, got up and made the altar of the God of Israel for burned offerings as is recorded in the law of Moses, the man of God.

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: They put the altar on its base; for fear was on them because of the people of the countries: and they made burned offerings on it to the Lord, even burned offerings morning and evening.

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And they kept the feast of tents, as it is recorded, making the regular burned offerings every day by number, as it is ordered; for every day what was needed.

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And after that, the regular burned offering and the offerings for the new moons and all the fixed feasts of the Lord which had been made holy, and the offering of everyone who freely gave his offering to the Lord.

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: From the first day of the seventh month they made a start with the burned offerings, but the base of the Temple of the Lord had still not been put in its place.

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And they gave money to the stoneworkers and woodworkers; and meat and drink and oil to the people of Zidon and of Tyre, for the transport of cedar-trees from Lebanon to the sea, to Joppa, as Cyrus, king of Persia, had given them authority to do.

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Now in the second year of their coming into the house of God in Jerusalem, in the second month, the work was taken in hand by Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and the rest of their brothers the priests and the Levites, and all those who had come from the land where they were prisoners to Jerusalem: and they made the Levites, of twenty years old and over, responsible for overseeing the work of the house of the Lord.

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Then Jeshua with his sons and his brothers, Kadmiel with his sons, the sons of Hodaviah, together took up the work of overseeing the workmen in the house of God: the sons of Henadad with their sons and their brothers, the Levites.

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And when the builders put in position the base of the Temple of the Lord, the priests, dressed in their robes, took their places with horns, and the Levites, the sons of Asaph, with brass instruments, to give praise to the Lord in the way ordered by David, king of Israel.

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 11
