text: And they gave praise to the Lord, answering one another in their songs and saying, For he is good, for his mercy to Israel is eternal. And all the people gave a great cry of joy, when they gave praise to the Lord, because the base of the Lord's house was put in place.

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: But a number of the priests and Levites and the heads of families, old men who had seen the first house, when the base of this house was put down before their eyes, were overcome with weeping; and a number were crying out with joy:

title: Ezra Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: So that in the ears of the people the cry of joy was mixed with the sound of weeping; for the cries of the people were loud and came to the ears of those who were a long way off.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Now news came to the haters of Judah and Benjamin that the people who had come back were building a Temple to the Lord, the God of Israel;

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: Then they came to Zerubbabel and to the heads of families, and said to them, Let us take part in the building with you; for we are servants of your God, even as you are; and we have been making offerings to him from the days of Esar-haddon, king of Assyria, who put us here.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: But Zerubbabel and Jeshua and the rest of the heads of families in Israel said to them, You have no part with us in the building of a house for our God; we ourselves will do the work together for the Lord, the God of Israel, as Cyrus, king of Persia, has given us orders.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Then the people of the land made the hands of the people of Judah feeble, troubling them with fear in their building;

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: And they gave payment to men who made designs against them and kept them from effecting their purpose, all through the time of Cyrus, king of Persia, till Darius became king.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And in the time of Ahasuerus, when he first became king, they put on record a statement against the people of Judah and Jerusalem.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And in the time of Artaxerxes, Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and the rest of his friends, sent a letter to Artaxerxes, king of Persia, writing it in the Aramaean writing and language.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: Rehum, the chief ruler, and Shimshai the scribe, sent a letter against Jerusalem, to Artaxerxes the king;

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: The letter was sent by Rehum, the chief ruler, and Shimshai the scribe and their friends; the Dinaites and the Apharsathchites, the Tarpelites, the Apharsites, the Archevites, the Babylonians, the Shushanchites, the Dehaites, the Elamites,

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: And the rest of the nations which the great and noble Osnappar took over and put in Samaria and the rest of the country over the river:

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: This is a copy of the letter which they sent to Artaxerxes the king: Your servants living across the river send these words:

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: We give news to the king that the Jews who came from you have come to us at Jerusalem; they are building up again that uncontrolled and evil town; the walls are complete and they are joining up the bases.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: The king may be certain that when the building of this town and its walls is complete, they will give no tax or payment in goods or forced payments, and in the end it will be a cause of loss to the kings.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Now because we are responsible to the king, and it is not right for us to see the king's honour damaged, we have sent to give the king word of these things,

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: So that search may be made in the book of the records of your fathers: and you will see in the book of the records that this town has been uncontrolled, and a cause of trouble to kings and countries, and that there were outbursts against authority there in the past: for which reason the town was made waste.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: We give you word, that if the building of this town and its walls is made complete, there will be an end of your power in the country across the river.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: Then the king sent an answer to Rehum, the chief ruler, and Shimshai the scribe, and their friends living in Samaria, and to the rest of those across the river, saying, Peace to you:

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: And now the sense of the letter which you sent to us has been made clear to me,

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: And I gave orders for a search to be made, and it is certain that in the past this town has made trouble for kings, and that outbursts against authority have taken place there.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: Further, there have been great kings in Jerusalem, ruling over all the country across the river, to whom they gave taxes and payments in goods and forced payments.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: Give an order now, that these men are to do nothing more, and that the building of the town is to be stopped, till I give an order.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: Be certain to do this with all care: do not let trouble be increased to the king's damage.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: Then, after reading the king's letter, Rehum and Shimshai the scribe and their friends went quickly to Jerusalem, to the Jews, and had them stopped by force.

title: Ezra Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: So the work of the house of God at Jerusalem came to an end; so it was stopped, till the second year of the rule of Darius, king of Persia.

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Now the prophets Haggai and Zechariah, the son of Iddo, were preaching to the Jews in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel.

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: Then Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, got up and made a start at building the house of God at Jerusalem: and the prophets of God were with them, helping them.

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: At the same time, Tattenai, ruler of the land across the river, and Shethar-bozenai, and their men, came to them and said, Who gave you orders to go on building this house and this wall?

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: Then they said these words to them: What are the names of the men who are at work on this building?

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: But the eye of their God was on the chiefs of the Jews, and they did not make them give up working till the question had been put before Darius and an answer had come by letter about it.

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: This is a copy of the letter which Tattenai, the ruler of the land across the river, and Shethar-bozenai and his friends the Apharsachites, living across the river, sent to Darius the king:

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: They sent him a letter saying, To Darius the king, all peace:

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: This is to give the king word that we went into the land of Judah, to the house of the great God, which is made of great stones, and has its walls supported with wood, and the work is going on with industry, and they are doing it well.

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: Then we said to the men responsible, who gave you authority for the building of this house and these walls?

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And we made request for their names, so that we might send you word, and give you the names of the men at the head of them.

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: And they made answer to us, saying, We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and we are building the house which was put up in times long past and was designed and made complete by a great king of Israel.

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: But when the God of heaven was moved to wrath by our fathers, he gave them up into the hands of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, the Chaldaean, who sent destruction on this house and took the people away into Babylon.

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: But in the first year of Cyrus, king of Babylon, Cyrus the king gave an order for the building of this house of God;

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: And the gold and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took from the Temple which was in Jerusalem, and put into the house of his god in Babylon, these Cyrus the king took from the house of his god in Babylon, and gave to one named Sheshbazzar, whom he had made ruler;

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And he said to him, Go, take these vessels, and put them in the Temple in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be put up again in its place.

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: Then this same Sheshbazzar came and put the house of God in Jerusalem on its bases: and from that time till now the building has been going on, but it is still not complete.

title: Ezra Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: So now, if it seems good to the king, let search be made in the king's store-house at Babylon, to see if it is true that an order was given by Cyrus the king for the building of this house of God at Jerusalem, and let the king send us word of his pleasure in connection with this business.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Then Darius the king gave an order and a search was made in the house of the records, where the things of value were stored up in Babylon.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: And at Achmetha, in the great house of the king in the land of Media, they came across a roll, in which this statement was put on record:

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: In the first year of Cyrus the king, Cyrus the king made an order: In connection with the house of God at Jerusalem, let the house be put up, the place where they make offerings, and let the earth for the bases be put in place; let it be sixty cubits high and sixty cubits wide;

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: With three lines of great stones and one line of new wood supports; and let the necessary money be given out of the king's store-house;

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And let the gold and silver vessels from the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took from the Temple at Jerusalem to Babylon, be given back and taken again to the Temple at Jerusalem, every one in its place, and put them in the house of God.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: So now, Tattenai, ruler of the land across the river, and Shethar-bozenai and your people the Apharsachites across the river, keep far from that place:

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: Let the work of this house of God go on; let the ruler of the Jews and their responsible men put up this house of God in its place.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: Further, I give orders as to what you are to do for the responsible men of the Jews in connection with the building of this house of God: that from the king's wealth, that is, from the taxes got together in the land over the river, the money needed is to be given to these men readily, so that their work may not be stopped.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And whatever they have need of, young oxen and sheep and lambs, for burned offerings to the God of heaven, grain, salt, wine, and oil, whatever the priests in Jerusalem say is necessary, is to be given to them day by day regularly:

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: So that they may make offerings of a sweet smell to the God of heaven, with prayers for the life of the king and of his sons.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And I have given orders that if anyone makes any change in this word, one of the supports is to be pulled out of his house, and he is to be lifted up and fixed to it; and his house is to be made waste for this;

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And may the God who has made it a resting-place for his name send destruction on all kings and peoples whose hands are outstretched to make any change in this or to do damage to this house of God at Jerusalem. I, Darius, have given this order, let it be done with all care.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: Then Tattenai, the ruler across the river, and Shethar-bozenai and their people, because of the order given by King Darius, did as he had said with all care.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And the responsible men of the Jews went on with their building, and did well, helped by the teaching of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah, the son of Iddo. They went on building till it was complete, in keeping with the word of the God of Israel, and the orders given by Cyrus, and Darius, and Artaxerxes, king of Persia.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: And the building of this house was complete on the third day of the month Adar, in the sixth year of the rule of Darius the king.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And the children of Israel, the priests and the Levites, and the rest of those who had come back, kept the feast of the opening of this house of God with joy.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: And they gave as offerings at the opening of this house of God a hundred oxen, two hundred sheep, four hundred lambs; and for a sin-offering for all Israel, twelve he-goats, being the number of the tribes of Israel.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: And they put the priests in their divisions and the Levites in their order, for the worship of God at Jerusalem; as it is recorded in the book of Moses.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: And the children of Israel who had come back kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: For the priests and the Levites had made themselves clean together; they were all clean: and they put the Passover lamb to death for all those who had come back, and for their brothers the priests and for themselves.

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: And the children of Israel, who had come back, and all those who were joined to them, after separating themselves from the evil ways of the people of the land to become the servants of the Lord, the God of Israel, took food together,

title: Ezra Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: And kept the feast of unleavened bread for seven days with joy: for the Lord had made them full of joy, by turning the heart of the king of Assyria to them to give them help in the work of the house of God, the God of Israel.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Now after these things, when Artaxerxes was king of Persia, Ezra, the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: The son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: The son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: The son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: The son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest:

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: This Ezra went up from Babylon; and he was a scribe, expert in the law of Moses which the Lord, the God of Israel, had given: and the king, moved by the Lord his God, gave him whatever he made request for.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: And some of the children of Israel went up, with some of the priests and the Levites and the music-makers and the door-keepers and the Nethinim, to Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: And he came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, in the seventh year of the king's rule.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: For, starting his journey from Babylon on the first day of the first month, he came to Jerusalem on the first day of the fifth month, by the good help of his God.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: For Ezra had given his mind to learning the law of the Lord and doing it, and to teaching his rules and decisions in Israel.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: Now this is a copy of the letter which King Artaxerxes gave to Ezra, the priest and the scribe, who put into writing the words of the orders of the Lord, and of his rules for Israel:

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: Artaxerxes, king of kings, to Ezra the priest, scribe of the law of the God of heaven, all peace;

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: And now it is my order that all those of the people of Israel, and their priests and Levites in my kingdom, who are ready and have a desire to go to Jerusalem, are to go with you.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: Because you are sent by the king and his seven wise men, to get knowledge about Judah and Jerusalem, as you are ordered by the law of your God which is in your hand;

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: And to take with you the silver and gold freely offered by the king and his wise men to the God of Israel, whose Temple is in Jerusalem,

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: As well as all the silver and gold which you get from the land of Babylon, together with the offering of the people and of the priests, freely given for the house of their God, which is in Jerusalem:

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: So with this money get with care oxen, sheep, and lambs, with their meal offerings and their drink offerings, to be offered on the altar of the house of your God, which is in Jerusalem.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: And whatever seems right to you and to your brothers to do with the rest of the silver and gold, that do, as may be pleasing to your God.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: And the vessels which have been given to you for the uses of the house of your God, you are to give to the God of Jerusalem.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: And whatever more is needed for the house of your God, and which you may have to give, take it from the king's store-house.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: And I, even I, Artaxerxes the king, now give orders to all keepers of the king's money across the river, that whatever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, may have need of from you, is to be done with all care,

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: Up to a hundred talents of silver, a hundred measures of grain, a hundred measures of wine, and a hundred measures of oil, and salt without measure.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: Whatever is ordered by the God of heaven, let it be done completely for the house of the God of heaven; so that there may not be wrath against the kingdom of the king and his sons.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: In addition, we make it clear to you, that it will be against the law to put any tax or payment in goods or forced payment on any of the priests or Levites, the music-makers, door-keepers, Nethinim, or any servants of this house of God.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: And you, Ezra, by the wisdom of your God which is in you, are to put rulers and judges to have authority over all the people across the river who have knowledge of the laws of your God; and you are to give teaching to him who has no knowledge of them.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: And if anyone does not keep the law of your God and the law of the king, take care that punishment is given to him, by death or by driving him from his country or by taking away his goods or by putting him in prison.

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: Praise be to the Lord, the God of our fathers, who has put such a thing into the heart of the king, to make fair the house of the Lord which is in Jerusalem;

title: Ezra Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: And has given mercy to me before the king and his government and before all the king's great captains. And I was made strong by the hand of the Lord my God which was on me, and I got together out of Israel chief men to go up with me.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Now these are the heads of families who were listed of those who went up with me from Babylon, when Artaxerxes was king.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: Of the sons of Phinehas, Gershom; of the sons of Ithamar, Daniel; of the sons of David, Hattush;

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: Of the sons of Shecaniah; of the sons of Parosh, Zechariah; and with him were listed a hundred and fifty males.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: Of the sons of Pahath-moab, Eliehoenai, the son of Zerahiah; and with him two hundred males.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: Of the sons of Shecaniah, the son of Jahaziel; and with him three hundred males.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: And of the sons of Adin, Ebed, the son of Jonathan; and with him fifty males.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And of the sons of Elam, Jeshaiah; the son of Athaliah; and with him seventy males.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And of the sons of Shephatiah, Zebadiah, the son of Michael; and with him eighty males.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: Of the sons of Joab, Obadiah, the son of Jehiel; and with him two hundred and eighteen males.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And of the sons of Shelomith, the son of Josiphiah; and with him a hundred and sixty males.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And of the sons of Bebai, Zechariah, the son of Bebai; and with him twenty-eight males.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And of the sons of Azgad, Johanan, the son of Hakkatan; and with him a hundred and ten males.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And of the sons of Adonikam, the last, whose names were Eliphelet, Jeuel, and Shemaiah; and with them sixty males.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And of the sons of Bigvai, Uthai and Zabbud; and with them seventy males.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And I made them come together by the river flowing to Ahava; and we were there in tents for three days: and after viewing the people and the priests I saw that no sons of Levi were there.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: Then I sent for Eliezer and Ariel and Shemaiah and Elnathan Jarib and Elnathan and Nathan and Zechariah and Meshullam, all responsible men; and for Joiarib and Elnathan, who were wise men.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: And I sent them to Iddo the chief at the place Casiphia, and gave them orders what to say to Iddo and his brothers the Nethinim at the place Casiphia, so that they might come back to us with men to do the work of the house of our God.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: And by the help of our God they got for us Ish-sechel, one of the sons of Mahli, the son of Levi, the son of Israel; and Sherebiah with his sons and brothers, eighteen;

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: And Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah of the sons of Merari, his brothers and their sons, twenty;

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: And of the Nethinim, to whom David and the captains had given the work of helping the Levites, two hundred and twenty Nethinim, all of them specially named.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: Then I gave orders for a time of going without food, there by the river Ahava, so that we might make ourselves low before our God in prayer, requesting from him a straight way for us and for our little ones and for all our substance.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: For I would not, for shame, make request to the king for a band of armed men and horsemen to give us help against those who might make attacks on us on the way: for we had said to the king, The hand of our God is on his servants for good, but his power and his wrath are against all those who are turned away from him.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: So we went without food, requesting our God for this: and his ear was open to our prayer.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: So I put on one side twelve of the chiefs of the priests, Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and ten of their brothers with them,

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: And gave to them by weight the silver and the gold and the vessels, all the offering for the house of our God which the king and his wise men and his captains and all Israel there present had given:

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: Measuring into their hands six hundred and fifty talents of silver, and silver vessels, a hundred talents' weight, and a hundred talents of gold,

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: And twenty gold basins, of a thousand darics, and two vessels of the best bright brass, equal in value to gold.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: And I said to them, You are holy to the Lord and the vessels are holy: and the silver and the gold are an offering freely given to the Lord, the God of your fathers.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: Take care of them and keep them, till you put them on the scales before the chiefs of the priests and the Levites and the chiefs of the families of Israel, in Jerusalem, in the rooms of the house of the Lord.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: So the priests and the Levites took the weight of silver and gold and the vessels, to take them to Jerusalem into the house of our God.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: Then we went away from the river of Ahava on the twelfth day of the first month, to go to Jerusalem; and the hand of our God was on us, and he gave us salvation from our haters and those who were waiting to make an attack on us by the way.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: And we came to Jerusalem and were there for three days.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 33
text: And on the fourth day, the silver and the gold and the vessels were measured out by weight in the house of our God into the hands of Meremoth, the son of Uriah, the priest; and with him was Eleazar, the son of Phinehas; and with them were Jozabad, the son of Jeshua, and Noadiah, the son of Binnui, the Levites;

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 34
text: All was handed over by number and by weight: and the weight was put on record at that time.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 35
text: And those who had been prisoners, who had come back from a strange land, made burned offerings to the God of Israel, twelve oxen for all Israel, ninety-six male sheep, seventy-seven lambs, twelve he-goats for a sin-offering: all this was a burned offering to the Lord.

title: Ezra Chapter 8 Verse 36
text: And they gave the king's orders to the king's captains and the rulers across the river, and they gave the people and the house of God the help which was needed.

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Now after these things were done, the captains came to me and said, The people of Israel and the priests and Levites have not kept themselves separate from the people of the lands, but have taken part in the disgusting ways of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, the Ammonites, the Moabites, the Egyptians, and the Amorites.

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: For they have taken their daughters for themselves and for their sons, so that the holy seed has been mixed with the peoples of the lands; and in fact the captains and rulers have been the first to do this evil.

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And hearing this, with signs of grief and pulling out the hair of my head and my chin, I took my seat on the earth deeply troubled.

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: Then everyone who went in fear of the words of the God of Israel, because of the sin of those who had come back, came together to me; and I kept where I was, overcome with grief, till the evening offering.

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And at the evening offering, having made myself low before God, I got up, and with signs of grief, falling down on my knees, with my hands stretched out to the Lord my God,

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: I said, O my God, shame keeps me from lifting up my face to you, my God: for our sins are increased higher than our heads and our evil-doing has come up to heaven.

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: From the days of our fathers till this day we have been great sinners; and for our sins, we and our kings and our priests have been given up into the hands of the kings of the lands, to the sword and to prison and to loss of goods and to shame of face, as it is this day.

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And now for a little time grace has come to us from the Lord our God, to let a small band of us get free and to give us a nail in his holy place, so that our God may give light to our eyes and a measure of new life in our prison chains.

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: For we are servants; but our God has not been turned away from us in our prison, but has had mercy on us before the eyes of the kings of Persia, to give us new strength to put up again the house of our God and to make fair its waste places, and to give us a wall in Judah and Jerusalem.

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And now, O our God, what are we to say after this? for we have not kept your laws,

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: Which you gave to your servants the prophets, saying, The land into which you are going, to take it for a heritage, is an unclean land, because of the evil lives of the peoples of the land and their disgusting ways, which have made the land unclean from end to end.

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: So now do not give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons or do anything for their peace or well-being for ever; so that you may be strong, living on the good of the land, and handing it on to your children for a heritage for ever.

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: And after everything which has come on us because of our evil-doing and our great sin, and seeing that the punishment which you, O God, have given us, is less than the measure of our sins, and that you have kept from death those of us who are here;

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: Are we again to go against your orders, taking wives from among the people who do these disgusting things? would you not be angry with us till our destruction was complete, till there was not one who got away safe?

title: Ezra Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: O Lord God of Israel, righteousness is yours; we are only a small band which has been kept from death, as at this day: see, we are before you in our sin; for no one may keep his place before you because of this.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Now while Ezra was making his prayer and his statement of wrongdoing, weeping and falling down before the house of God, a very great number of men and women and children out of Israel came together round him: for the people were weeping bitterly.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: And Shecaniah, the son of Jehiel, one of the sons of Elam, answering, said to Ezra, We have done evil against our God, and have taken as our wives strange women of the peoples of the land: but still there is hope for Israel in this question.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: Let us now make an agreement with our God to put away all the wives and all their children, if it seems right to my lord and to those who go in fear of the words of our God; and let it be done in keeping with the law.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: Up, now! for this is your business, and we are with you; take heart and do it.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: Then Ezra got up, and made the chiefs of the priests and the Levites and all Israel take an oath that they would do this. So they took an oath.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: Then Ezra got up from before the house of God and went into the room of Jehohanan, the son of Eliashib; but when he came there, he took no food or drink, for he was sorrowing for the sin of those who had come back.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: And they made a public statement through all Judah and Jerusalem, to all those who had come back, that they were to come together to Jerusalem;

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: And that if anyone did not come before three days were past, as ordered by the rulers and the responsible men, all his goods would be put under the curse, and he himself would be cut off from the meeting of the people who had come back.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: Then all the men of Judah and Benjamin came together to Jerusalem before three days were past; it was the ninth month, on the twentieth day of the month; and all the people were seated in the wide square in front of the house of God, shaking with fear because of this business and because of the great rain.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And Ezra the priest got to his feet and said to them, You have done wrong and taken strange women for your wives, so increasing the sin of Israel.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: So now, give praise to the Lord, the God of your fathers, and do his pleasure; and make yourselves separate from the peoples of the land and from the strange women.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: Then all the people, answering, said with a loud voice, As you have said, so it is right for us to do.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: But the number of people is great, and it is a time of much rain; it is not possible for us to go on waiting outside, and this is not a thing which may be done in one day or even two: for our sin in this business is great.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: So now let our rulers be representatives for all the people, and let all those in our towns who are married to strange women come at fixed times, and with them the responsible men and the judges of every town, till the burning wrath of our God is turned away from us, and this has been done.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: Only Jonathan, the son of Asahel, and Jahzeiah, the son of Tikvah, were against this, Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite supporting them.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: So those who had come back did so. And Ezra the priest, with certain heads of families, by their fathers' families, all of them by their names, were marked out; and on the first day of the tenth month they took their places to go into the question with care.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: And they got to the end of all the men who were married to strange women by the first day of the first month.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: And among the sons of the priests who were married to strange women were these: of the sons of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak and his brothers, Maaseiah and Eliezer and Jarib and Gedaliah.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: And they gave their word that they would put away their wives; and for their sin, they gave an offering of a male sheep of the flock.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: And of the sons of Immer, Hanani and Zebadiah.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: And of the sons of Harim, Maaseiah and Elijah and Shemaiah and Jehiel and Uzziah.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: And of the sons of Pashhur, Elioenai, Maaseiah, Ishmael, Nethanel, Jozabad, and Elasah.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: And of the Levites, Jozabad, and Shimei, and Kelaiah (that is Kelita), Pethahiah, Judah, and Eliezer.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: And of the music-makers, Eliashib; and of the door-keepers, Shallum and Telem and Uri.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: And of Israel, the sons of Parosh, Ramiah and Izziah and Malchijah and Mijamin and Eleazar and Malchijah and Benaiah.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: And of the sons of Elam, Mattaniah, Zechariah, and Jehiel and Abdi and Jeremoth and Elijah.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: And of the sons of Zattu, Elioenai, Eliashib, Mattaniah, and Jeremoth and Zabad and Aziza.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: And of the sons of Bebai, Jehohanan, Hananiah, Zabbai, Athlai.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: And of the sons of Bani, Meshullam, Malluch, and Adaiah, Jashub and Sheal, Jeremoth.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: And of the sons of Pahath-moab, Adna and Chelal, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattaniah, Bezalel and Binnui and Manasseh.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: And of the sons of Harim, Eliezer, Isshijah, Malchijah, Shemaiah, Shimeon,

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: Benjamin, Malluch, Shemariah.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: Of the sons of Hashum, Mattenai, Mattattah, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jeremai, Manasseh, Shimei.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 34
text: Of the sons of Bani, Maadai, Amram, and Uel,

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 35
text: Benaiah, Bedeiah, Cheluhi,

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 36
text: Vaniah, Meremoth, Eliashib,

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 37
text: Mattaniah, Mattenai, and Jaasu,

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 38
text: And Bani and Binnui, Shimei;

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 39
text: And Shelemiah and Nathan and Adaiah,

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 40
text: Machnadebai, Shashai, Sharai,

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 41
text: Azarel and Shelemiah, Shemariah,

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 42
text: Shallum, Amariah, Joseph.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 43
text: Of the sons of Nebo, Jeiel, Mattithiah, Zabad, Zebina, Iddo, and Joel, Benaiah.

title: Ezra Chapter 10 Verse 44
text: All these had taken strange wives; and some of them had wives by whom they had offspring.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The history of Nehemiah, the son of Hacaliah. Now it came about, in the month Chislev, in the twentieth year, when I was in Shushan, the king's town,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: That Hanani, one of my brothers, came with certain men from Judah; and in answer to my request for news of the Jews who had been prisoners and had got away, and of Jerusalem,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: They said to me, The small band of Jews now living there in the land are in great trouble and shame: the wall of Jerusalem has been broken down, and its doorways burned with fire.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Then, after hearing these words, for some days I gave myself up to weeping and sorrow, seated on the earth; and taking no food I made prayer to the God of heaven,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And said, O Lord, the God of heaven, the great God, greatly to be feared, keeping faith and mercy with those who have love for him and are true to his laws:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: Let your ear now take note and let your eyes be open, so that you may give ear to the prayer of your servant, which I make before you at this time, day and night, for the children of Israel, your servants, while I put before you the sins of the children of Israel, which we have done against you: truly, I and my father's people are sinners.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: We have done great wrong against you, and have not kept the orders, the rules, and the decisions, which you gave to your servant Moses.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Keep in mind, O Lord, the order you gave your servant Moses, saying, If you do wrong I will send you wandering among the peoples:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: But if you come back to me and keep my orders and do them, even if those of you who have been forced out are living in the farthest parts of heaven, I will get them from there, and take them back to the place marked out by me for the resting-place of my name.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Now these are your servants and your people, whom you have made yours by your great power and by your strong hand.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: O Lord, let your ear take note of the prayer of your servant, and of the prayers of your servants, who take delight in worshipping your name: give help, O Lord, to your servant this day, and let him have mercy in the eyes of this man. (Now I was the king's wine-servant.)

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And it came about in the month Nisan, in the twentieth year of Artaxerxes the king, when wine was before him, that I took up the wine and gave it to the king. Now I had never before been sad when the king was present.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And the king said to me, Why is your face sad, seeing that you are not ill? this is nothing but sorrow of heart. Then I was full of fear;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And said to the king, May the king be living for ever: is it not natural for my face to be sad, when the town, the place where the bodies of my fathers are at rest, has been made waste and its doorways burned with fire?

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: Then the king said to me, What is your desire? So I made prayer to the God of heaven.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: And I said to the king, If it is the king's pleasure, and if your servant has your approval, send me to Judah, to the town where the bodies of my fathers are at rest, so that I may take in hand the building of it.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And the king said to me (the queen being seated by his side), How long will your journey take, and when will you come back? So the king was pleased to send me, and I gave him a fixed time.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: Further, I said to the king, If it is the king's pleasure, let letters be given to me for the rulers across the river, so that they may let me go through till I come to Judah;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And a letter to Asaph, the keeper of the king's park, so that he may give me wood to make boards for the doors of the tower of the house, and for the wall of the town, and for the house which is to be mine. And the king gave me this, for the hand of my God was on me.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: Then I came to the rulers of the lands across the river and gave them the king's letters. Now the king had sent with me captains of the army and horsemen.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And Sanballat the Horonite and Tobiah the servant, the Ammonite, hearing of it, were greatly troubled because a man had come to the help of the children of Israel.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: So I came to Jerusalem and was there three days.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And in the night I got up, taking with me a small band of men; I said nothing to any man of what God had put into my heart to do for Jerusalem: and I had no beast with me but the one on which I was seated.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And I went out by night, through the doorway of the valley, and past the dragon's water-spring as far as the place where waste material was put, viewing the walls of Jerusalem which were broken down, and the doorways which had been burned with fire.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: Then I went on to the door of the fountain and to the king's pool: but there was no room for my beast to get through.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: Then in the night, I went up by the stream, viewing the wall; then turning back, I went in by the door in the valley, and so came back.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And the chiefs had no knowledge of where I had been or what I was doing; and I had not then said anything to the Jews or to the priests or the great ones or the chiefs or the rest of those who were doing the work.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: Then I said to them, You see what a bad condition we are in; how Jerusalem is a waste, and its doorways burned with fire: come, let us get to work, building up the wall of Jerusalem, so that we may no longer be put to shame.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: Then I gave them an account of how the hand of my God was on me, helping me; and of the king's words which he had said to me. And they said, Let us get to work on the building. So they made their hands strong for the good work.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: But Sanballat the Horonite and Tobiah the servant, the Ammonite, and Geshem the Arabian, hearing of it, made sport of us, laughing at us and saying, What are you doing? will you go against the king?

title: Nehemiah Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: Then answering them I said, The God of heaven, he will be our help; so we his servants will go on with our building: but you have no part or right or any name in Jerusalem.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Then Eliashib, the chief priest, got up with his brothers the priests, and took in hand the building of the sheep doorway; they made it holy and put its doors in position; as far as the tower of Hammeah they made it holy, even to the tower of Hananel.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And by his side the men of Jericho were building. And after them, Zaccur, the son of Imri.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: The sons of Hassenaah were the builders of the fish doorway; they put its boards in place and put up its doors, with their locks and rods.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: By their side Meremoth, the son of Uriah, the son of Hakkoz, was making good the walls. Then Meshullam, the son of Berechiah, the son of Meshezabel; and by him, Zadok, the son of Baana.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Near them, the Tekoites were at work; but their chiefs did not put their necks to the work of their Lord.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: Joiada, the son of Paseah, and Meshullam, the son of Besodeiah, made good the old doorway; they put its boards in place and put up its doors, with their locks and rods.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: By their side were working Melatiah the Gibeonite and Jadon the Meronothite, the men of Gibeon and of Mizpah from the seat of the ruler across the river.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Near them was working Uzziel, the son of Harhaiah, the gold-worker. And by him was Hananiah, one of the perfume-makers, building up Jerusalem as far as the wide wall.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Near them was working Rephaiah, the son of Hur, the ruler of half Jerusalem.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: By his side was Jedaiah, the son of Harumaph, opposite his house. And by him was Hattush, the son of Hashabneiah.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Malchijah, the son of Harim, and Hasshub, the son of Pahath-moab, were working on another part, and the tower of the ovens.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Near them was Shallum, the son of Hallohesh, the ruler of half Jerusalem, with his daughters.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Hanun and the people of Zanoah were working on the doorway of the valley; they put it up and put up its doors, with their locks and rods, and a thousand cubits of wall as far as the doorway where the waste material was placed.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: And Malchijah, the son of Rechab, the ruler of the division of Beth-haccherem, made good the doorway of the waste, building it up and putting up its doors, with their locks and rods.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And Shallun, the son of Col-hozeh, the ruler of the division of Mizpah, made good the doorway of the fountain, building it up and covering it and putting up its doors, with their locks and rods, with the wall of the pool of Shelah by the king's garden, as far as the steps which go down from the town of David.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: By his side was working Nehemiah, the son of Azbuk, ruler of half the division of Beth-zur, as far as the place opposite the last resting-places of David's family, and the pool which was made and the house of the men of war.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: Then came the Levites, Rehum, the son of Bani. By his side was working Hashabiah, ruler of half the division of Keilah, for his division.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: After him were working their brothers, Bavvai, the son of Henadad, ruler of half the division of Keilah.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: And by his side was working Ezer, the son of Jeshua, the ruler of Mizpah, making good another part opposite the way up to the store of arms at the turning of the wall.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: After him Baruch, the son of Zabbai, was hard at work on another part, from the turning of the wall to the door of the house of Eliashib, the chief priest.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: After him Meremoth, the son of Uriah, the son of Hakkoz, was working on another part, from the door of the house of Eliashib as far as the end of his house.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: After him were working the priests, the men of the lowland.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: After them came Benjamin and Hasshub, opposite their house. After them Azariah, the son of Maaseiah, the son of Ananiah, made good the wall by the house where he himself was living.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: After him Binnui, the son of Henadad, was working on another part, from the house of Azariah as far as the turning of the wall and the angle.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: Palal, the son of Uzai, made good the wall opposite the angle and the tower which comes out from the higher part of the king's house, by the open space of the watch. After him was Pedaiah, the son of Parosh.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: (Now the Nethinim were living in the Ophel, as far as the place facing the water doorway to the east, and the tower which comes out.)

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: After him the Tekoites were making good another part, opposite the great tower which comes out, and up to the wall of the Ophel.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 28
text: Further on, past the horse doorway, the priests were at work, every one opposite his house.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 29
text: After them Zadok, the son of Immer, was working opposite his house. And after him Shemaiah, the son of Shecaniah, the keeper of the east door.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 30
text: After him Hananiah, the son of Shelemiah, and Hanun, the sixth son of Zalaph, were making good another part. After him Meshullam, the son of Berechiah, made good the wall opposite his room.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 31
text: After him Malchijah, one of the gold-workers to the Nethinim and the traders, made good the wall opposite the doorway of Hammiphkad and as far as the way up to the angle.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 3 Verse 32
text: And between the way up to the angle and the sheep door, the gold-workers and the traders made good the wall.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Now, Sanballat, hearing that we were building the wall, was very angry, and in his wrath made sport of the Jews.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And in the hearing of his countrymen and the army of Samaria he said, What are these feeble Jews doing? will they make themselves strong? will they make offerings? will they get the work done in a day? will they make the stones which have been burned come again out of the dust?

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Now Tobiah the Ammonite was by him, and he said, Such is their building that if a fox goes up it, their stone wall will be broken down.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Give ear, O our God, for we are looked down on: let their words of shame be turned back on themselves, and let them be given up to wasting in a land where they are prisoners:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Let not their wrongdoing be covered or their sin washed away from before you: for they have made you angry before the builders.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: So we went on building the wall; and all the wall was joined together half-way up: for the people were working hard.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: But when it came to the ears of Sanballat and Tobiah and the Arabians and the Ammonites and the Ashdodites, that the building of the walls of Jerusalem was going forward and the broken places were being made good, they were full of wrath;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And they made designs, all of them together, to come and make an attack on Jerusalem, causing trouble there.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: But we made our prayer to God, and had men on watch against them day and night because of them.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: And Judah said, The strength of the workmen is giving way, and there is much waste material; it is impossible for us to put up the wall.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: And those who were against us said, Without their knowledge and without their seeing us, we will come among them and put them to death, causing the work to come to a stop.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And it came about that when the Jews who were living near them came, they said to us ten times, From all directions they are coming against us.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: So in the lowest part of the space at the back of the walls, in the open places, I put the people by families, with their swords, their spears, and their bows.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: And after looking, I got up and said to the great ones and to the chiefs and to the rest of the people, Have no fear of them: keep in mind the Lord who is great and greatly to be feared, and take up arms for your brothers, your sons, and your daughters, your wives and your houses.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: And when it came to the ears of those who were against us, that we had knowledge of their designs and that God had made their purpose come to nothing, we all went back to the wall, everyone to his work

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: And from that time, half of my servants were doing their part of the work, and half kept the spears and body-covers and the bows and the metal war-dresses; and the chiefs were at the back of the men of Judah.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: Those who were building the wall and those who were moving material did their part, everyone working with one hand, with his spear in the other;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: Every builder was working with his sword at his side. And by my side was a man for sounding the horn.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: And I said to the great ones and the chiefs and the rest of the people, The work is great and widely spaced and we are far away from one another on the wall:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: Wherever you may be when the horn is sounded, come here to us; our God will be fighting for us.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: So we went on with the work: and half of them had spears in their hands from the dawn of the morning till the stars were seen.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: And at the same time I said to the people, Let everyone with his servant come inside Jerusalem for the night, so that at night they may keep watch for us, and go on working by day.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: So not one of us, I or my brothers or my servants or the watchmen who were with me, took off his clothing, everyone went armed to the water.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Then there was a great outcry from the people and their wives against their countrymen the Jews.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: For there were some who said, We, our sons and our daughters, are a great number: let us get grain, so that we may have food for our needs.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: And there were some who said, We are giving our fields and our vine-gardens and our houses for debt: let us get grain because we are in need.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: And there were others who said, We have given up our fields and our vine-gardens to get money for the king's taxes.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: But our flesh is the same as the flesh of our countrymen, and our children as their children: and now we are giving our sons and daughters into the hands of others, to be their servants, and some of our daughters are servants even now: and we have no power to put a stop to it; for other men have our fields and our vine-gardens.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And on hearing their outcry and what they said I was very angry.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: And after turning it over in my mind, I made a protest to the chiefs and the rulers, and said to them, Every one of you is taking interest from his countryman. And I got together a great meeting of protest.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: And I said to them, We have given whatever we were able to give, to make our brothers the Jews free, who were servants and prisoners of the nations: and would you now give up your brothers for a price, and are they to become our property? Then they said nothing, answering not a word.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: And I said, What you are doing is not good: is it not the more necessary for you to go in the fear of our God, because of the shame which the nations may put on us?

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: Even I and my servants have been taking interest for the money and the grain we have let them have. So now, let us give up this thing.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: Give back to them this very day their fields, their vine-gardens, their olive-gardens, and their houses, as well as a hundredth part of the money and the grain and the wine and the oil which you have taken from them.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: Then they said, We will give them back, and take nothing for them; we will do as you say. Then I sent for the priests and made them take an oath that they would keep this agreement.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: And shaking out the folds of my robe, I said, So may God send out from his house and his work every man who does not keep this agreement; even so let him be sent out and made as nothing. And all the meeting of the people said, So be it, and gave praise to the Lord. And the people did as they had said.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: Now from the time when I was made ruler of the people in the land of Judah, from the twentieth year till the thirty-second year of Artaxerxes the king, for twelve years, I and my servants have never taken the food which was the right of the ruler.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: But earlier rulers who were before me made the people responsible for their upkeep, and took from them bread and wine at the rate of forty shekels of silver; and even their servants were lords over the people: but I did not do so, because of the fear of God.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: And I kept on with the work of this wall, and we got no land for ourselves: and all my servants were helping with the work.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: And more than this, a hundred and fifty of the Jews and the rulers were guests at my table, in addition to those who came to us from the nations round about us.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: Now the food made ready for one day was one ox and six fat sheep, as well as fowls; and once in ten days a store of all sorts of wine: but all the same, I did not take the food to which the ruler had a right, because the people were crushed under a hard yoke.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: Keep in mind, O my God, for my good, all I have done for this people.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Now when word was given to Sanballat and Tobiah and to Geshem the Arabian and to the rest of our haters, that I had done the building of the wall and that there were no more broken places in it (though even then I had not put up the doors in the doorways);

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: Sanballat and Geshem sent to me saying, Come, let us have a meeting in one of the little towns in the lowland of Ono. But their purpose was to do me evil.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: And I sent men to them saying, I am doing a great work, so that it is not possible for me to come down: is the work to be stopped while I go away from it and come down to you?

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: And four times they sent to me in this way, and I sent them the same answer.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: Then Sanballat sent his servant to me a fifth time with an open letter in his hand;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: And in it these words were recorded: It is said among the nations, and Geshem says so, that you and the Jews are hoping to make yourselves free from the king's authority; and that this is why you are building the wall: and they say that it is your purpose to be their king;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And that you have prophets preaching about you in Jerusalem, and saying, There is a king in Judah: now an account of these things will be sent to the king. So come now, and let us have a discussion.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: Then I sent to him, saying, No such things as you say are being done, they are only a fiction you have made up yourself.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: For they were hoping to put fear in us, saying, Their hands will become feeble and give up the work so that it may not get done. But now, O God, make my hands strong.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: And I went to the house of Shemaiah, the son of Delaiah, the son of Mehetabel, who was shut up; and he said, Let us have a meeting in the house of God, inside the Temple, and let the doors be shut: for they will come to put you to death; truly, in the night they will come to put you to death.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And I said, Am I the sort of man to go in flight? what man, in my position, would go into the Temple to keep himself safe? I will not go in.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: Then it became clear to me that God had not sent him: he had given this word of a prophet against me himself: and Tobiah and Sanballat had given him money to do so.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: For this reason they had given him money, in order that I might be overcome by fear and do what he said and do wrong, and so they would have reason to say evil about me and put shame on me.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: Keep in mind, O my God, Tobiah and Sanballat and what they did, and Noadiah, the woman prophet, and the rest of the prophets whose purpose was to put fear into me.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: So the wall was complete on the twenty-fifth day of the month Elul, in fifty-two days.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: And when our haters had news of this, all the nations round about us were full of fear and were greatly shamed, for they saw that this work had been done by our God.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: And further, in those days the chiefs of Judah sent a number of letters to Tobiah, and his letters came to them.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: For in Judah there were a number of people who had made an agreement by oath with him, because he was the son-in-law of Shecaniah, the son of Arah; and his son Jehohanan had taken as his wife the daughter of Meshullam, the son of Berechiah.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: And they said much before me of the good he had done, and gave him accounts of my words. And Tobiah sent letters with the purpose of causing me fear.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Now when the building of the wall was complete and I had put up the doors, and the door-keepers and the music-makers and the Levites had been given their places,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: I made my brother Hanani, and Hananiah, the ruler of the tower, responsible for the government of Jerusalem: for he was a man of good faith, fearing God more than most.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: And I said to them, Do not let the doors of Jerusalem be open till the sun is high; and while the watchmen are in their places, let the doors be shut and locked: and let the people of Jerusalem be put on watch, every one in his watch, opposite his house.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: Now the town was wide and great: but the people in it were only a small number, and the houses had not been put up.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: And my God put it into my heart to get together the rulers and the chiefs and the people so that they might be listed by families. And I came across a record of the names of those who came up at the first, and in it I saw these words:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: These are the people of the divisions of the kingdom, among those who had been made prisoners by Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, and taken away by him, who went back to Jerusalem and Judah, every one to his town;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: Who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahamani, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispereth, Bigvai, Nehum, Baanah. The number of the men of the people of Israel:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: The children of Parosh, two thousand, one hundred and seventy-two.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: The children of Shephatiah, three hundred and seventy-two.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: The children of Arah, six hundred and fifty-two.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: The children of Pahath-moab, of the children of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand, eight hundred and eighteen.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: The children of Elam, a thousand, two hundred and fifty-four.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: The children of Zattu, eight hundred and forty-five.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: The children of Zaccai, seven hundred and sixty.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: The children of Binnui, six hundred and forty-eight.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: The children of Bebai, six hundred and twenty-eight.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: The children of Azgad, two thousand, three hundred and twenty-two.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: The children of Adonikam, six hundred and sixty-seven.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: The children of Bigvai, two thousand and sixty-seven.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: The children of Adin, six hundred and fifty-five.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: The children of Ater, of Hezekiah, ninety-eight.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: The children of Hashum, three hundred and twenty-eight.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: The children of Bezai, three hundred and twenty-four.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: The children of Hariph, a hundred and twelve.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: The children of Gibeon, ninety-five.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: The men of Beth-lehem and Netophah, a hundred and eighty-eight.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: The men of Anathoth, a hundred and twenty-eight.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: The men of Beth-azmaveth, forty-two.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: The men of Kiriath-jearim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred and forty-three.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 30
text: The men of Ramah and Geba, six hundred and twenty-one.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 31
text: The men of Michmas, a hundred and twenty-two.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 32
text: The men of Beth-el and Ai, a hundred and twenty-three.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 33
text: The men of the other Nebo, fifty-two.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 34
text: The children of the other Elam, a thousand, two hundred and fifty-four.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 35
text: The children of Harim, three hundred and twenty.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 36
text: The children of Jericho, three hundred and forty-five.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 37
text: The children of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred and twenty-one.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 38
text: The children of Senaah, three thousand, nine hundred and thirty.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 39
text: The priests: the children of Jedaiah, of the family of Jeshua, nine hundred and seventy-three.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 40
text: The children of Immer, a thousand and fifty-two.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 41
text: The children of Pashhur, a thousand, two hundred and forty-seven.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 42
text: The children of Harim, a thousand and seventeen.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 43
text: The Levites: the children of Jeshua, of Kadmiel, of the children of Hodevah, seventy-four.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 44
text: The music-makers: the children of Asaph, a hundred and forty-eight.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 45
text: The door-keepers: the children of Shallum, the children of Ater, the children of Talmon, the children of Akkub, the children of Hatita, the children of Shobai, a hundred and thirty-eight.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 46
text: The Nethinim: the children of Ziha, the children of Hasupha, the children of Tabbaoth,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 47
text: The children of Keros, the children of Sia, the children of Padon,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 48
text: The children of Lebana, the children of Hagaba, the children of Salmai,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 49
text: The children of Hanan, the children of Giddel, the children of Gahar,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 50
text: The children of Reaiah, the children of Rezin, the children of Nekoda,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 51
text: The children of Gazzam, the children of Uzza, the children of Paseah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 52
text: The children of Besai, the children of Meunim, the children of Nephushesim,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 53
text: The children of Bakbuk, the children of Hakupha, the children of Harhur,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 54
text: The children of Bazlith, the children of Mehida, the children of Harsha,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 55
text: The children of Barkos, the children of Sisera, the children of Temah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 56
text: The children of Neziah, the children of Hatipha.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 57
text: The children of Solomon's servants: the children of Sotai, the children of Sophereth, the children of Perida,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 58
text: The children of Jaala, the children of Darkon, the children of Giddel,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 59
text: The children of Shephatiah, the children of Hattil, the children of Pochereth-hazzebaim, the children of Amon.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 60
text: All the Nethinim and the children of Solomon's servants were three hundred and ninety-two.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 61
text: All these were the people who went up from Tel-melah, Tel-harsha, Cherub, Addon, and Immer; but because they had no knowledge of their fathers' families or offspring, it was not certain if they were Israelites:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 62
text: The children of Delaiah, the children of Tobiah, the children of Nekoda, six hundred and forty-two.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 63
text: And of the priests: the children of Hobaiah, the children of Hakkoz, the children of Barzillai, who was married to one of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and took their name.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 64
text: They made search for their record among the lists of families, but their names were nowhere to be seen, so they were looked on as unclean and no longer priests.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 65
text: And the Tirshatha said that they were not to have the most holy things for their food, till a priest came to give decision by the Urim and Thummim.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 66
text: The number of all the people together was forty-two thousand, three hundred and sixty;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 67
text: As well as their men-servants and their women-servants, of whom there were seven thousand, three hundred and thirty-seven; and they had two hundred and forty-five men and women to make music.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 68
text: They had seven hundred and thirty-six horses, two hundred and forty-five transport beasts;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 69
text: Four hundred and thirty-five camels, six thousand, seven hundred and twenty asses.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 70
text: And some of the heads of families gave money for the work. The Tirshatha gave into the store a thousand darics of gold, fifty basins, five hundred and thirty priests' robes.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 71
text: And some of the heads of families gave into the store for the work twenty thousand darics of gold, and two thousand, two hundred pounds of silver.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 72
text: And that which the rest of the people gave was twenty thousand darics of gold, and two thousand pounds of silver, and sixty-seven priests' robes.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 7 Verse 73
text: So the priests and the Levites and the door-keepers and the music-makers and some of the people and the Nethinim, and all Israel, were living in their towns.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And when the seventh month came, the children of Israel were in their towns. And all the people came together like one man into the wide place in front of the water-doorway; and they made a request to Ezra the scribe that he would put before them the book of the law of Moses which the Lord had given to Israel.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And Ezra the priest put the law before the meeting of the people, before the men and women and all those who were able to take it in, on the first day of the seventh month.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: He was reading it in the wide place in front of the water-doorway, from early morning till the middle of the day, in the hearing of all those men and women whose minds were able to take it in; and the ears of all the people were open to the book of the law.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: And Ezra the scribe took his place on a tower of wood which they had made for the purpose; and by his side were placed Mattithiah and Shema and Anaiah and Uriah and Hilkiah and Maaseiah on the right; and on the left, Pedaiah and Mishael and Malchijah and Hashum and Hashbaddanah, Zechariah and Meshullam.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And Ezra took the book, opening it before the eyes of all the people (for he was higher than the people); and when it was open, all the people got to their feet:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: And Ezra gave praise to the Lord, the great God. And all the people in answer said, So be it, so be it; lifting up their hands; and with bent heads they gave worship to the Lord, going down on their faces to the earth.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And Jeshua and Bani and Sherebiah and Jamin, Akkub, Shabbethai, Hodiah, Maaseiah, Kelita, Azariah, Jozabad, Hanan, Pelaiah, and the Levites made the law clear to the people: and the people kept in their places.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And they gave out the words of the book the law of God, clearly, and gave the sense of it, so that their minds were able to take it in.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: And Nehemiah, who was the Tirshatha, and Ezra, the priest and scribe, and the Levites who were the teachers of the people, said to all the people, This day is holy to the Lord your God; let there be no sorrow or weeping; for all the people were weeping on hearing the words of the law.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: Then he said to them, Go away now, and take the fat for your food and the sweet for your drink, and send some to him for whom nothing is made ready: for this day is holy to our Lord: and let there be no grief in your hearts; for the joy of the Lord is your strong place.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: So the Levites made all the people quiet, saying, Be quiet, for the day is holy; and do not give way to grief.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And all the people went away to take food and drink, and to send food to others, and to be glad, because the words which were said to them had been made clear.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: And on the second day the heads of families of all the people and the priests and the Levites came together to Ezra the scribe, to give attention to the words of the law.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And they saw that it was recorded in the law that the Lord had given orders by Moses, that the children of Israel were to have tents for their living-places in the feast of the seventh month:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And that they were to give out an order, and make it public in all their towns and in Jerusalem, saying, Go out to the mountain and get olive branches and branches of field olives and of myrtle, and palm branches and branches of thick trees, to make tents, as it says in the book.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: And the people went out and got them and made themselves tents, every one on the roof of his house, and in the open spaces and in the open squares of the house of God, and in the wide place of the water-doorway, and the wide place of the doorway of Ephraim.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: All the people who had been prisoners and had come back, made tents and were living in them: for from the time of Jeshua, the son of Nun, till that day, the children of Israel had not done so. And there was very great joy.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: And day by day, from the first day till the last, he was reading from the book of the law of God. And they kept the feast for seven days: and on the eighth day there was a holy meeting, as it is ordered in the law.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Now on the twenty-fourth day of this month the children of Israel came together, taking no food and putting haircloth and dust on their bodies.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: And the seed of Israel made themselves separate from all the men of other nations, publicly requesting forgiveness for their sins and the wrongdoing of their fathers.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And for a fourth part of the day, upright in their places, they were reading from the book of the law of their God; and for a fourth part of the day they were requesting forgiveness and worshipping the Lord their God.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: Then Jeshua, and Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani took their places on the steps of the Levites, crying in a loud voice to the Lord their God.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: Then the Levites, Jeshua, and Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabneiah, Sherebiah, Hodiah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah said, Get up and give praise to the Lord your God for ever and ever. Praise be to your great name which is lifted up high over all blessing and praise.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: You are the Lord, even you only; you have made heaven, the heaven of heavens with all their armies, the earth and all things in it, the seas and everything in them; and you keep them from destruction: and the armies of heaven are your worshippers.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: You are the Lord, the God, who took Abram and made him yours, guiding him from Ur of the Chaldees, and gave him the name of Abraham;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: You saw that his heart was true to you, and made an agreement with him to give the land of the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Amorite and the Perizzite and the Jebusite and the Girgashite, even to give it to his seed, and you have done what you said; for righteousness is yours:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And you saw the trouble of our fathers in Egypt, and their cry came to your ears by the Red Sea;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 10
