text: And you did signs and wonders on Pharaoh and all his servants and all the people of his land; for you saw how cruel they were to them. So you got yourself a name as it is today.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: By you the sea was parted before them, so that they went through the sea on dry land; and those who went after them went down into the deep, like a stone into great waters.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And you went before them by day in a pillar of cloud, and in a pillar of fire by night, to give them light on the way they were to go.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: And you came down on Mount Sinai, and your voice came to them from heaven, giving them right decisions and true laws, good rules and orders:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: And you gave them word of your holy Sabbath, and gave them orders and rules and a law, by the hand of Moses your servant:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: And you gave them bread from heaven when they were in need, and made water come out of the rock for their drink, and gave them orders to go in and take for their heritage the land which your hand had been lifted up to give them.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: But they and our fathers, in their pride, made their necks stiff, and gave no attention to your orders,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: And would not do them, and gave no thought to the wonders you had done among them; but made their necks stiff, and turning away from you, made a captain over themselves to take them back to their prison in Egypt: but you are a God of forgiveness, full of grace and pity, slow to wrath and great in mercy, and you did not give them up.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: Even when they had made for themselves an ox of metal, and said, This is your God who took you up out of Egypt, and had done so much to make you angry;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: Even then, in your great mercy, you did not give them up in the waste land: the pillar of cloud still went before them by day, guiding them on their way, and the pillar of fire by night, to give them light, and make clear the way they were to go.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: And you gave your good spirit to be their teacher, and did not keep back your manna from their mouths, and gave them water when they had need of it.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: Truly, for forty years you were their support in the waste land, and they were in need of nothing; their clothing did not get old or their feet become tired.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: And you gave them kingdoms and peoples, making distribution to them in every part of the land: so they took for their heritage the land of Sihon, even the land of the king of Heshbon, and the land of Og, king of Bashan.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: And you made their children as great in number as the stars of heaven, and took them into the land, of which you had said to their fathers that they were to go in and take it for themselves.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: So the children went in and took the land, and you overcame before them the people of the land, the Canaanites, and gave them up into their hands, with their kings and the people of the land, so that they might do with them whatever it was their pleasure to do.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: And they took walled towns and a fat land, and became the owners of houses full of all good things, water-holes cut in the rock, vine-gardens and olive-gardens and a wealth of fruit-trees: so they had food enough and became fat, and had joy in the good you gave them.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: But they were hard-hearted, and went against your authority, turning their backs on your law, and putting to death your prophets, who gave witness against them with the purpose of turning them back again to you, and they did much to make you angry.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: And so you gave them up into the hands of their haters who were cruel to them: and in the time of their trouble, when they made their prayer to you, you gave ear to them from heaven; and in your great mercy gave them saviours, who made them free from the hands of their haters.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: But when they had rest, they did evil again before you: so you gave them into the hands of their haters, who had rule over them: but when they came back and made their prayer to you, you gave ear to them from heaven; again and again, in your mercy, you gave them salvation;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: And gave witness against them so that you might make them come back again to your law: but their hearts were lifted up, and they gave no attention to your orders and went against your decisions (which, if a man keeps them, will be life to him), and turning their backs on you, made their necks stiff and did not give ear.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 30
text: Year after year you put up with them, and gave witness against them by your spirit through your prophets: still they did not give ear: and so you gave them up into the hands of the peoples of the lands.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 31
text: Even then, in your great mercy, you did not put an end to them completely, or give them up; for you are a God of grace and mercy.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 32
text: And now, our God, the great, the strong, the God who is to be feared, who keeps faith and mercy, let not all this trouble seem small to you, which has come on us, and on our kings and our rulers and on our priests and our prophets and our fathers and on all your people from the time of the kings of Assyria till this day.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 33
text: But still, you have been in the right in everything which has come on us; you have been true to us, but we have done evil:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 34
text: And our kings, our rulers, our priests, and our fathers have not kept your law or given attention to your orders and your witness, with which you gave witness against them.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 35
text: For they have not been your servants in their kingdom, and in all the good things you gave them, and in the great and fat land you gave them, and they have not been turned away from their evil-doing.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 36
text: Now, today, we are servants, and as for the land which you gave to our fathers, so that the produce of it and the good might be theirs, see, we are servants in it:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 37
text: And it gives much increase to the kings whom you have put over us because of our sins: and they have power over our bodies and over our cattle at their pleasure, and we are in great trouble.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 9 Verse 38
text: And because of all this we are making an agreement in good faith, and putting it in writing; and our rulers, our Levites, and our priests are putting their names to it.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Now those who put down their names were Nehemiah the Tirshatha, the son of Hacaliah, and Zedekiah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: Seraiah, Azariah, Jeremiah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: Pashhur, Amariah, Malchijah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: Hattush, Shebaniah, Malluch,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: Harim, Meremoth, Obadiah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: Daniel, Ginnethon, Baruch,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: Meshullam, Abijah, Mijamin,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah; these were the priests.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: And the Levites: by name, Jeshua, the son of Azaniah, Binnui, of the sons of Henadad, Kadmiel,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: And their brothers, Shebaniah, Hodiah, Kelita, Pelaiah, Hanan,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: Mica, Rehob, Hashabiah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: Zaccur, Sherebiah, Shebaniah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: Hodiah, Bani, Beninu.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: The chiefs of the people: Parosh, Pahath-moab, Elam, Zattu, Bani,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: Bunni, Azgad, Bebai,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: Adonijah, Bigvai, Adin,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: Ater, Hezekiah, Azzur,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: Hodiah, Hashum, Bezai,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: Hariph, Anathoth, Nobai,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: Magpiash, Meshullam, Hezir,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: Meshezabel, Zadok, Jaddua,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: Pelatiah, Hanan, Anaiah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: Hoshea, Hananiah, Hasshub,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: Hallohesh, Pilha, Shobek,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: Rehum, Hashabnah, Maaseiah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: And Ahiah, Hanan, Anan,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: Malluch, Harim, Baanah.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: And the rest of the people, the priests, the Levites, the door-keepers, the music-makers, the Nethinim, and all those who had made themselves separate from the peoples of the lands, to keep the law of God, their wives, their sons, and their daughters, everyone who had knowledge and wisdom;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: They were united with their brothers, their rulers, and put themselves under a curse and an oath, to keep their steps in the way of God's law, which was given by Moses, the servant of God, and to keep and do all the orders of the Lord, our Lord, and his decisions and his rules;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: And that we would not give our daughters to the peoples of the lands, or take their daughters for our sons;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: And if the peoples of the lands come to do trade in goods or food on the Sabbath day, that we would do no trade with them on the Sabbath or on a holy day: and that in the seventh year we would take no payment from any debtor.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: And we made rules for ourselves, taxing ourselves a third of a shekel every year for the upkeep of the house of our God;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: For the holy bread, and for the regular meal offering and the regular burned offering on the Sabbaths and at the new moon and the fixed feasts, and for the sin-offerings to take away the sin of Israel, and for all the work of the house of our God.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 34
text: And we, the priests and the Levites and the people, made selection, by the decision of the Lord, of those who were to take the wood offering into the house of God, by families at the regular times, year by year, to be burned on the altar of the Lord our God, as it is recorded in the law;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 35
text: And to take the first-fruits of our land, and the first-fruits of every sort of tree, year by year, into the house of the Lord;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 36
text: As well as the first of our sons and of our cattle, as it is recorded in the law, and the first lambs of our herds and of our flocks, which are to be taken to the house of our God, to the priests who are servants in the house of our God:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 37
text: And that we would take the first of our rough meal, and our lifted offerings, and the fruit of every sort of tree, and wine and oil, to the priests, to the rooms of the house of our God; and the tenth of the produce of our land to the Levites; for they, the Levites, take a tenth in all the towns of our ploughed land.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 38
text: And the priest, the son of Aaron, is to be with the Levites, when the Levites take the tenths: and the Levites are to take a tenth of the tenths into the house of our God, to the rooms, into the store-house;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Verse 39
text: For the children of Israel and the children of Levi are to take the lifted offering of the grain and wine and oil into the rooms where the vessels of the holy place are, together with the priests and the door-keepers and the makers of music: and we will not give up caring for the house of our God.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: And the rulers of the people were living in Jerusalem: the rest of the people made selection, by the decision of chance, of one out of every ten to be living in Jerusalem, the holy town; the other nine to go to the other towns.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: And the people gave a blessing to all the men who were freely offering to take up their places in Jerusalem.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: Now these are the chiefs of the divisions of the country who were living in Jerusalem: but in the towns of Judah everyone was living on his heritage in the towns, that is, Israel, the priests, the Levites, the Nethinim, and the children of Solomon's servants.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: And in Jerusalem there were living certain of the children of Judah and of Benjamin. Of the children of Judah: Athaiah, the son of Uzziah, the son of Zechariah, the son of Amariah, the son of Shephatiah, the son of Mahalalel, of the children of Perez;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And Maaseiah, the son of Baruch, the son of Col-hozeh, the son of Hazaiah, the son of Adaiah, the son of Joiarib, the son of Zechariah, the son of the Shilonite.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: All the sons of Perez living in Jerusalem were four hundred and sixty-eight men of good position.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: And these are the sons of Benjamin: Sallu, the son of Meshullam, the son of Joed, the son of Pedaiah, the son of Kolaiah, the son of Maaseiah, the son of Ithiel, the son of Jeshaiah.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: And after him Gabbai, Sallai, nine hundred and twenty-eight.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And Joel, the son of Zichri, was their overseer; and Judah, the son of Hassenuah, was second over the town.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: Of the priests: Jedaiah, the son of Joiarib, Jachin,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: Seraiah, the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the ruler of the house of God,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And their brothers who did the work of the house, eight hundred and twenty-two; and Adaiah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Pelaliah, the son of Amzi, the son of Zechariah, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: And his brothers, heads of families, two hundred and forty-two; and Amashsai, the son of Azarel, the son of Ahzai, the son of Meshillemoth, the son of Immer,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And their brothers, men of war, a hundred and twenty-eight; and their overseer was Zabdiel, the son of Haggedolim.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: And of the Levites: Shemaiah, the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, the son of Bunni,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: And Shabbethai and Jozabad, of the chiefs of the Levites, who were responsible for the outside business of the house of God;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: And Mattaniah, the son of Mica, the son of Zabdi, the son of Asaph, who had to give the first note of the song of praise in prayer, and Bakbukiah, the second among his brothers, and Abda, the son of Shammua, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: All the Levites in the holy town were two hundred and eighty-four.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: In addition the door-keepers, Akkub, Talmon, and their brothers who kept watch at the doors, were a hundred and seventy-two.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: And the rest of Israel, of the priests, the Levites, were in all the towns of Judah, every one in his heritage.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: But the Nethinim were living in the Ophel; and Ziha and Gishpa were over the Nethinim.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: And the overseer of the Levites at Jerusalem was Uzzi, the son of Bani, the son of Hashabiah, the son of Mattaniah, the son of Mica, of the sons of Asaph, the music-makers, who was over the business of the house of God.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: For there was an order from the king about them and a regular amount for the music-makers, for their needs day by day.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: And Pethahiah, the son of Meshezabel, of the sons of Zerah, the son of Judah, was the king's servant in everything to do with the people.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: And for the daughter-towns with their fields, some of the men of Judah were living in Kiriath-arba and its daughter-towns, and in Dibon and its daughter-towns, and in Jekabzeel and its daughter-towns,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: And in Jeshua, and in Moladah, and Beth-pelet,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: And in Hazar-shual, and in Beer-sheba and its daughter-towns,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: And in Ziklag, and in Meconah and its daughter-towns,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: And in En-rimmon, and in Zorah, and in Jarmuth,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: Zanoah, Adullam and their daughter-towns, Lachish and its fields, Azekah and its daughter-towns. So they were living from Beer-sheba to the valley of Hinnom.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: And the children of Benjamin were living from Geba, at Michmash and Aija, and at Beth-el and its daughter-towns,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: At Anathoth, Nob, Ananiah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: Hazor, Ramah, Gittaim,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 34
text: Hadid, Zeboim, Neballat,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 35
text: Lod and Ono, the valley of expert workers.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Verse 36
text: And of the Levites, certain divisions in Judah were joined to Benjamin.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: Now these are the priests and the Levites who went up with Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua: Seraiah, Jeremiah, Ezra,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: Amariah, Malluch, Hattush,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: Shecaniah, Rehum, Meremoth,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: Iddo, Ginnethoi, Abijah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Mijamin, Maadiah, Bilgah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: Shemaiah, and Joiarib, Jedaiah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: Sallu, Amok, Hilkiah, Jedaiah. These were the chiefs of the priests and of their brothers in the days of Jeshua.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: And the Levites: Jeshua, Binnui, Kadmiel, Sherebiah, Judah, and Mattaniah, who was over the music-makers, he and his brothers.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: And Bakbukiah and Unno, their brothers, were opposite them in their watches.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: And Jeshua was the father of Joiakim, and Joiakim was the father of Eliashib, and Eliashib was the father of Joiada,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: And Joiada was the father of Jonathan, and Jonathan was the father of Jaddua.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: And in the days of Joiakim there were priests, heads of families: of Seraiah, Meraiah; of Jeremiah, Hananiah;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: Of Ezra, Meshullam; of Amariah, Jehohanan;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: Of Malluchi, Jonathan; of Shebaniah, Joseph;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: Of Harim, Adna; of Meraioth, Helkai;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: Of Iddo, Zechariah; of Ginnethon, Meshullam;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: Of Abijah, Zichri; of Miniamin, of Moadiah, Piltai;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: Of Bilgah, Shammua; of Shemaiah, Jehonathan;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: And of Joiarib, Mattenai; of Jedaiah, Uzzi;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: Of Sallai, Kallai; of Amok, Eber;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: Of Hilkiah, Hashabiah; of Jedaiah, Nethanel.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: The Levites in the days of Eliashib, Joiada, and Johanan, and Jaddua, were listed as heads of families; and the priests, when Darius the Persian was king.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: The sons of Levi, heads of families, were recorded in the book of the histories, even till the days of Johanan, the son of Eliashib.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: And the chiefs of the Levites: Hashabiah, Sherebiah, and Jeshua, the son of Kadmiel, with their brothers opposite them, to give blessing and praise as ordered by David, the man of God, watch against watch.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: Mattaniah, and Bakbukiah, Obadiah, Meshullam, Talmon, Akkub, were door-keepers keeping the watch at the store-houses of the doors.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: These were in the days of Joiakim, the son of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and in the days of Nehemiah the ruler and of Ezra the priest, the scribe.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: And when the time came for the wall of Jerusalem to be made holy, they sent for the Levites out of all their places to come to Jerusalem, to keep the feast with joy, and with praise and melody, with brass and corded instruments of music.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: And the sons of the music-makers came together from the lowland round about Jerusalem and from the daughter-towns of the Netophathites,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 29
text: And from Beth-gilgal and from the fields of Geba and Azmaveth: for the music-makers had made daughter-towns for themselves round about Jerusalem.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 30
text: And the priests and the Levites made themselves clean; and they made the people clean, and the doorways and the wall.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 31
text: Then I made the rulers of Judah come up on the wall, and I put in position two great bands of them who gave praise, walking in ordered lines; one went to the right on the wall, in the direction of the doorway where the waste was put;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 32
text: And after them went Hoshaiah and half of the rulers of Judah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 33
text: And Azariah, Ezra, and Meshullam,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 34
text: Judah and Benjamin and Shemaiah and Jeremiah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 35
text: And certain of the priests' sons with wind instruments; Zechariah, the son of Jonathan, the son of Shemaiah, the son of Mattaniah, the son of Micaiah, the son of Zaccur, the son of Asaph,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 36
text: And his brothers, Shemaiah, and Azarel, Milalai, Gilalai, Maai, Nethanel and Judah, Hanani, with the music-instruments of David, the man of God; and Ezra the scribe was at their head;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 37
text: And by the doorway of the fountain and straight in front of them, they went up by the steps of the town of David, at the slope up of the wall, over the house of David, as far as the water-doorway to the east.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 38
text: And the other band of those who gave praise went to the left, and I went after them with half the people, on the wall, over the tower of the ovens, as far as the wide wall;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 39
text: And over the doorway of Ephraim and by the old door and the fish door and the tower of Hananel and the tower of Hammeah, as far as the sheep door: and at the doorway of the watchmen they came to a stop.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 40
text: So the two bands of those who gave praise took up their positions in the house of God, and I and half of the chiefs with me:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 41
text: And the priests; Eliakim, Maaseiah, Miniamin, Micaiah, Elioenai, Zechariah, and Hananiah, with wind instruments;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 42
text: And Maaseiah and Shemaiah and Eleazar and Uzzi and Jehohanan and Malchijah and Elam and Ezer. And the makers of melody made their voices loud, with Jezrahiah their overseer.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 43
text: And on that day they made great offerings and were glad; for God had made them glad with great joy; and the women and the children were glad with them: so that the joy of Jerusalem came to the ears of those who were far off.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 44
text: And on that day certain men were put over the rooms where the things which had been given were stored, for the lifted offerings and the first-fruits and the tenths, and to take into them the amounts, from the fields of every town, fixed by the law for the priests and the Levites: for Judah was glad on account of the priests and the Levites who were in their places.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 45
text: And they kept the watch of their God, and were responsible for making things clean, and so did the music-makers and the door-keepers, as it was ordered by David and Solomon his son.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 46
text: For in the days of David and Asaph in the past, there was a master of the music, and songs of blessing and praise to God.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 12 Verse 47
text: And all Israel in the days of Zerubbabel and in the days of Nehemiah gave what was needed by the music-makers and the door-keepers day by day: and they made the offerings holy for the Levites; and the Levites did the same for the sons of Aaron.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: On that day there was a reading from the book of Moses in the hearing of the people; and they saw that it said in the book that no Ammonite or Moabite might ever come into the meeting of God;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: Because they did not give the children of Israel bread and water when they came to them, but got Balaam to put a curse on them: though the curse was turned into a blessing by our God.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: So after hearing the law, they took out of Israel all the mixed people.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: Now before this, Eliashib the priest, who had been placed over the rooms of the house of our God, being a friend of Tobiah,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: Had made ready for him a great room, where at one time they kept the meal offerings, the perfume, and the vessels and the tenths of the grain and wine and oil which were given by order to the Levites and the music-makers and the door-keepers, and the lifted offerings for the priests.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: But all this time I was not at Jerusalem: for in the thirty-second year of Artaxerxes, king of Babylon, I went to the king; and after some days, I got the king to let me go,

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: And I came to Jerusalem; and it was clear to me what evil Eliashib had done for Tobiah, in making ready for him a room in the buildings of the house of God.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: And it was evil in my eyes: so I had all Tobiah's things put out of the room.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: Then I gave orders, and they made the rooms clean: and I put back in them the vessels of the house of God, with the meal offerings and the perfume.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: And I saw that the Levites had not been given what was needed for their support; so that the Levites and the music-makers, who did the work, had gone away, everyone to his field.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: Then I made protests to the chiefs, and said, Why has the house of God been given up? And I got them together and put them in their places.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: Then all Judah came with the tenth part of the grain and wine and oil and put it into the store-houses.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: And I made controllers over the store-houses, Shelemiah the priest and Zadok the scribe, and of the Levites, Pedaiah: and with them was Hanan, the son of Zaccur the son of Mattaniah: they were taken to be true men and their business was the distribution of these things to their brothers.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: Keep me in mind, O my God, in connection with this, and do not let the good which I have done for the house of my God and its worship go from your memory completely.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: In those days, I saw in Judah some who were crushing grapes on the Sabbath, and getting in grain and putting it on asses; as well as wine and grapes and figs and all sorts of goods which they took into Jerusalem on the Sabbath day: and I gave witness against them on the day when they were marketing food.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: And there were men of Tyre there, who came with fish and all sorts of goods, trading with the children of Judah and in Jerusalem on the Sabbath.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: Then I made protests to the chiefs of Judah, and said to them, What is this evil which you are doing, not keeping the Sabbath day holy?

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: Did not your fathers do the same, and did not our God send all this evil on us and on this town? but you are causing more wrath to come on Israel by not keeping the Sabbath holy.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: And so, when the streets of Jerusalem were getting dark before the Sabbath, I gave orders for the doors to be shut and not to be open again till after the Sabbath: and I put some of my servants by the door so that nothing might be taken in on the Sabbath day.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: So the traders in all sorts of goods took their night's rest outside Jerusalem once or twice.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: Then I gave witness against them and said, Why are you waiting all night by the wall? if you do so again I will have you taken prisoners. From that time they did not come again on the Sabbath.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: And I gave the Levites orders to make themselves clean and come and keep the doors and make the Sabbath holy. Keep this in mind to my credit, O my God, and have mercy on me, for great is your mercy.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: And in those days I saw the Jews who were married to women of Ashdod and Ammon and Moab:

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: And their children were talking half in the language of Ashdod; they had no knowledge of the Jews' language, but made use of the language of the two peoples.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: And I took up the cause against them, cursing them and giving blows to some of them and pulling out their hair; and I made them take an oath by God, saying, You are not to give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons or for yourselves.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: Was it not in these things that Solomon, king of Israel, did wrong? among a number of nations there was no king like him, and he was dear to his God, and God made him king over all Israel: but even he was made to do evil by strange women.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: Are we then without protest to let you do all this great evil, sinning against our God by taking strange women for your wives?

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 28
text: And one of the sons of Joiada, the son of Eliashib, the chief priest, was son-in-law to Sanballat the Horonite: so I sent him away from me.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 29
text: Keep them in mind, O my God, because they have put shame on the priests' name and on the agreement of the priests and the Levites.

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 30
text: So I made them clean from all strange people, and had regular watches fixed for the priests and for the Levites, everyone in his work;

title: Nehemiah Chapter 13 Verse 31
text: And for the wood offering, at fixed times, and for the first fruits. Keep me in mind, O my God, for good.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Now it came about in the days of Ahasuerus, (that Ahasuerus who was ruler of a hundred and twenty-seven divisions of the kingdom, from India as far as Ethiopia:)

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: That in those days, when King Ahasuerus was ruling in Shushan, his strong town,

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: In the third year of his rule he gave a feast to all his captains and his servants; and the captains of the army of Persia and Media, the great men and the rulers of the divisions of his kingdom, were present before him;

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And for a long time, even a hundred and eighty days, he let them see all the wealth and the glory of his kingdom and the great power and honour which were his.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And at the end of that time, the king gave a feast for all the people who were present in Shushan, the king's town, small as well as great, for seven days, in the outer square of the garden of the king's house.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: There were fair hangings of white and green and blue, fixed with cords of purple and the best linen to silver rings and pillars of polished stone: the seats were of gold and silver on a floor of red and white and yellow and black stone.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And they gave them drink in gold vessels, every vessel being different, and wine of the kingdom, freely given by the king.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And the drinking was in keeping with the law; no one was forced: for the king had given orders to all the chief servants of his house to do as was pleasing to every man.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And Vashti the queen gave a feast for the women in the house of King Ahasuerus.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: On the seventh day, when the heart of the king was glad with wine, he gave orders to Mehuman, Biztha, Harbona, Bigtha, and Abagtha, Zethar, and Carcas, the seven unsexed servants who were waiting before Ahasuerus the king,

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: That Vashti the queen was to come before him, crowned with her crown, and let the people and the captains see her: for she was very beautiful.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: But when the servants gave her the king's order, Vashti the queen said she would not come: then the king was very angry, and his heart was burning with wrath.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And the king said to the wise men, who had knowledge of the times, (for this was the king's way with all who were expert in law and in the giving of decisions:

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And second only to him were Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish, Meres, Marsena, and Memucan, the seven rulers of Persia and Media, who were friends of the king, and had the first places in the kingdom:)

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: What is to be done by law to Vashti the queen, because she has not done what King Ahasuerus, by his servants, gave her orders to do?

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And before the king and the captains, Memucan gave his answer: Vashti the queen has done wrong, not only to the king, but to all the captains and to all the peoples in all the divisions of the kingdom of King Ahasuerus;

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: For news of what the queen has done will come to the ears of all women, and they will no longer give respect to their husbands when it is said to them, King Ahasuerus gave orders for Vashti the queen to come before him and she came not.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And the wives of the captains of Persia and Media, hearing what the queen has done, will say the same to all the king's captains. So there will be much shame and wrath.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: If it is pleasing to the king, let an order go out from him, and let it be recorded among the laws of the Persians and the Medes, so that it may never be changed, that Vashti is never again to come before King Ahasuerus; and let the king give her place to another who is better than she.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: And when this order, given by the king, is made public through all his kingdom (for it is great), all the wives will give honour to their husbands, great as well as small.

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: And this suggestion seemed good to the king and the captains; and the king did as Memucan said;

title: Esther Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And sent letters to all the divisions of the kingdom, to every division in the writing commonly used there, and to every people in the language which was theirs, saying that every man was to be the ruler in his house, and that this order was to be given out in the language of his people.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: After these things, when the king's feelings were calmer, the thought of Vashti and what she had done and the order he had made against her, came back to his mind.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: Then the servants who were waiting on the king said to him, Let search be made for some fair young virgins for the king:

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: Let the king give authority to certain men in all the divisions of his kingdom, to get together all the fair young virgins and send them to Shushan, the king's town, to the women's house, under the care of Hegai, the king's servant, the keeper of the women: and let the things needed for making them clean be given to them;

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And let the girl who is pleasing to the king be queen in place of Vashti. And the king was pleased with this suggestion; and he did so.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Now there was a certain Jew in Shushan named Mordecai, the son of Jair, the son of Shimei, the son of Kish, a Benjamite;

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: Who had been taken away from Jerusalem among those who had been made prisoner with Jeconiah, king of Judah, when Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, had taken him away.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And he had been a father to Hadassah, that is Esther, the daughter of his father's brother: for she had no father or mother, and she was very beautiful; and when her father and mother were dead, Mordecai took her for his daughter.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: So when the order made by the king was publicly given out, and a number of girls had been placed in the care of Hegai in the king's house in Shushan, Esther was taken into the king's house and put in the care of Hegai, the keeper of the women.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And he was pleased with the girl and was kind to her; and he quickly gave her what was needed for making her clean, and the things which were hers by right, and seven servant-girls who were to be hers from the king's house: and he had her and her servant-girls moved to the best place in the women's part of the house.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: Esther had not said what family or people she came from, for Mordecai had given her orders not to do so.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And every day Mordecai took his walk before the square of the women's house, to see how Esther was and what would be done to her.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: Now every girl, when her turn came, had to go in to King Ahasuerus, after undergoing, for a space of twelve months, what was ordered by the law for the women (for this was the time necessary for making them clean, that is, six months with oil of myrrh and six months with sweet perfumes and such things as are needed for making women clean):

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And in this way the girl went in to the king; whatever she had a desire for was given to her to take with her from the women's house into the house of the king.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: In the evening she went, and on the day after she came back to the second house of the women, into the keeping of Shaashgaz, one of the king's unsexed servants who had the care of the king's wives: only if the king had delight in her and sent for her by name did she go in to him again.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: Now when the time came for Esther, the daughter of Abihail, his father's brother, whom Mordecai had taken as his daughter, to go in to the king, she made request for nothing but what Hegai, the king's servant and keeper of the women, had given her. And Esther was looked on kindly by all who saw her.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: So Esther was taken in to King Ahasuerus in his house in the tenth month, which is the month Tebeth, in the seventh year of his rule.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And Esther was more pleasing to the king than all the women, and to his eyes she was fairer and more full of grace than all the other virgins: so he put his crown on her head and made her queen in place of Vashti.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: Then the king gave a great feast for all his captains and his servants, even Esther's feast; and he gave orders through all the divisions of his kingdom for a day of rest from work, and gave wealth from his store.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And when the virgins came together in the second house of the women, Mordecai took his seat in the doorway of the king's house.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: Esther had still said nothing of her family or her people, as Mordecai had given her orders; for Esther did what Mordecai said, as when she was living with him.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: In those days, while Mordecai was seated at the king's doorway, two of the king's servants, Bigthan and Teresh, keepers of the door, being angry, were looking for a chance to make an attack on King Ahasuerus.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: And Mordecai, having knowledge of their purpose, sent word of it to Esther the queen; and Esther gave the news to the king in Mordecai's name.

title: Esther Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: And when the thing had been looked into, it was seen to be true, and the two of them were put to death by hanging on a tree: and it was put down in the records before the king.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: After these things, by the order of the king, Haman, the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, was lifted up and given a position of honour and a higher place than all the other captains who were with him.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: And all the king's servants who were in the king's house went down to the earth before Haman and gave him honour: for so the king had given orders. But Mordecai did not go down before him or give him honour.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Then the king's servants who were in the king's house said to Mordecai, Why do you go against the king's order?

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: Now when they had said this to him day after day and he gave no attention, they let Haman have news of it, to see if Mordecai's behaviour would be overlooked: for he had said to them that he was a Jew.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And when Haman saw that Mordecai did not go down before him and give him honour, Haman was full of wrath.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: But it was not enough for him to make an attack on Mordecai only; for they had made clear to him who Mordecai's people were; so Haman made it his purpose to put an end to all the Jews, even Mordecai's people, through all the kingdom of Ahasuerus.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: In the first month, the month Nisan, in the twelfth year of King Ahasuerus, from day to day and from month to month they went on looking for a sign given by Pur (that is chance) before Haman, till the sign came out for the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, the month Adar.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And Haman said to King Ahasuerus, There is a certain nation living here and there in small groups among the people in all the divisions of your kingdom; their laws are different from those of any other nation, and they do not keep the king's laws: for this reason it is not right for the king to let them be.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: If it is the king's pleasure, let a statement ordering their destruction be put in writing: and I will give to those responsible for the king's business, ten thousand talents of silver for the king's store-house.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: And the king took his ring from his hand and gave it to Haman, the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, the hater of the Jews.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And the king said to Haman, The money is yours, and the people, to do with them whatever seems right to you.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Then on the thirteenth day of the first month, the king's scribes were sent for, and they put in writing Haman's orders to all the king's captains and the rulers of every division of his kingdom and the chiefs of every people: for every division of the kingdom in the writing commonly used there, and to every people in the language which was theirs; it was signed in the name of King Ahasuerus and stamped with the king's ring.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And letters were sent by the runners into every division of the kingdom ordering the death and destruction of all Jews, young and old, little children and women, on the same day, even the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, the month Adar, and the taking of all their goods by force.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: A copy of the writing, to be made public in every part of the kingdom, was sent out to all the peoples, so that they might be ready when that day came.

title: Esther Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: The runners went out quickly by the king's order, and a public statement was made in Shushan: and the king and Haman took wine together: but the town of Shushan was troubled.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Now when Mordecai saw what was done, pulling off his robe, he put on haircloth, with dust on his head, and went out into the middle of the town, crying out with a loud and bitter cry.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And he came even before the king's doorway; for no one might come inside the king's door clothed in haircloth.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And in every part of the kingdom, wherever the king's word and his order came, there was great sorrow among the Jews, and weeping and crying and going without food; and numbers of them were stretched on the earth covered with dust and haircloth.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And Esther's women and her servants came and gave her word of it. Then great was the grief of the queen: and she sent robes for Mordecai, so that his clothing of haircloth might be taken off; but he would not have them.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Then Esther sent for Hathach, one of the king's unsexed servants whom he had given her for waiting on her, and she gave him orders to go to Mordecai and see what this was and why it was.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: So Hathach went out and saw Mordecai in the open square of the town before the king's doorway.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: And Mordecai gave him an account of what had taken place, and of the amount of money which Haman had said he would put into the king's store for the destruction of the Jews.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And he gave him the copy of the order which had been given out in Shushan for their destruction, ordering him to let Esther see it, and to make it clear to her; and to say to her that she was to go in to the king, requesting his mercy, and making prayer for her people.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And Hathach came back and gave Esther an account of what Mordecai had said.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: Then Esther sent Hathach to say to Mordecai:

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: It is common knowledge among all the king's servants and the people of every part of the kingdom, that if anyone, man or woman, comes to the king in his inner room without being sent for, there is only one law for him, that he is to be put to death; only those to whom the king's rod of gold is stretched out may keep their lives: but I have not been sent for to come before the king these thirty days.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And they said these words to Mordecai.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: Then Mordecai sent this answer back to Esther: Do not have the idea that you in the king's house will be safe from the fate of all the Jews.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: If at this time you say nothing, then help and salvation will come to the Jews from some other place, but you and your father's family will come to destruction: and who is to say that you have not come to the kingdom even for such a time as this?

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: Then Esther sent them back to Mordecai with this answer:

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: Go, get together all the Jews who are present in Shushan, and go without food for me, taking no food or drink night or day for three days: and I and my women will do the same; and so I will go in to the king, which is against the law: and if death is to be my fate, then let it come.

title: Esther Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: So Mordecai went away and did everything as Esther had said.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Now on the third day, Esther put on her queen's robes, and took her place in the inner room of the king's house, facing the king's house: and the king was seated on his high seat in the king's house, facing the doorway of the house.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: And when the king saw Esther the queen waiting in the inner room, looking kindly on her he put out the rod of gold in his hand to her. So Esther came near and put her fingers on the top of the rod.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: Then the king said, What is your desire, Queen Esther, and what is your request? I will give it to you, even to the half of my kingdom.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: And Esther in answer said, If it seems good to the king, let the king and Haman come today to the feast which I have made ready for him.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: Then the king said, Let Haman come quickly, so that what Esther has said may be done. So the king and Haman came to the feast which Esther had made ready.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And while they were drinking wine the king said to Esther, What is your prayer? for it will be given to you and what is your request? for it will be done, even to the half of my kingdom.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: Then Esther said in answer, My prayer and my request is this:

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: If I have the king's approval, and if it is the king's pleasure to give me my prayer and do my request, let the king and Haman come to the feast which I will make ready for them, and tomorrow I will do as the king has said.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: Then on that day Haman went out full of joy and glad in heart; but when he saw Mordecai in the king's doorway, and he did not get to his feet or give any sign of fear before him, Haman was full of wrath against Mordecai.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: But controlling himself, he went to his house; and he sent for his friends and Zeresh, his wife.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: And he gave them an account of the glories of his wealth, and the number of children he had, and the ways in which he had been honoured by the king, and how he had put him over the captains and servants of the king.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And Haman said further, Truly, Esther the queen let no man but myself come in to the feast which she had made ready for the king; and tomorrow again I am to be her guest with the king.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: But all this is nothing to me while I see Mordecai the Jew seated by the king's doorway.

title: Esther Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: Then his wife Zeresh and all his friends said to him, Let a pillar, fifty cubits high, be made ready for hanging him, and in the morning get the king to give orders for the hanging of Mordecai: then you will be able to go to the feast with the king with a glad heart. And Haman was pleased with the suggestion, and he had the pillar made.

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: That night the king was unable to get any sleep; and he sent for the books of the records; and while some one was reading them to the king,

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: It came out that it was recorded in the book how Mordecai had given word of the designs of Bigthana and Teresh, two of the king's servants, keepers of the door, by whom an attack on the king had been designed.

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: And the king said, What honour and reward have been given to Mordecai for this? Then the servants who were waiting on the king said, Nothing has been done for him.

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: Then the king said, Who is in the outer room? Now Haman had come into the outer room to get the king's authority for the hanging of Mordecai on the pillar which he had made ready for him.

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: And the king's servants said to him, See, Haman is waiting in the outer room. And the king said, Let him come in.

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: So Haman came in. And the king said to him, What is to be done to the man whom the king has delight in honouring? Then the thought came into Haman's mind, Whom, more than myself, would the king have pleasure in honouring?

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And Haman, answering the king, said, For the man whom the king has delight in honouring,

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: Let them take the robes which the king generally puts on, and the horse on which the king goes, and the crown which is on his head:

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And let the robes and the horse be given to one of the king's most noble captains, so that they may put them on the man whom the king has delight in honouring, and let him go on horseback through the streets of the town, with men crying out before him, So let it be done to the man whom the king has delight in honouring.

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: Then the king said to Haman, Go quickly, and take the robes and the horse, as you have said, and do even so to Mordecai the Jew, who is seated at the king's doorway: see that you do everything as you have said.

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: Then Haman took the robes and the horse, and dressing Mordecai in the robes, he made him go on horseback through the streets of the town, crying out before him, So let it be done to the man whom the king has delight in honouring.

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And Mordecai came back to the king's doorway. But Haman went quickly back to his house, sad and with his head covered.

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And Haman gave his wife Zeresh and all his friends an account of what had taken place. Then his wise men and his wife Zeresh said to him, If Mordecai, who is starting to get the better of you, is of the seed of the Jews, you will not be able to do anything against him, but you will certainly go down before him.

title: Esther Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: While they were still talking, the king's servants came to take Haman to the feast which Esther had made ready.

title: Esther Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: So the king and Haman came to take wine with Esther the queen.

title: Esther Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And the king said to Esther again on the second day, while they were drinking, What is your prayer, Queen Esther? for it will be given to you; and what is your request? for it will be done, even to the half of my kingdom.

title: Esther Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Then Esther the queen, answering, said, If I have your approval, O king, and if it is the king's pleasure, let my life be given to me in answer to my prayer, and my people at my request:

title: Esther Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: For we are given up, I and my people, to destruction and death and to be cut off. If we had been taken as men-servants and women-servants for a price, I would have said nothing, for our trouble is little in comparison with the king's loss.

title: Esther Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: Then King Ahasuerus said to Esther the queen, Who is he and where is he who has had this evil thought in his heart?

title: Esther Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: And Esther said, Our hater and attacker is this evil Haman. Then Haman was full of fear before the king and the queen.

title: Esther Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: And the king in his wrath got up from the feast and went into the garden: and Haman got to his feet to make a prayer for his life to Esther the queen: for he saw that the king's purpose was evil against him.

title: Esther Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: Then the king came back from the garden into the room where they had been drinking; and Haman was stretched out on the seat where Esther was. Then the king said, Is he taking the queen by force before my eyes in my house? And while the words were on the king's lips, they put a cloth over Haman's face.

title: Esther Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: Then Harbonah, one of the unsexed servants waiting before the king, said, See, the pillar fifty cubits high, which Haman made for Mordecai, who said a good word for the king, is still in its place in Haman's house. Then the king said, Put him to death by hanging him on it.

title: Esther Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: So Haman was put to death by hanging him on the pillar he had made for Mordecai. Then the king's wrath became less.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: That day the king gave all the family of Haman, the hater of the Jews, to Esther the queen. And Mordecai came before the king, for Esther had made clear what he was to her.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And the king took off his ring, which he had taken from Haman, and gave it to Mordecai. And Esther put Mordecai over the family of Haman.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: Then Esther again came before the king, falling down at his feet, and made request to him with weeping, that he would put a stop to the evil purposes of Haman the Agagite and the designs which he had made against the Jews.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: Then the king put out the rod of gold to Esther, and she got up before the king.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And she said, If it is the king's pleasure and if I have his approval and this thing seems right to the king and I am pleasing to him, then let letters be sent giving orders against those which Haman, the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, sent out for the destruction of the Jews in all divisions of the kingdom:

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: For how is it possible for me to see the evil which is to overtake my nation? how may I see the destruction of my people?

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: Then King Ahasuerus said to Esther the queen and to Mordecai the Jew, See now, I have given Esther the family of Haman, and he has come to his death by hanging, because he made an attack on the Jews.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: So now send a letter about the Jews, writing whatever seems good to you, in the king's name, and stamping it with the king's ring: for a writing signed in the king's name and stamped with the king's ring may not be changed.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: Then at that time, on the twenty-third day of the third month, which is the month Sivan, the king's scribes were sent for; and everything ordered by Mordecai was put in writing and sent to the Jews and the captains and the rulers and the chiefs of all the divisions of the kingdom from India to Ethiopia, a hundred and twenty-seven divisions, to every division in the writing commonly used there, and to every people in their language, and to the Jews in their writing and their language.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: The letters were sent in the name of King Ahasuerus and stamped with his ring, and they were taken by men on horseback, going on the quick-running horses used for the king's business, the offspring of his best horses:

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: In these letters the king gave authority to the Jews in every town to come together and make a fight for their lives, and to send death and destruction on the power of any people in any part of the kingdom attacking them or their children or their women, and to take their goods from them by force,

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: On one day in every division of the kingdom of Ahasuerus, that is, on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, the month Adar.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: A copy of the writing, to be made public as an order in every division of the kingdom, was given out to all the peoples, so that the Jews might be ready when that day came to give punishment to their haters.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: So the men went out on the quick-running horses used on the king's business, wasting no time and forced on by the king's order; and the order was given out in Shushan, the king's town.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And Mordecai went out from before the king, dressed in king-like robes of blue and white, and with a great crown of gold and clothing of purple and the best linen: and all the town of Shushan gave loud cries of joy.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: And the Jews had light and joy and honour.

title: Esther Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: And in every part of the kingdom and in every town, wherever the king's letter and his order came, the Jews were glad with great joy, and had a feast and a good day. And a great number of the people of the land became Jews: for the fear of the Jews had come on them.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Now on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is the month Adar, when the time came for the king's order to be put into effect, on the very day when the haters of the Jews had been hoping to have rule over them; though the opposite had come about, and the Jews had rule over their haters;

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: On that day, the Jews came together in their towns through all the divisions of the kingdom of Ahasuerus, for the purpose of attacking all those who were attempting evil against them: and everyone had to give way before them, for the fear of them had come on all the peoples.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And all the chiefs and the captains and the rulers and those who did the king's business gave support to the Jews; because the fear of Mordecai had come on them.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: For Mordecai was great in the king's house, and word of him went out through every part of the kingdom: for the man Mordecai became greater and greater.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: So the Jews overcame all their attackers with the sword and with death and destruction, and did to their haters whatever they had a desire to do.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: And in Shushan the Jews put to death five hundred men.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: They put to death Parshandatha, Dalphon, Aspatha,

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: Poratha, Adalia, Aridatha,

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: Parmashta, Arisai, Aridai, and Vaizatha,

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: The ten sons of Haman the son of Hammedatha, the hater of the Jews; but they put not a hand on any of their goods.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: On that day the number of those who had been put to death in the town of Shushan was given to the king.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And the king said to Esther the queen, The Jews have put five hundred men to death in Shushan, as well as the ten sons of Haman: what then have they done in the rest of the kingdom! Now what is your prayer? for it will be given to you; what other request have you? and it will be done.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: Then Esther said, If it is the king's pleasure, let authority be given to the Jews in Shushan to do tomorrow as has been done today, and let orders be given for the hanging of Haman's ten sons.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: And the king said that this was to be done, and the order was given out in Shushan, and the hanging of Haman's ten sons was effected.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: For the Jews who were in Shushan came together again on the fourteenth day of the month Adar and put to death three hundred men in Shushan; but they put not a hand on their goods.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: And the other Jews in every division of the kingdom came together, fighting for their lives, and got salvation from their haters and put seventy-five thousand of them to death; but they did not put a hand on their goods.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: This they did on the thirteenth day of the month Adar; and on the fourteenth day of the same month they took their rest, and made it a day of feasting and joy.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: But the Jews in Shushan came together on the thirteenth and on the fourteenth day of the month; and on the fifteenth day they took their rest, and made it a day of feasting and joy.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: So the Jews of the country places living in unwalled towns make the fourteenth day of the month Adar a day of feasting and joy and a good day, a day for sending offerings one to another.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: And Mordecai sent letters to all the Jews in every division of the kingdom of Ahasuerus, near and far,

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: Ordering them to keep the fourteenth day of the month Adar and the fifteenth day of the same month, every year,

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: As days on which the Jews had rest from their haters, and the month which for them was turned from sorrow to joy, and from weeping to a good day: and that they were to keep them as days of feasting and joy, of sending offerings to one another and good things to the poor.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: And the Jews gave their word to go on as they had been doing and as Mordecai had given them orders in writing;

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: Because Haman, the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, the hater of all the Jews, had made designs for their destruction, attempting to get a decision by Pur (that is, chance) with a view to putting an end to them and cutting them off;

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: But when the business was put before the king, he gave orders by letters that the evil design which he had made against the Jews was to be turned against himself; and that he and his sons were to be put to death by hanging.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: So these days were named Purim, after the name of Pur. And so, because of the words of this letter, and of what they had seen in connection with this business, and what had come to them,

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: The Jews made a rule and gave an undertaking, causing their seed and all those who were joined to them to do the same, so that it might be in force for ever, that they would keep those two days, as ordered in the letter, at the fixed time every year;

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: And that those days were to be kept in memory through every generation and every family, in every division of the kingdom and every town, that there might never be a time when these days of Purim would not be kept among the Jews, or when the memory of them would go from the minds of their seed.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: Then Esther the queen, daughter of Abihail, and Mordecai the Jew, sent a second letter giving the force of their authority to the order about the Purim.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 30
text: And he sent letters to all the Jews in the hundred and twenty-seven divisions of the kingdom of Ahasuerus, with true words of peace,

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 31
text: Giving the force of law to these days of Purim at their fixed times, as they had been ordered by Mordecai the Jew and Esther the queen, and in keeping with the rules they had made for themselves and their seed, in connection with their time of going without food and their cry for help.

title: Esther Chapter 9 Verse 32
text: The order given by Esther gave the force of law to the rules about the Purim; and it was recorded in the book.

title: Esther Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: And King Ahasuerus put a tax on the land and on the islands of the sea.

title: Esther Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: And all his acts of power and his great strength and the full story of the high place which the king gave Mordecai, are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Media and Persia?

title: Esther Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: For Mordecai the Jew was second only to King Ahasuerus, and great among the Jews and respected by the body of his countrymen; working for the good of his people, and saying words of peace to all his seed.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: There was a man in the land of Uz whose name was Job. He was without sin and upright, fearing God and keeping himself far from evil.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: And he had seven sons and three daughters.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: And of cattle he had seven thousand sheep and goats, and three thousand camels, and a thousand oxen, and five hundred she-asses, and a very great number of servants. And the man was greater than any of the sons of the east.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: His sons regularly went to one another's houses, and every one on his day gave a feast: and at these times they sent for their three sisters to take part in their feasts with them.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: And at the end of their days of feasting, Job sent and made them clean, getting up early in the morning and offering burned offerings for them all. For, Job said, It may be that my sons have done wrong and said evil of God in their hearts. And Job did this whenever the feasts came round.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: And there was a day when the sons of the gods came together before the Lord, and the Satan came with them.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: And the Lord said to the Satan, Where do you come from? And the Satan said in answer, From wandering this way and that on the earth, and walking about on it.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And the Lord said to the Satan, Have you taken note of my servant Job, for there is no one like him on the earth, a man without sin and upright, fearing God and keeping himself far from evil?

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: And the Satan said in answer to the Lord, Is it for nothing that Job is a god-fearing man?

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Have you yourself not put a wall round him and his house and all he has on every side, blessing the work of his hands, and increasing his cattle in the land?

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: But now, put out your hand against all he has, and he will be cursing you to your face.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And the Lord said to the Satan, See, I give all he has into your hands, only do not put a finger on the man himself. And the Satan went out from before the Lord.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And there was a day when his sons and daughters were feasting in the house of their oldest brother,

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: And a man came to Job, and said, The oxen were ploughing, and the asses were taking their food by their side:

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And the men of Sheba came against them and took them away, putting the young men to the sword, and I was the only one who got away safe to give you the news.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And this one was still talking when another came, and said, The fire of God came down from heaven, burning up the sheep and the goats and the young men completely, and I was the only one who got away safe to give you the news.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And this one was still talking when another came, and said, The Chaldaeans made themselves into three bands, and came down on the camels and took them away, putting the young men to the sword, and I was the only one who got away safe to give you the news.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: And this one was still talking when another came, and said, Your sons and your daughters were feasting together in their oldest brother's house,

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: When a great wind came rushing from the waste land against the four sides of the house, and it came down on the young men, and they are dead; and I was the only one who got away safe to give you the news.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: Then Job got up, and after parting his clothing and cutting off his hair, he went down on his face to the earth, and gave worship, and said,

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: With nothing I came out of my mother's body, and with nothing I will go back there; the Lord gave and the Lord has taken away; let the Lord's name be praised.

title: Job Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: In all this Job did no sin, and did not say that God's acts were foolish.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And there was a day when the sons of the gods came together before the Lord, and the Satan came with them.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And the Lord said to the Satan, Where do you come from? And the Satan said in answer, From wandering this way and that on the earth, and walking about on it.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And the Lord said to the Satan, Have you taken note of my servant Job, for there is no one like him on the earth, a man without sin and upright, fearing God and keeping himself far from evil? and he still keeps his righteousness, though you have been moving me to send destruction on him without cause.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And the Satan said in answer to the Lord, Skin for skin, all a man has he will give for his life.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: But now, if you only put your hand on his bone and his flesh, he will certainly be cursing you to your face.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And the Lord said to the Satan, See, he is in your hands, only do not take his life.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And the Satan went out from before the Lord, and sent on Job an evil disease covering his skin from his feet to the top of his head.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And he took a broken bit of a pot, and, seated in the dust, was rubbing himself with the sharp edge of it.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And his wife said to him, Are you still keeping your righteousness? Say a curse against God, and put an end to yourself.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And he said to her, You are talking like one of the foolish women. If we take the good God sends us, are we not to take the evil when it comes? In all this Job kept his lips from sin.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: And Job's three friends had word of all this evil which had come on him. And they came every one from his place, Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite. So they came together to a meeting-place, in order that they might go and make clear to Job their grief for him, and give him comfort.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And lifting up their eyes when they were still far off, it did not seem that the man they saw was Job because of the change in him. And they gave way to bitter weeping, with signs of grief, and put dust on their heads.

title: Job Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And they took their seats on the earth by his side for seven days and seven nights: but no one said a word to him, for they saw that his pain was very great.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Then, opening his mouth, and cursing the day of his birth,

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: Job made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Let destruction take the day of my birth, and the night on which it was said, A man child has come into the world.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: That day--let it be dark; let not God take note of it from on high, and let not the light be shining on it;

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Let the dark and the black night take it for themselves; let it be covered with a cloud; let the dark shades of day send fear on it.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: That night--let the thick dark take it; let it not have joy among the days of the year; let it not come into the number of the months.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: As for that night, let it have no fruit; let no voice of joy be sounded in it;

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Let it be cursed by those who put a curse on the day; who are ready to make Leviathan awake.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Let its morning stars be dark; let it be looking for light, but may it not have any; let it not see the eyes of the dawn.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: Because it did not keep the doors of my mother's body shut, so that trouble might be veiled from my eyes.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Why did death not take me when I came out of my mother's body, why did I not, when I came out, give up my last breath?

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Why did the knees take me, or why the breasts that they might give me milk?

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: For then I might have gone to my rest in quiet, and in sleep have been in peace,

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: With kings and the wise ones of the earth, who put up great houses for themselves;

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: Or with rulers who had gold, and whose houses were full of silver;

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Or as a child dead at birth I might never have come into existence; like young children who have not seen the light.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: There the passions of the evil are over, and those whose strength has come to an end have rest.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: There the prisoners are at peace together; the voice of the overseer comes not again to their ears.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: The small and the great are there, and the servant is free from his master.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: Why does he give light to him who is in trouble, and life to the bitter in soul;

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: To those whose desire is for death, but it comes not; who are searching for it more than for secret wealth;

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: Who are glad with great joy, and full of delight when they come to their last resting-place;

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: To a man whose way is veiled, and who is shut in by God?

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: In place of my food I have grief, and cries of sorrow come from me like water.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: For I have a fear and it comes on me, and my heart is greatly troubled.

title: Job Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: I have no peace, no quiet, and no rest; nothing but pain comes on me.

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And Eliphaz the Temanite made answer and said,
