title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: If one says a word, will it be a weariness to you? but who is able to keep from saying what is in his mind?

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Truly, you have been a helper to others, and you have made feeble hands strong;

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: He who was near to falling has been lifted up by your words, and you have given strength to bent knees.

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: But now it has come on you and it is a weariness to you; you are touched by it and your mind is troubled.

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: Is not your fear of God your support, and your upright way of life your hope?

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: Have you ever seen destruction come to an upright man? or when were the god-fearing ever cut off?

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: What I have seen is that those by whom trouble has been ploughed, and evil planted, get the same for themselves.

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: By the breath of God destruction takes them, and by the wind of his wrath they are cut off.

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: Though the noise of the lion and the sounding of his voice, may be loud, the teeth of the young lions are broken.

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: The old lion comes to his end for need of food, and the young of the she-lion go wandering in all directions.

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: A word was given to me secretly, and the low sound of it came to my ears.

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: In troubled thoughts from visions of the night, when deep sleep comes on men,

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Fear came on me and shaking, and my bones were full of trouble;

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: And a breath was moving over my face; the hair of my flesh became stiff:

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: Something was present before me, but I was not able to see it clearly; there was a form before my eyes: a quiet voice came to my ears, saying:

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: May a man be upright before God? or a man be clean before his Maker?

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: Truly, he puts no faith in his servants, and he sees error in his angels;

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: How much more those living in houses of earth, whose bases are in the dust! They are crushed more quickly than an insect;

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: Between morning and evening they are completely broken; they come to an end for ever, and no one takes note.

title: Job Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: If their tent-cord is pulled up, do they not come to an end, and without wisdom?

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Give now a cry for help; is there anyone who will give you an answer? and to which of the holy ones will you make your prayer?

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: For wrath is the cause of death to the foolish, and he who has no wisdom comes to his end through passion.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: I have seen the foolish taking root, but suddenly the curse came on his house.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: Now his children have no safe place, and they are crushed before the judges, for no one takes up their cause.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: Their produce is taken by him who has no food, and their grain goes to the poor, and he who is in need of water gets it from their spring.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: For evil does not come out of the dust, or trouble out of the earth;

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: But trouble is man's fate from birth, as the flames go up from the fire.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: But as for me, I would make my prayer to God, and I would put my cause before him:

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: Who does great things outside our knowledge, wonders without number:

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: Who gives rain on the earth, and sends water on the fields:

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: Lifting up those who are low, and putting the sad in a safe place;

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: Who makes the designs of the wise go wrong, so that they are unable to give effect to their purposes.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: He takes the wise in their secret designs, and the purposes of the twisted are cut off suddenly.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: In the daytime it becomes dark for them, and in the sunlight they go feeling about as if it was night.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: But he keeps safe from their sword those who have no father, and the poor from the power of the strong.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: So the poor man has hope, and the mouth of the evil-doer is stopped.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: Truly, that man is happy who has training from the hand of God: so do not let your heart be shut to the teaching of the Ruler of all.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: For after his punishment he gives comfort, and after wounding, his hands make you well.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: He will keep you safe from six troubles, and in seven no evil will come near you.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: When there is need of food he will keep you from death, and in war from the power of the sword.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: He will keep you safe from the evil tongue; and you will have no fear of wasting when it comes.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: You will make sport of destruction and need, and will have no fear of the beasts of the earth.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: For you will be in agreement with the stones of the earth, and the beasts of the field will be at peace with you.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: And you will be certain that your tent is at peace, and after looking over your property you will see that nothing is gone.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: You will be certain that your seed will be great, and your offspring like the plants of the earth.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: You will come to your last resting-place in full strength, as the grain is taken up to the crushing-floor in its time.

title: Job Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: See, we have made search with care, and it is so; it has come to our ears; see that you take note of it for yourself.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: And Job made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: If only my passion might be measured, and put into the scales against my trouble!

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: For then its weight would be more than the sand of the seas: because of this my words have been uncontrolled.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: For the arrows of the Ruler of all are present with me, and their poison goes deep into my spirit: his army of fears is put in order against me.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: Does the ass of the fields give out his voice when he has grass? or does the ox make sounds over his food?

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: Will a man take food which has no taste without salt? or is there any taste in the soft substance of purslain?

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: My soul has no desire for such things, they are as disease in my food.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: If only I might have an answer to my prayer, and God would give me my desire!

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: If only he would be pleased to put an end to me; and would let loose his hand, so that I might be cut off!

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: So I would still have comfort, and I would have joy in the pains of death, for I have not been false to the words of the Holy One.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: Have I strength to go on waiting, or have I any end to be looking forward to?

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: Is my strength the strength of stones, or is my flesh brass?

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: I have no help in myself, and wisdom is completely gone from me.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: He whose heart is shut against his friend has given up the fear of the Ruler of all.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: My friends have been false like a stream, like streams in the valleys which come to an end:

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: Which are dark because of the ice, and the snow falling into them;

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: Under the burning sun they are cut off, and come to nothing because of the heat.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: The camel-trains go out of their way; they go up into the waste and come to destruction.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: The camel-trains of Tema were searching with care, the bands of Sheba were waiting for them:

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: They were put to shame because of their hope; they came and their hope was gone.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: So have you now become to me; you see my sad condition and are in fear.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: Did I say, Give me something? or, Make a payment for me out of your wealth?

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: Or, Get me out of the power of my hater? or, Give money so that I may be free from the power of the cruel ones?

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: Give me teaching and I will be quiet; and make me see my error.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: How pleasing are upright words! but what force is there in your arguments?

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: My words may seem wrong to you, but the words of him who has no hope are for the wind.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: Truly, you are such as would give up the child of a dead man to his creditors, and would make a profit out of your friend.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: Now then, let your eyes be turned to me, for truly I will not say what is false to your face.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: Let your minds be changed, and do not have an evil opinion of me; yes, be changed, for my righteousness is still in me.

title: Job Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: Is there evil in my tongue? is not the cause of my trouble clear to me?

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Has not man his ordered time of trouble on the earth? and are not his days like the days of a servant working for payment?

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: As a servant desiring the shades of evening, and a workman looking for his payment:

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: So I have for my heritage months of pain to no purpose, and nights of weariness are given to me.

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: When I go to my bed, I say, When will it be time to get up? but the night is long, and I am turning from side to side till morning light.

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: My flesh is covered with worms and dust; my skin gets hard and then is cracked again.

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: My days go quicker than the cloth-worker's thread, and come to an end without hope.

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: O, keep in mind that my life is wind: my eye will never again see good.

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: The eye of him who sees me will see me no longer: your eyes will be looking for me, but I will be gone.

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: A cloud comes to an end and is gone; so he who goes down into the underworld comes not up again.

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: He will not come back to his house, and his place will have no more knowledge of him.

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: So I will not keep my mouth shut; I will let the words come from it in the pain of my spirit, my soul will make a bitter outcry.

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: Am I a sea, or a sea-beast, that you put a watch over me?

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: When I say, In my bed I will have comfort, there I will get rest from my disease;

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: Then you send dreams to me, and visions of fear;

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: So that a hard death seems better to my soul than my pains.

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: I have no desire for life, I would not be living for ever! Keep away from me, for my days are as a breath.

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: What is man, that you have made him great, and that your attention is fixed on him,

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: And that your hand is on him every morning, and that you are testing him every minute?

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: How long will it be before your eyes are turned away from me, so that I may have a minute's breathing-space?

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: If I have done wrong, what have I done to you, O keeper of men? why have you made me a mark for your blows, so that I am a weariness to myself?

title: Job Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: And why do you not take away my sin, and let my wrongdoing be ended? for now I go down to the dust, and you will be searching for me with care, but I will be gone.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Then Bildad the Shuhite made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: How long will you say these things, and how long will the words of your mouth be like a strong wind?

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: Does God give wrong decisions? or is the Ruler of all not upright in his judging?

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: If your children have done evil against him, then their punishment is from his hand.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: If you will make search for God with care, and put your request before the Ruler of all;

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: If you are clean and upright; then he will certainly be moved to take up your cause, and will make clear your righteousness by building up your house again.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: And though your start was small, your end will be very great.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: Put the question now to the past generations, and give attention to what has been searched out by their fathers:

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: (For we are but of yesterday, and have no knowledge, because our days on earth are gone like a shade:)

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: Will they not give you teaching, and say words of wisdom to you?

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: Will the river-plant come up in its pride without wet earth? will the grass get tall without water?

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: When it is still green, without being cut down, it becomes dry and dead before any other plant.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: So is the end of all who do not keep God in mind; and the hope of the evil-doer comes to nothing:

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: Whose support is cut off, and whose hope is no stronger than a spider's thread.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: He is looking to his family for support, but it is not there; he puts his hope in it, but it comes to nothing.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: He is full of strength before the sun, and his branches go out over his garden.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: His roots are twisted round the stones, forcing their way in between them.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: If he is taken away from his place, then it will say, I have not seen you.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: Such is the joy of his way, and out of the dust another comes up to take his place.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: Truly, God will not give up him who is without sin, and will not take evil-doers by the hand.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: The time will come when your mouth will be full of laughing, and cries of joy will come from your lips.

title: Job Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: Your haters will be clothed with shame, and the tent of the sinner will not be seen again.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: And Job made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: Truly, I see that it is so: and how is it possible for a man to get his right before God?

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: If a man was desiring to go to law with him, he would not be able to give him an answer to one out of a thousand questions.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: He is wise in heart and great in strength: who ever made his face hard against him, and any good came of it?

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: It is he who takes away the mountains without their knowledge, overturning them in his wrath:

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: Who is moving the earth out of its place, so that its pillars are shaking:

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: Who gives orders to the sun, and it does not give its light; and who keeps the stars from shining.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: By whose hand the heavens were stretched out, and who is walking on the waves of the sea:

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: Who made the Bear and Orion, and the Pleiades, and the store-houses of the south:

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: Who does great things not to be searched out; yes, wonders without number.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: See, he goes past me and I see him not: he goes on before, but I have no knowledge of him.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: If he puts out his hand to take, by whom may it be turned back? who may say to him, What are you doing?

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: God's wrath may not be turned back; the helpers of Rahab were bent down under him.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: How much less may I give an answer to him, using the right words in argument with him?

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: Even if my cause was good, I would not be able to give an answer; I would make request for grace from him who was against me.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: If I had sent for him to be present, and he had come, I would have no faith that he would give ear to my voice.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: For I would be crushed by his storm, my wounds would be increased without cause.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: He would not let me take my breath, but I would be full of bitter grief.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: If it is a question of strength, he says, Here I am! and if it is a question of a cause at law, he says, Who will give me a fixed day?

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: Though I was in the right, he would say that I was in the wrong; I have done no evil; but he says that I am a sinner.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: I have done no wrong; I give no thought to what becomes of me; I have no desire for life.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: It is all the same to me; so I say, He puts an end to the sinner and to him who has done no wrong together.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: If death comes suddenly through disease, he makes sport of the fate of those who have done no wrong.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: The land is given into the power of the evil-doer; the faces of its judges are covered; if not by him, then who has done it?

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: My days go quicker than a post-runner: they go in flight, they see no good.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: They go rushing on like reed-boats, like an eagle dropping suddenly on its food.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: If I say, I will put my grief out of mind, I will let my face be sad no longer and I will be bright;

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: I go in fear of all my pains; I am certain that I will not be free from sin in your eyes.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 29
text: You will not let me be clear of sin! why then do I take trouble for nothing?

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 30
text: If I am washed with snow water, and make my hands clean with soap;

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 31
text: Then you will have me pushed into the dust, so that I will seem disgusting to my very clothing.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 32
text: For he is not a man as I am, that I might give him an answer, that we might come together before a judge.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 33
text: There is no one to give a decision between us, who might have control over us.

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 34
text: Let him take away his rod from me and not send his fear on me:

title: Job Chapter 9 Verse 35
text: Then I would say what is in my mind without fear of him; for there is no cause of fear in myself.

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: My soul is tired of life; I will let my sad thoughts go free in words; my soul will make a bitter outcry.

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: I will say to God, Do not put me down as a sinner; make clear to me what you have against me.

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: What profit is it to you to be cruel, to give up the work of your hands, looking kindly on the design of evil-doers?

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: Have you eyes of flesh, or do you see as man sees?

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: Are your days as the days of man, or your years like his,

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: That you take note of my sin, searching after my wrongdoing,

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: Though you see that I am not an evil-doer; and there is no one who is able to take a man out of your hands?

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: Your hands made me, and I was formed by you, but then, changing your purpose, you gave me up to destruction.

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: O keep in mind that you made me out of earth; and will you send me back again to dust?

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: Was I not drained out like milk, becoming hard like cheese?

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: By you I was clothed with skin and flesh, and joined together with bones and muscles.

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: You have been kind to me, and your grace has been with me, and your care has kept my spirit safe.

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: But you kept these things in the secret of your heart; I am certain this was in your thoughts:

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: That, if I did wrong, you would take note of it, and would not make me clear from sin:

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: That, if I was an evil-doer, the curse would come on me; and if I was upright, my head would not be lifted up, being full of shame and overcome with trouble.

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: And that if there was cause for pride, you would go after me like a lion; and again put out your wonders against me:

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: That you would send new witnesses against me, increasing your wrath against me, and letting loose new armies on me.

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: Why then did you make me come out of my mother's body? It would have been better for me to have taken my last breath, and for no eye to have seen me,

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: And for me to have been as if I had not been; to have been taken from my mother's body straight to my last resting-place.

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: Are not the days of my life small in number? Let your eyes be turned away from me, so that I may have a little pleasure,

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: Before I go to the place from which I will not come back, to the land where all is dark and black,

title: Job Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: A land of thick dark, without order, where the very light is dark.

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Then Zophar the Naamathite made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: Are all these words to go unanswered? and is a man seen to be right because he is full of talk?

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: Are your words of pride to make men keep quiet? and are you to make sport, with no one to put you to shame?

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: You may say, My way is clean, and I am free from sin in your eyes.

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: But if only God would take up the word, opening his lips in argument with you;

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And would make clear to you the secrets of wisdom, and the wonders of his purpose!

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: Are you able to take God's measure, to make discovery of the limits of the Ruler of all?

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: They are higher than heaven; what is there for you to do? deeper than the underworld, and outside your knowledge;

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: Longer in measure than the earth, and wider than the sea.

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: If he goes on his way, shutting a man up and putting him to death, who may make him go back from his purpose?

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: For in his eyes men are as nothing; he sees evil and takes note of it.

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And so a hollow-minded man will get wisdom, when a young ass of the field gets teaching.

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: But if you put your heart right, stretching out your hands to him;

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: If you put far away the evil of your hands, and let no wrongdoing have a place in your tent;

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: Then truly your face will be lifted up, with no mark of sin, and you will be fixed in your place without fear:

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: For your sorrow will go from your memory, like waters flowing away:

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: And your life will be brighter than day; though it is dark, it will become like the morning.

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: And you will be safe because there is hope; after looking round, you will take your rest in quiet;

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: Sleeping with no fear of danger; and men will be desiring to have grace in your eyes;

title: Job Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: But the eyes of the evil-doers will be wasting away; their way of flight is gone, and their only hope is the taking of their last breath.

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: And Job made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: No doubt you have knowledge, and wisdom will come to an end with you.

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: But I have a mind as well as you; I am equal to you: yes, who has not knowledge of such things as these?

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: It seems that I am to be as one who is a cause of laughing to his neighbour, one who makes his prayer to God and is answered! the upright man who has done no wrong is to be made sport of!

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: In the thought of him who is in comfort there is no respect for one who is in trouble; such is the fate of those whose feet are slipping.

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: There is wealth in the tents of those who make destruction, and those by whom God is moved to wrath are safe; even those whose god is their strength.

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: But put now a question to the beasts, and get teaching from them; or to the birds of the heaven, and they will make it clear to you;

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: Or to the things which go flat on the earth, and they will give you wisdom; and the fishes of the sea will give you news of it.

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: Who does not see by all these that the hand of the Lord has done this?

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all flesh of man.

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: Are not words tested by the ear, even as food is tasted by the mouth?

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: Old men have wisdom, and a long life gives knowledge.

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: With him there is wisdom and strength; power and knowledge are his.

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: Truly, there is no building up of what is pulled down by him; when a man is shut up by him, no one may let him loose.

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: Truly, he keeps back the waters and they are dry; he sends them out and the earth is overturned.

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: With him are strength and wise designs; he who is guided into error, together with his guide, are in his hands;

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: He takes away the wisdom of the wise guides, and makes judges foolish;

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: He undoes the chains of kings, and puts his band on them;

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: He makes priests prisoners, overturning those in safe positions;

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: He makes the words of responsible persons without effect, and takes away the good sense of the old;

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: He puts shame on chiefs, and takes away the power of the strong;

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: Uncovering deep things out of the dark, and making the deep shade bright;

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: Increasing nations, and sending destruction on them; making wide the lands of peoples, and then giving them up.

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: He takes away the wisdom of the rulers of the earth, and sends them wandering in a waste where there is no way.

title: Job Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: They go feeling about in the dark without light, wandering without help like those overcome with wine.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: Truly, my eye has seen all this, word of it has come to my ear, and I have knowledge of it.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: The same things are in my mind as in yours; I am equal to you.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: But I would have talk with the Ruler of all, and my desire is to have an argument with God.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: But you put a false face on things; all your attempts to put things right are of no value.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: If only you would keep quiet, it would be a sign of wisdom!

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: Give ear to the argument of my mouth, and take note of the words of my lips.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: Will you say in God's name what is not right, and put false words into his mouth?

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: Will you have respect for God's person in this cause, and put yourselves forward as his supporters?

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: Will it be good for you to be searched out by him, or have you the thought that he may be guided into error like a man?

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: He will certainly put you right, if you have respect for persons in secret.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: Will not his glory put you in fear, so that your hearts will be overcome before him?

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: Your wise sayings are only dust, and your strong places are only earth.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: Keep quiet, and let me say what is in my mind, whatever may come to me.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: I will take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in my hand.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: Truly, he will put an end to me; I have no hope; but I will not give way in argument before him;

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: And that will be my salvation, for an evil-doer would not come before him,

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: Give ear with care to my words, and keep what I say in your minds.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: See now, I have put my cause in order, and I am certain that I will be seen to be right.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: Is any one able to take up the argument against me? If so, I would keep quiet and give up my breath.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: Only two things do not do to me, then I will come before your face:

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: Take your hand far away from me; and let me not be overcome by fear of you.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: Then at the sound of your voice I will give answer; or let me put forward my cause for you to give me an answer.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: What is the number of my evil-doings and my sins? give me knowledge of them.

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: Why is your face veiled from me, as if I was numbered among your haters?

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: Will you be hard on a leaf in flight before the wind? will you make a dry stem go more quickly on its way?

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: For you put bitter things on record against me, and send punishment on me for the sins of my early years;

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: And you put chains on my feet, watching all my ways, and making a limit for my steps;

title: Job Chapter 13 Verse 28
text: Though a man comes to nothing like a bit of dead wood, or like a robe which has become food for the worm.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: As for man, the son of woman, his days are short and full of trouble.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: He comes out like a flower, and is cut down: he goes in flight like a shade, and is never seen again.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: Is it on such a one as this that your eyes are fixed, with the purpose of judging him?

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: If only a clean thing might come out of an unclean! But it is not possible.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: If his days are ordered, and you have knowledge of the number of his months, having given him a fixed limit past which he may not go;

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: Let your eyes be turned away from him, and take your hand from him, so that he may have pleasure at the end of his day, like a servant working for payment.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: For there is hope of a tree; if it is cut down, it will come to life again, and its branches will not come to an end.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: Though its root may be old in the earth, and its cut-off end may be dead in the dust;

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: Still, at the smell of water, it will make buds, and put out branches like a young plant.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: But man comes to his death and is gone: he gives up his spirit, and where is he?

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: The waters go from a pool, and a river becomes waste and dry;

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: So man goes down to his last resting-place and comes not again: till the heavens come to an end, they will not be awake or come out of their sleep.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: If only you would keep me safe in the underworld, putting me in a secret place till your wrath is past, giving me a fixed time when I might come to your memory again!

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: If death takes a man, will he come to life again? All the days of my trouble I would be waiting, till the time came for me to be free.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: At the sound of your voice I would give an answer, and you would have a desire for the work of your hands.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: For now my steps are numbered by you, and my sin is not overlooked.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: My wrongdoing is corded up in a bag, and my sin is shut up safe.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: But truly a mountain falling comes to dust, and a rock is moved from its place;

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: The stones are crushed small by the force of the waters; the dust of the earth is washed away by their overflowing: and so you put an end to the hope of man.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: You overcome him for ever, and he is gone; his face is changed in death, and you send him away.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: His sons come to honour, and he has no knowledge of it; they are made low, but he is not conscious of it.

title: Job Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: Only his flesh still has pain, and his soul is sad.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: And Eliphaz the Temanite made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: Will a wise man make answer with knowledge of no value, or will he give birth to the east wind?

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: Will he make arguments with words in which is no profit, and with sayings which have no value?

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: Truly, you make the fear of God without effect, so that the time of quiet worship before God is made less by your outcry.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: For your mouth is guided by your sin, and you have taken the tongue of the false for yourself.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: It is by your mouth, even yours, that you are judged to be in the wrong, and not by me; and your lips give witness against you.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: Were you the first man to come into the world? or did you come into being before the hills?

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: Were you present at the secret meeting of God? and have you taken all wisdom for yourself?

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: What knowledge have you which we have not? is there anything in your mind which is not in ours?

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: With us are men who are grey-haired and full of years, much older than your father.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: Are the comforts of God not enough for you, and the gentle word which was said to you?

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: Why is your heart uncontrolled, and why are your eyes lifted up;

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: So that you are turning your spirit against God, and letting such words go out of your mouth?

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: What is man, that he may be clean? and how may the son of woman be upright?

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: Truly, he puts no faith in his holy ones, and the heavens are not clean in his eyes;

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: How much less one who is disgusting and unclean, a man who takes in evil like water!

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: Take note and give ear to my words; and I will say what I have seen:

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: (The things which wise men have got from their fathers, and have not kept secret from us;

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: For only to them was the land given, and no strange people were among them:)

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: The evil man is in pain all his days, and the number of the years stored up for the cruel is small.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: A sound of fear is in his ears; in time of peace destruction will come on him:

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: He has no hope of coming safe out of the dark, and his fate will be the sword;

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: He is wandering about in search of bread, saying, Where is it? and he is certain that the day of trouble is ready for him:

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: He is greatly in fear of the dark day, trouble and pain overcome him:

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: Because his hand is stretched out against God, and his heart is lifted up against the Ruler of all,

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: Running against him like a man of war, covered by his thick breastplate; even like a king ready for the fight,

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: Because his face is covered with fat, and his body has become thick;

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: And he has made his resting-place in the towns which have been pulled down, in houses where no man had a right to be, whose fate was to become masses of broken walls.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: He does not get wealth for himself, and is unable to keep what he has got; the heads of his grain are not bent down to the earth.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: He does not come out of the dark; his branches are burned by the flame, and the wind takes away his bud.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: Let him not put his hope in what is false, falling into error: for he will get deceit as his reward.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: His branch is cut off before its time, and his leaf is no longer green.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: He is like a vine whose grapes do not come to full growth, or an olive-tree dropping its flowers.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 34
text: For the band of the evil-doers gives no fruit, and the tents of those who give wrong decisions for reward are burned with fire.

title: Job Chapter 15 Verse 35
text: Evil has made them with child, and they give birth to trouble; and the fruit of their body is shame for themselves.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And Job made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: Such things have frequently come to my ears: you are comforters who only give trouble.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: May words which are like the wind be stopped? or what is troubling you to make answer to them?

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: It would not be hard for me to say such things if your souls were in my soul's place; joining words together against you, and shaking my head at you:

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: I might give you strength with my mouth, and not keep back the comfort of my lips.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: If I say what is in my mind, my pain becomes no less: and if I keep quiet, how much of it goes from me?

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: But now he has overcome me with weariness and fear, and I am in the grip of all my trouble.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: It has come up as a witness against me, and the wasting of my flesh makes answer to my face.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: I am broken by his wrath, and his hate has gone after me; he has made his teeth sharp against me: my haters are looking on me with cruel eyes;

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: Their mouths are open wide against me; the blows of his bitter words are falling on my face; all of them come together in a mass against me.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: God gives me over to the power of sinners, sending me violently into the hands of evil-doers.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: I was in comfort, but I have been broken up by his hands; he has taken me by the neck, shaking me to bits; he has put me up as a mark for his arrows.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: His bowmen come round about me; their arrows go through my body without mercy; my life is drained out on the earth.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: I am broken with wound after wound; he comes rushing on me like a man of war.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: I have made haircloth the clothing of my skin, and my horn is rolled in the dust.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: My face is red with weeping, and my eyes are becoming dark;

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: Though my hands have done no violent acts, and my prayer is clean.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: O earth, let not my blood be covered, and let my cry have no resting-place!

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: Even now my witness is in heaven, and the supporter of my cause is on high.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: My friends make sport of me; to God my eyes are weeping,

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: So that he may give decision for a man in his cause with God, and between a son of man and his neighbour.

title: Job Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: For in a short time I will take the journey from which I will not come back.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: My spirit is broken, my days are ended, the last resting-place is ready for me.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: Truly, those who make sport of me are round about me, and my eyes become dark because of their bitter laughing.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: Be pleased, now, to be responsible for me to yourself; for there is no other who will put his hand in mine.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: You have kept their hearts from wisdom: for this cause you will not give them honour.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: As for him who is false to his friend for a reward, light will be cut off from the eyes of his children.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: He has made me a word of shame to the peoples; I have become a mark for their sport.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: My eyes have become dark because of my pain, and all my body is wasted to a shade.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: The upright are surprised at this, and he who has done no wrong is troubled because of the evil-doers.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: Still the upright keeps on his way, and he who has clean hands gets new strength.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: But come back, now, all of you, come; and I will not see a wise man among you.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, even the desires of my heart.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: They are changing night into day; they say, The light is near the dark.

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: If I am waiting for the underworld as my house, if I have made my bed in the dark;

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: If I say to the earth, You are my father; and to the worm, My mother and my sister;

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: Where then is my hope? and who will see my desire?

title: Job Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: Will they go down with me into the underworld? Will we go down together into the dust?

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: Then Bildad the Shuhite made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: How long will it be before you have done talking? Get wisdom, and then we will say what is in our minds.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: Why do we seem as beasts in your eyes, and as completely without knowledge?

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: But come back, now, come: you who are wounding yourself in your passion, will the earth be given up because of you, or a rock be moved out of its place?

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: For the light of the sinner is put out, and the flame of his fire is not shining.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: The light is dark in his tent, and the light shining over him is put out.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: The steps of his strength become short, and by his design destruction overtakes him.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: His feet take him into the net, and he goes walking into the cords.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: His foot is taken in the net; he comes into its grip.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: The twisted cord is put secretly in the earth to take him, and the cord is placed in his way.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: He is overcome by fears on every side, they go after him at every step.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: His strength is made feeble for need of food, and destruction is waiting for his falling footstep.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: His skin is wasted by disease, and his body is food for the worst of diseases.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: He is pulled out of his tent where he was safe, and he is taken away to the king of fears.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: In his tent will be seen that which is not his, burning stone is dropped on his house.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: Under the earth his roots are dry, and over it his branch is cut off.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: His memory is gone from the earth, and in the open country there is no knowledge of his name.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: He is sent away from the light into the dark; he is forced out of the world.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: He has no offspring or family among his people, and in his living-place there is no one of his name.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: At his fate those of the west are shocked, and those of the east are overcome with fear.

title: Job Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: Truly, these are the houses of the sinner, and this is the place of him who has no knowledge of God.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: And Job made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: How long will you make my life bitter, crushing me with words?

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: Ten times now you have made sport of me; it gives you no sense of shame to do me wrong.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: And, truly, if I have been in error, the effect of my error is only on myself.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: If you make yourselves great against me, using my punishment as an argument against me,

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: Be certain that it is God who has done me wrong, and has taken me in his net.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: Truly, I make an outcry against the violent man, but there is no answer: I give a cry for help, but no one takes up my cause.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: My way is walled up by him so that I may not go by: he has made my roads dark.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: He has put off my glory from me, and taken the crown from my head.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: I am broken down by him on every side, and I am gone; my hope is uprooted like a tree.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: His wrath is burning against me, and I am to him as one of his haters.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: His armies come on together, they make their road high against me, and put up their tents round mine.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: He has taken my brothers far away from me; they have seen my fate and have become strange to me.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: My relations and my near friends have given me up, and those living in my house have put me out of their minds.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: I am strange to my women-servants, and seem to them as one from another country.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: At my cry my servant gives me no answer, and I have to make a prayer to him.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: My breath is strange to my wife, and I am disgusting to the offspring of my mother's body.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: Even young children have no respect for me; when I get up their backs are turned on me.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: All the men of my circle keep away from me; and those dear to me are turned against me.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: My bones are joined to my skin, and I have got away with my flesh in my teeth.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: Have pity on me, have pity on me, O my friends! for the hand of God is on me.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: Why are you cruel to me, like God, for ever saying evil against me?

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: If only my words might be recorded! if they might be put in writing in a book!

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: And with an iron pen and lead be cut into the rock for ever!

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: But I am certain that he who will take up my cause is living, and that in time to come he will take his place on the dust;

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 26
text: And ... without my flesh I will see God;

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 27
text: Whom I will see on my side, and not as one strange to me. My heart is broken with desire.

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 28
text: If you say, How cruel we will be to him! because the root of sin is clearly in him:

title: Job Chapter 19 Verse 29
text: Be in fear of the sword, for the sword is the punishment for such things, so that you may be certain that there is a judge.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: Then Zophar the Naamathite made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: For this cause my thoughts are troubling me and driving me on.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: I have to give ear to arguments which put me to shame, and your answers to me are wind without wisdom.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: Have you knowledge of this from early times, when man was placed on the earth,

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: That the pride of the sinner is short, and the joy of the evil-doer but for a minute?

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: Though he is lifted up to the heavens, and his head goes up to the clouds;

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: Like the waste from his body he comes to an end for ever: those who have seen him say, Where is he?

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: He is gone like a dream, and is not seen again; he goes in flight like a vision of the night.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: The eye which saw him sees him no longer; and his place has no more knowledge of him.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: His children are hoping that the poor will be kind to them, and his hands give back his wealth.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: His bones are full of young strength, but it will go down with him into the dust.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: Though evil-doing is sweet in his mouth, and he keeps it secretly under his tongue;

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: Though he takes care of it, and does not let it go, but keeps it still in his mouth;

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: His food becomes bitter in his stomach; the poison of snakes is inside him.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: He takes down wealth as food, and sends it up again; it is forced out of his stomach by God.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: He takes the poison of snakes into his mouth, the tongue of the snake is the cause of his death.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: Let him not see the rivers of oil, the streams of honey and milk.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: He is forced to give back the fruit of his work, and may not take it for food; he has no joy in the profit of his trading.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: Because he has been cruel to the poor, turning away from them in their trouble; because he has taken a house by force which he did not put up;

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: There is no peace for him in his wealth, and no salvation for him in those things in which he took delight.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: He had never enough for his desire; for this cause his well-being will quickly come to an end.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: Even when his wealth is great, he is full of care, for the hand of everyone who is in trouble is turned against him.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: God gives him his desire, and sends the heat of his wrath on him, making it come down on him like rain.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: He may go in flight from the iron spear, but the arrow from the bow of brass will go through him;

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: He is pulling it out, and it comes out of his back; and its shining point comes out of his side; he is overcome by fears.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: All his wealth is stored up for the dark: a fire not made by man sends destruction on him, and on everything in his tent.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 27
text: The heavens make clear his sin, and the earth gives witness against him.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 28
text: The produce of his house is taken away into another country, like things given into the hands of others in the day of wrath.

title: Job Chapter 20 Verse 29
text: This is the reward of the evil man, and the heritage given to him by God.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: Then Job made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: Give attention with care to my words; and let this be your comfort.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: Let me say what is in my mind, and after that, go on making sport of me.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: As for me, is my outcry against man? is it then to be wondered at if my spirit is troubled?

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: Take note of me and be full of wonder, put your hand on your mouth.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: At the very thought of it my flesh is shaking with fear.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: Why is life given to the evil-doers? why do they become old and strong in power?

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: Their children are ever with them, and their offspring before their eyes.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: Their houses are free from fear, and the rod of God does not come on them.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: Their ox is ready at all times to give seed; their cow gives birth, without dropping her young.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: They send out their young ones like a flock, and their children have pleasure in the dance,

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: They make songs to the instruments of music, and are glad at the sound of the pipe.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: Their days come to an end without trouble, and suddenly they go down to the underworld.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: Though they said to God, Go away from us, for we have no desire for the knowledge of your ways.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: What is the Ruler of all, that we may give him worship? and what profit is it to us to make prayer to him?

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: Truly, is not their well-being in their power? (The purpose of the evil-doers is far from me.)

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: How frequently is the light of the evil-doers put out, or does trouble come on them? how frequently does his wrath take them with cords?

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: How frequently are they as dry stems before the wind, or as grass taken away by the storm-wind?

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: You say, God keeps punishment stored up for his children. Let him send it on the man himself, so that he may have the punishment of it!

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: Let his eyes see his trouble, and let him be full of the wrath of the Ruler of all!

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: For what interest has he in his house after him, when the number of his months is ended?

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: Is anyone able to give teaching to God? for he is the judge of those who are on high.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: One comes to his end in complete well-being, full of peace and quiet:

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: His buckets are full of milk, and there is no loss of strength in his bones.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: And another comes to his end with a bitter soul, without ever tasting good.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 26
text: Together they go down to the dust, and are covered by the worm.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 27
text: See, I am conscious of your thoughts, and of your violent purposes against me;

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 28
text: For you say, Where is the house of the ruler, and where is the tent of the evil-doer?

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 29
text: Have you not put the question to the travellers, and do you not take note of their experience?

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 30
text: How the evil man goes free in the day of trouble, and has salvation in the day of wrath?

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 31
text: Who will make his way clear to his face? and if he has done a thing, who gives him punishment for it?

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 32
text: He is taken to his last resting-place, and keeps watch over it.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 33
text: The earth of the valley covering his bones is sweet to him, and all men come after him, as there were unnumbered before him.

title: Job Chapter 21 Verse 34
text: Why then do you give me comfort with words in which there is no profit, when you see that there is nothing in your answers but deceit?

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: Is it possible for a man to be of profit to God? No, for a man's wisdom is only of profit to himself.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: Is it of any interest to the Ruler of all that you are upright? or is it of use to him that your ways are without sin?

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: Is it because you give him honour that he is sending punishment on you and is judging you?

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: Is not your evil-doing great? and there is no end to your sins.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: For you have taken your brother's goods when he was not in your debt, and have taken away the clothing of those who have need of it.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: You do not give water to the tired traveller, and from him who has no food you keep back bread.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: For it was the man with power who had the land, and the man with an honoured name who was living in it.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: You have sent widows away without hearing their cause, and you have taken away the support of the child who has no father.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: For this cause nets are round your feet, and you are overcome with sudden fear.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: Your light is made dark so that you are unable to see, and you are covered by a mass of waters.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: Is not God as high as heaven? and see the stars, how high they are!

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: And you say, What knowledge has God? is he able to give decisions through the deep dark?

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: Thick clouds are covering him, so that he is unable to see; and he is walking on the arch of heaven.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: Will you keep the old way by which evil men went?

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: Who were violently taken away before their time, who were overcome by the rush of waters:

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: Who said to God, Go away from us; and, What is the Ruler of all able to do to us?

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: Though he made their houses full of good things: but the purpose of the evil-doers is far from me!

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: The upright saw it and were glad: and those who had done no wrong made sport of them,

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: Saying, Truly, their substance is cut off, and their wealth is food for the fire.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: Put yourself now in a right relation with him and be at peace: so will you do well in your undertakings.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: Be pleased to take teaching from his mouth, and let his words be stored up in your heart.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: If you come back to the Ruler of all, making yourself low before him; if you put evil far away from your tents;

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: And put your gold in the dust, even your gold of Ophir among the rocks of the valleys;

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: Then the Ruler of all will be your gold, and his teaching will be your silver;

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: For then you will have delight in the Ruler of all, and your face will be lifted up to God.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: You will make your prayer to him, and be answered; and you will give effect to your oaths.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: Your purposes will come about, and light will be shining on your ways.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: For God makes low those whose hearts are lifted up, but he is a saviour to the poor in spirit.

title: Job Chapter 22 Verse 30
text: He makes safe the man who is free from sin, and if your hands are clean, salvation will be yours.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: And Job made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: Even today my outcry is bitter; his hand is hard on my sorrow.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: If only I had knowledge of where he might be seen, so that I might come even to his seat!

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: I would put my cause in order before him, and my mouth would be full of arguments.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: I would see what his answers would be, and have knowledge of what he would say to me.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: Would he make use of his great power to overcome me? No, but he would give attention to me.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: There an upright man might put his cause before him; and I would be free for ever from my judge.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: See, I go forward, but he is not there; and back, but I do not see him;

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: I am looking for him on the left hand, but there is no sign of him; and turning to the right, I am not able to see him.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: For he has knowledge of the way I take; after I have been tested I will come out like gold.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: My feet have gone in his steps; I have kept in his way, without turning to one side or to the other.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: I have never gone against the orders of his lips; the words of his mouth have been stored up in my heart.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: But his purpose is fixed and there is no changing it; and he gives effect to the desire of his soul.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: For what has been ordered for me by him will be gone through to the end: and his mind is full of such designs.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: For this cause I am in fear before him, my thoughts of him overcome me.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: For God has made my heart feeble, and my mind is troubled before the Ruler of all.

title: Job Chapter 23 Verse 17
text: For I am overcome by the dark, and by the black night which is covering my face.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: Why are times not stored up by the Ruler of all, and why do those who have knowledge of him not see his days?

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: The landmarks are changed by evil men, they violently take away flocks, together with their keepers.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: They send away the ass of him who has no father, they take the widow's ox for debt.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: The crushed are turned out of the way; all the poor of the earth go into a secret place together.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: Like asses in the waste land they go out to their work, looking for food with care; from the waste land they get bread for their children.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: They get mixed grain from the field, and they take away the late fruit from the vines of those who have wealth.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: They take their rest at night without clothing, and have no cover in the cold.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: They are wet with the rain of the mountains, and get into the cracks of the rock for cover.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: The child without a father is forced from its mother's breast, and they take the young children of the poor for debt.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: Others go about without clothing, and though they have no food, they get in the grain from the fields.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: Between the lines of olive-trees they make oil; though they have no drink, they are crushing out the grapes.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: From the town come sounds of pain from those who are near death, and the soul of the wounded is crying out for help; but God does not take note of their prayer.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: Then there are those who are haters of the light, who have no knowledge of its ways, and do not go in them.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: He who is purposing death gets up before day, so that he may put to death the poor and those in need.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: And the man whose desire is for the wife of another is waiting for the evening, saying, No eye will see me; and he puts a cover on his face. And in the night the thief goes about;

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: In the dark he makes holes in the walls of houses: in the daytime they are shutting themselves up, they have no knowledge of the light.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: For the middle of the night is as morning to them, they are not troubled by the fear of the dark.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: They go quickly on the face of the waters; their heritage is cursed in the earth; the steps of the crusher of grapes are not turned to their vine-garden.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: Snow waters become dry with the heat: so do sinners go down into the underworld.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: The public place of his town has no more knowledge of him, and his name has gone from the memory of men: he is rooted up like a dead tree.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 21
text: He is not kind to the widow, and he has no pity for her child.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 22
text: But God by his power gives long life to the strong; he gets up again, though he has no hope of life.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 23
text: He takes away his fear of danger and gives him support; and his eyes are on his ways.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 24
text: For a short time they are lifted up; then they are gone; they are made low, they are pulled off like fruit, and like the heads of grain they are cut off.

title: Job Chapter 24 Verse 25
text: And if it is not so, now, who will make it clear that my words are false, and that what I say is of no value?

title: Job Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: Then Bildad the Shuhite made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: Rule and power are his; he makes peace in his high places.

title: Job Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: Is it possible for his armies to be numbered? and on whom is not his light shining?

title: Job Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: How then is it possible for man to be upright before God? or how may he be clean who is a son of woman?

title: Job Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: See, even the moon is not bright, and the stars are not clean in his eyes:

title: Job Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: How much less man who is an insect, and the son of man who is a worm!

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: Then Job made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: How have you given help to him who has no power! how have you been the salvation of the arm which has no strength!

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: How have you given teaching to him who has no wisdom, and fully made clear true knowledge!

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: To whom have your words been said? and whose spirit came out from you?

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: The shades in the underworld are shaking; the waters and those living in them.

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: The underworld is uncovered before him, and Destruction has no veil.

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: By his hand the north is stretched out in space, and the earth is hanging on nothing.

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: By him the waters are shut up in his thick clouds, and the cloud does not give way under them.

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: By him the face of his high seat is veiled, and his cloud stretched out over it.

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: By him a circle is marked out on the face of the waters, to the limits of the light and the dark.

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: The pillars of heaven are shaking, and are overcome by his sharp words.

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: By his power the sea was made quiet; and by his wisdom Rahab was wounded.

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 13
text: By his wind the heavens become bright: by his hand the quickly moving snake was cut through.

title: Job Chapter 26 Verse 14
text: See, these are only the outskirts of his ways; and how small is that which comes to our ears about him! But the thunder of his acts of power is outside all knowledge.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: And Job again took up the word and said,

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: By the life of God, who has taken away my right; and of the Ruler of all, who has made my soul bitter;

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: (For all my breath is still in me, and the spirit of God is my life;)

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 4
text: Truly, there is no deceit in my lips, and my tongue does not say what is false.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 5
text: Let it be far from me! I will certainly not say that you are right! I will come to death before I give up my righteousness.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 6
text: I will keep it safe, and will not let it go: my heart has nothing to say against any part of my life.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 7
text: Let my hater be like the evil man, and let him who comes against me be as the sinner.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 8
text: For what is the hope of the sinner when he is cut off, when God takes back his soul?

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 9
text: Will his cry come to the ears of God when he is in trouble?

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 10
text: Will he take delight in the Ruler of all, and make his prayer to God at all times?

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 11
text: I will give you teaching about the hand of God; I will not keep secret from you what is in the mind of the Ruler of all.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 12
text: Truly, you have all seen it yourselves; why then have you become completely foolish?

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 13
text: This is the punishment of the evil-doer from God, and the heritage given to the cruel by the Ruler of all.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 14
text: If his children are increased, it is for the sword; and his offspring have not enough bread.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 15
text: When those of his house who are still living come to their end by disease, they are not put into the earth, and their widows are not weeping for them.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 16
text: Though he may get silver together like dust, and make ready great stores of clothing;

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 17
text: He may get them ready, but the upright will put them on, and he who is free from sin will take the silver for a heritage.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 18
text: His house has no more strength than a spider's thread, or a watchman's tent.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 19
text: He goes to rest full of wealth, but does so for the last time: on opening his eyes, he sees it there no longer.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 20
text: Fears overtake him like rushing waters; in the night the storm-wind takes him away.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 21
text: The east wind takes him up and he is gone; he is forced violently out of his place.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 22
text: God sends his arrows against him without mercy; he goes in flight before his hand.

title: Job Chapter 27 Verse 23
text: Men make signs of joy because of him, driving him from his place with sounds of hissing.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 1
text: Truly there is a mine for silver, and a place where gold is washed out.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 2
text: Iron is taken out of the earth, and stone is changed into brass by the fire.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 3
text: Man puts an end to the dark, searching out to the farthest limit the stones of the deep places of the dark.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 4
text: He makes a deep mine far away from those living in the light of day; when they go about on the earth, they have no knowledge of those who are under them, who are hanging far from men, twisting from side to side on a cord.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 5
text: As for the earth, bread comes out of it; but under its face it is turned up as if by fire.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 6
text: Its stones are the place of sapphires, and it has dust of gold.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 7
text: No bird has knowledge of it, and the hawk's eye has never seen it.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 8
text: The great beasts have not gone over it, and the cruel lion has not taken that way.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 9
text: Man puts out his hand on the hard rock, overturning mountains by the roots.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 10
text: He makes deep ways, cut through the rock, and his eye sees everything of value.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 11
text: He keeps back the streams from flowing, and makes the secret things come out into the light.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 12
text: But where may wisdom be seen? and where is the resting-place of knowledge?

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 13
text: Man has not seen the way to it, and it is not in the land of the living.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 14
text: The deep waters say, It is not in me: and the sea says, It is not with me.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 15
text: Gold may not be given for it, or a weight of silver in payment for it.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 16
text: It may not be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the onyx of great price, or the sapphire.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 17
text: Gold and glass are not equal to it in price, and it may not be exchanged for jewels of the best gold.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 18
text: There is no need to say anything about coral or crystal; and the value of wisdom is greater than that of pearls.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 19
text: The topaz of Ethiopia is not equal to it, and it may not be valued with the best gold.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 20
text: From where then does wisdom come, and where is the resting-place of knowledge?

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 21
text: For it is kept secret from the eyes of all living, unseen by the birds of the air.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 22
text: Destruction and Death say, We have only had word of it with our ears.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 23
text: God has knowledge of the way to it, and of its resting-place;

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 24
text: For his eyes go to the ends of the earth, and he sees everything under heaven.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 25
text: When he made a weight for the wind, measuring out the waters;

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 26
text: When he made a law for the rain, and a way for the thunder-flames;

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 27
text: Then he saw it, and put it on record; he gave it its fixed form, searching it out completely.

title: Job Chapter 28 Verse 28
text: And he said to man, Truly the fear of the Lord is wisdom, and to keep from evil is the way to knowledge.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 1
text: And Job again took up the word and said,

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 2
text: If only I might again be as I was in the months which are past, in the days when God was watching over me!

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 3
text: When his light was shining over my head, and when I went through the dark by his light.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 4
text: As I was in my flowering years, when my tent was covered by the hand of God;

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 5
text: While the Ruler of all was still with me, and my children were round me;

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 6
text: When my steps were washed with milk, and rivers of oil were flowing out of the rock for me.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 7
text: When I went out of my door to go up to the town, and took my seat in the public place,

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 8
text: The young men saw me, and went away, and the old men got up from their seats;

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 9
text: The rulers kept quiet, and put their hands on their mouths;

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 10
text: The chiefs kept back their words, and their tongues were joined to the roofs of their mouths.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 11
text: For when it came to their ears, men said that I was truly happy; and when their eyes saw, they gave witness to me;

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 12
text: For I was a saviour to the poor when he was crying for help, to the child with no father, and to him who had no supporter.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 13
text: The blessing of him who was near to destruction came on me, and I put a song of joy into the widow's heart.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 14
text: I put on righteousness as my clothing, and was full of it; right decisions were to me a robe and a head-dress.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 15
text: I was eyes to the blind, and feet to him who had no power of walking.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 16
text: I was a father to the poor, searching out the cause of him who was strange to me.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 17
text: By me the great teeth of the evil-doer were broken, and I made him give up what he had violently taken away.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 18
