text: Then I said, I will come to my end with my children round me, my days will be as the sand in number;

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 19
text: My root will be open to the waters, and the night mist will be on my branches,

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 20
text: My glory will be ever new, and my bow will be readily bent in my hand.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 21
text: Men gave ear to me, waiting and keeping quiet for my suggestions.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 22
text: After I had said what was in my mind, they were quiet and let my words go deep into their hearts;

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 23
text: They were waiting for me as for the rain, opening their mouths wide as for the spring rains.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 24
text: I was laughing at them when they had no hope, and the light of my face was never clouded by their fear.

title: Job Chapter 29 Verse 25
text: I took my place as a chief, guiding them on their way, and I was as a king among his army. ...

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 1
text: But now those who are younger than I make sport of me; those whose fathers I would not have put with the dogs of my flocks.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 2
text: Of what use is the strength of their hands to me? all force is gone from them.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 3
text: They are wasted for need of food, biting the dry earth; their only hope of life is in the waste land.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 4
text: They are pulling off the salt leaves from the brushwood, and making a meal of roots.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 5
text: They are sent out from among their townsmen, men are crying after them as thieves

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 6
text: They have to get a resting-place in the hollows of the valleys, in holes of the earth and rocks.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 7
text: They make noises like asses among the brushwood; they get together under the thorns.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 8
text: They are sons of shame, and of men without a name, who have been forced out of the land.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 9
text: And now I have become their song, and I am a word of shame to them.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 10
text: I am disgusting to them; they keep away from me, and put marks of shame on me.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 11
text: For he has made loose the cord of my bow, and put me to shame; he has sent down my flag to the earth before me.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 12
text: The lines of his men of war put themselves in order, and make high their ways of destruction against me:

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 13
text: They have made waste my roads, with a view to my destruction; his bowmen come round about me;

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 14
text: As through a wide broken place in the wall they come on, I am overturned by the shock of their attack.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 15
text: Fears have come on me; my hope is gone like the wind, and my well-being like a cloud.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 16
text: But now my soul is turned to water in me, days of trouble overtake me:

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 17
text: The flesh is gone from my bones, and they give me no rest; there is no end to my pains.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 18
text: With great force he takes a grip of my clothing, pulling me by the neck of my coat.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 19
text: Truly God has made me low, even to the earth, and I have become like dust.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 20
text: You give no answer to my cry, and take no note of my prayer.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 21
text: You have become cruel to me; the strength of your hand is hard on me.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 22
text: Lifting me up, you make me go on the wings of the wind; I am broken up by the storm.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 23
text: For I am certain that you will send me back to death, and to the meeting-place ordered for all living.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 24
text: Has not my hand been stretched out in help to the poor? have I not been a saviour to him in his trouble?

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 25
text: Have I not been weeping for the crushed? and was not my soul sad for him who was in need?

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 26
text: For I was looking for good, and evil came; I was waiting for light, and it became dark.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 27
text: My feelings are strongly moved, and give me no rest; days of trouble have overtaken me.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 28
text: I go about in dark clothing, uncomforted; I get up in the public place, crying out for help.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 29
text: I have become a brother to the jackals, and go about in the company of ostriches.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 30
text: My skin is black and dropping off me; and my bones are burning with the heat of my disease.

title: Job Chapter 30 Verse 31
text: And my music has been turned to sorrow, and the sound of my pipe into the noise of weeping.

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 1
text: I made an agreement with my eyes; how then might my eyes be looking on a virgin?

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 2
text: For what is God's reward from on high, or the heritage given by the Ruler of all from heaven?

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 3
text: Is it not trouble for the sinner, and destruction for the evil-doers?

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 4
text: Does he not see my ways, and are not my steps all numbered?

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 5
text: If I have gone in false ways, or my foot has been quick in working deceit;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 6
text: (Let me be measured in upright scales, and let God see my righteousness:)

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 7
text: If my steps have been turned out of the way, or if my heart went after my eyes, or if the property of another is in my hands;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 8
text: Let me put seed in the earth for another to have the fruit of it, and let my produce be uprooted.

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 9
text: If my heart went after another man's wife, or if I was waiting secretly at my neighbour's door;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 10
text: Then let my wife give pleasure to another man and let others make use of her body.

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 11
text: For that would be a crime; it would be an act for which punishment would be measured out by the judges:

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 12
text: It would be a fire burning even to destruction, and taking away all my produce.

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 13
text: If I did wrong in the cause of my man-servant, or my woman-servant, when they went to law with me;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 14
text: What then will I do when God comes as my judge? and what answer may I give to his questions?

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 15
text: Did not God make him as well as me? did he not give us life in our mothers' bodies?

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 16
text: If I kept back the desire of the poor; if the widow's eye was looking for help to no purpose;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 17
text: If I kept my food for myself, and did not give some of it to the child with no father;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 18
text: (For I was cared for by God as by a father from my earliest days; he was my guide from the body of my mother;)

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 19
text: If I saw one near to death for need of clothing, and that the poor had nothing covering him;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 20
text: If his back did not give me a blessing, and the wool of my sheep did not make him warm;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 21
text: If my hand had been lifted up against him who had done no wrong, when I saw that I was supported by the judges;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 22
text: May my arm be pulled from my body, and be broken from its base.

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 23
text: For the fear of God kept me back, and because of his power I might not do such things.

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 24
text: If I made gold my hope, or if I ever said to the best gold, I have put my faith in you;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 25
text: If I was glad because my wealth was great, and because my hand had got together a great store;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 26
text: If, when I saw the sun shining, and the moon moving on its bright way,

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 27
text: A secret feeling of worship came into my heart, and my hand gave kisses from my mouth;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 28
text: That would have been another sin to be rewarded with punishment by the judges; for I would have been false to God on high.

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 29
text: If I was glad at the trouble of my hater, and gave cries of joy when evil overtook him;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 30
text: (For I did not let my mouth give way to sin, in putting a curse on his life;)

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 31
text: If the men of my tent did not say, Who has not had full measure of his meat?

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 32
text: The traveller did not take his night's rest in the street, and my doors were open to anyone on a journey;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 33
text: If I kept my evil doings covered, and my sin in the secret of my breast,

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 34
text: For fear of the great body of people, or for fear that families might make sport of me, so that I kept quiet, and did not go out of my door;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 35
text: If only God would give ear to me, and the Ruler of all would give me an answer! or if what he has against me had been put in writing!

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 36
text: Truly I would take up the book in my hands; it would be to me as a crown;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 37
text: I would make clear the number of my steps, I would put it before him like a prince! The words of Job are ended.

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 38
text: If my land has made an outcry against me, or the ploughed earth has been in sorrow;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 39
text: If I have taken its produce without payment, causing the death of its owners;

title: Job Chapter 31 Verse 40
text: Then in place of grain let thorns come up, and in place of barley evil-smelling plants.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 1
text: So these three men gave no more answers to Job, because he seemed to himself to be right.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 2
text: And Elihu, the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, was angry, burning with wrath against Job, because he seemed to himself more right than God;

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 3
text: And he was angry with his three friends, because they had been unable to give him an answer, and had not made Job's sin clear.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 4
text: Now Elihu had kept quiet while Job was talking, because they were older than he;

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 5
text: And when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of the three men, he was very angry.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 6
text: And Elihu, the son of Barachel the Buzite, made answer and said, I am young, and you are very old, so I was in fear, and kept myself from putting my knowledge before you.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 7
text: I said to myself, It is right for the old to say what is in their minds, and for those who are far on in years to give out wisdom.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 8
text: But truly it is the spirit in man, even the breath of the Ruler of all, which gives them knowledge.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 9
text: It is not the old who are wise, and those who are full of years have not the knowledge of what is right.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 10
text: So I say, Give ear to me, and I will put forward my knowledge.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 11
text: I was waiting for your words, I was giving ear to your wise sayings; while you were searching out what to say,

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 12
text: I was taking note; and truly not one of you was able to make clear Job's error, or to give an answer to his words.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 13
text: Take care that you do not say, Wisdom is here; God may overcome him, but not man.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 14
text: I will not put forward words like these, or make use of your sayings in answer to him.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 15
text: Fear has overcome them, they have no more answers to give; they have come to an end of words.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 16
text: And am I to go on waiting while they have nothing to say? while they keep quiet and give no more answers?

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 17
text: I will give my answer; I will put forward my knowledge:

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 18
text: For I am full of words, I am unable to keep in my breath any longer:

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 19
text: My stomach is like wine which is unable to get out; like skins full of new wine, it is almost burst.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 20
text: Let me say what is in my mind, so that I may get comfort; let me give answer with open mouth.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 21
text: Let me not give respect to any man, or give names of honour to any living.

title: Job Chapter 32 Verse 22
text: For I am not able to give names of honour to any man; and if I did, my Maker would quickly take me away.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 1
text: And now, O Job, give ear to my words, and take note of all I say.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 2
text: See, now my mouth is open, my tongue gives out words.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 3
text: My heart is overflowing with knowledge, my lips say what is true.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 4
text: The spirit of God has made me, and the breath of the Ruler of all gives me life.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 5
text: If you are able, give me an answer; put your cause in order, and come forward.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 6
text: See, I am the same as you are in the eyes of God; I was cut off from the same bit of wet earth.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 7
text: Fear of me will not overcome you, and my hand will not be hard on you.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 8
text: But you said in my hearing, and your voice came to my ears:

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 9
text: I am clean, without sin; I am washed, and there is no evil in me:

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 10
text: See, he is looking for something against me; in his eyes I am as one of his haters;

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 11
text: He puts chains on my feet; he is watching all my ways.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 12
text: Truly, in saying this you are wrong; for God is greater than man.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 13
text: Why do you put forward your cause against him, saying, He gives no answer to any of my words?

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 14
text: For God gives his word in one way, even in two, and man is not conscious of it:

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 15
text: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep comes on men, while they take their rest on their beds;

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 16
text: Then he makes his secrets clear to men, so that they are full of fear at what they see;

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 17
text: In order that man may be turned from his evil works, and that pride may be taken away from him;

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 18
text: To keep back his soul from the underworld, and his life from destruction.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 19
text: Pain is sent on him as a punishment, while he is on his bed; there is no end to the trouble in his bones;

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 20
text: He has no desire for food, and his soul is turned away from delicate meat;

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 21
text: His flesh is so wasted away, that it may not be seen, and his bones. ...

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 22
text: And his soul comes near to the underworld, and his life to the angels of death.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 23
text: If now there may be an angel sent to him, one of the thousands which there are to be between him and God, and to make clear to man what is right for him;

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 24
text: And if he has mercy on him, and says, Let him not go down to the underworld, I have given the price for his life:

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 25
text: Then his flesh becomes young again, and he comes back to the days of his early strength;

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 26
text: He makes his prayer to God, and he has mercy on him; he sees God's face with cries of joy; he gives news of his righteousness to men;

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 27
text: He makes a song, saying, I did wrong, turning from the straight way, but he did not give me the reward of my sin.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 28
text: He kept my soul from the underworld, and my life sees the light in full measure.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 29
text: Truly, God does all these things to man, twice and three times,

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 30
text: Keeping back his soul from the underworld, so that he may see the light of life.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 31
text: Take note O Job, give ear to me; keep quiet, while I say what is in my mind.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 32
text: If you have anything to say, give me an answer; for it is my desire that you may be judged free from sin.

title: Job Chapter 33 Verse 33
text: If not, give attention to me, and keep quiet, and I will give you wisdom.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 1
text: And Elihu made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 2
text: Give ear, you wise, to my words; and you who have knowledge, give attention to me;

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 3
text: For words are tested by the ear, as food is tasted by the mouth.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 4
text: Let us make the decision for ourselves as to what is right; let us have the knowledge among ourselves of what is good.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 5
text: For Job has said, I am upright, and it is God who has taken away my right;

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 6
text: Though I am right, still I am in pain; my wound may not be made well, though I have done no wrong.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 7
text: What man is like Job, a man who freely makes sport of God,

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 8
text: And goes in the company of evil-doers, walking in the way of sinners?

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 9
text: For he has said, It is no profit to a man to take delight in God.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 10
text: Now then, you wise, take note; you men of knowledge, give ear to me. Let it be far from God to do evil, and from the Ruler of all to do wrong.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 11
text: For he gives to every man the reward of his work, and sees that he gets the fruit of his ways.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 12
text: Truly, God does not do evil, and the Ruler of all is not a false judge.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 13
text: Who put the earth into his care, or made him responsible for the world?

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 14
text: If he made his spirit come back to him, taking his breath into himself again,

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 15
text: All flesh would come to an end together, and man would go back to the dust.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 16
text: If you are wise, take note of this; give ear to the voice of my words.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 17
text: How may a hater of right be a ruler? and will you say that the upright Ruler of all is evil?

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 18
text: He who says to a king, You are an evil-doer; and to rulers, You are sinners;

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 19
text: Who has no respect for rulers, and who gives no more attention to those who have wealth than to the poor, for they are all the work of his hands.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 20
text: Suddenly they come to an end, even in the middle of the night: the blow comes on the men of wealth, and they are gone, and the strong are taken away without the hand of man.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 21
text: For his eyes are on the ways of a man, and he sees all his steps.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 22
text: There is no dark place, and no thick cloud, in which the workers of evil may take cover.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 23
text: For he does not give man a fixed time to come before him to be judged.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 24
text: He sends the strong to destruction without searching out their cause, and puts others in their place.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 25
text: For he has knowledge of their works, overturning them in the night, so that they are crushed.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 26
text: The evil-doers are broken by his wrath, he puts his hand on them with force before the eyes of all onlookers.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 27
text: Because they did not go after him, and took no note of his ways,

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 28
text: So that the cry of the poor might come up to him, and the prayer of those in need come to his ears.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 34
text: Men of knowledge, and all wise men, hearing me, will say,

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 35
text: Job's words do not come from knowledge; they are not the fruit of wisdom.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 36
text: May Job be tested to the end, because his answers have been like those of evil men.

title: Job Chapter 34 Verse 37
text: For in addition to his sin, he is uncontrolled in heart; before our eyes he makes sport of God, increasing his words against him.

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 1
text: And Elihu made answer and said,

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 2
text: Does it seem to you to be right, and righteousness before God, to say,

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 3
text: What profit is it to me, and how am I better off than if I had done wrong?

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 4
text: I will make answer to you and to your friends:

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 5
text: Let your eyes be turned to the heavens, and lifted up to see the skies; they are higher than you.

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 6
text: If you have done wrong, is he any the worse for it? and if your sins are great in number, what is it to him?

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 7
text: If you are upright, what do you give to him? or what does he take from your hand?

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 8
text: Your evil-doing may have an effect on a man like yourself, or your righteousness on a son of man.

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 9
text: Because the hand of the cruel is hard on them, men are making sounds of grief; they are crying out for help because of the arm of the strong.

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 10
text: But no one has said, Where is God my Maker, who gives songs in the night;

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 11
text: Who gives us more knowledge than the beasts of the earth, and makes us wiser than the birds of the heaven?

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 12
text: There they are crying out because of the pride of the evil-doers, but he gives them no answer.

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 13
text: But God will not give ear to what is false, or the Ruler of all take note of it;

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 14
text: How much less when you say that you do not see him; that the cause is before him, and you are waiting for him.

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 15
text: And now ... ;

title: Job Chapter 35 Verse 16
text: And Job's mouth is open wide to give out what is of no profit, increasing words without knowledge.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 1
text: And Elihu went on to say,

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 2
text: Give me a little more time, and I will make it clear to you; for I have still something to say for God.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 3
text: I will get my knowledge from far, and I will give righteousness to my Maker.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 4
text: For truly my words are not false; one who has all knowledge is talking with you.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 5
text: Truly, God gives up the hard-hearted, and will not give life to the sinner.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 6
text: His eyes are ever on the upright, and he gives to the crushed their right;

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 7
text: Lifting them up to the seat of kings, and making them safe for ever.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 8
text: And if they have been prisoned in chains, and taken in cords of trouble,

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 9
text: Then he makes clear to them what they have done, even their evil works in which they have taken pride.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 10
text: Their ear is open to his teaching, and he gives them orders so that their hearts may be turned from evil.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 11
text: If they give ear to his voice, and do his word, then he gives them long life, and years full of pleasure.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 12
text: But if not, they come to their end, and give up their breath without knowledge.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 13
text: Those who have no fear of God keep wrath stored up in their hearts; they give no cry for help when they are made prisoners.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 14
text: They come to their end while they are still young, their life is short like that of those who are used for sex purposes in the worship of their gods.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 15
text: He makes the wrong done to the poor the way of their salvation, opening their ears by their trouble.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 21
text: Take care not to be turned to sin, for you have taken evil for your part in place of sorrow.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 22
text: Truly God is lifted up in strength; who is a ruler like him?

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 23
text: Who ever gave orders to him, or said to him, You have done wrong?

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 24
text: See that you give praise to his work, about which men make songs.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 25
text: All people are looking on it; man sees it from far.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 26
text: Truly, God is great, greater than all our knowledge; the number of his years may not be searched out.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 27
text: For he takes up the drops from the sea; he sends them through his mist as rain,

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 28
text: Flowing down from the sky, and dropping on the peoples.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 29
text: And who has knowledge of how the clouds are stretched out, or of the thunders of his tent?

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 30
text: See, he is stretching out his mist, covering the tops of the mountains with it.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 31
text: For by these he gives food to the peoples, and bread in full measure.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 32
text: He takes the light in his hands, sending it against the mark.

title: Job Chapter 36 Verse 33
text: The thunder makes clear his passion, and the storm gives news of his wrath.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 1
text: At this my heart is shaking; it is moved out of its place.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 2
text: Give ear to the rolling noise of his voice; to the hollow sound which goes out of his mouth.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 3
text: He sends it out through all the heaven, and his thunder-flame to the ends of the earth.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 4
text: After it a voice is sounding, thundering out the word of his power; he does not keep back his thunder-flames; from his mouth his voice is sounding.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 5
text: He does wonders, more than may be searched out; great things of which we have no knowledge;

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 6
text: For he says to the snow, Make the earth wet; and to the rain-storm, Come down.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 7
text: He puts an end to the work of every man, so that all may see his work.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 8
text: Then the beasts go into their holes, and take their rest.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 9
text: Out of its place comes the storm-wind, and the cold out of its store-houses.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 10
text: By the breath of God ice is made, and the wide waters are shut in.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 11
text: The thick cloud is weighted with thunder-flame, and the cloud sends out its light;

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 12
text: And it goes this way and that, round about, turning itself by his guiding, to do whatever he gives orders to be done, on the face of his world of men,

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 13
text: For a rod, or for a curse, or for mercy, causing it to come on the mark.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 14
text: Give ear to this, O Job, and keep quiet in your place; and take note of the wonders worked by God.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 15
text: Have you knowledge of God's ordering of his works, how he makes the light of his cloud to be seen?

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 16
text: Have you knowledge of the balancings of the clouds, the wonders of him who has all wisdom?

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 17
text: You, whose clothing is warm, when the earth is quiet because of the south wind,

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 18
text: Will you, with him, make the skies smooth, and strong as a polished looking-glass?

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 19
text: Make clear to me what we are to say to him; we are unable to put our cause before him, because of the dark.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 20
text: How may he have knowledge of my desire for talk with him? or did any man ever say, May destruction come on me?

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 21
text: And now the light is not seen, for it is dark because of the clouds; but a wind comes, clearing them away.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 22
text: A bright light comes out of the north; God's glory is greatly to be feared.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 23
text: There is no searching out of the Ruler of all: his strength and his judging are great; he is full of righteousness, doing no wrong.

title: Job Chapter 37 Verse 24
text: For this cause men go in fear of him; he has no respect for any who are wise in heart.

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 1
text: And the Lord made answer to Job out of the storm-wind, and said,

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 2
text: Who is this who makes the purpose of God dark by words without knowledge?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 3
text: Get your strength together like a man of war; I will put questions to you, and you will give me the answers.

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 4
text: Where were you when I put the earth on its base? Say, if you have knowledge.

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 5
text: By whom were its measures fixed? Say, if you have wisdom; or by whom was the line stretched out over it?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 6
text: On what were its pillars based, or who put down its angle-stone,

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 7
text: When the morning stars made songs together, and all the sons of the gods gave cries of joy?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 8
text: Or where were you when the sea came to birth, pushing out from its secret place;

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 9
text: When I made the cloud its robe, and put thick clouds as bands round it,

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 10
text: Ordering a fixed limit for it, with locks and doors;

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 11
text: And said, So far you may come, and no farther; and here the pride of your waves will be stopped?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 12
text: Have you, from your earliest days, given orders to the morning, or made the dawn conscious of its place;

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 13
text: So that it might take a grip of the skirts of the earth, shaking all the evil-doers out of it?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 14
text: It is changed like wet earth under a stamp, and is coloured like a robe;

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 15
text: And from the evil-doers their light is kept back, and the arm of pride is broken.

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 16
text: Have you come into the springs of the sea, walking in the secret places of the deep?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 17
text: Have the doors of death been open to you, or have the door-keepers of the dark ever seen you?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 18
text: Have you taken note of the wide limits of the earth? Say, if you have knowledge of it all.

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 19
text: Which is the way to the resting-place of the light, and where is the store-house of the dark;

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 20
text: So that you might take it to its limit, guiding it to its house?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 21
text: No doubt you have knowledge of it, for then you had come to birth, and the number of your days is great.

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 22
text: Have you come into the secret place of snow, or have you seen the store-houses of the ice-drops,

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 23
text: Which I have kept for the time of trouble, for the day of war and fighting?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 24
text: Which is the way to the place where the wind is measured out, and the east wind sent out over the earth?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 25
text: By whom has the way been cut for the flowing of the rain, and the flaming of the thunder;

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 26
text: Causing rain to come on a land where no man is living, on the waste land which has no people;

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 27
text: To give water to the land where there is waste and destruction, and to make the dry land green with young grass?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 28
text: Has the rain a father? or who gave birth to the drops of night mist?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 29
text: Out of whose body came the ice? and who gave birth to the cold mist of heaven?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 30
text: The waters are joined together, hard as a stone, and the face of the deep is covered.

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 31
text: Are the bands of the Pleiades fixed by you, or are the cords of Orion made loose?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 32
text: Do you make Mazzaroth come out in its right time, or are the Bear and its children guided by you?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 33
text: Have you knowledge of the laws of the heavens? did you give them rule over the earth?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 34
text: Is your voice sent up to the cloud, so that you may be covered by the weight of waters?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 35
text: Do you send out the thunder-flames, so that they may go, and say to you, Here we are?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 36
text: Who has put wisdom in the high clouds, or given knowledge to the lights of the north?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 37
text: By whose wisdom are the clouds numbered, or the water-skins of the heavens turned to the earth,

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 38
text: When the earth becomes hard as metal, and is joined together in masses?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 39
text: Do you go after food for the she-lion, or get meat so that the young lions may have enough,

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 40
text: When they are stretched out in their holes, and are waiting in the brushwood?

title: Job Chapter 38 Verse 41
text: Who gives in the evening the meat he is searching for, when his young ones are crying to God; when the young lions with loud noise go wandering after their food?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 1
text: Have you knowledge of the rock-goats? or do you see the roes giving birth to their young?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 2
text: Is the number of their months fixed by you? or is the time when they give birth ordered by you?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 3
text: They are bent down, they give birth to their young, they let loose the fruit of their body.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 4
text: Their young ones are strong, living in the open country; they go out and do not come back again.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 5
text: Who has let the ass of the fields go free? or made loose the bands of the loud-voiced beast?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 6
text: To whom I have given the waste land for a heritage, and the salt land as a living-place.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 7
text: He makes sport of the noise of the town; the voice of the driver does not come to his ears;

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 8
text: He goes looking for his grass-lands in the mountains, searching out every green thing.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 9
text: Will the ox of the mountains be your servant? or is his night's resting-place by your food-store?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 10
text: Will he be pulling your plough with cords, turning up the valleys after you?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 11
text: Will you put your faith in him, because his strength is great? will you give the fruit of your work into his care?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 12
text: Will you be looking for him to come back, and get in your seed to the crushing-floor?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 13
text: Is the wing of the ostrich feeble, or is it because she has no feathers,

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 14
text: That she puts her eggs on the earth, warming them in the dust,

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 15
text: Without a thought that they may be crushed by the foot, and broken by the beasts of the field?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 16
text: She is cruel to her young ones, as if they were not hers; her work is to no purpose; she has no fear.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 17
text: For God has taken wisdom from her mind, and given her no measure of knowledge.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 18
text: When she is shaking her wings on high, she makes sport of the horse and of him who is seated on him.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 19
text: Do you give strength to the horse? is it by your hand that his neck is clothed with power?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 20
text: Is it through you that he is shaking like a locust, in the pride of his loud-sounding breath?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 21
text: He is stamping with joy in the valley; he makes sport of fear.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 22
text: In his strength he goes out against the arms of war, turning not away from the sword.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 23
text: The bow is sounding against him; he sees the shining point of spear and arrow.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 24
text: Shaking with passion, he is biting the earth; he is not able to keep quiet at the sound of the horn;

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 25
text: When it comes to his ears he says, Aha! He is smelling the fight from far off, and hearing the thunder of the captains, and the war-cries.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 26
text: Is it through your knowledge that the hawk takes his flight, stretching out his wings to the south?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 27
text: Or is it by your orders that the eagle goes up, and makes his resting-place on high?

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 28
text: On the rock is his house, and on the mountain-top his strong place.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 29
text: From there he is watching for food; his eye sees it far off.

title: Job Chapter 39 Verse 30
text: His young have blood for their drink, and where the dead bodies are, there is he to be seen.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 2
text: Will he who is protesting give teaching to the Ruler of all? Let him who has arguments to put forward against God give an answer.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 3
text: And Job said in answer to the Lord,

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 4
text: Truly, I am of no value; what answer may I give to you? I will put my hand on my mouth.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 5
text: I have said once, and even twice, what was in my mind, but I will not do so again.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 6
text: Then the Lord made answer to Job out of the storm-wind, and said,

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 7
text: Get your strength together like a man of war: I will put questions to you, and you will give me the answers.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 8
text: Will you even make my right of no value? will you say that I am wrong in order to make clear that you are right?

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 9
text: Have you an arm like God? have you a voice of thunder like his?

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 10
text: Put on the ornaments of your pride; be clothed with glory and power:

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 11
text: Let your wrath be overflowing; let your eyes see all the sons of pride, and make them low.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 12
text: Send destruction on all who are lifted up, pulling down the sinners from their places.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 13
text: Let them be covered together in the dust; let their faces be dark in the secret place of the underworld.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 14
text: Then I will give praise to you, saying that your right hand is able to give you salvation.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 15
text: See now the Great Beast, whom I made, even as I made you; he takes grass for food, like the ox.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 16
text: His strength is in his body, and his force in the muscles of his stomach.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 17
text: His tail is curving like a cedar; the muscles of his legs are joined together.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 18
text: His bones are pipes of brass, his legs are like rods of iron.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 19
text: He is the chief of the ways of God, made by him for his pleasure.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 20
text: He takes the produce of the mountains, where all the beasts of the field are at play.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 21
text: He takes his rest under the trees of the river, and in the pool, under the shade of the water-plants.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 22
text: He is covered by the branches of the trees; the grasses of the stream are round him.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 23
text: Truly, if the river is overflowing, it gives him no cause for fear; he has no sense of danger, even if Jordan is rushing against his mouth.

title: Job Chapter 40 Verse 24
text: Will anyone take him when he is on the watch, or put metal teeth through his nose?

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 1
text: Is it possible for Leviathan to be pulled out with a fish-hook, or for a hook to be put through the bone of his mouth?

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 2
text: Will you put a cord into his nose, or take him away with a cord round his tongue?

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 3
text: Will he make prayers to you, or say soft words to you?

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 4
text: Will he make an agreement with you, so that you may take him as a servant for ever?

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 5
text: Will you make sport with him, as with a bird? or put him in chains for your young women?

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 6
text: Will the fishermen make profit out of him? will they have him cut up for the traders?

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 7
text: Will you put sharp-pointed irons into his skin, or fish-spears into his head?

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 8
text: Only put your hand on him, and see what a fight you will have; you will not do it again!

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 9
text: Truly, the hope of his attacker is false; he is overcome even on seeing him!

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 10
text: He is so cruel that no one is ready to go against him. Who then is able to keep his place before me?

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 11
text: Who ever went against me, and got the better of me? There is no one under heaven!

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 12
text: I will not keep quiet about the parts of his body, or about his power, and the strength of his frame.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 13
text: Who has ever taken off his outer skin? who may come inside his inner coat of iron?

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 14
text: Who has made open the doors of his face? Fear is round about his teeth.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 15
text: His back is made of lines of plates, joined tight together, one against the other, like a stamp.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 16
text: One is so near to the other that no air may come between them.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 17
text: They take a grip of one another; they are joined together, so that they may not be parted.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 18
text: His sneezings give out flames, and his eyes are like the eyes of the dawn.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 19
text: Out of his mouth go burning lights, and flames of fire are jumping up.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 20
text: Smoke comes out of his nose, like a pot boiling on the fire.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 21
text: His breath puts fire to coals, and a flame goes out of his mouth.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 22
text: Strength is in his neck, and fear goes dancing before him.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 23
text: The plates of his flesh are joined together, fixed, and not to be moved.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 24
text: His heart is as strong as a stone, hard as the lower crushing-stone.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 25
text: When he gets ready for the fight, the strong are overcome with fear.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 26
text: The sword may come near him but is not able to go through him; the spear, or the arrow, or the sharp-pointed iron.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 27
text: Iron is to him as dry grass, and brass as soft wood.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 28
text: The arrow is not able to put him to flight: stones are no more to him than dry stems.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 29
text: A thick stick is no better than a leaf of grass, and he makes sport of the onrush of the spear.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 30
text: Under him are sharp edges of broken pots: as if he was pulling a grain-crushing instrument over the wet earth.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 31
text: The deep is boiling like a pot of spices, and the sea like a perfume-vessel.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 32
text: After him his way is shining, so that the deep seems white.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 33
text: On earth there is not another like him, who is made without fear.

title: Job Chapter 41 Verse 34
text: Everything which is high goes in fear of him; he is king over all the sons of pride.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 1
text: And Job said in answer to the Lord,

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 2
text: I see that you are able to do every thing, and to give effect to all your designs.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 3
text: Who is this who makes dark the purpose of God by words without knowledge? For I have been talking without knowledge about wonders not to be searched out.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 4
text: Give ear to me, and I will say what is in my mind; I will put questions to you, and you will give me the answers.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 5
text: Word of you had come to my ears, but now my eye has seen you.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 6
text: For this cause I give witness that what I said is false, and in sorrow I take my seat in the dust.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 7
text: And it came about, after he had said these words to Job, that the Lord said to Eliphaz the Temanite, I am very angry with you and your two friends, because you have not said what is right about me, as my servant Job has.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 8
text: And now, take seven oxen and seven sheep, and go to my servant Job, and give a burned offering for yourselves, and my servant Job will make prayer for you, that I may not send punishment on you; because you have not said what is right about me, as my servant Job has.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 9
text: And Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite, went and did as the Lord had said. And the Lord gave ear to Job.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 10
text: And the Lord made up to Job for all his losses, after he had made prayer for his friends: and all Job had before was increased by the Lord twice as much.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 11
text: And all his brothers and sisters, and his friends of earlier days, came and took food with him in his house; and made clear their grief for him, and gave him comfort for all the evil which the Lord had sent on him; and they all gave him a bit of money and a gold ring.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 12
text: And the Lord's blessing was greater on the end of Job's life than on its start: and so he came to have fourteen thousand sheep and goats, and six thousand camels, and two thousand oxen, and a thousand she-asses.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 13
text: And he had seven sons and three daughters.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 14
text: And he gave the first the name of Jemimah, the second Keziah, and the third Keren-happuch;

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 15
text: And there were no women so beautiful as the daughters of Job in all the earth: and their father gave them a heritage among their brothers.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 16
text: And after this Job had a hundred and forty years of life, and saw his sons, and his sons' sons, even four generations.

title: Job Chapter 42 Verse 17
text: And Job came to his end, old and full of days.

title: Psalms Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Happy is the man who does not go in the company of sinners, or take his place in the way of evil-doers, or in the seat of those who do not give honour to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: But whose delight is in the law of the Lord, and whose mind is on his law day and night.

title: Psalms Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: He will be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, which gives its fruit at the right time, whose leaves will ever be green; and he will do well in all his undertakings.

title: Psalms Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: The evil-doers are not so; but are like the dust from the grain, which the wind takes away.

title: Psalms Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: For this cause there will be no mercy for sinners when they are judged, and the evil-doers will have no place among the upright,

title: Psalms Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: Because the Lord sees the way of the upright, but the end of the sinner is destruction.

title: Psalms Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: Why are the nations so violently moved, and why are the thoughts of the people so foolish?

title: Psalms Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: The kings of the earth have taken their place, and the rulers are fixed in their purpose, against the Lord, and against the king of his selection, saying,

title: Psalms Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: Let their chains be broken, and their cords taken from off us.

title: Psalms Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: Then he whose seat is in the heavens will be laughing: the Lord will make sport of them.

title: Psalms Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Then will his angry words come to their ears, and by his wrath they will be troubled:

title: Psalms Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: But I have put my king on my holy hill of Zion.

title: Psalms Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: I will make clear the Lord's decision: he has said to me, You are my son, this day have I given you being.

title: Psalms Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: Make your request to me, and I will give you the nations for your heritage, and the farthest limits of the earth will be under your hand.

title: Psalms Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: They will be ruled by you with a rod of iron; they will be broken like a potter's vessel.

title: Psalms Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: So now be wise, you kings: take his teaching, you judges of the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: Give worship to the Lord with fear, kissing his feet and giving him honour,

title: Psalms Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: For fear that he may be angry, causing destruction to come on you, because he is quickly moved to wrath. Happy are all those who put their faith in him.

title: Psalms Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. Of David. When he went in flight from Absalom his son. - Lord, how greatly are they increased who make attacks on me! in great numbers they come against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: Unnumbered are those who say of my soul, There is no help for him in God. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: But your strength, O Lord, is round me, you are my glory and the lifter up of my head.

title: Psalms Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: I send up a cry to the Lord with my voice, and he gives me an answer from his holy hill. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: I took my rest in sleep, and then again I was awake; for the Lord was my support.

title: Psalms Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: I will have no fear, though ten thousand have come round me, putting themselves against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: Come to me, Lord; keep me safe, O my God; for you have given all my haters blows on their face-bones; the teeth of the evil-doers have been broken by you.

title: Psalms Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Salvation comes from the Lord; your blessing is on your people. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker on corded instruments. A Psalm. Of David. - Give answer to my cry, O God of my righteousness; make me free from my troubles; have mercy on me, and give ear to my prayer.

title: Psalms Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: O you sons of men, how long will you go on turning my glory into shame? how long will you give your love to foolish things, going after what is false? (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: See how the Lord has made great his mercy for me; the Lord will give ear to my cry.

title: Psalms Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Let there be fear in your hearts, and do no sin; have bitter feelings on your bed, but make no sound. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Give the offerings of righteousness, and put your faith in the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: There are numbers who say, Who will do us any good? the light of his face has gone from us.

title: Psalms Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: Lord, you have put joy in my heart, more than they have when their grain and their wine are increased.

title: Psalms Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: I will take my rest on my bed in peace, because you only, Lord, keep me safe.

title: Psalms Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker on wind instruments. A Psalm. Of David. - Give ear to my words, O Lord; give thought to my heart-searchings.

title: Psalms Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: Let the voice of my cry come to you, my King and my God; for to you will I make my prayer.

title: Psalms Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: My voice will come to you in the morning, O Lord; in the morning will I send my prayer to you, and keep watch.

title: Psalms Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: For you are not a God who takes pleasure in wrongdoing; there is no evil with you.

title: Psalms Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: The sons of pride have no place before you; you are a hater of all workers of evil.

title: Psalms Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: You will send destruction on those whose words are false; the cruel man and the man of deceit are hated by the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: But as for me, I will come into your house, in the full measure of your mercy; and in your fear I will give worship, turning my eyes to your holy Temple.

title: Psalms Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: Be my guide, O Lord, in the ways of your righteousness, because of those who are against me; make your way straight before my face.

title: Psalms Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: For no faith may be put in their words; their inner part is nothing but evil; their throat is like an open place for the dead; smooth are the words of their tongues.

title: Psalms Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: Send them to destruction, O Lord; let their evil designs be the cause of their fall; let them be forced out by all their sins; because they have gone against your authority.

title: Psalms Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: But let all those who put their faith in you be glad with cries of joy at all times, and let all the lovers of your name be glad in you.

title: Psalms Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: For you, Lord, will send a blessing on the upright man; your grace will be round him, and you will be his strength.

title: Psalms Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker on corded instruments, on the Sheminith. A Psalm. Of David. - O Lord, do not be bitter with me in your wrath; do not send punishment on me in the heat of your passion.

title: Psalms Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am wasted away: make me well, for even my bones are troubled.

title: Psalms Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: My soul is in bitter trouble; and you, O Lord, how long?

title: Psalms Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: Come back, O Lord, make my soul free; O give me salvation because of your mercy.

title: Psalms Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: For in death there is no memory of you; in the underworld who will give you praise?

title: Psalms Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: The voice of my sorrow is a weariness to me; all the night I make my bed wet with weeping; it is watered by the drops flowing from my eyes.

title: Psalms Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: My eyes are wasting away with trouble; they are becoming old because of all those who are against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: Go from me, all you workers of evil; for the Lord has given ear to the voice of my weeping.

title: Psalms Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: The Lord has given ear to my request; the Lord has let my prayer come before him.

title: Psalms Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: Let all those who are against me be shamed and deeply troubled; let them be turned back and suddenly put to shame.

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: - Shiggaion of David; a song which he made to the Lord, about the words of Cush the Benjamite. - O Lord my God, I put my faith in you; take me out of the hands of him who is cruel to me, and make me free;

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: So that he may not come rushing on my soul like a lion, wounding it, while there is no one to be my saviour.

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: O Lord my God, if I have done this; if my hands have done any wrong;

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: If I have given back evil to him who did evil to me, or have taken anything from him who was against me without cause;

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: Let my hater go after my soul and take it; let my life be crushed to the earth, and my honour into the dust. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: Come up, Lord, in your wrath; be lifted up against my haters; be awake, my God, give orders for the judging.

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: The meeting of the nations will be round you; take your seat, then, over them, on high.

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: The Lord will be judge of the peoples; give a decision for me, O Lord, because of my righteousness, and let my virtue have its reward.

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: O let the evil of the evil-doer come to an end, but give strength to the upright: for men's minds and hearts are tested by the God of righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: God, who is the saviour of the upright in heart, is my breastplate.

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: God is the judge of the upright, and is angry with the evil-doers every day.

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: If a man is not turned from his evil, he will make his sword sharp; his bow is bent and ready.

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: He has made ready for him the instruments of death; he makes his arrows flames of fire.

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: That man is a worker of evil; the seed of wrongdoing has given birth to deceit.

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: He has made a hole deep in the earth, and is falling into the hole which he has made

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: His wrongdoing will come back to him, and his violent behaviour will come down on his head.

title: Psalms Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: I will give praise to the Lord for his righteousness; I will make a song to the name of the Lord Most High.

title: Psalms Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker on the Gittith. A Psalm. Of David. - O Lord, our Lord, whose glory is higher than the heavens, how noble is your name in all the earth!

title: Psalms Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: You have made clear your strength even out of the mouths of babies at the breast, because of those who are against you; so that you may put to shame the cruel and violent man.

title: Psalms Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: When I see your heavens, the work of your fingers, the moon and the stars, which you have put in their places;

title: Psalms Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: What is man, that you keep him in mind? the son of man, that you take him into account?

title: Psalms Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: For you have made him only a little lower than the gods, crowning him with glory and honour.

title: Psalms Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: You have made him ruler over the works of your hands; you have put all things under his feet;

title: Psalms Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: All sheep and oxen, and all the beasts of the field;

title: Psalms Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: The birds of the air and the fish of the sea, and whatever goes through the deep waters of the seas.

title: Psalms Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: O Lord, our Lord, how noble is your name in all the earth!

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker on Muthlabben. A Psalm. Of David. - I will give you praise, O Lord, with all my heart; I will make clear all the wonder of your works.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: I will be glad and have delight in you: I will make a song of praise to your name, O Most High.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: When my haters are turned back, they will be broken and overcome before you.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: For you gave approval to my right and my cause; you were seated in your high place judging in righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: You have said sharp words to the nations, you have sent destruction on the sinners, you have put an end to their name for ever and ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: You have given their towns to destruction; the memory of them has gone; they have become waste for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: But the Lord is King for ever: he has made ready his high seat for judging.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: And he will be the judge of the world in righteousness, giving true decisions for the peoples.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: The Lord will be a high tower for those who are crushed down, a high tower in times of trouble;

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: And those who have knowledge of your name will put their faith in you; because you, Lord, have ever given your help to those who were waiting for you.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: Make songs of praise to the Lord, whose house is in Zion: make his doings clear to the people.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: When he makes search for blood, he has them in his memory: he is not without thought for the cry of the poor.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: Have mercy on me, O Lord, and see how I am troubled by my haters; let me be lifted up from the doors of death;

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: So that I may make clear all your praise in the house of the daughter of Zion: I will be glad because of your salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: The nations have gone down into the hole which they made: in their secret net is their foot taken.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: The Lord has given knowledge of himself through his judging: the evil-doer is taken in the net which his hands had made. (Higgaion. Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: The sinners and all the nations who have no memory of God will be turned into the underworld.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: For the poor will not be without help; the hopes of those in need will not be crushed for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: Up! O Lord; let not man overcome you: let the nations be judged before you.

title: Psalms Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: Put them in fear, O Lord, so that the nations may see that they are only men. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Why do you keep far away, O Lord? why are you not to be seen in times of trouble?

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: The evil-doer in his pride is cruel to the poor; let him be taken by the tricks of his invention.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: For the evil-doer is lifted up because of the purpose of his heart, and he whose mind is fixed on wealth is turned away from the Lord, saying evil against him.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: The evil-doer in his pride says, God will not make a search. All his thoughts are, There is no God.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: His ways are ever fixed; your decisions are higher than he may see: as for his haters, they are as nothing to him.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: He has said in his heart, I will not be moved: through all generations I will never be in trouble.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and false words: under his tongue are evil purposes and dark thoughts.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: He is waiting in the dark places of the towns: in the secret places he puts to death those who have done no wrong: his eyes are secretly turned against the poor.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: He keeps himself in a secret place like a lion in his hole, waiting to put his hands on the poor man, and pulling him into his net.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: The upright are crushed and made low, and the feeble are overcome by his strong ones.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: He says in his heart, God has no memory of me: his face is turned away; he will never see it.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: Up! O Lord; let your hand be lifted: give thought to the poor.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: Why has the evil-doer a low opinion of God, saying in his heart, You will not make search for it?

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: You have seen it; for your eyes are on sorrow and grief, to take it into your hand: the poor man puts his faith in you; you have been the helper of the child who has no father.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: Let the arm of the sinner and the evil-doer be broken; go on searching for his sin till there is no more.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: The Lord is King for ever and ever; the nations are gone from his land.

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: Lord, you have given ear to the prayer of the poor: you will make strong their hearts, you will give them a hearing:

title: Psalms Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: To give decision for the child without a father and for the broken-hearted, so that the man of the earth may no longer be feared.

title: Psalms Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: - For the chief music-maker. Of David. - In the Lord put I my faith; how will you say to my soul, Go in flight like a bird to the mountain?

title: Psalms Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: See, the bows of the evil-doers are bent, they make ready their arrows on the cord, so that they may send them secretly against the upright in heart.

title: Psalms Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: If the bases are broken down, what is the upright man to do?

title: Psalms Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: The Lord is in his holy Temple, the Lord's seat is in heaven; his eyes are watching and testing the children of men.

title: Psalms Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: The Lord puts the upright and the sinner to the test, but he has hate in his soul for the lover of violent acts.

title: Psalms Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: On the evil-doer he will send down fire and flames, and a burning wind; with these will their cup be full.

title: Psalms Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: For the Lord is upright; he is a lover of righteousness: the upright will see his face.

title: Psalms Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: - For the chief music-maker on the Sheminith. A Psalm. Of David. - Send help, Lord, for mercy has come to an end; there is no more faith among the children of men.

title: Psalms Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: Everyone says false words to his neighbour: their tongues are smooth in their talk, and their hearts are full of deceit.

title: Psalms Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: The smooth lips and the tongue of pride will be cut off by the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: They have said, With our tongues will we overcome; our lips are ours: who is lord over us?

title: Psalms Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Because of the crushing of the poor and the weeping of those in need, now will I come to his help, says the Lord; I will give him the salvation which he is desiring.

title: Psalms Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: The words of the Lord are true words: like silver tested by fire and burned clean seven times.

title: Psalms Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: You will keep them, O Lord, you will keep them safe from this generation for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: The sinners are walking on every side, and evil is honoured among the children of men.

title: Psalms Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. A Psalm. Of David. - Will you for ever put me out of your memory, O Lord? will your face for ever be turned away from me?

title: Psalms Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: How long is my soul to be in doubt, with sorrow in my heart all the day? how long will he who is against me be given power over me?

title: Psalms Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: Let my voice come before you, and give me an answer, O Lord my God; let your light be shining on me, so that the sleep of death may not overtake me;

title: Psalms Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: And he who is against me may not say, I have overcome him; and those who are troubling me may not be glad when I am moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: But I have had faith in your mercy; my heart will be glad in your salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: I will make a song to the Lord, because he has given me my reward.

title: Psalms Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. Of David. - The foolish man has said in his heart, God will not do anything. They are unclean, they have done evil works; there is not one who does good.

title: Psalms Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: The Lord was looking down from heaven on the children of men, to see if there were any who had wisdom, searching after God.

title: Psalms Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: They have all gone out of the way together; they are unclean, there is not one who does good, no, not one.

title: Psalms Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: Have all the workers of evil no knowledge? they take my people for food as they would take bread; they make no prayer to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: Then were they in great fear: for God is in the generation of the upright.

title: Psalms Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: You have put to shame the thoughts of the poor, but the Lord is his support.

title: Psalms Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: May the salvation of Israel come out of Zion! when the fate of his people is changed by the Lord, Jacob will have joy and Israel will be glad.

title: Psalms Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. Of David. - Lord, who may have a resting-place in your tent, a living-place on your holy hill?

title: Psalms Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: He who goes on his way uprightly, doing righteousness, and saying what is true in his heart;

title: Psalms Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: Whose tongue is not false, who does no evil to his friend, and does not take away the good name of his neighbour;

title: Psalms Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: Who gives honour to those who have the fear of the Lord, turning away from him who has not the Lord's approval. He who takes an oath against himself, and makes no change.

title: Psalms Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: He who does not put out his money at interest, or for payment give false decisions against men who have done no wrong. He who does these things will never be moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: - Michtam. Of David. - Keep me safe, O God: for in you I have put my faith.

title: Psalms Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: O my soul, you have said to the Lord, You are my Lord: I have no good but you.

title: Psalms Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: As for the saints who are in the earth, they are the noble in whom is all my delight.

title: Psalms Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: Their sorrows will be increased who go after another god: I will not take drink offerings from their hands, or take their names on my lips.

title: Psalms Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: The Lord is my heritage and the wine of my cup; you are the supporter of my right.

title: Psalms Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: Fair are the places marked out for me; I have a noble heritage.

title: Psalms Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: I will give praise to the Lord who has been my guide; knowledge comes to me from my thoughts in the night.

title: Psalms Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: I have put the Lord before me at all times; because he is at my right hand, I will not be moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: Because of this my heart is glad, and my glory is full of joy: while my flesh takes its rest in hope.

title: Psalms Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: For you will not let my soul be prisoned in the underworld; you will not let your loved one see the place of death.

title: Psalms Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: You will make clear to me the way of life; where you are joy is complete; in your right hand there are pleasures for ever and ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: - A Prayer. Of David. - Let my cause come to your ears, O Lord, give attention to my cry; give ear to my prayer which goes not out from false lips.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: Be my judge; for your eyes see what is right.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: You have put my heart to the test, searching me in the night; you have put me to the test and seen no evil purpose in me; I will keep my mouth from sin.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: As for the works of men, by the word of your lips I have kept myself from the ways of the violent.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: I have kept my feet in your ways, my steps have not been turned away.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: My cry has gone up to you, for you will give me an answer, O God: let your ear be turned to me, and give attention to my words.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: Make clear the wonder of your mercy, O saviour of those who put their faith in your right hand, from those who come out against them.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: Keep me as the light of your eyes, covering me with the shade of your wings,

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: From the evil-doers who are violent to me, and from those who are round me, desiring my death.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: They are shut up in their fat: with their mouths they say words of pride.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: They have made a circle round our steps: their eyes are fixed on us, forcing us down to the earth;

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: Like a lion desiring its food, and like a young lion waiting in secret places.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: Up! Lord, come out against him, make him low, with your sword be my saviour from the evil-doer.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: With your hand, O Lord, from men, even men of the world, whose heritage is in this life, and whom you make full with your secret wealth: they are full of children; after their death their offspring take the rest of their goods.

title: Psalms Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: As for me, I will see your face in righteousness: when I am awake it will be joy enough for me to see your form.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. Of the servant of the Lord, of David, who said the words of this song to the Lord on the day when the Lord made him free from the hand of all his haters, and from the hand of Saul; and he said, - I will give you my love, O Lord, my strength.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: The Lord is my Rock, my walled town, and my saviour; my God, my Rock, in him will I put my faith; my breastplate, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: I will send up my cry to the Lord, who is to be praised; so will I be made safe from those who are against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: The cords of death were round me, and the seas of evil put me in fear.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: The cords of hell were round me: the nets of death came on me.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: In my trouble my voice went up to the Lord, and my cry to my God: my voice came to his hearing in his holy Temple, and my prayer came before him, even into his ears.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: Then trouble and shock came on the earth; and the bases of the mountains were moved and shaking, because he was angry.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: There went up a smoke from his nose, and a fire of destruction from his mouth: flames were lighted by it.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: The heavens were bent, so that he might come down; and it was dark under his feet.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: And he went in flight through the air, seated on a storm-cloud: going quickly on the wings of the wind.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: He made the dark his secret place; his tent round him was the dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: Before his shining light his dark clouds went past, raining ice and fire.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: The Lord made thunder in the heavens, and the voice of the Highest was sounding out: a rain of ice and fire.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: He sent out his arrows, driving them in all directions; by his flames of fire they were troubled.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: Then the deep beds of the waters were seen, and the bases of the world were uncovered, because of your words of wrath, O Lord, because of the breath from your mouth.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: He sent from on high, he took me, pulling me out of great waters.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: He made me free from my strong hater, and from those who were against me, because they were stronger than I.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: They came on me in the day of my trouble; but the Lord was my support.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: He took me out into a wide place; he was my saviour because he had delight in me.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: The Lord gives me the reward of my righteousness, because my hands are clean before him.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: For I have kept the ways of the Lord; I have not been turned away in sin from my God.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: For all his decisions were before me, and I did not put away his laws from me.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: And I was upright before him, and I kept myself from sin.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: Because of this the Lord has given me the reward of my righteousness, because my hands are clean in his eyes.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 25
text: On him who has mercy you will have mercy; to the upright you will be upright;

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 26
text: He who is holy will see that you are holy; but to the man whose way is not straight you will be a hard judge.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 27
text: For you are the saviour of those who are in trouble; but eyes full of pride will be made low.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 28
text: You, O Lord, will be my light; by you, my God, the dark will be made bright for me.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 29
text: By your help I have made a way through the wall which was shutting me in; by the help of my God I have gone over a wall.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 30
text: As for God, his way is completely good; the word of the Lord is tested; he is a breastplate for all those who put their faith in him.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 31
text: For who is God but the Lord? or who is a Rock but our God?

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 32
text: God puts a strong band about me, guiding me in a straight way.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 33
text: He makes my feet like roes' feet, and puts me on high places.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 34
text: He makes my hands expert in war, so that a bow of brass is bent by my arms.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 35
