text: You have given me the breastplate of your salvation: your right hand has been my support, and your mercy has made me great.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 36
text: You have made my steps wide under me, so that my feet are kept from slipping.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 37
text: I go after my haters and overtake them; not turning back till they are all overcome.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 38
text: I will give them wounds, so that they are not able to get up: they are stretched under my feet.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 39
text: For I have been armed by you with strength for the fight: you have made low under me those who come out against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 40
text: By you their backs are turned in flight, so that my haters are cut off.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 41
text: They were crying out, but there was no one to come to their help: even to the Lord, but he gave them no answer.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 42
text: Then they were crushed as small as dust before the wind; they were drained out like the waste of the streets.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 43
text: You have made me free from the fightings of the people; you have made me the head of the nations: a people of whom I had no knowledge will be my servants.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 44
text: From the time when my name comes to their ears they will be ruled by me: men of other countries will, with false hearts, put themselves under my authority.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 45
text: They will be wasting away, they will come out of their secret places shaking with fear.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 46
text: The Lord is living; praise be to my Rock, and let the God of my salvation be honoured.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 47
text: It is God who sends punishment on my haters, and puts peoples under my rule.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 48
text: He makes me free from my haters; I am lifted up over those who come up against me: you have made me free from the violent man.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 49
text: Because of this I will give you praise, O Lord, among the nations, and will make a song of praise to your name.

title: Psalms Chapter 18 Verse 50
text: Great salvation does he give to his king; he has mercy on the king of his selection, David, and on his seed for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. A Psalm. Of David. - The heavens are sounding the glory of God; the arch of the sky makes clear the work of his hands.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: Day after day it sends out its word, and night after night it gives knowledge.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: There are no words or language; their voice makes no sound.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: Their line has gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them has he put a tent for the sun,

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: Who is like a newly married man coming from his bride-tent, and is glad like a strong runner starting on his way.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: His going out is from the end of the heaven, and his circle to the ends of it; there is nothing which is not open to his heat.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: The law of the Lord is good, giving new life to the soul: the witness of the Lord is certain, giving wisdom to the foolish.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: The orders of the Lord are right, making glad the heart: the rule of the Lord is holy, giving light to the eyes.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: The fear of the Lord is clean, and has no end; the decisions of the Lord are true and full of righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: More to be desired are they than gold, even than much shining gold; sweeter than the dropping honey.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: By them is your servant made conscious of danger, and in keeping them there is great reward.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: Who has full knowledge of his errors? make me clean from secret evil.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: Keep your servant back from sins of pride; let them not have rule over me: then will I be upright and free from great sin.

title: Psalms Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: Let the words of my mouth and the thoughts of my heart be pleasing in your eyes, O Lord, my strength and my salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. A Psalm. Of David. - May the Lord give ear to you in the day of trouble; may you be placed on high by the name of the God of Jacob;

title: Psalms Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: May he send you help from the holy place, and give you strength from Zion;

title: Psalms Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: May he keep all your offerings in mind, and be pleased with the fat of your burned offerings; (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: May he give you your heart's desire, and put all your purposes into effect.

title: Psalms Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: We will be glad in your salvation, and in the name of our God we will put up our flags: may the Lord give you all your requests.

title: Psalms Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: Now am I certain that the Lord gives salvation to his king; he will give him an answer from his holy heaven with the strength of salvation in his right hand.

title: Psalms Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: Some put their faith in carriages and some in horses; but we will be strong in the name of the Lord our God.

title: Psalms Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: They are bent down and made low; but we have been lifted up.

title: Psalms Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: Come to our help, Lord: let the king give ear to our cry.

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. A Psalm. Of David. - The king will be glad in your strength, O Lord; how great will be his delight in your salvation!

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: You have given him his heart's desire, and have not kept back the request of his lips. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: For you go before him with the blessings of good things: you put a crown of fair gold on his head.

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: He made request to you for life, and you gave it to him, long life for ever and ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: His glory is great in your salvation: honour and authority have you put on him.

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: For you have made him a blessing for ever: you have given him joy in the light of your face.

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: For the king has faith in the Lord, and through the mercy of the Most High he will not be moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: Your hand will make a search for all your haters; your right hand will be hard on all those who are against you.

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: You will make them like a flaming oven before you; the Lord in his wrath will put an end to them, and they will be burned up in the fire.

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: Their fruit will be cut off from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: For their thoughts were bitter against you: they had an evil design in their minds, which they were not able to put into effect.

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: Their backs will be turned when you make ready the cords of your bow against their faces.

title: Psalms Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: Be lifted up, O Lord, in your strength; so will we make songs in praise of your power.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker on Aijeleth-hash-shahar. A Psalm. Of David. - My God, my God, why are you turned away from me? why are you so far from helping me, and from the words of my crying?

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: O my God, I make my cry in the day, and you give no answer; and in the night, and have no rest.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: But you are holy, O you who are seated among the praises of Israel.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: Our fathers had faith in you: they had faith and you were their saviour.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: They sent up their cry to you and were made free: they put their faith in you and were not put to shame.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: But I am a worm and not a man; cursed by men, and looked down on by the people.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: I am laughed at by all those who see me: pushing out their lips and shaking their heads they say,

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: He put his faith in the Lord; let the Lord be his saviour now: let the Lord be his saviour, because he had delight in him.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: But it was you who took care of me from the day of my birth: you gave me faith even from my mother's breasts.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: I was in your hands even before my birth; you are my God from the time when I was in my mother's body.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: Be not far from me, for trouble is near; there is no one to give help.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: A great herd of oxen is round me: I am shut in by the strong oxen of Bashan.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: I saw their mouths wide open, like lions crying after food.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: I am flowing away like water, and all my bones are out of place: my heart is like wax, it has become soft in my body.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: My throat is dry like a broken vessel; my tongue is fixed to the roof of my mouth, and the dust of death is on my lips.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: Dogs have come round me: I am shut in by the band of evil-doers; they made wounds in my hands and feet.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: I am able to see all my bones; their looks are fixed on me:

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: They make a division of my robes among them, by the decision of chance they take my clothing.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: Do not be far from me, O Lord: O my strength, come quickly to my help.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: Make my soul safe from the sword, my life from the power of the dog.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: Be my saviour from the lion's mouth; let me go free from the horns of the cruel oxen.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: I will give the knowledge of your name to my brothers: I will give you praise among the people.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: You who have fear of the Lord, give him praise; all you seed of Jacob, give him glory; go in fear of him, all you seed of Israel.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: For he has not been unmoved by the pain of him who is troubled; or kept his face covered from him; but he has given an answer to his cry.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: My praise will be of you in the great meeting: I will make my offerings before his worshippers.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: The poor will have a feast of good things: those who make search for the Lord will give him praise: your heart will have life for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: All the ends of the earth will keep it in mind and be turned to the Lord: all the families of the nations will give him worship.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: For the kingdom is the Lord's; he is the ruler among the nations.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: All the fat ones of the earth will give him worship; all those who go down to the dust will make themselves low before him, even he who has not enough for the life of his soul.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 30
text: A seed will be his servant; the doings of the Lord will be made clear to the generation which comes after.

title: Psalms Chapter 22 Verse 31
text: They will come and make his righteousness clear to a people of the future because he has done this.

title: Psalms Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. Of David. - The Lord takes care of me as his sheep; I will not be without any good thing.

title: Psalms Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: He makes a resting-place for me in the green fields: he is my guide by the quiet waters.

title: Psalms Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: He gives new life to my soul: he is my guide in the ways of righteousness because of his name.

title: Psalms Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: Yes, though I go through the valley of deep shade, I will have no fear of evil; for you are with me, your rod and your support are my comfort.

title: Psalms Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: You make ready a table for me in front of my haters: you put oil on my head; my cup is overflowing.

title: Psalms Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: Truly, blessing and mercy will be with me all the days of my life; and I will have a place in the house of the Lord all my days.

title: Psalms Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. Of David. - The earth is the Lord's, with all its wealth; the world and all the people living in it.

title: Psalms Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: For by him it was based on the seas, and made strong on the deep rivers.

title: Psalms Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: Who may go up into the hill of the Lord? and who may come into his holy place?

title: Psalms Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: He who has clean hands and a true heart; whose desire has not gone out to foolish things, who has not taken a false oath.

title: Psalms Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: He will have blessing from the Lord, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: This is the generation of those whose hearts are turned to you, even to your face, O God of Jacob. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: Let your heads be lifted up, O doors; be lifted up, O you eternal doors: that the King of glory may come in.

title: Psalms Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: Who is the King of glory? The Lord of strength and power, the Lord strong in war.

title: Psalms Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: Let your heads be lifted up, O doors; let them be lifted up, O you eternal doors: that the King of glory may come in.

title: Psalms Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: Who is the King of glory? The Lord of armies, he is the King of glory. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: - Of David. - To you, O Lord, my soul is lifted up.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: O my God, I have put my faith in you, let me not be shamed; let not my haters be glorying over me.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: Let no servant of yours be put to shame; may those be shamed who are false without cause.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: Make your steps clear to me, O Lord; give me knowledge of your ways.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: Be my guide and teacher in the true way; for you are the God of my salvation; I am waiting for your word all the day.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: O Lord, keep in mind your pity and your mercies; for they have been from the earliest times.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 7
text: Do not keep in mind my sins when I was young, or my wrongdoing: let your memory of me be full of mercy, O Lord, because of your righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 8
text: Good and upright is the Lord: so he will be the teacher of sinners in the way.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 9
text: He will be an upright guide to the poor in spirit: he will make his way clear to them.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 10
text: All the ways of the Lord are mercy and good faith for those who keep his agreement and his witness.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 11
text: Because of your name, O Lord, let me have forgiveness for my sin, which is very great.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 12
text: If a man has the fear of the Lord, the Lord will be his teacher in the way of his pleasure.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 13
text: His soul will be full of good things, and his seed will have the earth for its heritage.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 14
text: The secret of the Lord is with those in whose hearts is the fear of him; he will make his agreement clear to them.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 15
text: My eyes are turned to the Lord at all times; for he will take my feet out of the net.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 16
text: Be turned to me, and have mercy on me; for I am troubled and have no helper.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 17
text: The troubles of my heart are increased: O take me out of my sorrows.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 18
text: Give thought to my grief and my pain; and take away all my sins.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 19
text: See how those who are against me are increased, for bitter is their hate of me.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 20
text: O keep my soul, and take me out of danger: let me not be shamed, for I have put my faith in you.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 21
text: For my clean and upright ways keep me safe, because my hope is in you.

title: Psalms Chapter 25 Verse 22
text: Give Israel salvation, O God, out of all his troubles.

title: Psalms Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: - Of David. - O Lord, be my judge, for my behaviour has been upright: I have put my faith in the Lord, I am not in danger of slipping.

title: Psalms Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: Put me in the scales, O Lord, so that I may be tested; let the fire make clean my thoughts and my heart.

title: Psalms Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: For your mercy is before my eyes; and I have gone in the way of your good faith.

title: Psalms Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: I have not taken my seat with foolish persons, and I do not go with false men.

title: Psalms Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: I have been a hater of the band of wrongdoers, and I will not be seated among sinners.

title: Psalms Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: I will make my hands clean from sin; so will I go round your altar, O Lord;

title: Psalms Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: That I may give out the voice of praise, and make public all the wonders which you have done.

title: Psalms Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: Lord, your house has been dear to me, and the resting-place of your glory.

title: Psalms Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: Let not my soul be numbered among sinners, or my life among men of blood;

title: Psalms Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: In whose hands are evil designs, and whose right hands take money for judging falsely.

title: Psalms Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: But as for me, I will go on in my upright ways: be my saviour, and have mercy on me.

title: Psalms Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: I have a safe resting-place for my feet; I will give praise to the Lord in the meetings of the people.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: - Of David. - The Lord is my light and my salvation; who is then a cause of fear to me? the Lord is the strength of my life; who is a danger to me?

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: When evil-doers, even my haters, came on me to put an end to me, they were broken and put to shame.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: Even if an army came against me with its tents, my heart would have no fear: if war was made on me, my faith would not be moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 4
text: One prayer have I made to the Lord, and this is my heart's desire; that I may have a place in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, looking on his glory, and getting wisdom in his Temple.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 5
text: For in the time of trouble he will keep me safe in his tent: in the secret place of his tent he will keep me from men's eyes; high on a rock he will put me.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 6
text: And now my head will be lifted up higher than my haters who are round me: because of this I will make offerings of joy in his tent; I will make a song, truly I will make a song of praise to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 7
text: O Lord, let the voice of my cry come to your ears: have mercy on me, and give me an answer.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 8
text: When you said, Make search for my face, my heart said to you, For your face will I make my search.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 9
text: Let not your face be covered from me; do not put away your servant in wrath; you have been my help: do not give me up or take your support from me, O God of my salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 10
text: When my father and my mother are turned away from me, then the Lord will be my support.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 11
text: Make your way clear to me, O Lord, guiding me by the right way, because of my haters.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 12
text: Do not give me into their hands, because false witnesses have come out against me, and men breathing destruction.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 13
text: I had almost given up my hope of seeing the blessing of the Lord in the land of the living.

title: Psalms Chapter 27 Verse 14
text: Let your hope be in the Lord: take heart and be strong; yes, let your hope be in the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 28 Verse 1
text: - Of David. - My cry goes up to you, O Lord, my Rock; do not keep back your answer from me, so that I may not become like those who go down into the underworld.

title: Psalms Chapter 28 Verse 2
text: Give ear to the voice of my prayer, when I am crying to you, when my hands are lifted up to your holy place.

title: Psalms Chapter 28 Verse 3
text: Do not take me away with the sinners and the workers of evil, who say words of peace to their neighbours, but evil is in their hearts.

title: Psalms Chapter 28 Verse 4
text: Give them the right reward of their acts, and of their evil doings: give them punishment for the works of their hands, let them have their full reward.

title: Psalms Chapter 28 Verse 5
text: Because they have no respect for the works of the Lord, or for the things which his hands have made, they will be broken down and not lifted up by him.

title: Psalms Chapter 28 Verse 6
text: May the Lord be praised, because he has given ear to the voice of my prayer.

title: Psalms Chapter 28 Verse 7
text: The Lord is my strength and my breastplate, my heart had faith in him and I am helped; for this cause my heart is full of rapture, and I will give him praise in my song.

title: Psalms Chapter 28 Verse 8
text: The Lord is their strength, and a strong place of salvation for his king.

title: Psalms Chapter 28 Verse 9
text: Be a saviour to your people, and send a blessing on your heritage: be their guide, and let them be lifted up for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 29 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. Of David. - Give to the Lord, you sons of the gods, give to the Lord glory and strength.

title: Psalms Chapter 29 Verse 2
text: Give to the Lord the full glory of his name; give him worship in holy robes.

title: Psalms Chapter 29 Verse 3
text: The voice of the Lord is on the waters: the God of glory is thundering, the Lord is on the great waters.

title: Psalms Chapter 29 Verse 4
text: The voice of the Lord is full of power; the voice of the Lord has a noble sound.

title: Psalms Chapter 29 Verse 5
text: By the voice of the Lord are the cedar-trees broken, even the cedars of Lebanon are broken by the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 29 Verse 6
text: He makes them go jumping about like a young ox; Lebanon and Sirion like a young mountain ox.

title: Psalms Chapter 29 Verse 7
text: At the voice of the Lord flames of fire are seen.

title: Psalms Chapter 29 Verse 8
text: At the voice of the Lord there is a shaking in the waste land, even a shaking in the waste land of Kadesh.

title: Psalms Chapter 29 Verse 9
text: At the voice of the Lord the roes give birth, the leaves are taken from the trees: in his Temple everything says, Glory.

title: Psalms Chapter 29 Verse 10
text: The Lord had his seat as king when the waters came on the earth; the Lord is seated as king for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 29 Verse 11
text: The Lord will give strength to his people; the Lord will give his people the blessing of peace.

title: Psalms Chapter 30 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. A Song at the blessing of the House. Of David. - I will give you praise and honour, O Lord, because through you I have been lifted up; you have not given my haters cause to be glad over me.

title: Psalms Chapter 30 Verse 2
text: O Lord my God, I sent up my cry to you, and you have made me well.

title: Psalms Chapter 30 Verse 3
text: O Lord, you have made my soul come again from the underworld: you have given me life and kept me from going down among the dead.

title: Psalms Chapter 30 Verse 4
text: Make songs to the Lord, O you saints of his, and give praise to his holy name.

title: Psalms Chapter 30 Verse 5
text: For his wrath is only for a minute; in his grace there is life; weeping may be for a night, but joy comes in the morning.

title: Psalms Chapter 30 Verse 6
text: When things went well for me I said, I will never be moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 30 Verse 7
text: Lord, by your grace you have kept my mountain strong: when your face was turned from me I was troubled.

title: Psalms Chapter 30 Verse 8
text: My voice went up to you, O Lord; I made my prayer to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 30 Verse 9
text: What profit is there in my blood if I go down into the underworld? will the dust give you praise, or be a witness to your help?

title: Psalms Chapter 30 Verse 10
text: Give ear to me, O Lord, and have mercy on me: Lord, be my helper.

title: Psalms Chapter 30 Verse 11
text: By you my sorrow is turned into dancing; you have taken away my clothing of grief, and given me robes of joy;

title: Psalms Chapter 30 Verse 12
text: So that my glory may make songs of praise to you and not be quiet. O Lord my God, I will give you praise for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. A Psalm. Of David. - In you, O Lord, have I put my hope; let me never be shamed; keep me safe in your righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 2
text: Let your ear be turned to me; take me quickly out of danger; be my strong Rock, my place of strength where I may be safe.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 3
text: For you are my Rock and my strong tower; go in front of me and be my guide, because of your name.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 4
text: Take me out of the net which they have put ready for me secretly; for you are my strength.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 5
text: Into your hands I give my spirit; you are my saviour, O Lord God for ever true.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 6
text: I am full of hate for those who go after false gods; but my hope is in the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 7
text: I will be glad and have delight in your mercy; because you have seen my trouble; you have had pity on my soul in its sorrows;

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 8
text: And you have not given me into the hand of my hater; you have put my feet in a wide place.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 9
text: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am in trouble; my eyes are wasted with grief, I am wasted in soul and body.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 10
text: My life goes on in sorrow, and my years in weeping; my strength is almost gone because of my sin, and my bones are wasted away.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 11
text: Because of all those who are against me, I have become a word of shame to my neighbours; a cause of shaking the head and a fear to my friends: those who saw me in the street went in flight from me.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 12
text: I have gone from men's minds and memory like a dead man; I am like a broken vessel.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 13
text: False statements against me have come to my ears; fear was on every side: they were talking together against me, designing to take away my life.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 14
text: But I had faith in you, O Lord; I said, You are my God.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 15
text: The chances of my life are in your hand; take me out of the hands of my haters, and of those who go after me.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 16
text: Let your servant see the light of your face; in your mercy be my saviour.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 17
text: Let me not be shamed, O Lord, for I have made my prayer to you; let the sinners be shamed, and let their mouths be shut in the underworld.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 18
text: Let the false lips be shut, which say evil against the upright, looking down on him in their pride.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 19
text: O how great is your grace, which you have put in store for your worshippers, and which you have made clear to those who had faith in you, before the sons of men!

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 20
text: You will keep them safe in your house from the designs of man; in the secret of your tent will you keep them from angry tongues.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 21
text: May the Lord be praised, because he has made clear to me the wonder of his grace in a strong town.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 22
text: And as for me, I said in my fear, I am cut off from before your eyes; but you gave ear to the voice of my prayer, when my cry went up to you.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 23
text: O have love for the Lord, all you his saints; for the Lord keeps safe from danger all those who are true to him, and gives the workers of pride their right reward.

title: Psalms Chapter 31 Verse 24
text: Put away fear and let your heart be strong, all you whose hope is in the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 32 Verse 1
text: - Of David. Maschil. - Happy is he who has forgiveness for his wrongdoing, and whose sin is covered.

title: Psalms Chapter 32 Verse 2
text: Happy is the man in whom the Lord sees no evil, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.

title: Psalms Chapter 32 Verse 3
text: When I kept my mouth shut, my bones were wasted, because of my crying all through the day.

title: Psalms Chapter 32 Verse 4
text: For the weight of your hand was on me day and night; my body became dry like the earth in summer. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 32 Verse 5
text: I made my wrongdoing clear to you, and did not keep back my sin. I said, I will put it all before the Lord; and you took away my wrongdoing and my sin. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 32 Verse 6
text: For this cause let every saint make his prayer to you at a time when you are near: then the overflowing of the great waters will not overtake him.

title: Psalms Chapter 32 Verse 7
text: You are my safe and secret place; you will keep me from trouble; you will put songs of salvation on the lips of those who are round me. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 32 Verse 8
text: I will give you knowledge, teaching you the way to go; my eye will be your guide.

title: Psalms Chapter 32 Verse 9
text: Do not be like the horse or the ass, without sense; ...

title: Psalms Chapter 32 Verse 10
text: The sinner will be full of trouble; but mercy will be round the man who has faith in the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 32 Verse 11
text: Be glad in the Lord with joy, you upright men; give cries of joy, all you whose hearts are true.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 1
text: Be glad in the Lord, O doers of righteousness; for praise is beautiful for the upright.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 2
text: Give praise to the Lord on the corded instrument; make melody to him with instruments of music.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 3
text: Make a new song to him; playing expertly with a loud noise.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 4
text: For the word of the Lord is upright, and all his works are certain.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 5
text: His delight is in righteousness and wisdom; the earth is full of the mercy of the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 6
text: By the word of the Lord were the heavens made; and all the army of heaven by the breath of his mouth.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 7
text: He makes the waters of the sea come together in a mass; he keeps the deep seas in store-houses.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 8
text: Let the earth be full of the fear of the Lord; let all the people of the world be in holy fear of him.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 9
text: For he gave the word, and it was done; by his order it was fixed for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 10
text: The Lord undoes the designs of the nations; he makes the thoughts of the peoples without effect.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 11
text: The Lord's purpose is eternal, the designs of his heart go on through all the generations of man.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 12
text: Happy is the nation whose God is the Lord; and the people whom he has taken for his heritage.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 13
text: The Lord is looking down from heaven; he sees all the sons of men;

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 14
text: From his house he keeps watch on all who are living on the earth;

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 15
text: He makes all their hearts; their works are clear to him.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 16
text: A king's salvation is not in the power of his army; a strong man does not get free by his great strength.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 17
text: A horse is a false hope; his great power will not make any man free from danger.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 18
text: See, the eye of the Lord is on those in whose hearts is the fear of him, on those whose hope is in his mercy;

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 19
text: To keep their souls from death; and to keep them living in time of need.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 20
text: Our souls are waiting for the Lord; he is our help and our salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 21
text: For in him our hearts have joy; in his holy name is our hope.

title: Psalms Chapter 33 Verse 22
text: Let your mercy be on us, O Lord, as we are waiting for you.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 1
text: - Of David. When he made a change in his behaviour before Abimelech, who sent him away, and he went. - I will be blessing the Lord at all times; his praise will be ever in my mouth.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 2
text: My soul will say great things of the Lord: the poor in spirit will have knowledge of it and be glad.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 3
text: O give praise to the Lord with me; let us be witnesses together of his great name.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 4
text: I was searching for the Lord, and he gave ear to my voice, and made me free from all my fears.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 5
text: Let your eyes be turned to him and you will have light, and your faces will not be shamed.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 6
text: This poor man's cry came before the Lord, and he gave him salvation from all his troubles.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 7
text: The angel of the Lord is ever watching over those who have fear of him, to keep them safe.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 8
text: By experience you will see that the Lord is good; happy is the man who has faith in him.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 9
text: Keep yourselves in the fear of the Lord, all you his saints; for those who do so will have no need of anything.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 10
text: The young lions are in need and have no food; but those who are looking to the Lord will have every good thing.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 11
text: Come, children, give attention to me; I will be your teacher in the fear of the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 12
text: What man has a love of life, and a desire that his days may be increased so that he may see good?

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 13
text: Keep your tongue from evil, and your lips from words of deceit.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 14
text: Be turned from evil, and do good; make a search for peace, desiring it with all your heart.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 15
text: The eyes of the Lord are on the upright, and his ears are open to their cry.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 16
text: The face of the Lord is against those who do evil, to take away the memory of them from the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 17
text: The cry of the upright comes before the Lord, and he takes them out of all their troubles.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 18
text: The Lord is near the broken-hearted; he is the saviour of those whose spirits are crushed down.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 19
text: Great are the troubles of the upright: but the Lord takes him safely out of them all.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 20
text: He keeps all his bones: not one of them is broken.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 21
text: Evil will put an end to the sinner, and those who are haters of righteousness will come to destruction.

title: Psalms Chapter 34 Verse 22
text: The Lord will be the saviour of the souls of his servants, and no one who has faith in him will be put to shame.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 1
text: - Of David. - O Lord, be on my side against those who are judging me; be at war with those who make war against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 2
text: Be a breastplate to me, and give me your help.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 3
text: Take up your spear and keep back my attackers; say to my soul, I am your salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 4
text: Let them be overcome and put to shame who make attempts to take my soul; let those who would do me damage be turned back and made foolish.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 5
text: Let them be like dust from the grain before the wind; let the angel of the Lord send them in flight.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 6
text: Let their way be dark and full of danger; let them be troubled by the angel of the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 7
text: For without cause they have put a net ready for me secretly, in which to take my soul.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 8
text: Let destruction come on them without their knowledge; let them be taken themselves in their secret nets, falling into the same destruction.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 9
text: And my soul will have joy in the Lord; it will be glad in his salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 10
text: All my bones will say, Lord, who is like you? The saviour of the poor man from the hands of the strong, of him who is poor and in need from him who takes his goods.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 11
text: False witnesses got up: they put questions to me about crimes of which I had no knowledge.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 12
text: They gave me back evil for good, troubling my soul.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 13
text: But as for me, when they were ill I put on the clothing of sorrow: I went without food and was sad, and my prayer came back again to my heart.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 14
text: My behaviour was as if it had been my friend or my brother: I was bent low in grief like one whose mother is dead.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 15
text: But they took pleasure in my trouble, and came together, yes, low persons came together against me without my knowledge; they never came to an end of wounding me.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 16
text: Like men of deceit they put me to shame; the voice of their wrath was loud against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 17
text: Lord, how long will you be looking on? take my soul from their destruction, my life from the lions.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 18
text: I will give you praise in the great meeting; I will give you honour among a strong people.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 19
text: Do not let my haters be glad over me falsely; let not those who are against me without cause make sport of me.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 20
text: For they do not say words of peace; in their deceit they are designing evil things against the quiet ones in the land.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 21
text: Their mouths were open wide against me, and they said, Aha, aha, our eyes have seen it.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 22
text: You have seen this, O Lord; be not unmoved: O Lord, be not far from me.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 23
text: Be awake, O Lord, be moved to take up my cause, my God and my Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 24
text: Be my judge, O Lord my God, in your righteousness; do not let them be glad over me.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 25
text: Let them not say in their hearts, So we will have it: let them not say, We have put an end to him.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 26
text: Let all those who take pleasure in my troubles be shamed and come to nothing: let those who are lifted up against me be covered with shame and have no honour.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 27
text: Let those who are on my side give cries of joy; let them ever say, The Lord be praised, for he has pleasure in the peace of his servant.

title: Psalms Chapter 35 Verse 28
text: And my tongue will be talking of your righteousness and of your praise all the day.

title: Psalms Chapter 36 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. Of the servant of the Lord. Of David. - The sin of the evil-doer says in his heart, There is no fear of the Lord before his eyes.

title: Psalms Chapter 36 Verse 2
text: For he takes comfort in the thought that his sin will not be uncovered and hated.

title: Psalms Chapter 36 Verse 3
text: In the words of his mouth are evil and deceit; he has given up being wise and doing good.

title: Psalms Chapter 36 Verse 4
text: He gives thought to evil on his bed; he takes a way which is not good; he is not a hater of evil.

title: Psalms Chapter 36 Verse 5
text: Your mercy, O Lord, is in the heavens, and your strong purpose is as high as the clouds.

title: Psalms Chapter 36 Verse 6
text: Your righteousness is like the mountains of God; your judging is like the great deep; O Lord, you give life to man and beast.

title: Psalms Chapter 36 Verse 7
text: How good is your loving mercy, O God! the children of men take cover under the shade of your wings.

title: Psalms Chapter 36 Verse 8
text: The delights of your house will be showered on them; you will give them drink from the river of your pleasures.

title: Psalms Chapter 36 Verse 9
text: For with you is the fountain of life: in your light we will see light.

title: Psalms Chapter 36 Verse 10
text: O let there be no end to your loving mercy to those who have knowledge of you, or of your righteousness to the upright in heart.

title: Psalms Chapter 36 Verse 11
text: Let not the foot of pride come against me, or the hand of the evil-doers put me out of my place.

title: Psalms Chapter 36 Verse 12
text: There the workers of evil have come down: they have been made low, and will not be lifted up.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 1
text: - Of David. - Do not be angry because of the wrongdoers, or have envy of the workers of evil.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 2
text: For they will quickly be cut down like grass, and become dry like the green plants.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 3
text: Have faith in the Lord, and do good; be at rest in the land, and go after righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 4
text: So will your delight be in the Lord, and he will give you your heart's desires.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 5
text: Put your life in the hands of the Lord; have faith in him and he will do it.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 6
text: And he will make your righteousness be seen like the light, and your cause like the shining of the sun.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 7
text: Take your rest in the Lord, waiting quietly for him; do not be angry because of the man who does well in his evil ways, and gives effect to his bad designs.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 8
text: Put an end to your wrath and be no longer bitter; do not give way to angry feeling which is a cause of sin.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 9
text: For the evil-doers will be cut off: but those who have faith in the Lord will have the earth for their heritage.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 10
text: For in a short time the evil-doer will be gone: you will go searching for his place, and it will not be there.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 11
text: But the gentle will have the earth for their heritage; they will take their delight in peace without measure.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 12
text: The sinner has evil designs against the upright, lifting up the voice of wrath against him.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 13
text: He will be laughed at by the Lord, who sees that his day is coming.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 14
text: The evil-doers have taken out their swords, their bows are bent; for crushing the poor, and to put to death those who are upright in their ways.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 15
text: But their swords will be turned into their hearts, and their bows will be broken.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 16
text: The little which the good man has is better than the wealth of evil-doers.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 17
text: For the arms of the evil-doers will be broken: but the Lord is the support of the good.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 18
text: The days of the upright are numbered by the Lord, and their heritage will be for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 19
text: They will not be shamed in the evil time, and in the days when all are in need of food they will have enough.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 20
text: But the wrongdoers will come to destruction, and the haters of the Lord will be like the fat of lambs, they will be burned up; they will go up in smoke, and never again be seen.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 21
text: The sinner takes money and does not give it back; but the upright man has mercy, and gives to others.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 22
text: Those who have his blessing will have the earth for their heritage; but those who are cursed by him will be cut off.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 23
text: The steps of a good man are ordered by the Lord, and he takes delight in his way.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 24
text: Even if he has a fall he will not be without help: for the hand of the Lord is supporting him.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 25
text: I have been young, and now am old, but I have not seen the good man without help, or his children looking for bread.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 26
text: All the day he is ready to have mercy and to give; his children are a blessing.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 27
text: Be turned from evil, and do good; and your place will be for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 28
text: For the Lord is a lover of righteousness, and takes care of his saints; they will be kept safe for ever; but the seed of the evil-doers will be cut off.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 29
text: The upright will have the earth for their heritage, and will go on living there for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 30
text: The mouth of the good man says words of wisdom; the talk of his tongue is of righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 31
text: The law of his God is in his heart; he will never make a false step.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 32
text: The sinners are watching the upright man, desiring to put him to death.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 33
text: The Lord will not give him into their hands, or be against him when he is judged.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 34
text: Be waiting for the Lord, and keep his way; and you will be lifted up, and have the land for your heritage: when the evil-doers are cut off, you will see it.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 35
text: I have seen the evil-doer in great power, covering the earth like a great tree.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 36
text: But he came to an end, and there was no sign of him; I made a search for him and he was not there.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 37
text: Give attention to the good man, and take note of the upright; because the end of that man is peace.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 38
text: But as for the sinners, they will be cut off together; the end of the wrongdoers is destruction.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 39
text: But the Lord is the saviour of the upright: he is their strength in the time of trouble.

title: Psalms Chapter 37 Verse 40
text: And the Lord will be their help, and keep them safe: he will take them out of the hands of the evil-doers, and be their saviour, because they had faith in him.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. Of David. To keep in memory. - O Lord, be not bitter with me in your wrath; let not your hand be on me in the heat of your passion.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 2
text: For your arrows have gone into my flesh, and I am crushed under the weight of your hand.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 3
text: My flesh is wasted because of your wrath; and there is no peace in my bones because of my sin.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 4
text: For my crimes have gone over my head; they are like a great weight which is more than my strength.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 5
text: My wounds are poisoned and evil-smelling, because of my foolish behaviour.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 6
text: I am troubled, I am made low; I go weeping all the day.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 7
text: For my body is full of burning; all my flesh is unhealthy.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 8
text: I am feeble and crushed down; I gave a cry like a lion because of the grief in my heart.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 9
text: Lord, all my desire is before you; my sorrow is not kept secret from you.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 10
text: My heart goes out in pain, my strength is wasting away; as for the light of my eyes, it is gone from me.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 11
text: My lovers and my friends keep away from my disease; my relations keep far away.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 12
text: Those who have a desire to take my life put nets for me; those who are designing my destruction say evil things against me, all the day their minds are full of deceit.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 13
text: But I kept my ears shut like a man without hearing; like a man without a voice, never opening his mouth.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 14
text: So I was like a man whose ears are shut, and in whose mouth there are no sharp words.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 15
text: In you, O Lord, is my hope: you will give me an answer, O Lord, my God.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 16
text: I said, Let them not be glad over me; when my foot is moved, let them not be lifted up with pride against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 17
text: My feet are near to falling, and my sorrow is ever before me.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 18
text: I will make clear my wrongdoing, with sorrow in my heart for my sin.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 19
text: But they are strong who have hate for me without cause: those who are against me falsely are increased in numbers.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 20
text: They give me back evil for good; they are my haters because I go after the thing which is right.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 21
text: Do not give me up, O Lord; O my God, be near to me.

title: Psalms Chapter 38 Verse 22
text: Come quickly to give me help, O Lord, my salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. Of Jeduthun. A Psalm. Of David. - I said, I will give attention to my ways, so that my tongue may do no wrong; I will keep my mouth under control, while the sinner is before me.

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 2
text: I made no sound, I said no word, even of good; and I was moved with sorrow.

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 3
text: My heart was burning in my breast; while I was deep in thought the fire was lighted; then I said with my tongue,

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 4
text: Lord, give me knowledge of my end, and of the measure of my days, so that I may see how feeble I am.

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 5
text: You have made my days no longer than a hand's measure; and my years are nothing in your eyes; truly, every man is but a breath. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 6
text: Truly, every man goes on his way like an image; he is troubled for no purpose: he makes a great store of wealth, and has no knowledge of who will get it.

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 7
text: And now, Lord, what am I waiting for? my hope is in you.

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 8
text: Make me free from all my sins; do not let me be shamed by the man of evil behaviour.

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 9
text: I was quiet, and kept my mouth shut; because you had done it.

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 10
text: No longer let your hand be hard on me; I am wasted by the blows of your hand.

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 11
text: By the weight of your wrath against man's sin, the glory of his form is wasted away; truly every man is but a breath. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 12
text: Let my prayer come to your ears, O Lord, and give attention to my cry, make an answer to my weeping: for my time here is short before you, and in a little time I will be gone, like all my fathers.

title: Psalms Chapter 39 Verse 13
text: Let your wrath be turned away from me, so that I may be comforted, before I go away from here, and become nothing.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. Of David. A Psalm. - When I was waiting quietly for the Lord, his heart was turned to me, and he gave ear to my cry.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 2
text: He took me up out of a deep waste place, out of the soft and sticky earth; he put my feet on a rock, and made my steps certain.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 3
text: And he put a new song in my mouth, even praise to our God; numbers have seen it with fear, and put their faith in the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 4
text: Happy is the man who has faith in the Lord, and does not give honour to the men of pride or to those who are turned away to deceit.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 5
text: O Lord my God, great are the wonders which you have done in your thought for us; it is not possible to put them out in order before you; when I would give an account of them, their number is greater than I may say.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 6
text: You had no desire for offerings of beasts or fruits of the earth; ears you made for me: for burned offerings and sin offerings you made no request.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 7
text: Then I said, See, I come; it is recorded of me in the roll of the book,

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 8
text: My delight is to do your pleasure, O my God; truly, your law is in my heart.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 9
text: I have given news of righteousness in the great meeting; O Lord, you have knowledge that I have not kept back my words.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 10
text: Your righteousness has not been folded away in my heart; I have made clear your true word and your salvation; I have not kept secret your mercy or your faith from the great meeting.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 11
text: Take not away your gentle mercies from me, O Lord; let your mercy and your faith keep me safe for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 12
text: For unnumbered evils are round about me; my sins have overtaken me, so that I am bent down with their weight; they are more than the hairs of my head, my strength is gone because of them.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 13
text: Be pleased, O Lord, to take me out of danger; O Lord, come quickly and give me help.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 14
text: Let those who go after my soul for its destruction have shame and trouble together; let them be turned back and made foolish who take pleasure in my trouble.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 15
text: Let those who say to me, Aha, aha! be surprised because of their shame.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 16
text: Let all those who are looking for you be glad and have joy in you; let the lovers of your salvation ever say, May the Lord be great.

title: Psalms Chapter 40 Verse 17
text: Though I am poor and in need, the Lord has me in mind; you are my help and my saviour; let there be no waiting, O my God.

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. A Psalm. Of David. - Happy is the man who gives thought to the poor; the Lord will be his saviour in the time of trouble.

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 2
text: The Lord will keep him safe, and give him life; the Lord will let him be a blessing on the earth, and will not give him into the hand of his haters.

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 3
text: The Lord will be his support on his bed of pain: by you will all his grief be turned to strength.

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 4
text: I said, Lord, have mercy on me; make my soul well, because my faith is in you.

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 5
text: My haters say evil against me, When will he be dead, and his name come to an end?

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 6
text: If one comes to see me, deceit is in his heart; he keeps a store of evil, which he makes public in every place.

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 7
text: All my haters are talking secretly together against me; they are designing my downfall.

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 8
text: They say, He has an evil disease, which will not let him go: and now that he is down he will not get up again.

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 9
text: Even my dearest friend, in whom I had faith, who took bread with me, is turned against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 10
text: But you, O Lord, have mercy on me, lifting me up, so that I may give them their punishment.

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 11
text: By this I see that you have pleasure in me, because my hater does not overcome me.

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 12
text: And as for me, you are my support in my righteousness, giving me a place before your face for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 41 Verse 13
text: May the Lord God of Israel be praised, through eternal days and for ever. So be it. So be it.

title: Psalms Chapter 42 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. Maschil. Of the sons of Korah. - Like the desire of the roe for the water-streams, so is my soul's desire for you, O God.

title: Psalms Chapter 42 Verse 2
text: My soul is dry for need of God, the living God; when may I come and see the face of God?

title: Psalms Chapter 42 Verse 3
text: My tears have been my food day and night, while they keep saying to me, Where is your God?

title: Psalms Chapter 42 Verse 4
text: Let my soul be overflowing with grief when these things come back to my mind, how I went in company to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, with the song of those who were keeping the feast.

title: Psalms Chapter 42 Verse 5
text: Why are you crushed down, O my soul? and why are you troubled in me? put your hope in God; for I will again give him praise who is my help and my God.

title: Psalms Chapter 42 Verse 6
text: My soul is crushed down in me, so I will keep you in mind; from the land of Jordan and of the Hermons, from the hill Mizar.

title: Psalms Chapter 42 Verse 7
text: Deep is sounding to deep at the noise of your waterfalls; all your waves have gone rolling over me.

title: Psalms Chapter 42 Verse 8
text: But the Lord will send his mercy in the daytime, and in the night his song will be with me, a prayer to the God of my life.

title: Psalms Chapter 42 Verse 9
text: I will say to God my Rock, Why have you let me go from your memory? why do I go in sorrow because of the attacks of my haters?

title: Psalms Chapter 42 Verse 10
text: The cruel words of my haters are like a crushing of my bones; when they say to me every day, Where is your God?

title: Psalms Chapter 42 Verse 11
text: Why are you crushed down, O my soul? and why are you troubled in me? put your hope in God; for I will again give him praise who is my help and my God.

title: Psalms Chapter 43 Verse 1
text: Be my judge, O God, supporting my cause against a nation without religion; O keep me from the false and evil man.

title: Psalms Chapter 43 Verse 2
text: You are the God of my strength; why have you put me from you? why do I go in sorrow because of the attacks of my haters?

title: Psalms Chapter 43 Verse 3
text: O send out your light and your true word; let them be my guide: let them take me to your holy hill, and to your tents.

title: Psalms Chapter 43 Verse 4
text: Then I will go up to the altar of God, to the God of my joy; I will be glad and give praise to you on an instrument of music, O God, my God.

title: Psalms Chapter 43 Verse 5
text: Why are you crushed down, O my soul? and why are you troubled in me? put your hope in God, for I will again give him praise who is my help and my God.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. Of the sons of Korah Maschil. - It has come to our ears, O God, our fathers have given us the story, of the works which you did in their days, in the old times,

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 2
text: Uprooting the nations with your hand, and planting our fathers in their place; cutting down the nations, but increasing the growth of your people.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 3
text: For they did not make the land theirs by their swords, and it was not their arms which kept them safe; but your right hand, and your arm, and the light of your face, because you had pleasure in them.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 4
text: You are my King and my God; ordering salvation for Jacob.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 5
text: Through you will we overcome our haters; by your name will they be crushed under our feet who are violent against us.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 6
text: I will not put faith in my bow, my sword will not be my salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 7
text: But it is you who have been our saviour from those who were against us, and have put to shame those who had hate for us.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 8
text: Our pride is in God at all times, to his name we give praise for ever. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 9
text: But now you have sent us away from you, and put us to shame; you do not go out with our armies.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 10
text: Because of this we are turned back by the attacker: those who have hate for us take our goods for themselves.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 11
text: You have made us like sheep which are taken for meat; we are put to flight among the nations.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 12
text: You let your people go for nothing; your wealth is not increased by their price.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 13
text: You have made us to be looked down on by our neighbours, we are laughed at and shamed by those who are round about us.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 14
text: Our name is a word of shame among the nations, a sign for the shaking of heads among the peoples.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 15
text: My downfall is ever before me, and I am covered with the shame of my face;

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 16
text: Because of the voice of him who says sharp and bitter words; because of the hater and him who is the instrument of punishment.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 17
text: All this has come on us, but still we have kept you in our memory; and we have not been false to your word.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 18
text: Our hearts have not gone back, and our steps have not been turned out of your way;

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 19
text: Though you have let us be crushed in the place of jackals, though we are covered with darkest shade.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 20
text: If the name of our God has gone out of our minds, or if our hands have been stretched out to a strange god,

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 21
text: Will not God make search for it? for he sees the secrets of the heart.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 22
text: Truly, because of you we are put to death every day; we are numbered like sheep for destruction.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 23
text: Why are you sleeping, O Lord? awake! and come to our help, do not give us up for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 24
text: Why is your face covered, and why do you give no thought to our trouble and our cruel fate?

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 25
text: For our souls are crushed down to the dust: our bodies are stretched out on the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 44 Verse 26
text: Up! and come to our help, and give us salvation because of your mercy.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to Shoshannim. Of the sons of Korah. Maschil. A Song of loves. - My heart is flowing over with good things; my words are of that which I have made for a king; my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 2
text: You are fairer than the children of men; grace is flowing through your lips; for this cause the blessing of God is with you for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 3
text: Put on your sword, make it ready at your side, O strong chief, with your glory and power.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 4
text: And go nobly on in your power, because you are good and true and without pride; and your right hand will be teaching you things of fear.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 5
text: Your arrows are sharp in the heart of the king's haters; because of them the peoples are falling under you.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 6
text: Your seat of power, O God, is for ever and ever; the rod of your kingdom is a rod of honour.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 7
text: You have been a lover of righteousness and a hater of evil: and so God, your God, has put the oil of joy on your head, lifting you high over all other kings.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 8
text: Your robes are full of the smell of all sorts of perfumes and spices; music from the king's ivory houses has made you glad.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 9
text: Kings' daughters are among your noble women: on your right is the queen in gold of Ophir.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 10
text: O daughter, give thought and attention, and let your ear be open; no longer keep in mind your people, and your father's house;

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 11
text: So will the king have a great desire for you, seeing how beautiful you are; because he is your lord, give him honour.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 12
text: And the daughters of Tyre will be there with an offering; those who have wealth among the people will be looking for your approval.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 13
text: In the great house the king's daughter is all shining: her clothing is worked with gold.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 14
text: She will come before the king in robes of needlework; the virgins in her train will come before you.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 15
text: With joy and rapture will they come; they will go into the king's house.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 16
text: Your children will take the place of your fathers; so that you may make them rulers over all the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 45 Verse 17
text: I will keep the memory of your name living through all generations; and because of this the people will give you praise for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 46 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. Of the sons of Korah; put to Alamoth. A Song. - God is our harbour and our strength, a very present help in trouble.

title: Psalms Chapter 46 Verse 2
text: For this cause we will have no fear, even though the earth is changed, and though the mountains are moved in the heart of the sea;

title: Psalms Chapter 46 Verse 3
text: Though its waters are sounding and troubled, and though the mountains are shaking with their violent motion. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 46 Verse 4
text: There is a river whose streams make glad the resting-place of God, the holy place of the tents of the Most High.

title: Psalms Chapter 46 Verse 5
text: God has taken his place in her; she will not be moved: he will come to her help at the dawn of morning.

title: Psalms Chapter 46 Verse 6
text: The nations were angry, the kingdoms were moved; at the sound of his voice the earth became like wax.

title: Psalms Chapter 46 Verse 7
text: The Lord of armies is with us; the God of Jacob is our high tower. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 46 Verse 8
text: Come, see the works of the Lord, the destruction which he has made in the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 46 Verse 9
text: He puts an end to wars over all the earth; by him the bow is broken, and the spear cut in two, and the carriage burned in the fire.

title: Psalms Chapter 46 Verse 10
text: Be at peace in the knowledge that I am God: I will be lifted up among the nations, I will be honoured through all the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 46 Verse 11
text: The Lord of armies is with us; the God of Jacob is our high tower. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 47 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. A Psalm. Of the sons of Korah. - O make a glad noise with your hands, all you peoples; letting your voices go up to God with joy.

title: Psalms Chapter 47 Verse 2
text: For the Lord Most High is to be feared; he is a great King over all the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 47 Verse 3
text: He will put down the peoples under us, and the nations under our feet.

title: Psalms Chapter 47 Verse 4
text: He will give us our heritage, the glory of Jacob who is dear to him. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 47 Verse 5
text: God has gone up with a glad cry, the Lord with the sound of the horn.

title: Psalms Chapter 47 Verse 6
text: Give praises to God, make songs of praise; give praises to our King, make songs of praise.

title: Psalms Chapter 47 Verse 7
text: For God is the King of all the earth; make songs of praise with knowledge.

title: Psalms Chapter 47 Verse 8
text: God is the ruler over the nations; God is on the high seat of his holy rule.

title: Psalms Chapter 47 Verse 9
text: The rulers of the peoples have come together, with the people of the God of Abraham; because the powers of the earth are God's: he is lifted up on high.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 1
text: - A Song. A Psalm. Of the sons of Korah. - Great is the Lord and greatly to be praised, in the town of our God, in his holy mountain.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 2
text: Beautiful in its high position, the joy of all the earth, is the mountain of Zion, the mountain of God, the town of the great King.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 3
text: In its buildings God is seen to be a high tower.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 4
text: For see! the kings came together by agreement, they were joined together.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 5
text: They saw it, and so were full of wonder; they were troubled, and went quickly away in fear.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 6
text: Shaking came on them and pain, as on a woman in childbirth.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 7
text: By you the ships of Tarshish are broken as by an east wind.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 8
text: As it came to our ears so have we seen it, in the town of the Lord of armies, in the town of our God; God will keep it fixed for ever. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 9
text: Our thoughts were of your mercy, O God, while we were in your Temple.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 10
text: As your name is, O God, so is your praise to the ends of the earth; your right hand is full of righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 11
text: Let there be joy in the mountain of Zion, and let the daughters of Judah be glad, because of your wise decisions.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 12
text: Make your way about Zion, and go round it, numbering its towers.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 13
text: Take note of its strong walls, looking well at its fair buildings; so that you may give word of it to the generation which comes after.

title: Psalms Chapter 48 Verse 14
text: Because this God is our God for ever and ever: he will be our guide.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 1
text: - Alamoth. To the chief music-maker. Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm. - Give attention to this, all you peoples; let your ears be open, all you who are living in the world.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 2
text: High and low together, the poor, and those who have wealth.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 3
text: From my mouth will come words of wisdom; and in the thoughts of my heart will be knowledge.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 4
text: I will put my teaching into a story; I will make my dark sayings clear with music.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 5
text: What cause have I for fear in the days of evil, when the evil-doing of those who are working for my downfall is round about me?

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 6
text: Even of those whose faith is in their wealth, and whose hearts are lifted up because of their stores.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 7
text: Truly, no man may get back his soul for a price, or give to God the payment for himself;

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 8
text: (Because it takes a great price to keep his soul from death, and man is not able to give it.)

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 9
text: So that he might have eternal life, and never see the underworld.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 10
text: For he sees that wise men come to their end, and foolish persons of low behaviour come to destruction together, letting their wealth go to others.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 11
text: The place of the dead is their house for ever, and their resting-place through all generations; those who come after them give their names to their lands.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 12
text: But man, like the animals, does not go on for ever; he comes to an end like the beasts.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 13
text: This is the way of the foolish; their silver is for those who come after them, and their children get the pleasure of their gold. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 14
text: Death will give them their food like sheep; the underworld is their fate and they will go down into it; their flesh is food for worms; their form is wasted away; the underworld is their resting-place for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 15
text: But God will get back my soul; for he will take me from the power of death. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 16
text: Have no fear when wealth comes to a man, and the glory of his house is increased;

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 17
text: For at his death, he will take nothing away; his glory will not go down after him.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 18
text: Though he might have pride in his soul in his life-time, and men will give you praise if you do well for yourself,

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 19
text: He will go to the generation of his fathers; he will not see the light again.

title: Psalms Chapter 49 Verse 20
text: Man, like the animals, does not go on for ever; he comes to an end like the beasts.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. Of Asaph. - The God of gods, even the Lord, has sent out his voice, and the earth is full of fear; from the coming up of the sun to its going down.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 2
text: From Zion, most beautiful of places, God has sent out his light.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 3
text: Our God will come, and will not keep quiet; with fire burning before him, and storm-winds round him.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 4
text: His voice will go out to the heavens and to the earth, for the judging of his people:

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 5
text: Let my saints come together to me; those who have made an agreement with me by offerings.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 6
text: And let the heavens make clear his righteousness; for God himself is the judge. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 7
text: Give ear, O my people, to my words; O Israel, I will be a witness against you; I am God, even your God.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 8
text: I will not take up a cause against you because of your offerings, or because of your burned offerings, which are ever before me.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 9
text: I will take no ox out of your house, or he-goats from your flocks;

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 10
text: For every beast of the woodland is mine, and the cattle on a thousand hills.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 11
text: I see all the birds of the mountains, and the beasts of the field are mine.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 12
text: If I had need of food, I would not give you word of it; for the earth is mine and all its wealth.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 13
text: Am I to take the flesh of the ox for my food, or the blood of goats for my drink?

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 14
text: Make an offering of praise to God; keep the agreements which you have made with the Most High;

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 15
text: Let your voice come up to me in the day of trouble; I will be your saviour, so that you may give glory to me.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 16
text: But to the sinner, God says, What are you doing, talking of my laws, or taking the words of my agreement in your mouth?

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 17
text: Seeing that you have no desire for my teaching, turning your back on my words.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 18
text: When you saw a thief, you were in agreement with him, and you were joined with those who took other men's wives.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 19
text: You have given your mouth to evil, your tongue to words of deceit.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 20
text: You say evil of your brother; you make false statements against your mother's son.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 21
text: These things have you done, and I said nothing; it seemed to you that I was such a one as yourself; but I will make a protest against you, and put them in order before your eyes.

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 22
text: Now keep this in mind, you who have no memory of God, for fear that you may be crushed under my hand, with no one to give you help:

title: Psalms Chapter 50 Verse 23
text: Whoever makes an offering of praise gives glory to me; and to him who is upright in his ways I will make clear the salvation of God.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. A Psalm. Of David. When Nathan the prophet came to him, after he had gone in to Bath-sheba. - Have pity on me, O God, in your mercy; out of a full heart, take away my sin.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 2
text: Let all my wrongdoing be washed away, and make me clean from evil.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 3
text: For I am conscious of my error; my sin is ever before me.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 4
text: Against you, you only, have I done wrong, working that which is evil in your eyes; so that your words may be seen to be right, and you may be clear when you are judging.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 5
text: Truly, I was formed in evil, and in sin did my mother give me birth.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 6
text: Your desire is for what is true in the inner parts: in the secrets of my soul you will give me knowledge of wisdom.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 7
text: Make me free from sin with hyssop: let me be washed whiter than snow.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 8
text: Make me full of joy and rapture; so that the bones which have been broken may be glad.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 9
text: Let your face be turned from my wrongdoing, and take away all my sins.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 10
text: Make a clean heart in me, O God; give me a right spirit again.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 11
text: Do not put me away from before you, or take your holy spirit from me.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 12
text: Give me back the joy of your salvation; let a free spirit be my support.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 13
text: Then will I make your ways clear to wrongdoers; and sinners will be turned to you.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 14
text: Be my saviour from violent death, O God, the God of my salvation; and my tongue will give praise to your righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 15
text: O Lord, let my lips be open, so that my mouth may make clear your praise.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 16
