text: You have no desire for an offering or I would give it; you have no delight in burned offerings.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 17
text: The offerings of God are a broken spirit; a broken and sorrowing heart, O God, you will not put from you.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 18
text: Do good to Zion in your good pleasure, building up the walls of Jerusalem.

title: Psalms Chapter 51 Verse 19
text: Then you will have delight in the offerings of righteousness, in burned offerings and offerings of beasts; then they will make offerings of oxen on your altar.

title: Psalms Chapter 52 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. Maschil. Of David. When Doeg the Edomite came to Saul saying, David has come to the house of Ahimelech. - Why do you take pride in wrongdoing, lifting yourself up against the upright man all the day?

title: Psalms Chapter 52 Verse 2
text: Purposing destruction, using deceit; your tongue is like a sharp blade.

title: Psalms Chapter 52 Verse 3
text: You have more love for evil than for good, for deceit than for works of righteousness. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 52 Verse 4
text: Destruction is in all your words, O false tongue.

title: Psalms Chapter 52 Verse 5
text: But God will put an end to you for ever; driving you out from your tent, uprooting you from the land of the living. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 52 Verse 6
text: The upright will see it with fear, and will say, laughing at you:

title: Psalms Chapter 52 Verse 7
text: See, this is the man who did not make God his strength, but had faith in his goods and his property, and made himself strong in his wealth.

title: Psalms Chapter 52 Verse 8
text: But I am like a branching olive-tree in the house of God; I have put my faith in his mercy for ever and ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 52 Verse 9
text: I will give you praise without end for what you have done; I will give honour to your name before your saints, for it is good.

title: Psalms Chapter 53 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to Mahalath. Maschil. Of David. - The foolish man has said in his heart, God will not do anything. They are unclean, they have done evil works; there is not one who does good.

title: Psalms Chapter 53 Verse 2
text: God was looking down from heaven on the children of men, to see if there were any who had wisdom, searching after God.

title: Psalms Chapter 53 Verse 3
text: Every one of them has gone back; they are unclean: there is not one who does good, no, not one.

title: Psalms Chapter 53 Verse 4
text: Have the workers of evil no knowledge? they take my people for food, as they would take bread; they make no prayer to God.

title: Psalms Chapter 53 Verse 5
text: They were in great fear, where there was no cause for fear: for the bones of those who make war on you have been broken by God; you have put them to shame, because God has no desire for them.

title: Psalms Chapter 53 Verse 6
text: May the salvation of Israel come out of Zion! When the fate of his people is changed by God, Jacob will have joy, and Israel will be glad.

title: Psalms Chapter 54 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; on Neginoth. Maschil. Of David. When the Ziphites came and said to Saul, Is not David keeping himself secret among us? - Let your name be my salvation, O God; let my cause be judged by your strength.

title: Psalms Chapter 54 Verse 2
text: Let my prayer come before you, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.

title: Psalms Chapter 54 Verse 3
text: For men who are going after me have come out against me, violent men are purposing to take my soul; they have not put God before their eyes. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 54 Verse 4
text: See, God is my helper: the Lord is the great supporter of my soul.

title: Psalms Chapter 54 Verse 5
text: Let the evil works of my haters come back on them again; let them be cut off by your good faith.

title: Psalms Chapter 54 Verse 6
text: Freely will I make my offerings to you; I will give praise to your name, O Lord, for it is good.

title: Psalms Chapter 54 Verse 7
text: Because it has been my saviour from all my trouble; and my eyes have seen the punishment of my haters.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker, on Neginoth. Maschil. Of David. - Give hearing to my prayer, O God; and let not your ear be shut against my request.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 2
text: Give thought to me, and let my prayer be answered: I have been made low in sorrow;

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 3
text: I am troubled because of the voice of the cruel ones, because of the loud cry of the evil-doers; for they put a weight of evil on me, and they are cruel in their hate for me.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 4
text: My heart is deeply wounded, and the fear of death has come on me.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 5
text: Fear and shaking have come over me, with deep fear I am covered.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 6
text: And I said, If only I had wings like a dove! for then I would go in flight from here and be at rest.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 7
text: I would go wandering far away, living in the waste land. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 8
text: I would quickly take cover from the driving storm and from the violent wind.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 9
text: Send destruction on them, O Lord, make a division of tongues among them: for I have seen fighting and violent acts in the town.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 10
text: By day and night they go round the town, on the walls; trouble and sorrow are in the heart of it.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 11
text: Evil is there; cruel rule and deceit are ever in the streets.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 12
text: For it was not my hater who said evil of me; that would have been no grief to me; it was not one outside the number of my friends who made himself strong against me, or I would have kept myself from him in a secret place;

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 13
text: But it was you, my equal, my guide, my well-loved friend.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 14
text: We had loving talk together, and went to the house of God in company.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 15
text: Let the hand of death come on them suddenly, and let them go down living into the underworld; because evil is in their houses and in their hearts.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 16
text: As for me, I will make my prayer to God, and he will be my saviour.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 17
text: In the evening and in the morning and in the middle of the day I will make my prayer with sounds of grief; and my voice will come to his ears.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 18
text: He has taken my soul away from the attack which was made against me, and given it peace; for great numbers were against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 19
text: God will give thought to me; he who from early times is strong will send pain and trouble on them. (Selah.) Because they are unchanged, they have no fear of God.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 20
text: He has put out his hand against those who were at peace with him; he has not kept his agreement.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 21
text: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart; his words were softer than oil, but they were sharp swords.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 22
text: Put your cares on the Lord, and he will be your support; he will not let the upright man be moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 55 Verse 23
text: But you, O God, will send them down into the underworld; the cruel and the false will be cut off before half their days are ended; but I will have faith in you.

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to Jonath elem rehokim. Of David. Michtam. When the Philistines took him in Gath. - Have mercy on me, O God, for man is attempting my destruction; every day he makes cruel attacks against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 2
text: My haters are ever ready to put an end to me; great numbers are lifting themselves up against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 3
text: In the time of my fear, I will have faith in you.

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 4
text: In God will I give praise to his word; in God have I put my hope; I will have no fear of what flesh may do to me.

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 5
text: Every day they make wrong use of my words; all their thoughts are against me for evil.

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 6
text: They come together, they are waiting in secret places, they take note of my steps, they are waiting for my soul.

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 7
text: By evil-doing they will not get free from punishment. In wrath, O God, let the peoples be made low.

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 8
text: You have seen my wanderings; put the drops from my eyes into your bottle; are they not in your record?

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 9
text: When I send up my cry to you, my haters will be turned back; I am certain of this, for God is with me.

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 10
text: In God will I give praise to his word; in the Lord will I give praise to his word.

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 11
text: In God have I put my hope, I will have no fear of what man may do to me.

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 12
text: I keep the memory of my debt to you, O God; I will give you the offerings of praise.

title: Psalms Chapter 56 Verse 13
text: Because you have taken my soul from the power of death; and kept my feet from falling, so that I may be walking before God in the light of life.

title: Psalms Chapter 57 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to Al-tashheth. Michtam. Of David. When he went in flight from Saul, in the hole of the rock. - Have mercy on me, O God, have mercy on me; for the hope of my soul is in you: I will keep myself safely under the shade of your wings, till these troubles are past.

title: Psalms Chapter 57 Verse 2
text: I will send up my cry to the Most High God; to God who does all things for me.

title: Psalms Chapter 57 Verse 3
text: He will send from heaven, and take me from the power of him whose desire is for my destruction. God will send out his mercy and his good faith.

title: Psalms Chapter 57 Verse 4
text: My soul is among lions; I am stretched out among those who are on fire, even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and whose tongue is a sharp sword.

title: Psalms Chapter 57 Verse 5
text: O God, be lifted up higher than the heavens; let your glory be over all the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 57 Verse 6
text: They have made ready a net for my steps; my soul is bent down; they have made a great hole before me, and have gone down into it themselves. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 57 Verse 7
text: My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed; I will make songs, and give praise.

title: Psalms Chapter 57 Verse 8
text: You are my glory; let the instruments of music be awake; I myself will be awake with the dawn.

title: Psalms Chapter 57 Verse 9
text: I will give you praise, O Lord, among the peoples; I will make songs to you among the nations.

title: Psalms Chapter 57 Verse 10
text: For your mercy is great, stretching up to the heavens, and your righteousness goes up to the clouds.

title: Psalms Chapter 57 Verse 11
text: Be lifted up, O God, higher than the heavens, let your glory be over all the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 58 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to Al-tashheth. Michtam. Of David. - Is there righteousness in your mouths, O you gods? are you upright judges, O you sons of men?

title: Psalms Chapter 58 Verse 2
text: The purposes of your hearts are evil; your hands are full of cruel doings on the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 58 Verse 3
text: The evil-doers are strange from the first; from the hour of their birth they go out of the true way, saying false words.

title: Psalms Chapter 58 Verse 4
text: Their poison is like the poison of a snake; they are like the adder, whose ears are shut;

title: Psalms Chapter 58 Verse 5
text: Who will not be moved by the voice of the wonder-worker, however great are his powers.

title: Psalms Chapter 58 Verse 6
text: O God, let their teeth be broken in their mouths; let the great teeth of the young lions be pulled out, O Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 58 Verse 7
text: Let them be turned to liquid like the ever-flowing waters; let them be cut off like the grass by the way.

title: Psalms Chapter 58 Verse 8
text: Let them be like an after-birth which is turned to water and comes to an end; like the fruit of a woman who gives birth before her time, let them not see the sun.

title: Psalms Chapter 58 Verse 9
text: Before they are conscious of it, let them be cut down like thorns; let a strong wind take them away like waste growth.

title: Psalms Chapter 58 Verse 10
text: The upright man will be glad when he sees their punishment; his feet will be washed in the blood of the evil-doer.

title: Psalms Chapter 58 Verse 11
text: So that men will say, Truly there is a reward for righteousness; truly there is a God who is judge on the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to At-tashheth. Michtam. Of David. When Saul sent, and they were watching the house, to put him to death. - Take me out of the hands of the cruel ones, O my God; keep me safe from those who come up against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 2
text: Take me out of the power of the workers of evil, and keep me safe from the men of blood.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 3
text: For see, they are watching in secret for my soul; the strong have come together against me? but not because of my sin, or my evil-doing, O Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 4
text: For no sin of mine they go quickly and get themselves ready; be awake and come to my help, and see.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 5
text: You, O Lord God of armies, are the God of Israel; come now and give punishment to the nations; have no mercy on any workers of deceit. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 6
text: They come back in the evening; they make a noise like a dog, and go round the town.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 7
text: See, hate is dropping from their lips; curses are on their tongues: they say, Who gives attention to it?

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 8
text: But you are laughing at them, O Lord; you will make sport of all the nations.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 9
text: O my strength, I will put my hope in you; because God is my strong tower.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 10
text: The God of my mercy will go before me: God will let me see my desire effected on my haters.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 11
text: Put them not to death, for so my people will keep the memory of them: let them be sent in all directions by your power; make them low, O Lord our saviour.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 12
text: Because of the sin of their mouths and the word of their lips, let them even be taken in their pride; and for their curses and their deceit,

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 13
text: Put an end to them in your wrath, put an end to them, so that they may not be seen again; let them see that God is ruling in Jacob and to the ends of the earth. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 14
text: And in the evening let them come back, and make a noise like a dog, and go round the town.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 15
text: Let them go wandering up and down in search of food, and be there all night if they have not enough.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 16
text: But I will make songs of your power; yes, I will give cries of joy for your mercy in the morning; because you have been my strength and my high tower in the day of my trouble.

title: Psalms Chapter 59 Verse 17
text: To you, O my strength, will I make my song: because God is my high tower, even the God of my mercy.

title: Psalms Chapter 60 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to Shushan-eduth. Michtam. Of David. For teaching. When he was fighting against Aram-naharaim and Aramzobah, when Joab came back, and put twelve thousand of the Edomites to death, in the Valley of Salt. - God, you have put us away from you, you have sent us in all directions, you have been angry; O be turned to us again.

title: Psalms Chapter 60 Verse 2
text: By the power of your hand the earth is shaking and broken; make it strong again, for it is moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 60 Verse 3
text: You have made the people see hard times; you have given us the wine of shaking for our drink.

title: Psalms Chapter 60 Verse 4
text: Give a safe place to those who have fear of you, where they may go in flight from before the bow. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 60 Verse 5
text: So that your loved ones may be made safe, let your right hand be my salvation, and give me an answer.

title: Psalms Chapter 60 Verse 6
text: God has said in his holy place, I will be glad: I will make a division of Shechem, and the valley of Succoth will be measured out.

title: Psalms Chapter 60 Verse 7
text: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; and Ephraim is the strength of my head; Judah is my law-giver;

title: Psalms Chapter 60 Verse 8
text: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I put out my shoe; over Philistia will a glad cry be sounded.

title: Psalms Chapter 60 Verse 9
text: Who will take me into the strong town? who will be my guide into Edom?

title: Psalms Chapter 60 Verse 10
text: Have not you put us away, O God? and you have not gone out with our armies.

title: Psalms Chapter 60 Verse 11
text: Give us help in our trouble; for there is no help in man.

title: Psalms Chapter 60 Verse 12
text: Through God we will do great things, for through him our haters will be crushed under our feet.

title: Psalms Chapter 61 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. On a corded instrument. Of David. - Let my cry come to you, O God; let your ears be open to my prayer.

title: Psalms Chapter 61 Verse 2
text: From the end of the earth will I send up my cry to you, when my heart is overcome: take me to the rock which is over-high for me.

title: Psalms Chapter 61 Verse 3
text: For you have been my secret place, and my high tower from those who made war on me.

title: Psalms Chapter 61 Verse 4
text: I will make your tent my resting-place for ever: I will keep myself under the cover of your wings. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 61 Verse 5
text: For you, O God, have made answer to my prayers; you have given me the heritage of those who give honour to your name.

title: Psalms Chapter 61 Verse 6
text: You will give the king long life; and make his years go on through the generations.

title: Psalms Chapter 61 Verse 7
text: May the seat of his authority be before God for ever; may mercy and righteousness keep him safe.

title: Psalms Chapter 61 Verse 8
text: So will I make songs in praise of your name for ever, giving to God that which is right day by day.

title: Psalms Chapter 62 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. After Jeduthun. A Psalm. Of David. - My soul, put all your faith in God; for from him comes my salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 62 Verse 2
text: He only is my Rock and my salvation; he is my high tower; I will not be greatly moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 62 Verse 3
text: How long will you go on designing evil against a man? running against him as against a broken wall, which is on the point of falling?

title: Psalms Chapter 62 Verse 4
text: Their only thought is to put him down from his place of honour; their delight is in deceit: blessing is in their mouths but cursing in their hearts. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 62 Verse 5
text: My soul, put all your faith in God; for from him comes my hope.

title: Psalms Chapter 62 Verse 6
text: He only is my Rock and my salvation; he is my high tower; I will not be greatly moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 62 Verse 7
text: In God is my salvation, and my glory; the Rock of my strength, and my safe place.

title: Psalms Chapter 62 Verse 8
text: Have faith in him at all times, you people; let your hearts go flowing out before him: God is our safe place. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 62 Verse 9
text: Truly men of low birth are nothing, and men of high position are not what they seem; if they are put in the scales together they are less than a breath.

title: Psalms Chapter 62 Verse 10
text: Have no faith in the rewards of evil-doing, or in profits wrongly made: if your wealth is increased, do not put your hopes on it.

title: Psalms Chapter 62 Verse 11
text: Once has God said, twice has it come to my ears, that power is God's:

title: Psalms Chapter 62 Verse 12
text: And mercy, O Lord, is yours, for you give to every man the reward of his work.

title: Psalms Chapter 63 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. Of David. When he was in the waste land of Judah. - O God, you are my God; early will I make my search for you: my soul is dry for need of you, my flesh is wasted with desire for you, as a dry and burning land where no water is;

title: Psalms Chapter 63 Verse 2
text: To see your power and your glory, as I have seen you in the holy place.

title: Psalms Chapter 63 Verse 3
text: Because your mercy is better than life, my lips will give you praise.

title: Psalms Chapter 63 Verse 4
text: So will I go on blessing you all my life, lifting up my hands in your name.

title: Psalms Chapter 63 Verse 5
text: My soul will be comforted, as with good food; and my mouth will give you praise with songs of joy;

title: Psalms Chapter 63 Verse 6
text: When the memory of you comes to me on my bed, and when I give thought to you in the night-time.

title: Psalms Chapter 63 Verse 7
text: Because you have been my help, I will have joy in the shade of your wings.

title: Psalms Chapter 63 Verse 8
text: My soul keeps ever near you: your right hand is my support.

title: Psalms Chapter 63 Verse 9
text: But those whose desire is my soul's destruction will go down to the lower parts of the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 63 Verse 10
text: They will be cut off by the sword; they will be food for foxes.

title: Psalms Chapter 63 Verse 11
text: But the king will have joy in God; everyone who takes an oath by him will have cause for pride; but the false mouth will be stopped.

title: Psalms Chapter 64 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. A Psalm. Of David. - O God, let the voice of my grief come to your ear: keep my life from the fear of those who are against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 64 Verse 2
text: Keep me safe from the secret purpose of wrongdoers; from the band of the workers of evil;

title: Psalms Chapter 64 Verse 3
text: Who make their tongues sharp like a sword, and whose arrows are pointed, even bitter words;

title: Psalms Chapter 64 Verse 4
text: So that in secret they may let loose their arrows at the upright, suddenly and unseen.

title: Psalms Chapter 64 Verse 5
text: They make themselves strong in an evil purpose; they make holes for secret nets; they say, Who will see it,

title: Psalms Chapter 64 Verse 6
text: Or make discovery of our secret purpose? The design is framed with care; and the inner thought of a man, and his heart, is deep.

title: Psalms Chapter 64 Verse 7
text: But God sends out an arrow against them; suddenly they are wounded.

title: Psalms Chapter 64 Verse 8
text: The evil of their tongues is the cause of their fall; all those who see them are shaking their heads at them.

title: Psalms Chapter 64 Verse 9
text: And in fear men make public the works of God; and giving thought to his acts they get wisdom.

title: Psalms Chapter 64 Verse 10
text: The upright will be glad in the Lord and have hope in him; and all the lovers of righteousness will give him glory.

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. A Psalm. Of David. A Song. - It is right for you, O God, to have praise in Zion: to you let the offering be made.

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 2
text: To you, O hearer of prayer, let the words of all flesh come.

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 3
text: Evils have overcome us: but as for our sins, you will take them away.

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 4
text: Happy is the man of your selection, to whom you give a resting-place in your house; we will be full of the good things out of your holy place.

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 5
text: You will give us an answer in righteousness by great acts of power, O God of our salvation; you who are the hope of all the ends of the earth, and of the far-off lands of the sea;

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 6
text: The God by whose strength the mountains are fixed; who is robed with power:

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 7
text: Who makes the loud voice of the sea quiet, and puts an end to the sound of its waves.

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 8
text: Those in the farthest parts of the earth have fear when they see your signs: the outgoings of the morning and evening are glad because of you.

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 9
text: You have given your blessing to the earth, watering it and making it fertile; the river of God is full of water: and having made it ready, you give men grain.

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 10
text: You make the ploughed lands full of water; you make smooth the slopes: you make the earth soft with showers, sending your blessing on its growth.

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 11
text: The year is crowned with the good you give; life-giving rain is dropping from your footsteps,

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 12
text: Falling on the grass of the waste land: and the little hills are glad on every side.

title: Psalms Chapter 65 Verse 13
text: The grass-land is thick with flocks; the valleys are full of grain; they give glad cries and songs of joy.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. A Song. A Psalm. - Send up a glad cry to God, all the earth:

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 2
text: Make a song in honour of his name: give praise and glory to him.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 3
text: Say to God, How greatly to be feared are your works! because of your great power your haters are forced to put themselves under your feet.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 4
text: Let all the earth give you worship, and make songs to you; let them make songs to your name. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 5
text: Come and see the works of God: he is to be feared in all he does to the children of men.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 6
text: The sea was turned into dry land: they went through the river on foot: there did we have joy in him.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 7
text: He is ruling in power for ever; his eyes are watching the nations: may his haters have no strength against him. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 8
text: Give blessings to our God, O you peoples, let the voice of his praise be loud;

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 9
text: Because he gives us life, and has not let our feet be moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 10
text: For you, O God, have put us to the test: testing us by fire like silver.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 11
text: You let us be put in prison; chains were put on our legs.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 12
text: You let men go driving over our heads; we went through fire and through water; but you took us out into a wide place.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 13
text: I will come into your house with burned offerings, I will make payment of my debt to you,

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 14
text: Keeping the word which came from my lips, and which my mouth said, when I was in trouble.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 15
text: I will give you burned offerings of fat beasts, and the smoke of sheep; I will make offerings of oxen and goats. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 16
text: Come, give ear to me, all you God-fearing men, so that I may make clear to you what he has done for my soul.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 17
text: My voice went up to him, and I was lifted up from the underworld.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 18
text: I said in my heart, The Lord will not give ear to me:

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 19
text: But truly God's ear has been open; he has give attention to the voice of my prayer.

title: Psalms Chapter 66 Verse 20
text: Praise be to God who has not taken away his good faith and his mercy from me.

title: Psalms Chapter 67 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. With corded instruments. A Psalm. A Song. - May God give us mercy and blessing, and let the light of his face be shining on us; (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 67 Verse 2
text: So that men may see your way on the earth, and your salvation among all nations.

title: Psalms Chapter 67 Verse 3
text: Let the peoples give you praise, O God; let all the peoples give you praise.

title: Psalms Chapter 67 Verse 4
text: O let the nations be glad, and make song of joy; for you will be the judge of the peoples in righteousness, guiding the nations of the earth. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 67 Verse 5
text: Let the peoples give you praise, O God; let all the peoples give you praise.

title: Psalms Chapter 67 Verse 6
text: The earth has given her increase; and God, even our God, will give us his blessing.

title: Psalms Chapter 67 Verse 7
text: God will give us his blessing; so let all the ends of the earth be in fear of him.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. Of David. A Psalm. A Song. - Let God be seen, and let his haters be put to flight; let those who are against him be turned back before him.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 2
text: Let them be like smoke before the driving wind; as wax turning soft before the fire, so let them come to an end before the power of God.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 3
text: But let the upright be glad; let them have delight before God; let them be full of joy.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 4
text: Make songs to God, make songs of praise to his name; make a way for him who comes through the waste lands; his name is Jah; be glad before him.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 5
text: A father to those who have no father, a judge of the widows, is God in his holy place.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 6
text: Those who are without friends, God puts in families; he makes free those who are in chains; but those who are turned away from him are given a dry land.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 7
text: O God, when you went out before your people, wandering through the waste land; (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 8
text: The earth was shaking and the heavens were streaming, because God was present; even Sinai itself was moved before God, the God of Israel.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 9
text: You, O God, did freely send the rain, giving strength to the weariness of your heritage.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 10
text: Those whose resting-place was there, even the poor, were comforted by your good things, O God.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 11
text: The Lord gives the word; great is the number of the women who make it public.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 12
text: Kings of armies quickly go in flight: and the women in the houses make a division of their goods.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 13
text: Will you take your rest among the flocks? like the wings of a dove covered with silver, and its feathers with yellow gold.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 14
text: When the Most High put the kings to flight, it was as white as snow in Salmon.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 15
text: A hill of God is the hill of Bashan; a hill with high tops is the hill of Bashan.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 16
text: Why are you looking with envy, you high hills, on the hill desired by God as his resting-place? truly, God will make it his house for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 17
text: The war-carriage of God is among Israel's thousands; the Lord has come from Sinai to the holy place.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 18
text: You have gone up on high, taking your prisoners with you; you have taken offerings from men; the Lord God has taken his place on the seat of his power.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 19
text: Praise be to the Lord, who is our support day by day, even the God of our salvation. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 20
text: Our God is for us a God of salvation; his are the ways out of death.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 21
text: The heads of the haters of God will be crushed; even the head of him who still goes on in his evil ways.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 22
text: The Lord said, I will make them come back from Bashan, and from the deep parts of the sea;

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 23
text: So that your foot may be red with blood, and the tongues of your dogs with the same.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 24
text: We see your going, O God: even the going of my God, my King, into the holy place.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 25
text: The makers of songs go before, the players of music come after, among the young girls playing on brass instruments.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 26
text: Give praise to God in the great meeting; even the Lord, you who come from the fountain of Israel.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 27
text: There is little Benjamin ruling them, the chiefs of Judah and their army, the rulers of Zebulun and the rulers of Naphtali.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 28
text: O God, send out your strength; the strength, O God, with which you have done great things for us,

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 29
text: Out of your Temple in Jerusalem.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 30
text: Say sharp words to the beast among the water-plants, the band of strong ones, with the lords of the peoples, put an end to the people whose delight is in war.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 31
text: Kings will give you offerings, they will come out of Egypt; from Pathros will come offerings of silver; Ethiopia will be stretching out her hands to God.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 32
text: Make songs to God, you kingdoms of the earth; O make songs of praise to the Lord; (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 33
text: To him who goes or the clouds of heaven, the heaven which was from earliest times; he sends out his voice of power.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 34
text: Make clear that strength is God's: he is lifted up over Israel, and his power is in the clouds.

title: Psalms Chapter 68 Verse 35
text: O God, you are to be feared in your holy place: the God of Israel gives strength and power to his people. Praise be to God.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to Shoshannim. Of David. - Be my saviour, O God; because the waters have come in, even to my neck.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 2
text: My feet are deep in the soft earth, where there is no support; I have come into deep waters, the waves are flowing over me.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 3
text: I am tired with my crying; my throat is burning: my eyes are wasted with waiting for my God.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 4
text: Those who have hate for me without cause are greater in number than the hairs of my head; those who are against me, falsely desiring my destruction, are very strong; I gave back what I had not taken away.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 5
text: O God, you see how foolish I am; and my wrongdoing is clear to you.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 6
text: Let not those who have hope in you be put to shame because of me, O Lord God of armies: let not those who are waiting for you be made low because of me, O God of Israel.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 7
text: I have been wounded with sharp words because of you; my face has been covered with shame.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 8
text: I have become strange to my brothers, and like a man from a far country to my mother's children.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 9
text: I am on fire with passion for your house; and the hard things which are said about you have come on me.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 10
text: My bitter weeping, and my going without food, were turned to my shame.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 11
text: When I put on the clothing of grief, they said evil of me.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 12
text: I am a cause of wonder to those in authority; a song to those who are given to strong drink.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 13
text: But as for me, let my prayer be made to you, O Lord, at a time when you are pleased; O God, give me an answer in your great mercy, for your salvation is certain.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 14
text: Take me from the grip of the sticky earth, so that I may not go down into it; let me be lifted up from the deep waters.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 15
text: Let me not be covered by the flowing waters; let not the deep waters go over my head, and let me not be shut up in the underworld.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 16
text: Give an answer to my words, O Lord; for your mercy is good: be turned to me, because of your great pity.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 17
text: Let not your face be covered from your servant, for I am in trouble; quickly give me an answer.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 18
text: Come near to my soul, for its salvation: be my saviour, because of those who are against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 19
text: You have seen my shame, how I was laughed at and made low; my haters are all before you.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 20
text: My heart is broken by bitter words, I am full of grief; I made a search for some to have pity on me, but there was no one; I had no comforter.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 21
text: They gave me poison for my food; and bitter wine for my drink.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 22
text: Let their table before them be for their destruction; let their feasts become a net to take them.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 23
text: Let their eyes be blind so that they may not see; let their bodies for ever be shaking.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 24
text: Let your curse come on them; let the heat of your wrath overtake them.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 25
text: Give their houses to destruction, and let there be no one in their tents.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 26
text: Because they are cruel to him against whom your hand is turned; they make bitter the grief of him who is wounded by you.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 27
text: Let their punishment be increased; let them not come into your righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 28
text: Let their names be taken from the book of the living, let them not be numbered with the upright.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 29
text: But I am poor and full of sorrow; let me be lifted up by your salvation, O Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 30
text: I will give praise to the name of God with a song; I will give glory to him for what he has done.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 31
text: This will be more pleasing to the Lord than an ox, or a young ox of full growth.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 32
text: The poor will see it and be glad: you who are lovers of God, let your hearts have life.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 33
text: For the ears of the Lord are open to the poor, and he takes thought for his prisoners.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 34
text: Let the heavens and the earth give praise to him, the seas, and everything moving in them.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 35
text: For God will be the saviour of Zion, and the builder of the towns of Judah; so that it may be their resting-place and heritage.

title: Psalms Chapter 69 Verse 36
text: The seed of his servants will have their part in it, and there the lovers of his name will have rest.

title: Psalms Chapter 70 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. Of David. To keep in memory. - Let your salvation come quickly, O God; come quickly to my help, O Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 70 Verse 2
text: Let those who go after my soul have shame and trouble; let those who have evil designs against me be turned back and made foolish.

title: Psalms Chapter 70 Verse 3
text: Let those who say Aha, aha! be turned back as a reward of their shame.

title: Psalms Chapter 70 Verse 4
text: Let all those who are looking for you be glad and have joy in you; let the lovers of your salvation ever say, May God be great.

title: Psalms Chapter 70 Verse 5
text: But I am poor and in need; come to me quickly, O God; you are my help and my saviour; let there be no waiting, O Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 1
text: In you, O Lord, have I put my hope; let me never be shamed.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 2
text: Keep me safe in your righteousness, and come to my help; give ear to my voice, and be my saviour.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 3
text: Be my strong Rock, the strong place of my salvation; for you are my Rock, and my safe place.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 4
text: O my God, take me out of the hand of the sinner, out of the hand of the evil and cruel man.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 5
text: For you are my hope, O Lord God; I have had faith in you from the time when I was young.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 6
text: You have been my support from the day of my birth; you took me out of my mother's body; my praise will be ever of you.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 7
text: I am a wonder to all; but you are my strong tower.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 8
text: My mouth will be full of your praise and glory all the day.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 9
text: Do not give me up when I am old; be my help even when my strength is gone.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 10
text: For my haters are waiting secretly for me; and those who are watching for my soul are banded together in their evil designs,

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 11
text: Saying, God has given him up; go after him and take him, for he has no helper.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 12
text: O God, be not far from me; O my God, come quickly to my help.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 13
text: Let those who say evil against my soul be overcome and put to shame; let my haters be made low and have no honour.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 14
text: But I will go on ever hoping, and increasing in all your praise.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 15
text: My mouth will make clear your righteousness and your salvation all the day; for they are more than may be measured.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 16
text: I will give news of the great acts of the Lord God; my words will be of your righteousness, and of yours only.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 17
text: O God, you have been my teacher from the time when I was young; and I have been talking of your works of wonder even till now.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 18
text: Now when I am old and grey-headed, O God, give me not up; till I have made clear your strength to this generation, and your power to all those to come.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 19
text: Your righteousness, O God, is very high; you have done great things; O God, who is like you?

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 20
text: You, who have sent great and bitter troubles on me, will give me life again, lifting me up from the deep waters of the underworld.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 21
text: You will make me greater than before, and give me comfort on every side.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 22
text: I will give praise to you with instruments of music, O my God, for you are true; I will make songs to you with music, O Holy One of Israel.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 23
text: Joy will be on my lips when I make melody to you; and in my soul, to which you have given salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 71 Verse 24
text: My tongue will be talking of your righteousness all the day; for those whose purpose is to do me evil have been crushed and put to shame.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 1
text: - Of Solomon. - Give the king your authority, O God, and your righteousness to the king's son.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 2
text: May he be a judge of your people in righteousness, and make true decisions for the poor.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 3
text: May the mountains give peace to the people, and the hills righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 4
text: May he be a judge of the poor among the people, may he give salvation to the children of those who are in need; by him let the violent be crushed.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 5
text: May his life go on as long as the sun and moon, through all generations.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 6
text: May he come down like rain on the cut grass; like showers watering the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 7
text: In his days may the upright do well, living in peace as long as there is a moon in heaven.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 8
text: Let his kingdom be from sea to sea, from the River to the ends of the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 9
text: Let those who are against him go down before him; and let his haters be low in the dust.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 10
text: Let the kings of Tarshish and of the islands come back with offerings; let the kings of Sheba and Seba give of their stores.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 11
text: Yes, let all kings go down before him; let all nations be his servants.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 12
text: For he will be a saviour to the poor in answer to his cry; and to him who is in need, without a helper.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 13
text: He will have pity on the poor, and be the saviour of those who are in need.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 14
text: He will keep their souls free from evil designs and violent attacks; and their blood will be of value in his eyes.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 15
text: May he have long life, and may gold from Sheba be given to him: may prayers be made for him at all times; may blessings be on him every day.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 16
text: May there be wide-stretching fields of grain in the land, shaking on the top of the mountains, full of fruit like Lebanon: may its stems be unnumbered like the grass of the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 17
text: May his name go on for ever, as long as the sun: may men be blessing themselves by him; may all nations be blessing his name.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 18
text: Praise be to the Lord God, the God of Israel, the only doer of wonders.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 19
text: Praise to the glory of his noble name for ever; let all the earth be full of his glory. So be it, So be it.

title: Psalms Chapter 72 Verse 20
text: The prayers of David, the son of Jesse, are ended. - A Psalm. Of Asaph. -

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 1
text: Truly, God is good to Israel, even to such as are clean in heart.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 2
text: But as for me, my feet had almost gone from under me; I was near to slipping;

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 3
text: Because of my envy of the men of pride, when I saw the well-being of the wrongdoers.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 4
text: For they have no pain; their bodies are fat and strong.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 5
text: They are not in trouble as others are; they have no part in the unhappy fate of men.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 6
text: For this reason pride is round them like a chain; they are clothed with violent behaviour as with a robe.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 7
text: Their eyes are bursting with fat; they have more than their heart's desire.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 8
text: Their thoughts are deep with evil designs; their talk from their seats of power is of cruel acts.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 9
text: Their mouth goes up to heaven; their tongues go walking through the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 10
text: For this reason they are full of bread; and water is ever flowing for them.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 11
text: And they say, How will the Lord see this? is there knowledge in the Most High?

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 12
text: Truly, such are the sinners; they do well at all times, and their wealth is increased.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 13
text: As for me, I have made my heart clean to no purpose, washing my hands in righteousness;

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 14
text: For I have been troubled all the day; every morning have I undergone punishment.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 15
text: If I would make clear what it is like, I would say, You are false to the generation of your children.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 16
text: When my thoughts were turned to see the reason of this, it was a weariness in my eyes;

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 17
text: Till I went into God's holy place, and saw the end of the evil-doers.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 18
text: You put their feet where there was danger of slipping, so that they go down into destruction.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 19
text: How suddenly are they wasted! fears are the cause of their destruction.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 20
text: As a dream when one is awake, they are ended; they are like an image gone out of mind when sleep is over.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 21
text: My heart was made bitter, and I was pained by the bite of grief:

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 22
text: As for me, I was foolish, and without knowledge; I was like a beast before you.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 23
text: But still I am ever with you; you have taken me by my right hand.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 24
text: Your wisdom will be my guide, and later you will put me in a place of honour.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 25
text: Whom have I in heaven but you? and having you I have no desire for anything on earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 26
text: My flesh and my heart are wasting away: but God is the Rock of my heart and my eternal heritage.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 27
text: For those who are far away from you will come to destruction: you will put an end to all those who have not kept faith with you.

title: Psalms Chapter 73 Verse 28
text: But it is good for me to come near to God: I have put my faith in the Lord God, so that I may make clear all his works.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 1
text: - Maschil. Of Asaph. - Of God, why have you put us away from you for ever? why is the fire of your wrath smoking against the sheep who are your care?

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 2
text: Keep in mind your band of worshippers, for whom you gave payment in the days which are past, whom you took for yourself as the people of your heritage; even this mountain of Zion, which has been your resting-place.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 3
text: Go up and see the unending destruction; all the evil which your haters have done in the holy place;

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 4
text: Sending out their voices like lions among your worshippers; they have put up their signs to be seen.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 5
text: They are cutting down, like a man whose blade is lifted up against the thick trees.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 6
text: Your doors are broken down with hammers and iron blades.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 7
text: They have put on fire your holy place; they have made the place of your name unclean, pulling it down to the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 8
text: They have said in their hearts, Let us put an end to them all together; they have given over to the fire all God's places of worship in the land.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 9
text: We do not see our signs: there is no longer any prophet, or anyone among us to say how long.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 10
text: O God, how long will those who are against us say cruel things? will the hater go on looking down on your name for ever?

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 11
text: Why are you keeping back your hand, and covering your right hand in your robe?

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 12
text: For from the past God is my King, working salvation in the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 13
text: The sea was parted in two by your strength; the heads of the great sea-beasts were broken.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 14
text: The heads of the great snake were crushed by you; you gave them as food to the fishes of the sea.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 15
text: You made valleys for fountains and springs; you made the ever-flowing rivers dry.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 16
text: The day is yours and the night is yours: you made the light and the sun.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 17
text: By you all the limits of the earth were fixed; you have made summer and winter.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 18
text: Keep this in mind, O Lord, that your haters have said cruel things, and that your name has been looked down on by a people of evil behaviour.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 19
text: O give not the soul of your dove to the hawk; let not the life of the poor go out of your memory for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 20
text: Keep in mind your undertaking; for the dark places of the earth are full of pride and cruel acts.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 21
text: O let not the crushed be turned back in shame; let the low man and the poor give praise to your name.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 22
text: Up! O God, be the judge of your cause; keep in mind the bitter things which the man of evil behaviour says against you every day.

title: Psalms Chapter 74 Verse 23
text: Keep in mind the voice of your haters; the outcry of those who come against you goes up every day.

title: Psalms Chapter 75 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to Al-tashheth. A Psalm. Of Asaph. A Song. - To you, O God, we give praise, to you we give praise: and those who give honour to your name make clear your works of power.

title: Psalms Chapter 75 Verse 2
text: When the right time has come, I will be the judge in righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 75 Verse 3
text: When the earth and all its people become feeble, I am the support of its pillars. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 75 Verse 4
text: I say to the men of pride, Let your pride be gone: and to the sinners, Let not your horn be lifted up.

title: Psalms Chapter 75 Verse 5
text: Let not your horn be lifted up: let no more words of pride come from your outstretched necks.

title: Psalms Chapter 75 Verse 6
text: For honour does not come from the east, or from the west, or uplifting from the south;

title: Psalms Chapter 75 Verse 7
text: But God is the judge, putting down one, and lifting up another.

title: Psalms Chapter 75 Verse 8
text: For in the hand of the Lord is a cup, and the wine is red; it is well mixed, overflowing from his hand: he will make all the sinners of the earth take of it, even to the last drop.

title: Psalms Chapter 75 Verse 9
text: But I will ever be full of joy, making songs of praise to the God of Jacob.

title: Psalms Chapter 75 Verse 10
text: By him will all the horns of the sinners be cut off; but the horns of the upright will be lifted up.

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to Neginoth. A Psalm. Of Asaph. A Song. -

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 2
text: In Judah is the knowledge of God; his name is great in Israel,

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 3
text: In Salem is his tent, his resting-place in Zion.

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 4
text: There were the arrows of the bow broken, there he put an end to body-cover, sword, and fight. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 5
text: You are shining and full of glory, more than the eternal mountains.

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 6
text: Gone is the wealth of the strong, their last sleep has overcome them; the men of war have become feeble.

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 7
text: At the voice of your wrath, O God of Jacob, deep sleep has overcome carriage and horse.

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 8
text: You, you are to be feared; who may keep his place before you in the time of your wrath?

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 9
text: From heaven you gave your decision; the earth, in its fear, gave no sound,

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 10
text: When God took his place as judge, for the salvation of the poor on the earth. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 11
text: The ... will give you praise; the rest of ...

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 12
text: Give to the Lord your God what is his by right; let all who are round him give offerings to him who is to be feared.

title: Psalms Chapter 76 Verse 13
text: He puts an end to the wrath of rulers; he is feared by the kings of the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. After Jeduthun. Of Asaph. A Psalm. - I was crying to God with my voice; even to God with my voice, and he gave ear to me.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 2
text: In the day of my trouble, my heart was turned to the Lord: my hand was stretched out in the night without resting; my soul would not be comforted.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 3
text: I will keep God in memory, with sounds of grief; my thoughts are troubled, and my spirit is overcome. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 4
text: You keep my eyes from sleep; I am so troubled that no words come.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 5
text: My thoughts go back to the days of the past, to the years which are gone.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 6
text: The memory of my song comes back to me in the night; my thoughts are moving in my heart; my spirit is searching with care.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 7
text: Will the Lord put me away for ever? will he be kind no longer?

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 8
text: Is his mercy quite gone for ever? has his word come to nothing?

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 9
text: Has God put away the memory of his pity? are his mercies shut up by his wrath? (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 10
text: And I said, It is a weight on my spirit; but I will keep in mind the years of the right hand of the Most High.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 11
text: I will keep in mind the works of Jah: I will keep the memory of your wonders in the past.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 12
text: I will give thought to all your work, while my mind goes over your acts of power.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 13
text: Your way, O God, is holy: what god is so great as our God?

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 14
text: You are the God who does works of power: you have made your strength clear to the nations.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 15
text: With your arm you have made your people free, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 16
text: The waters saw you, O God; the waters saw you, they were in fear: even the deep was troubled.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 17
text: The clouds sent out water; the skies gave out a sound; truly, your arrows went far and wide.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 18
text: The voice of your thunder went rolling on; the world was flaming with the light of the storm; the earth was shaking.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 19
text: Your way was in the sea, and your road in the great waters; there was no knowledge of your footsteps.

title: Psalms Chapter 77 Verse 20
text: You were guiding your people like a flock, by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 1
text: - Maschil. Of Asaph. - Give ear, O my people, to my law; let your ears be bent down to the words of my mouth.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 2
text: Opening my mouth I will give out a story, even the dark sayings of old times;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 3
text: Which have come to our hearing and our knowledge, as they were given to us by our fathers.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 4
text: We will not keep them secret from our children; we will make clear to the coming generation the praises of the Lord and his strength, and the great works of wonder which he has done.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 5
text: He put up a witness in Jacob, and made a law in Israel; which he gave to our fathers so that they might give knowledge of them to their children;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 6
text: So that the generation to come might have knowledge of them, even the children of the future, who would give word of them to their children;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 7
text: So that they might put their hope in God, and not let God's works go out of their minds, but keep his laws;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 8
text: And not be like their fathers, a stiff-necked and uncontrolled generation; a generation whose heart was hard, whose spirit was not true to God.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 9
text: The children of Ephraim, armed with bows, were turned back on the day of the fight.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 10
text: They were not ruled by God's word, and they would not go in the way of his law;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 11
text: They let his works go out of their memory, and the wonders which he had made them see.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 12
text: He did great works before the eyes of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the fields of Zoan.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 13
text: The sea was cut in two so that they might go through; the waters were massed together on this side and on that.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 14
text: In the daytime he was guiding them in the cloud, and all through the night with a light of fire.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 15
text: The rocks of the waste land were broken by his power, and he gave them drink as out of the deep waters.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 16
text: He made streams come out of the rock; and waters came flowing down like rivers.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 17
text: And they went on sinning against him even more, turning away from the Most High in the waste land;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 18
text: Testing God in their hearts, requesting meat for their desire.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 19
text: They said bitter words against God, saying, Is God able to make ready a table in the waste land?

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 20
text: See, the rock was cut open by his power, so that the water came rushing out, and overflowing streams; is he able to give us bread? is he able to get meat for his people?

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 21
text: So these things came to the Lord's ears, and he was angry; and a fire was lighted against Jacob, and wrath came up against Israel;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 22
text: Because they had no faith in God, and no hope in his salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 23
text: And he gave orders to the clouds on high, and the doors of heaven were open;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 24
text: And he sent down manna like rain for their food, and gave them the grain of heaven.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 25
text: Man took part in the food of strong ones; he sent them meat in full measure.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 26
text: He sent an east wind from heaven, driving on the south wind by his power.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 27
text: He sent down meat on them like dust, and feathered birds like the sand of the sea,

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 28
text: And he let it come down into their resting-place, round about their tents.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 29
text: So they had food and were full; for he gave them their desire;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 30
text: But they were not turned from their desires; and while the food was still in their mouths,

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 31
text: The wrath of God came on them, and put to death the fattest of them, and put an end to the young men of Israel.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 32
text: For all this they went on sinning even more, and had no faith in his great wonders.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 33
text: So their days were wasted like a breath, and their years in trouble.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 34
text: When he sent death on them, then they made search for him; turning to him and looking for him with care;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 35
text: In the memory that God was their Rock, and the Most High God their saviour.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 36
text: But their lips were false to him, and their tongues were untrue to him;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 37
text: And their hearts were not right with him, and they did not keep their agreement with him.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 38
text: But he, being full of pity, has forgiveness for sin, and does not put an end to man: frequently turning back his wrath, and not being violently angry.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 39
text: So he kept in mind that they were only flesh; a breath which is quickly gone, and will not come again.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 40
text: How frequently did they go against him in the waste land, and give him cause for grief in the dry places!

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 41
text: Again they put God to the test, and gave pain to the Holy One of Israel.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 42
text: They did not keep in mind the work of his hand, or the day when he took them from the power of their haters;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 43
text: How he had done his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 44
text: So that their rivers were turned to blood, and they were not able to get drink from their streams.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 45
text: He sent different sorts of flies among them, poisoning their flesh; and frogs for their destruction.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 46
text: He gave the increase of their fields to worms, the fruits of their industry to the locusts.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 47
text: He sent ice for the destruction of their vines; their trees were damaged by the bitter cold.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 48
text: Ice was rained down on their cattle; thunderstorms sent destruction among the flocks.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 49
text: He sent on them the heat of his wrath, his bitter disgust, letting loose evil angels among them.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 50
text: He let his wrath have its way; he did not keep back their soul from death, but gave their life to disease.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 51
text: He gave to destruction all the first sons of Egypt; the first-fruits of their strength in the tents of Ham;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 52
text: But he took his people out like sheep, guiding them in the waste land like a flock.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 53
text: He took them on safely so that they had no fear; but their haters were covered by the sea.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 54
text: And he was their guide to his holy land, even to the mountain, which his right hand had made his;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 55
text: Driving out nations before them, marking out the line of their heritage, and giving the people of Israel their tents for a resting-place.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 56
text: But they were bitter against the Most High God, testing him, and not keeping his laws;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 57
text: Their hearts were turned back and untrue like their fathers; they were turned to one side like a twisted bow.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 58
text: They made him angry with their high places; moving him to wrath with their images.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 59
text: When this came to God's ears he was very angry, and gave up Israel completely;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 60
text: So that he went away from the holy place in Shiloh, the tent which he had put among men;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 61
text: And he let his strength be taken prisoner, and gave his glory into the hands of his hater.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 62
text: He gave his people up to the sword, and was angry with his heritage.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 63
text: Their young men were burned in the fire; and their virgins were not praised in the bride-song.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 64
text: Their priests were put to death by the sword, and their widows made no weeping for them.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 65
text: Then was the Lord like one awaking from sleep, and like a strong man crying out because of wine.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 66
text: His haters were turned back by his blows and shamed for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 67
text: And he put the tent of Joseph on one side, and took not the tribe of Ephraim;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 68
text: But he took the tribe of Judah for himself, and the mountain of Zion, in which he had pleasure.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 69
text: And he made his holy place like the high heaven, like the earth which is fixed by him for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 70
text: He took David to be his servant, taking him from the place of the flocks;

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 71
text: From looking after the sheep which were giving milk, he took him to give food to Jacob his people, and to Israel his heritage.

title: Psalms Chapter 78 Verse 72
text: So he gave them food with an upright heart, guiding them by the wisdom of his hands.

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. Of Asaph. - O God, the nations have come into your heritage; they have made your holy Temple unclean; they have made Jerusalem a mass of broken walls.

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 2
text: They have given the bodies of your servants as food to the birds of the air, and the flesh of your saints to the beasts of the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 3
text: Their blood has been flowing like water round about Jerusalem; there was no one to put them in their last resting-place.

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 4
text: We are looked down on by our neighbours, we are laughed at and made sport of by those who are round us.

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 5
text: How long, O Lord? will you be angry for ever? will your wrath go on burning like fire?

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 6
text: Let your wrath be on the nations who have no knowledge of you, and on the kingdoms who have not made prayer to your name.

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 7
text: For they have taken Jacob for their meat, and made waste his house.

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 8
text: Do not keep in mind against us the sins of our fathers; let your mercy come to us quickly, for we have been made very low.

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 9
text: Give us help, O God of our salvation, for the glory of your name; take us out of danger and give us forgiveness for our sins, because of your name.

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 10
text: Why may the nations say, Where is their God? Let payment for the blood of your servants be made openly among the nations before our eyes.

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 11
text: Let the cry of the prisoner come before you; with your strong arm make free the children of death;

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 12
text: And give punishment seven times over into the breast of our neighbours for the bitter words which they have said against you, O Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 79 Verse 13
text: So we your people, and the sheep of your flock, will give you glory for ever: we will go on praising you through all generations.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to Shoshannim-eduth. Of Asaph. A Psalm. - Give ear, O Keeper of Israel, guiding Joseph like a flock; you who have your seat on the winged ones, let your glory be seen.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 2
text: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, let your strength be awake from sleep, and come as our salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 3
text: Take us back again, O God; let us see the shining of your face, and let us be safe.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 4
text: O Lord God of armies, how long will your wrath be burning against the rest of your people?

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 5
text: You have given them the bread of weeping for food; for their drink you have given them sorrow in great measure.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 6
text: You make us a cause of war among our neighbours; our haters are laughing at us among themselves.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 7
text: Take us back again, O God of armies; let us see the shining of your face, and let us be safe.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 8
text: You took a vine out of Egypt: driving out the nations, and planting it in their land.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 9
text: You made ready a place for it, so that it might take deep root, and it sent out its branches over all the land.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 10
text: The mountains were covered with its shade, and the great trees with its branches.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 11
text: It sent out its arms to the Sea, and its branches to the River.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 12
text: Why are its walls broken down by your hands, so that all who go by may take its fruit?

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 13
text: It is uprooted by the pigs from the woods, the beasts of the field get their food from it.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 14
text: Come back, O God of armies: from heaven let your eyes be turned to this vine, and give your mind to it,

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 15
text: Even to the tree which was planted by your right hand, and to the branch which you made strong for yourself.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 16
text: It is burned with fire; it is cut down: they are made waste by the wrath of your face.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 17
text: Let your hand be on the man of your right hand, on the son of man whom you made strong for yourself.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 18
text: So will we not be turned back from you; keep us in life, and we will give praise to your name.

title: Psalms Chapter 80 Verse 19
text: Take us back, O Lord God of armies; let us see the shining of your face, and let us be safe.

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to the Gittith. Of Asaph. - Make a song to God our strength: make a glad cry to the God of Jacob.

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 2
text: Take up the melody, playing on an instrument of music, even on corded instruments.

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 3
text: Let the horn be sounded in the time of the new moon, at the full moon, on our holy feast-day:

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 4
text: For this is a rule for Israel, and a law of the God of Jacob.

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 5
text: He gave it to Joseph as a witness, when he went out over the land of Egypt; then the words of a strange tongue were sounding in my ears.

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 6
text: I took the weight from his back; his hands were made free from the baskets.

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 7
text: You gave a cry in your trouble, and I made you free; I gave you an answer in the secret place of the thunder; I put you to the test at the waters of Meribah. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 8
text: Give ear, O my people, and I will give you my word, O Israel, if you will only do as I say!

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 9
text: There is to be no strange god among you; you are not to give worship to any other god.

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 10
text: I am the Lord your God, who took you up from the land of Egypt: let your mouth be open wide, so that I may give you food.

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 11
text: But my people did not give ear to my voice; Israel would have nothing to do with me.

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 12
text: So I gave them up to the desires of their hearts; that they might go after their evil purposes.

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 13
text: If only my people would give ear to me, walking in my ways!

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 14
text: I would quickly overcome their haters: my hand would be turned against those who make war on them.

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 15
text: The haters of the Lord would be broken, and their destruction would be eternal.

title: Psalms Chapter 81 Verse 16
text: I would give them the best grain for food; you would be full of honey from the rock.

title: Psalms Chapter 82 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. Of Asaph. - God is in the meeting-place of God; he is judging among the gods.

title: Psalms Chapter 82 Verse 2
text: How long will you go on judging falsely, having respect for the persons of evil-doers? (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 82 Verse 3
text: Give ear to the cause of the poor and the children without fathers; let those who are troubled and in need have their rights.

title: Psalms Chapter 82 Verse 4
text: Be the saviour of the poor and those who have nothing: take them out of the hand of the evil-doers.

title: Psalms Chapter 82 Verse 5
text: They have no knowledge or sense; they go about in the dark: all the bases of the earth are moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 82 Verse 6
text: I said, You are gods; all of you are the sons of the Most High:

title: Psalms Chapter 82 Verse 7
text: But you will come to death like men, falling like one of the rulers of the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 82 Verse 8
text: Up! O God, come as judge of the earth; for all the nations are your heritage.

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 1
text: - A Song. A Psalm. Of Asaph. - O God, do not keep quiet: let your lips be open and take no rest, O God.

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 2
text: For see! those who make war on you are out of control; your haters are lifting up their heads.

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 3
text: They have made wise designs against your people, talking together against those whom you keep in a secret place.

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 4
text: They have said, Come, let us put an end to them as a nation; so that the name of Israel may go out of man's memory.

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 5
text: For they have all come to an agreement; they are all joined together against you:

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 6
text: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; Moab and the Hagarites;

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 7
text: Gebal and Ammon and Amalek; the Philistines and the people of Tyre;

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 8
text: Assur is joined with them; they have become the support of the children of Lot. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 9
text: Do to them what you did to the Midianites; what you did to Sisera and Jabin, at the stream of Kishon:

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 10
text: Who came to destruction at En-dor; their bodies became dust and waste.

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 11
text: Make their chiefs like Oreb and Zeeb; and all their rulers like Zebah and Zalmunna:

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 12
text: Who have said, Let us take for our heritage the resting-place of God.

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 13
text: O my God, make them like the rolling dust; like dry stems before the wind.

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 14
text: As fire burning a wood, and as a flame causing fire on the mountains,

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 15
text: So go after them with your strong wind, and let them be full of fear because of your storm.

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 16
text: Let their faces be full of shame; so that they may give honour to your name, O Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 17
text: Let them be overcome and troubled for ever; let them be put to shame and come to destruction;

title: Psalms Chapter 83 Verse 18
text: So that men may see that you only, whose name is Yahweh, are Most High over all the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 84 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker; put to the Gittith A Psalm. Of the sons of Korah. - How dear are your tents, O Lord of armies!

title: Psalms Chapter 84 Verse 2
text: The passion of my soul's desire is for the house of the Lord; my heart and my flesh are crying out for the living God.

title: Psalms Chapter 84 Verse 3
text: The little birds have places for themselves, where they may put their young, even your altars, O Lord of armies, my King and my God.

title: Psalms Chapter 84 Verse 4
text: Happy are they whose resting-place is in your house: they will still be praising you. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 84 Verse 5
