text: Happy is the man whose strength is in you; in whose heart are the highways to Zion.

title: Psalms Chapter 84 Verse 6
text: Going through the valley of balsam-trees, they make it a place of springs; it is clothed with blessings by the early rain.

title: Psalms Chapter 84 Verse 7
text: They go from strength to strength; every one of them comes before God in Zion.

title: Psalms Chapter 84 Verse 8
text: O Lord God of armies, let my prayer come to you: give ear, O God of Jacob. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 84 Verse 9
text: O God, let your eyes be on him who is our safe cover, and let your heart be turned to your king.

title: Psalms Chapter 84 Verse 10
text: For a day in your house is better than a thousand. It is better to be a door-keeper in the house of my God, than to be living in the tents of sin.

title: Psalms Chapter 84 Verse 11
text: The Lord God is our sun and our strength: the Lord will give grace and glory: he will not keep back any good thing from those whose ways are upright.

title: Psalms Chapter 84 Verse 12
text: O Lord of armies, happy is the man whose hope is in you.

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. A Psalm. Of the sons of Korah. - Lord, you were good to your land: changing the fate of Jacob.

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 2
text: The wrongdoing of your people had forgiveness; all their sin had been covered. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 3
text: You were no longer angry: you were turned from the heat of your wrath.

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 4
text: Come back to us, O God of our salvation, and be angry with us no longer.

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 5
text: Will you go on being angry with us for ever? will you keep your wrath against us through all the long generations?

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 6
text: Will you not give us life again, so that your people may be glad in you?

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 7
text: Let us see your mercy, O Lord, and give us your salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 8
text: I will give ear to the voice of the Lord; for he will say words of peace to his people and to his saints; but let them not go back to their foolish ways.

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 9
text: Truly, his salvation is near to his worshippers; so that glory may be in our land.

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 10
text: Mercy and faith have come together; righteousness and peace have given one another a kiss.

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 11
text: Faith comes up from the earth like a plant; righteousness is looking down from heaven.

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 12
text: The Lord will give what is good; and our land will give its increase.

title: Psalms Chapter 85 Verse 13
text: Righteousness will go before him, making a way for his footsteps.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 1
text: - A Prayer. Of David. - Let your ears be open to my voice, O Lord, and give me an answer; for I am poor and in need.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 2
text: Keep my soul, for I am true to you; O my God, give salvation to your servant, whose hope is in you.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 3
text: Have mercy on me, O Lord; for my cry goes up to you all the day.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 4
text: Make glad the soul of your servant; for it is lifted up to you, O Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 5
text: You are good, O Lord, and full of forgiveness; your mercy is great to all who make their cry to you.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 6
text: O Lord, give ear to my prayer; and take note of the sound of my requests.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 7
text: In the day of my trouble I send up my cry to you; for you will give me an answer.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 8
text: There is no god like you, O Lord; there are no works like your works.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 9
text: Let all the nations whom you have made come and give worship to you, O Lord, giving glory to your name.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 10
text: For you are great, and do great works of wonder; you only are God.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 11
text: Make your way clear to me, O Lord; I will go on my way in your faith: let my heart be glad in the fear of your name.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 12
text: I will give you praise, O Lord my God, with all my heart; I will give glory to your name for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 13
text: For your mercy to me is great; you have taken my soul up from the deep places of the underworld.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 14
text: O God, men of pride have come up against me, and the army of violent men would take my life; they have not put you before them.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 15
text: But you, O Lord, are a God full of pity and forgiveness, slow to get angry, great in mercy and wisdom.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 16
text: O be turned to me and have mercy on me: give your strength to your servant, and your salvation to the son of her who is your servant.

title: Psalms Chapter 86 Verse 17
text: Give me a sign for good; so that my haters may see it and be shamed; because you, Lord, have been my help and comfort.

title: Psalms Chapter 87 Verse 1
text: - Of the sons of Korah. A Psalm. A Song. - This house is resting on the holy mountain.

title: Psalms Chapter 87 Verse 2
text: The Lord has more love for the doors of Zion than for all the tents of Jacob.

title: Psalms Chapter 87 Verse 3
text: Noble things are said of you, O town of God. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 87 Verse 4
text: Rahab and Babylon will be named among those who have knowledge of me; see, Philistia and Tyre, with Ethiopia; this man had his birth there.

title: Psalms Chapter 87 Verse 5
text: And of Zion it will be said, This or that man had his birth there; and the Most High will make her strong.

title: Psalms Chapter 87 Verse 6
text: The Lord will keep in mind, when he is writing the records of the people, that this man had his birth there. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 87 Verse 7
text: The players on instruments will be there, and the dancers will say, All my springs are in you.

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 1
text: - A Song. A Psalm. Of the sons of Korah. To the chief music-maker; put to Mahalath Leannoth. Maschil. Of Heman the Ezrahite. - O Lord, God of my salvation, I have been crying to you for help by day and by night:

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 2
text: Let my prayer come before you; give ear to my cry:

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 3
text: For my soul is full of evils, and my life has come near to the underworld.

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 4
text: I am numbered among those who go down into the earth; I have become like a man for whom there is no help:

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 5
text: My soul is among the dead, like those in the underworld, to whom you give no more thought; for they are cut off from your care.

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 6
text: You have put me in the lowest deep, even in dark places.

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 7
text: The weight of your wrath is crushing me, all your waves have overcome me. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 8
text: You have sent my friends far away from me; you have made me a disgusting thing in their eyes: I am shut up, and not able to come out.

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 9
text: My eyes are wasting away because of my trouble: Lord, my cry has gone up to you every day, my hands are stretched out to you.

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 10
text: Will you do works of wonder for the dead? will the shades come back to give you praise? (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 11
text: Will the story of your mercy be given in the house of the dead? will news of your faith come to the place of destruction?

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 12
text: May there be knowledge of your wonders in the dark? or of your righteousness where memory is dead?

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 13
text: But to you did I send up my cry, O Lord; in the morning my prayer came before you.

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 14
text: Lord, why have you sent away my soul? why is your face covered from me?

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 15
text: I have been troubled and in fear of death from the time when I was young; your wrath is hard on me, and I have no strength.

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 16
text: The heat of your wrath has gone over me; I am broken by your cruel punishments.

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 17
text: They are round me all the day like water; they have made a circle about me.

title: Psalms Chapter 88 Verse 18
text: You have sent my friends and lovers far from me; I am gone from the memory of those who are dear to me.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 1
text: - Maschil. Of Ethan the Ezrahite. - My song will be of the mercies of the Lord for ever: with my mouth will I make his faith clear to all generations.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 2
text: For you have said, Mercy will be made strong for ever; my faith will be unchanging in the heavens.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 3
text: I have made an agreement with the man of my selection, I have made an oath to David my servant;

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 4
text: I will make your seed go on for ever, your kingdom will be strong through all generations. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 5
text: In heaven let them give praise for your wonders, O Lord; and your unchanging faith among the saints.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 6
text: For who is there in the heavens in comparison with the Lord? who is like the Lord among the sons of the gods?

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 7
text: God is greatly to be feared among the saints, and to be honoured over all those who are about him.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 8
text: O Lord God of armies, who is strong like you, O Jah? and your unchanging faith is round about you.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 9
text: You have rule over the sea in storm; when its waves are troubled, you make them calm.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 10
text: Rahab was crushed by you like one wounded to death; with your strong arm you put to flight all your haters.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 11
text: Yours are the heavens, and the earth is yours; you have made the world, and everything which is in it.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 12
text: You have made the north and the south; Tabor and Hermon are sounding with joy at your name.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 13
text: Yours is an arm of power; strong is your hand and high your right hand.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 14
text: The seat of your kingdom is resting on righteousness and right judging: mercy and good faith come before your face.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 15
text: Happy are the people who have knowledge of the holy cry: the light of your face, O Lord, will be shining on their way.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 16
text: In your name will they have joy all the day: in your righteousness will they be lifted up.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 17
text: For you are the glory of their strength; in your pleasure will our horn be lifted up.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 18
text: For our breastplate is the Lord; and our king is the Holy One of Israel's.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 19
text: Then your voice came to your holy one in a vision, saying, I have put the crown on a strong one, lifting up one taken from among the people.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 20
text: I have made discovery of David my servant; I have put my holy oil on his head.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 21
text: My hand will be his support; my arm will give him strength.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 22
text: The deceit of those who are against him will not overcome him; he will not be troubled by the sons of evil.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 23
text: I will have those who are against him broken before his face, and his haters will be crushed under my blows.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 24
text: But my faith and my mercy will be with him; and in my name will his horn be lifted up.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 25
text: I will put his hand in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 26
text: He will say to me, You are my father, my God, and the Rock of my salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 27
text: And I will make him the first of my sons, most high over the kings of the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 28
text: I will keep my mercy for him for ever; my agreement with him will not be changed.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 29
text: His seed will keep their place for ever; his kingdom will be eternal, like the heavens.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 30
text: If his children give up my law, and are not ruled by my decisions;

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 31
text: If my rules are broken, and my orders are not kept;

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 32
text: Then I will send punishment on them for their sin; my rod will be the reward of their evil-doing.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 33
text: But I will not take away my mercy from him, and will not be false to my faith.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 34
text: I will be true to my agreement; the things which have gone out of my lips will not be changed.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 35
text: I have made an oath once by my holy name, that I will not be false to David.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 36
text: His seed will not come to an end for ever; the seat of his kingdom will be like the sun before me.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 37
text: It will be fixed for ever like the moon; and the witness in heaven is true. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 38
text: But you have put him away in disgust; you have been angry with the king of your selection.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 39
text: You have made your agreement with your servant of no effect: you have had no respect for his crown, it has come down even to the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 40
text: All his walls are broken down; you have given his strong towers to destruction.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 41
text: All those who come by take away his goods; he is laughed at by his neighbours.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 42
text: You have given power to the right hand of his haters; you have made glad all those who are against him.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 43
text: His sword is turned back; you have not been his support in the fight.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 44
text: You have put an end to his glory: the seat of his kingdom has been levelled to the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 45
text: You have made him old before his time; he is covered with shame. (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 46
text: How long, O Lord, will you Keep yourself for ever from our eyes? how long will your wrath be burning like fire?

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 47
text: See how short my time is; why have you made all men for no purpose?

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 48
text: What man now living will not see death? will he be able to keep back his soul from the underworld? (Selah.)

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 49
text: Lord, where are your earlier mercies? where is the oath which you made to David in unchanging faith?

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 50
text: Keep in mind, O Lord, the shame of your servants, and how the bitter words of all the people have come into my heart;

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 51
text: The bitter words of your haters, O Lord, shaming the footsteps of your king.

title: Psalms Chapter 89 Verse 52
text: Let the Lord be praised for ever. So be it, So be it.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 1
text: - A Prayer of Moses, the man of God. - Lord, you have been our resting-place in all generations.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 2
text: Before the mountains were made, before you had given birth to the earth and the world, before time was, and for ever, you are God.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 3
text: You send man back to his dust; and say, Go back, you children of men.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 4
text: For to you a thousand years are no more than yesterday when it is past, and like a watch in the night.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 6
text: In the morning it is green; in the evening it is cut down, and becomes dry.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 7
text: We are burned up by the heat of your passion, and troubled by your wrath.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 8
text: You have put our evil doings before you, our secret sins in the light of your face.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 9
text: For all our days have gone by in your wrath; our years come to an end like a breath.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 10
text: The measure of our life is seventy years; and if through strength it may be eighty years, its pride is only trouble and sorrow, for it comes to an end and we are quickly gone.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 11
text: Who has knowledge of the power of your wrath, or who takes note of the weight of your passion?

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 12
text: So give us knowledge of the number of our days, that we may get a heart of wisdom.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 13
text: Come back, O Lord; how long? let your purpose for your servants be changed.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 14
text: In the morning give us your mercy in full measure; so that we may have joy and delight all our days.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 15
text: Make us glad in reward for the days of our sorrow, and for the years in which we have seen evil.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 16
text: Make your work clear to your servants, and your glory to their children.

title: Psalms Chapter 90 Verse 17
text: Let the pleasure of the Lord our God be on us: O Lord, give strength to the work of our hands.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 1
text: Happy is he whose resting-place is in the secret of the Lord, and under the shade of the wings of the Most High;

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 2
text: Who says of the Lord, He is my safe place and my tower of strength: he is my God, in whom is my hope.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 3
text: He will take you out of the bird-net, and keep you safe from wasting disease.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 4
text: You will be covered by his feathers; under his wings you will be safe: his good faith will be your salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 5
text: You will have no fear of the evil things of the night, or of the arrow in flight by day,

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 6
text: Or of the disease which takes men in the dark, or of the destruction which makes waste when the sun is high.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 7
text: You will see a thousand falling by your side, and ten thousand at your right hand; but it will not come near you.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 8
text: Only with your eyes will you see the reward of the evil-doers.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 9
text: Because you have said, I am in the hands of the Lord, the Most High is my safe resting-place;

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 10
text: No evil will come on you, and no disease will come near your tent.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 11
text: For he will give you into the care of his angels to keep you wherever you go.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 12
text: In their hands they will keep you up, so that your foot may not be crushed against a stone.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 13
text: You will put your foot on the lion and the snake; the young lion and the great snake will be crushed under your feet.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 14
text: Because he has given me his love, I will take him out of danger: I will put him in a place of honour, because he has kept my name in his heart.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 15
text: When his cry comes up to me, I will give him an answer: I will be with him in trouble; I will make him free from danger and give him honour.

title: Psalms Chapter 91 Verse 16
text: With long life will he be rewarded; and I will let him see my salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. A Song for the Sabbath. - It is a good thing to give praise to the Lord, and to make melody to your name, O Most High;

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 2
text: To make clear your mercy in the morning, and your unchanging faith every night;

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 3
text: On a ten-corded instrument, and on an instrument of music with a quiet sound.

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 4
text: For you, O Lord, have made me glad through your work; I will have joy in the works of your hands.

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 5
text: O Lord, how great are your works! and your thoughts are very deep.

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 6
text: A man without sense has no knowledge of this; and a foolish man may not take it in.

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 7
text: When the sinners come up like the grass, and all the workers of evil do well for themselves, it is so that their end may be eternal destruction.

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 8
text: But you, O Lord, are on high for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 9
text: For see! your haters, O Lord, will be put to death; all the workers of evil will be put to flight;

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 10
text: But my horn is lifted up like the horn of the ox: the best oil is flowing on my head.

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 11
text: My eyes have seen trouble come on my haters; my ears have news of the fate of the evil-doers who have come up against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 12
text: The good man will be like a tall tree in his strength; his growth will be as the wide-stretching trees of Lebanon.

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 13
text: Those who are planted in the house of the Lord will come up tall and strong in his gardens.

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 14
text: They will give fruit even when they are old; they will be fertile and full of growth;

title: Psalms Chapter 92 Verse 15
text: For a sign that the Lord is upright; he is my Rock, there is no deceit in him.

title: Psalms Chapter 93 Verse 1
text: The Lord is King; he is clothed with glory; the Lord is clothed with strength; power is the cord of his robe; the world is fixed, so that it may not be moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 93 Verse 2
text: The seat of your power has been from the past; you are eternal.

title: Psalms Chapter 93 Verse 3
text: The rivers send up, O Lord, the rivers send up their voices; they send them up with a loud cry.

title: Psalms Chapter 93 Verse 4
text: The Lord in heaven is stronger than the noise of great waters, yes, he is stronger than the great waves of the sea.

title: Psalms Chapter 93 Verse 5
text: Your witness is most certain; it is right for your house to be holy, O Lord, for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 1
text: O God, in whose hands is punishment, O God of punishment, let your shining face be seen.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 2
text: Be lifted up, O judge of the earth; let their reward come to the men of pride.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 3
text: How long will sinners, O Lord, how long will sinners have joy over us?

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 4
text: Words of pride come from their lips; all the workers of evil say great things of themselves.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 5
text: Your people are crushed by them, O Lord, your heritage is troubled,

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 6
text: They put to death the widow and the guest, they take the lives of children who have no father;

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 7
text: And they say, Jah will not see it, the God of Jacob will not give thought to it.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 8
text: Give your mind to my words, you who are without wisdom among the people; you foolish men, when will you be wise?

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 9
text: Has he by whom your ears were planted no hearing? or is he blind by whom your eyes were formed?

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 10
text: He who is the judge of the nations, will he not give men the reward of their acts, even he who gives knowledge to man?

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 11
text: The Lord has knowledge of the thoughts of man, for they are only a breath.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 12
text: Happy is the man who is guided by you, O Jah, and to whom you give teaching out of your law;

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 13
text: So that you may give him rest from the days of evil, till a hole is made ready for the destruction of the sinners.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 14
text: The Lord will not give up his people, or take away his support from his heritage;

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 15
text: But decisions will again be made in righteousness; and they will be kept by all whose hearts are true.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 16
text: Who will give me help against the sinners? and who will be my support against the workers of evil?

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 17
text: If the Lord had not been my helper, my soul would quickly have gone down into death.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 18
text: If I say, My foot is slipping; your mercy, O Lord, is my support.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 19
text: Among all my troubled thoughts, your comforts are the delight of my soul.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 20
text: What part with you has the seat of sin, which makes evil into a law?

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 21
text: They are banded together against the soul of the upright, to give decisions against those who have done no wrong.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 22
text: But the Lord is my safe resting-place; my God is the Rock where I am safe.

title: Psalms Chapter 94 Verse 23
text: And he has made their evil designs come back on themselves, cutting them off in their sin; the Lord our God will put an end to them.

title: Psalms Chapter 95 Verse 1
text: O come, let us make songs to the Lord; sending up glad voices to the Rock of our salvation.

title: Psalms Chapter 95 Verse 2
text: Let us come before his face with praises; and make melody with holy songs.

title: Psalms Chapter 95 Verse 3
text: For the Lord is a great God, and a great King over all gods.

title: Psalms Chapter 95 Verse 4
text: The deep places of the earth are in his hand; and the tops of the mountains are his.

title: Psalms Chapter 95 Verse 5
text: The sea is his, and he made it; and the dry land was formed by his hands.

title: Psalms Chapter 95 Verse 6
text: O come, let us give worship, falling down on our knees before the Lord our Maker.

title: Psalms Chapter 95 Verse 7
text: For he is our God; and we are the people to whom he gives food, and the sheep of his flock. Today, if you would only give ear to his voice!

title: Psalms Chapter 95 Verse 8
text: Let not your hearts be hard, as at Meribah, as in the day of Massah in the waste land;

title: Psalms Chapter 95 Verse 9
text: When your fathers put me to the test and saw my power and my work.

title: Psalms Chapter 95 Verse 10
text: For forty years I was angry with this generation, and said, They are a people whose hearts are turned away from me, for they have no knowledge of my ways;

title: Psalms Chapter 95 Verse 11
text: And I made an oath in my wrath, that they might not come into my place of rest.

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 1
text: O make a new song to the Lord; let all the earth make melody to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 2
text: Make songs to the Lord, blessing his name; give the good news of his salvation day by day.

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 3
text: Make clear his glory to the nations, and his wonders to all the peoples.

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 4
text: For the Lord is great, and greatly to be praised; he is more to be feared than all other gods.

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 5
text: For all the gods of the nations are false gods; but the Lord made the heavens.

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 6
text: Honour and glory are before him: strong and fair is his holy place.

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 7
text: Give to the Lord, O you families of the peoples, give to the Lord glory and strength.

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 8
text: Give to the Lord the glory of his name; take with you an offering and come into his house.

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 9
text: O give worship to the Lord in holy robes; be in fear before him, all the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 10
text: Say among the nations, The Lord is King; yes, the world is ordered so that it may not be moved; he will be an upright judge of the peoples.

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 11
text: Let the heavens have joy and the earth be glad; let the sea be thundering with all its waters;

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 12
text: Let the field be glad, and everything which is in it; yes, let all the trees of the wood be sounding with joy,

title: Psalms Chapter 96 Verse 13
text: Before the Lord, for he is come; he is come to be the judge of the earth; the earth will be judged in righteousness, and the peoples with unchanging faith.

title: Psalms Chapter 97 Verse 1
text: The Lord is King, let the earth have joy; let all the sea-lands be glad.

title: Psalms Chapter 97 Verse 2
text: Dark clouds are round him; his kingdom is based on righteousness and right judging.

title: Psalms Chapter 97 Verse 3
text: Fire goes before him, burning up all those who are against him round about.

title: Psalms Chapter 97 Verse 4
text: His bright flames give light to the world; the earth saw it with fear.

title: Psalms Chapter 97 Verse 5
text: The mountains became like wax at the coming of the Lord, at the coming of the Lord of all the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 97 Verse 6
text: The heavens gave out the news of his righteousness, and all the people saw his glory.

title: Psalms Chapter 97 Verse 7
text: Shamed be all those who give worship to images, and take pride in false gods; give him worship, all you gods.

title: Psalms Chapter 97 Verse 8
text: Zion gave ear and was glad; and the daughters of Judah were full of joy, because of your decisions, O Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 97 Verse 9
text: For you, Lord, are most high over the earth; you are lifted up over all other gods.

title: Psalms Chapter 97 Verse 10
text: You who are lovers of the Lord, be haters of evil; he keeps the souls of his saints; he takes them out of the hand of sinners.

title: Psalms Chapter 97 Verse 11
text: Light is shining on the lovers of righteousness, and for the upright in heart there is joy.

title: Psalms Chapter 97 Verse 12
text: Be glad in the Lord, you upright men; praising the memory of his holy name.

title: Psalms Chapter 98 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. - O make a new song to the Lord, because he has done works of wonder; with his right hand, and with his holy arm, he has overcome.

title: Psalms Chapter 98 Verse 2
text: The Lord has given to all the knowledge of his salvation; he has made clear his righteousness in the eyes of the nations.

title: Psalms Chapter 98 Verse 3
text: He has kept in mind his mercy and his unchanging faith to the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

title: Psalms Chapter 98 Verse 4
text: Let all the earth send out a glad cry to the Lord; sounding with a loud voice, and praising him with songs of joy.

title: Psalms Chapter 98 Verse 5
text: Make melody to the Lord with instruments of music; with a corded instrument and the voice of song.

title: Psalms Chapter 98 Verse 6
text: With wind instruments and the sound of the horn, make a glad cry before the Lord, the King.

title: Psalms Chapter 98 Verse 7
text: Let the sea be thundering, with all its waters; the world, and all who are living in it;

title: Psalms Chapter 98 Verse 8
text: Let the streams make sounds of joy with their hands; let the mountains be glad together,

title: Psalms Chapter 98 Verse 9
text: Before the Lord, for he has come as judge of the earth; judging the world in righteousness, and giving true decisions for the peoples.

title: Psalms Chapter 99 Verse 1
text: The Lord is King; let the peoples be in fear: his seat is on the winged ones; let the earth be moved.

title: Psalms Chapter 99 Verse 2
text: The Lord is great in Zion; he is high over all the nations.

title: Psalms Chapter 99 Verse 3
text: Let them give praise to your name, for it is great and to be feared; holy is he.

title: Psalms Chapter 99 Verse 4
text: The king's power is used for righteousness; you give true decisions, judging rightly in the land of Jacob.

title: Psalms Chapter 99 Verse 5
text: Give high honour to the Lord our God, worshipping at his feet; holy is he.

title: Psalms Chapter 99 Verse 6
text: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among those who gave honour to his name; they made prayers to the Lord, and he gave answers to them.

title: Psalms Chapter 99 Verse 7
text: His voice came to them from the pillar of cloud; they kept his witness, and the law which he gave them.

title: Psalms Chapter 99 Verse 8
text: You gave them an answer, O Lord our God; you took away their sin, though you gave them punishment for their wrongdoing.

title: Psalms Chapter 99 Verse 9
text: Give high honour to the Lord our God, worshipping with your faces turned to his holy hill; for the Lord our God is holy.

title: Psalms Chapter 100 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm of Praise. - Make a glad sound to the Lord, all the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 100 Verse 2
text: Give worship to the Lord with joy; come before him with a song.

title: Psalms Chapter 100 Verse 3
text: Be certain that the Lord is God; it is he who has made us, and we are his; we are his people, and the sheep to whom he gives food.

title: Psalms Chapter 100 Verse 4
text: Come into his doors with joy, and into his house with praise; give him honour, blessing his name.

title: Psalms Chapter 100 Verse 5
text: For the Lord is good, and his mercy is never-ending; his faith is unchanging through all generations.

title: Psalms Chapter 101 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. Of David. - I will make a song of mercy and righteousness; to you, O Lord, will I make melody.

title: Psalms Chapter 101 Verse 2
text: I will do wisely in the way of righteousness: O when will you come to me? I will be walking in my house with a true heart.

title: Psalms Chapter 101 Verse 3
text: I will not put any evil thing before my eyes; I am against all turning to one side; I will not have it near me.

title: Psalms Chapter 101 Verse 4
text: The false heart I will send away from me: I will not have an evil-doer for a friend.

title: Psalms Chapter 101 Verse 5
text: I will put to death anyone who says evil of his neighbour secretly; the man with a high look and a heart of pride is disgusting to me.

title: Psalms Chapter 101 Verse 6
text: My eyes will be on those of good faith in the land, so that they may be living in my house; he who is walking in the right way will be my servant.

title: Psalms Chapter 101 Verse 7
text: The worker of deceit will not come into my house; the false man will have no place before my eyes.

title: Psalms Chapter 101 Verse 8
text: Morning by morning will I put to death all the sinners in the land, so that all evil-doers may be cut off from Jerusalem.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 1
text: - A Prayer of the man who is in trouble, when he is overcome, and puts his grief before the Lord. - Give ear to my prayer, O Lord, and let my cry come to you.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 2
text: Let not your face be veiled from me in the day of my trouble; give ear to me, and let my cry be answered quickly.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 3
text: My days are wasted like smoke, and my bones are burned up as in a fire.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 4
text: My heart is broken; it has become dry and dead like grass, so that I give no thought to food.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 5
text: Because of the voice of my sorrow, my flesh is wasted to the bone.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 6
text: I am like a bird living by itself in the waste places; like the night-bird in a waste of sand.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 7
text: I keep watch like a bird by itself on the house-top.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 8
text: My haters say evil of me all day; those who are violent against me make use of my name as a curse.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 9
text: I have had dust for bread and my drink has been mixed with weeping:

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 10
text: Because of your passion and your wrath, for I have been lifted up and then made low by you.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 11
text: My days are like a shade which is stretched out; I am dry like the grass.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 12
text: But you, O Lord, are eternal; and your name will never come to an end.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 13
text: You will again get up and have mercy on Zion: for the time has come for her to be comforted.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 14
text: For your servants take pleasure in her stones, looking with love on her dust.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 15
text: So the nations will give honour to the name of the Lord, and all the kings of the earth will be in fear of his glory:

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 16
text: When the Lord has put up the walls of Zion, and has been been in his glory;

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 17
text: When he has given ear to the prayer of the poor, and has not put his request on one side.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 18
text: This will be put in writing for the coming generation, and the people of the future will give praise to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 19
text: For from his holy place the Lord has seen, looking down on the earth from heaven;

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 20
text: Hearing the cry of the prisoner, making free those for whom death is ordered;

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 21
text: So that they may give out the name of the Lord in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem;

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 22
text: When the peoples are come together, and the kingdoms, to give worship to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 23
text: He has taken my strength from me in the way; he has made short my days.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 24
text: I will say, O my God, take me not away before my time; your years go on through all generations:

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 25
text: In the past you put the earth on its base, and the heavens are the work of your hands.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 26
text: They will come to an end, but you will still go on; they all will become old like a coat, and like a robe they will be changed:

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 27
text: But you are the unchanging One, and your years will have no end.

title: Psalms Chapter 102 Verse 28
text: The children of your servants will have a safe resting-place, and their seed will be ever before you.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 1
text: - Of David. - Give praise to the Lord, O my soul; let everything in me give praise to his holy name.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 2
text: Give praise to the Lord, O my soul; let not all his blessings go from your memory.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 3
text: He has forgiveness for all your sins; he takes away all your diseases;

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 4
text: He keeps back your life from destruction, crowning you with mercy and grace.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 5
text: He makes your mouth full of good things, so that your strength is made new again like the eagle's.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 6
text: The Lord gives decisions in righteousness for all who are in trouble.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 7
text: He gave knowledge of his way to Moses, and made his acts clear to the children of Israel.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 8
text: The Lord is kind and full of pity, not quickly made angry, but ever ready to have mercy.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 9
text: His feeling will no longer be bitter; he will not keep his wrath for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 10
text: He has not given us the punishment for our sins, or the reward of our wrongdoing.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 11
text: For as the heaven is high over the earth, so great is his mercy to his worshippers.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 12
text: As far as the east is from the west, so far has he put our sins from us.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 13
text: As a father has pity on his children, so the Lord has pity on his worshippers.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 14
text: For he has knowledge of our feeble frame; he sees that we are only dust.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 15
text: As for man, his days are as grass: his beautiful growth is like the flower of the field.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 16
text: The wind goes over it and it is gone; and its place sees it no longer.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 17
text: But the mercy of the Lord is eternal for his worshippers, and their children's children will see his righteousness;

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 18
text: If they keep his agreement, and have his laws in mind to do them.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 19
text: The Lord has made ready his high seat in the heavens; his kingdom is ruling over all.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 20
text: Give praise to the Lord, you his angels, who are great in strength, doing his orders, and waiting for his voice.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 21
text: Give praise to the Lord, all you his armies; and you his servants who do his pleasure.

title: Psalms Chapter 103 Verse 22
text: Give praise to the Lord, all his works, in all places under his rule: give praise to the Lord, O my soul.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 1
text: Give praise to the Lord, O my soul. O Lord my God, you are very great; you are robed with honour and power.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 2
text: You are clothed with light as with a robe; stretching out the heavens like a curtain:

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 3
text: The arch of your house is based on the waters; you make the clouds your carriage; you go on the wings of the wind:

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 4
text: He makes winds his angels, and flames of fire his servants.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 5
text: He has made the earth strong on its bases, so that it may not be moved for ever and ever;

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 6
text: Covering it with the sea as with a robe: the waters were high over the mountains;

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 7
text: At the voice of your word they went in flight; at the sound of your thunder they went away in fear;

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 8
text: The mountains came up and the valleys went down into the place which you had made ready for them.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 9
text: You made a limit over which they might not go, so that the earth would never again be covered by them.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 10
text: You sent the springs into the valleys; they are flowing between the hills.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 11
text: They give drink to every beast of the field; the mountain asses come to them for water.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 12
text: The birds of the air have their resting-places by them, and make their song among the branches.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 13
text: He sends down rain from his store-houses on the hills: the earth is full of the fruit of his works.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 14
text: He makes the grass come up for the cattle, and plants for the use of man; so that bread may come out of the earth;

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 15
text: And wine to make glad the heart of man, and oil to make his face shining, and bread giving strength to his heart.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 16
text: The trees of the Lord are full of growth, the cedars of Lebanon of his planting;

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 17
text: Where the birds have their resting-places; as for the stork, the tall trees are her house.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 18
text: The high hills are a safe place for the mountain goats, and the rocks for the small beasts.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 19
text: He made the moon for a sign of the divisions of the year; teaching the sun the time of its going down.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 20
text: When you make it dark, it is night, when all the beasts of the woods come quietly out of their secret places.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 21
text: The young lions go thundering after their food; searching for their meat from God.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 22
text: The sun comes up, and they come together, and go back to their secret places to take their rest.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 23
text: Man goes out to his work, and to his business, till the evening.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 24
text: O Lord, how great is the number of your works! in wisdom you have made them all; the earth is full of the things you have made.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 25
text: There is the great, wide sea, where there are living things, great and small, more than may be numbered.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 26
text: There go the ships; there is that great beast, which you have made as a plaything.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 27
text: All of them are waiting for you, to give them their food in its time.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 28
text: They take what you give them; they are full of the good things which come from your open hand.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 29
text: If your face is veiled, they are troubled; when you take away their breath, they come to an end, and go back to the dust.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 30
text: If you send out your spirit, they are given life; you make new the face of the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 31
text: Let the glory of the Lord be for ever; let the Lord have joy in his works:

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 32
text: At whose look the earth is shaking; at whose touch the mountains send out smoke.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 33
text: I will make songs to the Lord all my life; I will make melody to my God while I have my being.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 34
text: Let my thoughts be sweet to him: I will be glad in the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 104 Verse 35
text: Let sinners be cut off from the earth, and let all evil-doers come to an end. Give praise to the Lord, O my soul. Give praise to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 1
text: O give praise to the Lord; give honour to his name, talking of his doings among the peoples.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 2
text: Let your voice be sounding in songs and melody; let all your thoughts be of the wonder of his works.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 3
text: Have glory in his holy name; let the hearts of those who are searching after the Lord be glad.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 4
text: Let your search be for the Lord and for his strength; let your hearts ever be turned to him.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 5
text: Keep in mind the great works which he has done; his wonders, and the decisions of his mouth;

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 6
text: O you seed of Abraham, his servant, you children of Jacob, his loved ones.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 7
text: He is the Lord our God: he is judge of all the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 8
text: He has kept his agreement in mind for ever, the word which he gave for a thousand generations;

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 9
text: The agreement which he made with Abraham, and his oath to Isaac;

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 10
text: And he gave it to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an eternal agreement;

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 11
text: Saying, To you will I give the land of Canaan, the measured line of your heritage:

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 12
text: When they were still small in number, and strange in the land;

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 13
text: When they went about from one nation to another, and from one kingdom to another people.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 14
text: He would not let anyone do them wrong; he even kept back kings because of them,

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 15
text: Saying, Put not your hand on those who have been marked with my holy oil, and do my prophets no wrong.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 16
text: And he took away all food from the land, so that the people were without bread.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 17
text: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was given as a servant for a price:

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 18
text: His feet were fixed in chains; his neck was put in iron bands;

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 19
text: Till the time when his word came true; he was tested by the word of the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 20
text: The king sent men to take off his chains; even the ruler of the people, who let him go free.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 21
text: He made him lord of his house, and ruler over everything he had;

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 22
text: To give his chiefs teaching at his pleasure, and so that his law-givers might get wisdom from him.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 23
text: Then Israel came into Egypt, and Jacob was living in the land of Ham.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 24
text: And his people were greatly increased, and became stronger than those who were against them.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 25
text: Their hearts were turned to hate against his people, so that they made secret designs against them.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 26
text: He sent Moses, his servant, and Aaron, the man of his selection.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 27
text: He let his signs be seen among the people, and his wonders in the land of Ham.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 28
text: He sent black night and made it dark; and they did not go against his word.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 29
text: At his word their waters were turned to blood, and he sent death on all their fish.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 30
text: Their land was full of frogs, even in the rooms of the king.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 31
text: He gave the word, and there came the dog-fly, and insects over all the land.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 32
text: He gave them ice for rain, and flaming fire in their land.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 33
text: He gave their vines and their fig-trees to destruction, and the trees of their land were broken down.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 34
text: At his word the locusts came, and young locusts more than might be numbered,

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 35
text: And put an end to all the plants of their land, taking all the fruit of the earth for food.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 36
text: He put to death the first child of every family in the land, the first-fruits of their strength.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 37
text: He took his people out with silver and gold: there was not one feeble person among them.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 38
text: Egypt was glad when they went; for the fear of them had come down on them.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 39
text: A cloud was stretched over them for a cover; and he sent fire to give light in the night.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 40
text: At the people's request he sent birds, and gave them the bread of heaven for food.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 41
text: His hand made the rock open, and the waters came streaming out; they went down through the dry places like a river.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 42
text: For he kept in mind his holy word, and Abraham, his servant.

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 43
text: And he took his people out with joy, the men of his selection with glad cries:

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 44
text: And gave them the lands of the nations; and they took the work of the peoples for a heritage;

title: Psalms Chapter 105 Verse 45
text: So that they might keep his orders, and be true to his laws. Give praise to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 1
text: Let the Lord be praised. O give praise to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy is unchanging for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 2
text: Who is able to give an account of the great acts of the Lord, or to make clear all his praise?

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 3
text: Happy are they whose decisions are upright, and he who does righteousness at all times.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 4
text: Keep me in mind, O Lord, when you are good to your people; O let your salvation come to me;

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 5
text: So that I may see the well-being of the people of your selection, and have a part in the joy of your nation, and take pride in your heritage.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 6
text: We are sinners like our fathers, we have done wrong, our acts are evil.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 7
text: Our fathers did not give thought to your wonders in Egypt; they did not keep in memory the great number of your mercies, but gave you cause for wrath at the sea, even at the Red Sea.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 8
text: But he was their saviour because of his name, so that men might see his great power.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 9
text: By his word the Red Sea was made dry: and he took them through the deep waters as through the waste land.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 10
text: And he took them safely out of the hands of their haters, and kept them from the attacks of those who were against them.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 11
text: And the waters went over their haters; all of them came to an end.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 12
text: Then they had faith in his words; they gave him songs of praise.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 13
text: But their memory of his works was short; not waiting to be guided by him,

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 14
text: They gave way to their evil desires in the waste land, and put God to the test in the dry places.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 15
text: And he gave them their request, but sent a wasting disease into their souls.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 16
text: They were full of envy against Moses among the tents, and against Aaron, the holy one of the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 17
text: The earth opening put an end to Dathan, covering up Abiram and his band.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 18
text: And a fire was lighted among their tents; the sinners were burned up by the flames.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 19
text: They made a young ox in Horeb, and gave worship to an image of gold.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 20
text: And their glory was changed into the image of an ox, whose food is grass.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 21
text: They had no memory of God their saviour, who had done great things in Egypt;

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 22
text: Works of wonder in the land of Ham, and things of fear by the Red Sea.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 23
text: And he was purposing to put an end to them if Moses, his special servant, had not gone up before him, between him and his people, turning back his wrath, to keep them from destruction.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 24
text: They were disgusted with the good land; they had no belief in his word;

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 25
text: Talking against him secretly in their tents, they did not give ear to the voice of the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 26
text: So he made an oath against them, to put an end to them in the waste land:

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 27
text: That their children might be mixed among the nations, and sent away into other lands.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 28
text: And they were joined to Baal-peor, and took part in the offerings to the dead.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 29
text: So they made him angry by their behaviour; and he sent disease on them.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 30
text: Then Phinehas got up, and made prayer for them; and the disease went no farther.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 31
text: And all the generations coming after him kept the memory of his righteousness for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 32
text: They made God angry again at the waters of Meribah, so that Moses was troubled because of them;

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 33
text: For they made his spirit bitter, and he said unwise things.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 34
text: They did not put an end to the peoples, as the Lord had said;

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 35
text: But they were joined to the nations, learning their works.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 36
text: And they gave worship to images; which were a danger to them:

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 37
text: They even made offerings of their sons and their daughters to evil spirits,

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 38
text: And gave the blood of their sons and their daughters who had done no wrong, offering them to the images of Canaan; and the land was made unclean with blood.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 39
text: So they became unclean through their works, going after their evil desires.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 40
text: Then the wrath of the Lord was burning against his people, and he was angry with his heritage.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 41
text: And he gave them into the hands of the nations; and they were ruled by their haters.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 42
text: By them they were crushed, and made low under their hands.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 43
text: Again and again he made them free; but their hearts were turned against his purpose, and they were overcome by their sins.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 44
text: But when their cry came to his ears, he had pity on their trouble:

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 45
text: And kept in mind his agreement with them, and in his great mercy gave them forgiveness.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 46
text: He put pity into the hearts of those who made them prisoners.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 47
text: Be our saviour, O Lord our God, and let us come back together from among the nations, so that we may give honour to your holy name, and have glory in your praise.

title: Psalms Chapter 106 Verse 48
text: Praise be to the Lord God of Israel for ever and for ever; and let all the people say, So be it. Give praise to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 1
text: O give praise to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy is unchanging for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 2
text: Let those whose cause the Lord has taken up say so, his people whom he has taken out of the hands of their haters;

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 3
text: Making them come together out of all the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 4
text: They were wandering in the waste places; they saw no way to a resting-place.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 5
text: Their souls became feeble for need of food and drink.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 6
text: Then they sent up their cry to the Lord in their sorrow, and he gave them salvation out of all their troubles;

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 7
text: Guiding them in the right way, so that they might come into the town of their resting-place.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 8
text: Let men give praise to the Lord for his mercy, and for the wonders which he does for the children of men!

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 9
text: He gives its desire to the unresting soul, so that it is full of good things.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 10
text: Those who were in the dark, in the black night, in chains of sorrow and iron;

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 11
text: Because they went against the words of God, and gave no thought to the laws of the Most High:

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 12
text: So that he made their hearts weighted down with grief; they were falling, and had no helper.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 13
text: Then they sent up their cry to the Lord in their sorrow, and he gave them salvation out of all their troubles.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 14
text: He took them out of the dark and the black night, and all their chains were broken.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 15
text: Let men give praise to the Lord for his mercy, and for the wonders which he does for the children of men!

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 16
text: The doors of brass are broken by his arm, and the bands of iron are cut in two.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 17
text: Foolish men, because of their sins, and because of their wrongdoing, are troubled;

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 18
text: They are disgusted by all food, and they come near to the doors of death.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 19
text: Then they send up their cry to the Lord in their sorrow, and he gives them salvation out of all their troubles.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 20
text: He sent his word and made them well, and kept them safe from the underworld.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 21
text: Let men give praise to the Lord for his mercy, and for the wonders which he does for the children of men!

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 22
text: Let them make offerings of praise, giving news of his works with cries of joy.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 23
text: Those who go down to the sea in ships, who do business in the great waters;

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 24
text: They see the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 25
text: For at his word comes up the storm-wind, lifting high the waves.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 26
text: The sailors go up to heaven, and down into the deep; their souls are wasted because of their trouble.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 27
text: They are turned here and there, rolling like a man who is full of wine; and all their wisdom comes to nothing.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 28
text: Then they send up their cry to the Lord in their sorrow, and he gives them salvation out of all their troubles.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 29
text: He makes the storm into a calm, so that the waves are at peace.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 30
text: Then they are glad, because the sea is quiet, and he takes them to the harbour of their desire.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 31
text: Let men give praise to the Lord for his mercy, and for the wonders which he does for the children of men!

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 32
text: Let them give glory to him in the meeting of the people, and praise among the chiefs.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 33
text: He makes rivers into waste places, and springs of water into a dry land;

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 34
text: He makes a fertile country into a salt waste, because of the sins of those who are living there.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 35
text: He makes a waste land into a place of water, and a dry land into water-springs.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 36
text: And there he gives the poor a resting-place, so that they may make themselves a town;

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 37
text: And put seed in the fields and make vine-gardens, to give them fruit.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 38
text: He gives them his blessing so that they are increased greatly, and their cattle do not become less.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 39
text: And when they are made low, and crushed by trouble and sorrow,

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 40
text: He puts an end to the pride of kings, and sends them wandering in the waste lands where there is no way.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 41
text: But he puts the poor man on high from his troubles, and gives him families like a flock.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 42
text: The upright see it and are glad: the mouth of the sinner is stopped.

title: Psalms Chapter 107 Verse 43
text: Let the wise give thought to these things, and see the mercies of the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 1
text: - A Song. A Psalm. Of David. - O God, my heart is fixed; I will make songs and melody, even with my glory.

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 2
text: Give out your sounds, O corded instruments: the dawn will be awaking with my song.

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 3
text: I will give you praise, O Lord, among the peoples; I will make melody to you among the nations.

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 4
text: For your mercy is higher than the heavens: and your unchanging faith than the clouds.

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 5
text: Be lifted up, O God, higher than the heavens; let your glory be over all the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 6
text: Let your right hand be stretched out for salvation, and give me an answer, so that your loved ones may be safe from danger.

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 7
text: This is the word of the holy God: I will be glad; I will make Shechem a heritage, measuring out the valley of Succoth.

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 8
text: Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim is the strength of my head; Judah is my law-giver;

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 9
text: Moab is my washpot; on Edom is the resting-place of my shoe; over Philistia will I send out a glad cry.

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 10
text: Who will take me into the strong town? who will be my guide into Edom?

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 11
text: Have you not sent us away from you, O God? and you go not out with our armies.

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 12
text: Give us help in our trouble; for there is no help in man.

title: Psalms Chapter 108 Verse 13
text: With God we will do great things; for by him will our haters be crushed underfoot.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 1
text: - To the chief music-maker. Of David. A Psalm. - God of my praise, let my prayer be answered;

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 2
text: For the mouth of the sinner is open against me in deceit: his tongue has said false things against me.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 3
text: Words of hate are round about me; they have made war against me without cause.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 4
text: For my love they give me back hate; but I have given myself to prayer.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 5
text: They have put on me evil for good; hate in exchange for my love.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 6
text: Put an evil man over him; and let one be placed at his right hand to say evil of him.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 7
text: When he is judged, let the decision go against him; and may his prayer become sin.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 8
text: Let his life be short; let another take his position of authority.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 9
text: Let his children have no father, and his wife be made a widow.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 10
text: Let his children be wanderers, looking to others for their food; let them be sent away from the company of their friends.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 11
text: Let his creditor take all his goods; and let others have the profit of his work.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 12
text: Let no man have pity on him, or give help to his children when he is dead.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 13
text: Let his seed be cut off; in the coming generation let their name go out of memory.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 14
text: Let the Lord keep in mind the wrongdoing of his fathers; and may the sin of his mother have no forgiveness.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 15
text: Let them be ever before the eyes of the Lord, so that the memory of them may be cut off from the earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 16
text: Because he had no mercy, but was cruel to the low and the poor, designing the death of the broken-hearted.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 17
text: As he took pleasure in cursing, so let it come on him; and as he had no delight in blessing, let it be far from him.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 18
text: He put on cursing like a robe, and it has come into his body like water, and into his bones like oil.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 19
text: Let it be to him as a robe which he puts on, let it be like a band which is round him at all times.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 20
text: Let this be the reward given to my haters from the Lord, and to those who say evil of my soul.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 21
text: But, O Lord God, give me your help, because of your name; take me out of danger, because your mercy is good.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 22
text: For I am poor and in need, and my heart is wounded in me.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 23
text: I am gone like the shade when it is stretched out: I am forced out of my place like a locust.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 24
text: My knees are feeble for need of food; there is no fat on my bones.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 25
text: As for me, they make sport of me; shaking their heads when they see me.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 26
text: Give me help, O Lord my God; in your mercy be my saviour;

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 27
text: So that they may see that it is the work of your hand; that you, Lord, have done it.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 28
text: They may give curses but you give blessing; when they come up against me, put them to shame; but let your servant be glad.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 29
text: Let my haters be clothed with shame, covering themselves with shame as with a robe.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 30
text: I will give the Lord great praise with my mouth; yes, I will give praise to him among all the people.

title: Psalms Chapter 109 Verse 31
text: For he is ever at the right hand of the poor, to take him out of the hands of those who go after his soul.

title: Psalms Chapter 110 Verse 1
text: - A Psalm. Of David. - The Lord said to my lord, Be seated at my right hand, till I put all those who are against you under your feet.

title: Psalms Chapter 110 Verse 2
text: The Lord will send out the rod of your strength from Zion; be king over your haters.

title: Psalms Chapter 110 Verse 3
text: Your people give themselves gladly in the day of your power; like the dew of the morning on the holy mountains is the army of your young men.

title: Psalms Chapter 110 Verse 4
text: The Lord has made an oath, and will not take it back. You are a priest for ever, after the order of Melchizedek.

title: Psalms Chapter 110 Verse 5
text: In the day of his wrath kings will be wounded by the Lord at your right hand.

title: Psalms Chapter 110 Verse 6
text: He will be judge among the nations, the valleys will be full of dead bodies; the head over a great country will be wounded by him.

title: Psalms Chapter 110 Verse 7
text: He will take of the stream by the way; so his head will be lifted up.

title: Psalms Chapter 111 Verse 1
text: Let the Lord be praised. I will give praise to the Lord with all my heart, among the upright, and in the meeting of the people.

title: Psalms Chapter 111 Verse 2
text: The works of the Lord are great, searched out by all those who have delight in them.

title: Psalms Chapter 111 Verse 3
text: His work is full of honour and glory; and his righteousness is unchanging for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 111 Verse 4
text: Certain for ever is the memory of his wonders: the Lord is full of pity and mercy.

title: Psalms Chapter 111 Verse 5
text: He has given food to his worshippers; he will keep his agreement in mind for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 111 Verse 6
text: He has made clear to his people the power of his works, giving them the heritage of the nations.

title: Psalms Chapter 111 Verse 7
text: The works of his hands are faith and righteousness; all his laws are unchanging.

title: Psalms Chapter 111 Verse 8
text: They are fixed for ever and ever, they are done in faith and righteousness.

title: Psalms Chapter 111 Verse 9
text: He has sent salvation to his people; he has given his word for ever: holy is his name and greatly to be feared.

title: Psalms Chapter 111 Verse 10
text: The fear of the Lord is the best part of wisdom: all those who keep his laws are wise: his praise is eternal.

title: Psalms Chapter 112 Verse 1
text: Let the Lord be praised. Happy is the man who gives honour to the Lord, and has great delight in his laws.

title: Psalms Chapter 112 Verse 2
text: His seed will be strong on the earth; blessings will be on the generation of the upright.

title: Psalms Chapter 112 Verse 3
text: A store of wealth will be in his house, and his righteousness will be for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 112 Verse 4
text: For the upright there is a light shining in the dark; he is full of grace and pity.

title: Psalms Chapter 112 Verse 5
text: All is well for the man who is kind and gives freely to others; he will make good his cause when he is judged.

title: Psalms Chapter 112 Verse 6
text: He will not ever be moved; the memory of the upright will be living for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 112 Verse 7
text: He will have no fear of evil news; his heart is fixed, for his hope is in the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 112 Verse 8
text: His heart is resting safely, he will have no fear, till he sees trouble come on his haters.

title: Psalms Chapter 112 Verse 9
text: He has given with open hands to the poor; his righteousness is for ever; his horn will be lifted up with honour.

title: Psalms Chapter 112 Verse 10
text: The sinner will see it with grief; he will be wasted away with envy; the desire of the evil-doers will come to nothing.

title: Psalms Chapter 113 Verse 1
text: Let the Lord be praised. O you servants of the Lord, give praise to the name of the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 113 Verse 2
text: Let blessing be on the name of the Lord, from this time and for ever.

title: Psalms Chapter 113 Verse 3
text: From the coming up of the sun to its going down, the Lord's name is to be praised.

title: Psalms Chapter 113 Verse 4
text: The Lord is high over all nations, and his glory is higher than the heavens.

title: Psalms Chapter 113 Verse 5
text: Who is like the Lord our God, who is seated on high,

title: Psalms Chapter 113 Verse 6
text: Looking down on the heavens, and on the earth?

title: Psalms Chapter 113 Verse 7
text: He takes the poor man out of the dust, lifting him up from his low position;

title: Psalms Chapter 113 Verse 8
text: To give him a place among the rulers, even with the rulers of his people.

title: Psalms Chapter 113 Verse 9
text: He gives the unfertile woman a family, making her a happy mother of children. Give praise to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 114 Verse 1
text: When Israel came out of Egypt, the children of Jacob from a people whose language was strange to them;

title: Psalms Chapter 114 Verse 2
text: Judah became his holy place, and Israel his kingdom.

title: Psalms Chapter 114 Verse 3
text: The sea saw it, and went in flight; Jordan was turned back.

title: Psalms Chapter 114 Verse 4
text: The mountains were jumping like goats, and the little hills like lambs.

title: Psalms Chapter 114 Verse 5
text: What was wrong with you, O sea, that you went in flight? O Jordan, that you were turned back?

title: Psalms Chapter 114 Verse 6
text: You mountains, why were you jumping like goats, and you little hills like lambs?

title: Psalms Chapter 114 Verse 7
text: Be troubled, O earth, before the Lord, before the God of Jacob;

title: Psalms Chapter 114 Verse 8
text: Who made the rock into a water-spring, and the hard stone into a fountain.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 1
text: Not to us, O Lord, not to us, but to your name let glory be given, because of your mercy and your unchanging faith.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 2
text: Why may the nations say, Where is now their God?

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 3
text: But our God is in heaven: he has done whatever was pleasing to him.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 4
text: Their images are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 5
text: They have mouths, but no voice; they have eyes, but they see not;

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 6
text: They have ears, but no hearing; they have noses, but no sense of smell;

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 7
text: They have hands without feeling, and feet without power of walking; and no sound comes from their throat.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 8
text: Those who make them are like them; and so is everyone who puts his faith in them.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 9
text: O Israel, have faith in the Lord: he is their help and their breastplate.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 10
text: O house of Aaron, have faith in the Lord: he is their help and their breastplate.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 11
text: You worshippers of the Lord, have faith in the Lord: he is their help and their breastplate.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 12
text: The Lord has kept us in mind and will give us his blessing; he will send blessings on the house of Israel and on the house of Aaron.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 13
text: He will send blessings on the worshippers of the Lord, on the small and on the great.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 14
text: May the Lord give you and your children still greater increase.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 15
text: May you have the blessing of the Lord, who made heaven and earth.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 16
text: The heavens are the Lord's; but the earth he has given to the children of men.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 17
text: The dead do not give praise to the Lord; or those who go down to the underworld.

title: Psalms Chapter 115 Verse 18
text: But we will give praise to the Lord now and for ever. Praise be to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 1
text: I have given my love to the Lord, because he has given ear to the voice of my cry and my prayer.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 2
text: He has let my request come before him, and I will make my prayer to him all my days.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 3
text: The nets of death were round me, and the pains of the underworld had me in their grip; I was full of trouble and sorrow.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 4
text: Then I made my prayer to the Lord, saying, O Lord, take my soul out of trouble.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 5
text: The Lord is full of grace and righteousness; truly, he is a God of mercy.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 6
text: The Lord keeps the simple; I was made low, and he was my saviour.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 7
text: Come back to your rest, O my soul; for the Lord has given you your reward.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 8
text: You have taken my soul from the power of death, keeping my eyes from weeping, and my feet from falling.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 9
text: I will go before the Lord in the land of the living.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 10
text: I still had faith, though I said, I am in great trouble;

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 11
text: Though I said in my fear, All men are false.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 12
text: What may I give to the Lord for all the good things which he has done for me?

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 13
text: I will take the cup of salvation, and give praise to the name of the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 14
text: I will make the offering of my oath to the Lord, even before all his people.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 15
text: Dear in the eyes of the Lord is the death of his saints.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 16
text: O Lord, truly I am your servant; I am your servant, the son of her who is your servant; by you have my cords been broken.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 17
text: I will give an offering of praise to you, and make my prayer in the name of the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 18
text: I will make the offerings of my oath, even before all his people;

title: Psalms Chapter 116 Verse 19
text: In the Lord's house, even in Jerusalem. Praise be to the Lord.

title: Psalms Chapter 117 Verse 1
text: Let all the nations give praise to the Lord: let all the people give him praise.

title: Psalms Chapter 117 Verse 2
