title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: For the Lord will be your hope, and will keep your foot from being taken in the net.

title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Verse 27
text: Do not keep back good from those who have a right to it, when it is in the power of your hand to do it.

title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Verse 28
text: Say not to your neighbour, Go, and come again, and tomorrow I will give; when you have it by you at the time.

title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Verse 29
text: Do not make evil designs against your neighbour, when he is living with you without fear.

title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Verse 30
text: Do not take up a cause at law against a man for nothing, if he has done you no wrong.

title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Verse 31
text: Have no envy of the violent man, or take any of his ways as an example.

title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Verse 32
text: For the wrong-hearted man is hated by the Lord, but he is a friend to the upright.

title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Verse 33
text: The curse of the Lord is on the house of the evil-doer, but his blessing is on the tent of the upright.

title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Verse 34
text: He makes sport of the men of pride, but he gives grace to the gentle-hearted.

title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Verse 35
text: The wise will have glory for their heritage, but shame will be the reward of the foolish.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Give ear, my sons, to the teaching of a father; give attention so that you may have knowledge:

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: For I give you good teaching; do not give up the knowledge you are getting from me.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: For I was a son to my father, a gentle and an only one to my mother.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And he gave me teaching, saying to me, Keep my words in your heart; keep my rules so that you may have life:

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Get wisdom, get true knowledge; keep it in memory, do not be turned away from the words of my mouth.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: Do not give her up, and she will keep you; give her your love, and she will make you safe.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: The first sign of wisdom is to get wisdom; go, give all you have to get true knowledge.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: Put her in a high place, and you will be lifted up by her; she will give you honour, when you give her your love.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: She will put a crown of grace on your head, giving you a head-dress of glory.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: Give ear, O my son, and let your heart be open to my sayings; and long life will be yours.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: I have given you teaching in the way of wisdom, guiding your steps in the straight way.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: When you go, your way will not be narrow, and in running you will not have a fall.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: Take learning in your hands, do not let her go: keep her, for she is your life.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Do not go in the road of sinners, or be walking in the way of evil men.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: Keep far from it, do not go near; be turned from it, and go on your way.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: For they take no rest till they have done evil; their sleep is taken away if they have not been the cause of someone's fall.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: The bread of evil-doing is their food, the wine of violent acts their drink.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: But the way of the upright is like the light of early morning, getting brighter and brighter till the full day.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: The way of sinners is dark; they see not the cause of their fall.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: My son, give attention to my words; let your ear be turned to my sayings.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: Let them not go from your eyes; keep them deep in your heart.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: For they are life to him who gets them, and strength to all his flesh.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: And keep watch over your heart with all care; so you will have life.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: Put away from you an evil tongue, and let false lips be far from you.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: Keep your eyes on what is in front of you, looking straight before you.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: Keep a watch on your behaviour; let all your ways be rightly ordered.

title: Proverbs Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: Let there be no turning to the right or to the left, keep your feet from evil.

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: My son, give attention to my wisdom; let your ear be turned to my teaching:

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: So that you may be ruled by a wise purpose, and your lips may keep knowledge.

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: For honey is dropping from the lips of the strange woman, and her mouth is smoother than oil;

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: But her end is bitter as wormwood, and sharp as a two-edged sword;

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: Her feet go down to death, and her steps to the underworld;

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: She never keeps her mind on the road of life; her ways are uncertain, she has no knowledge.

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: Give ear to me then, my sons, and do not put away my words from you.

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: Go far away from her, do not come near the door of her house;

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: For fear that you may give your honour to others, and your wealth to strange men:

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: And strange men may be full of your wealth, and the fruit of your work go to the house of others;

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: And you will be full of grief at the end of your life, when your flesh and your body are wasted;

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And you will say, How was teaching hated by me, and my heart put no value on training;

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: I did not give attention to the voice of my teachers, my ear was not turned to those who were guiding me!

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: I was in almost all evil in the company of the people.

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: Let water from your store and not that of others be your drink, and running water from your fountain.

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: Let not your springs be flowing in the streets, or your streams of water in the open places.

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: Let them be for yourself only, not for other men with you.

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: Let blessing be on your fountain; have joy in the wife of your early years.

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: As a loving hind and a gentle doe, let her breasts ever give you rapture; let your passion at all times be moved by her love.

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: Why let yourself, my son, go out of the way with a strange woman, and take another woman in your arms?

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: For a man's ways are before the eyes of the Lord, and he puts all his goings in the scales.

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: The evil-doer will be taken in the net of his crimes, and prisoned in the cords of his sin.

title: Proverbs Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: He will come to his end for need of teaching; he is so foolish that he will go wandering from the right way.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: My son, if you have made yourself responsible for your neighbour, or given your word for another,

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: You are taken as in a net by the words of your mouth, the sayings of your lips have overcome you.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: Do this, my son, and make yourself free, because you have come into the power of your neighbour; go without waiting, and make a strong request to your neighbour.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: Give no sleep to your eyes, or rest to them;

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: Make yourself free, like the roe from the hand of the archer, and the bird from him who puts a net for her.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: Go to the ant, you hater of work; give thought to her ways and be wise:

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: Having no chief, overseer, or ruler,

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: She gets her meat in the summer, storing up food at the time of the grain-cutting.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: How long will you be sleeping, O hater of work? when will you get up from your sleep?

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: A little sleep, a little rest, a little folding of the hands in sleep:

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: Then loss will come on you like an outlaw, and your need like an armed man

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: A good-for-nothing man is an evil-doer; he goes on his way causing trouble with false words;

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: Making signs with his eyes, rubbing with his feet, and giving news with his fingers;

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: His mind is ever designing evil: he lets loose violent acts.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: For this cause his downfall will be sudden; quickly he will be broken, and there will be no help for him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: Six things are hated by the Lord; seven things are disgusting to him:

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: Eyes of pride, a false tongue, hands which take life without cause;

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: A heart full of evil designs, feet which are quick in running after sin;

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: A false witness, breathing out untrue words, and one who lets loose violent acts among brothers.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: My son, keep the rule of your father, and have in memory the teaching of your mother:

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: Keep them ever folded in your heart, and have them hanging round your neck.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: In your walking, it will be your guide; when you are sleeping, it will keep watch over you; when you are awake, it will have talk with you.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: For the rule is a light, and the teaching a shining light; and the guiding words of training are the way of life.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: They will keep you from the evil woman, from the smooth tongue of the strange woman.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: Let not your heart's desire go after her fair body; let not her eyes take you prisoner.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: For a loose woman is looking for a cake of bread, but another man's wife goes after one's very life.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: May a man take fire to his breast without burning his clothing?

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: Or may one go on lighted coals, and his feet not be burned?

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: So it is with him who goes in to his neighbour's wife; he who has anything to do with her will not go free from punishment.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: Men do not have a low opinion of a thief who takes food when he is in need of it:

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 31
text: But if he is taken in the act he will have to give back seven times as much, giving up all his property which is in his house.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 32
text: He who takes another man's wife is without all sense: he who does it is the cause of destruction to his soul.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 33
text: Wounds will be his and loss of honour, and his shame may not be washed away.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 34
text: For bitter is the wrath of an angry husband; in the day of punishment he will have no mercy.

title: Proverbs Chapter 6 Verse 35
text: He will not take any payment; and he will not make peace with you though your money offerings are increased.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: My son, keep my sayings, and let my rules be stored up with you.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: Keep my rules and you will have life; let my teaching be to you as the light of your eyes;

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Let them be fixed to your fingers, and recorded in your heart.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: Say to wisdom, You are my sister; let knowledge be named your special friend:

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: So that they may keep you from the strange woman, even from her whose words are smooth.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: Looking out from my house, and watching through the window,

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: I saw among the young men one without sense,

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: Walking in the street near the turn of her road, going on the way to her house,

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: At nightfall, in the evening of the day, in the black dark of the night.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And the woman came out to him, in the dress of a loose woman, with a designing heart;

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: She is full of noise and uncontrolled; her feet keep not in her house.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: Now she is in the street, now in the open spaces, waiting at every turning of the road.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: So she took him by his hand, kissing him, and without a sign of shame she said to him:

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: I have a feast of peace-offerings, for today my oaths have been effected.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: So I came out in the hope of meeting you, looking for you with care, and now I have you.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: My bed is covered with cushions of needlework, with coloured cloths of the cotton thread of Egypt;

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: I have made my bed sweet with perfumes and spices.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: Come, let us take our pleasure in love till the morning, having joy in love's delights.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: For the master of the house is away on a long journey:

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: He has taken a bag of money with him; he is coming back at the full moon.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: With her fair words she overcame him, forcing him with her smooth lips.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: The simple man goes after her, like an ox going to its death, like a roe pulled by a cord;

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: Like a bird falling into a net; with no thought that his life is in danger, till an arrow goes into his side.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: So now, my sons, give ear to me; give attention to the sayings of my mouth;

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: Let not your heart be turned to her ways, do not go wandering in her footsteps.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: For those wounded and made low by her are great in number; and all those who have come to their death through her are a great army.

title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: Her house is the way to the underworld, going down to the rooms of death.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Is not wisdom crying out, and the voice of knowledge sounding?

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: At the top of the highways, at the meeting of the roads, she takes her place;

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: Where the roads go into the town her cry goes out, at the doorways her voice is loud:

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: I am crying out to you, O men; my voice comes to the sons of men.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: Become expert in reason, O you simple ones; you foolish ones, take training to heart.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: Give ear, for my words are true, and my lips are open to give out what is upright.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: For good faith goes out of my mouth, and false lips are disgusting to me.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: All the words of my mouth are righteousness; there is nothing false or twisted in them.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: They are all true to him whose mind is awake, and straightforward to those who get knowledge.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: Take my teaching, and not silver; get knowledge in place of the best gold.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: For wisdom is better than jewels, and all things which may be desired are nothing in comparison with her.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: I, wisdom, have made wise behaviour my near relation; I am seen to be the special friend of wise purposes.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: The fear of the Lord is seen in hating evil: pride, a high opinion of oneself, the evil way, and the false tongue, are unpleasing to me.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: Wise design and good sense are mine; reason and strength are mine.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: Through me kings have their power, and rulers give right decisions.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: Through me chiefs have authority, and the noble ones are judging in righteousness.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: Those who have given me their love are loved by me, and those who make search for me with care will get me.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: Wealth and honour are in my hands, even wealth without equal and righteousness.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: My fruit is better than gold, even than the best gold; and my increase is more to be desired than silver.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: I go in the road of righteousness, in the way of right judging:

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: So that I may give my lovers wealth for their heritage, making their store-houses full.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: The Lord made me as the start of his way, the first of his works in the past.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 23
text: From eternal days I was given my place, from the birth of time, before the earth was.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 24
text: When there was no deep I was given birth, when there were no fountains flowing with water.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 25
text: Before the mountains were put in their places, before the hills was my birth:

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 26
text: When he had not made the earth or the fields or the dust of the world.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 27
text: When he made ready the heavens I was there: when he put an arch over the face of the deep:

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 28
text: When he made strong the skies overhead: when the fountains of the deep were fixed:

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 29
text: When he put a limit to the sea, so that the waters might not go against his word: when he put in position the bases of the earth:

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 30
text: Then I was by his side, as a master workman: and I was his delight from day to day, playing before him at all times;

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 31
text: Playing in his earth; and my delight was with the sons of men.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 32
text: Give ear to me then, my sons: for happy are those who keep my ways.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 33
text: Take my teaching and be wise; do not let it go.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 34
text: Happy is the man who gives ear to me, watching at my doors day by day, keeping his place by the pillars of my house.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 35
text: For whoever gets me gets life, and grace from the Lord will come to him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 8 Verse 36
text: But he who does evil to me, does wrong to his soul: all my haters are in love with death.

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Wisdom has made her house, putting up her seven pillars.

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: She has put her fat beasts to death; her wine is mixed, her table is ready.

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: She has sent out her women-servants; her voice goes out to the highest places of the town, saying,

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: Whoever is simple, let him come in here; and to him who has no sense, she says:

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: Come, take of my bread, and of my wine which is mixed.

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: Give up the simple ones and have life, and go in the way of knowledge.

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: He who gives teaching to a man of pride gets shame for himself; he who says sharp words to a sinner gets a bad name.

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: Do not say sharp words to a man of pride, or he will have hate for you; make them clear to a wise man, and you will be dear to him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: Give teaching to a wise man, and he will become wiser; give training to an upright man, and his learning will be increased.

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: The fear of the Lord is the start of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One gives a wise mind

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: For by me your days will be increased, and the years of your life will be long.

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: If you are wise, you are wise for yourself; if your heart is full of pride, you only will have the pain of it.

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: The foolish woman is full of noise; she has no sense at all.

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: Seated at the door of her house, in the high places of the town,

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: Crying out to those who go by, going straight on their way, she says:

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: Whoever is simple, let him come in here: and to him who is without sense, she says:

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: Drink taken without right is sweet, and food in secret is pleasing.

title: Proverbs Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: But he does not see that the dead are there, that her guests are in the deep places of the underworld.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: A wise son makes a glad father, but a foolish son is a sorrow to his mother.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: Wealth which comes from sin is of no profit, but righteousness gives salvation from death.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: The Lord will not let the upright be in need of food, but he puts far from him the desire of the evil-doers.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: He who is slow in his work becomes poor, but the hand of the ready worker gets in wealth.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: He who in summer gets together his store is a son who does wisely; but he who takes his rest when the grain is being cut is a son causing shame.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: Blessings are on the head of the upright, but the face of sinners will be covered with sorrow.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: The memory of the upright is a blessing, but the name of the evil-doer will be turned to dust.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: The wise-hearted man will let himself be ruled, but the man whose talk is foolish will have a fall.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: He whose ways are upright will go safely, but he whose ways are twisted will be made low.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: He who makes signs with his eyes is a cause of trouble, but he who makes a man see his errors is a cause of peace.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: The mouth of the upright man is a fountain of life, but the mouth of the evil-doer is a bitter cup.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: Hate is a cause of violent acts, but all errors are covered up by love.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: In the lips of him who has knowledge wisdom is seen; but a rod is ready for the back of him who is without sense.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: Knowledge is stored up by the wise, but the mouth of the foolish man is a destruction which is near.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: The property of the man of wealth is his strong town: the poor man's need is his destruction.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: The work of the upright gives life: the increase of the evil-doer is a cause of sin.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: He who takes note of teaching is a way of life, but he who gives up training is a cause of error.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: Hate is covered up by the lips of the upright man, but he who lets out evil about another is foolish.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: Where there is much talk there will be no end to sin, but he who keeps his mouth shut does wisely.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: The tongue of the upright man is like tested silver: the heart of the evil-doer is of little value.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: The lips of the upright man give food to men, but the foolish come to death for need of sense.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: The blessing of the Lord gives wealth: hard work makes it no greater.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: It is sport to the foolish man to do evil, but the man of good sense takes delight in wisdom.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: The thing feared by the evil-doer will come to him, but the upright man will get his desire.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: When the storm-wind is past, the sinner is seen no longer, but the upright man is safe for ever.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: Like acid drink to the teeth and as smoke to the eyes, so is the hater of work to those who send him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: The fear of the Lord gives long life, but the years of the evil-doer will be cut short.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: The hope of the upright man will give joy, but the waiting of the evil-doer will have its end in sorrow.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: The way of the Lord is a strong tower for the upright man, but destruction to the workers of evil.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: The upright man will never be moved, but evil-doers will not have a safe resting-place in the land.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: The mouth of the upright man is budding with wisdom, but the twisted tongue will be cut off.

title: Proverbs Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: The lips of the upright man have knowledge of what is pleasing, but twisted are the mouths of evil-doers.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Scales of deceit are hated by the Lord, but a true weight is his delight.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: When pride comes, there comes shame, but wisdom is with the quiet in spirit.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: The righteousness of the upright will be their guide, but the twisted ways of the false will be their destruction.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: Wealth is of no profit in the day of wrath, but righteousness keeps a man safe from death.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: The righteousness of the good man will make his way straight, but the sin of the evil-doer will be the cause of his fall.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: The righteousness of the upright will be their salvation, but the false will themselves be taken in their evil designs.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: At the death of an upright man his hope does not come to an end, but the hope of the evil-doer comes to destruction.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: The upright man is taken out of trouble, and in his place comes the sinner.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: With his mouth the evil man sends destruction on his neighbour; but through knowledge the upright are taken out of trouble.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: When things go well for the upright man, all the town is glad; at the death of sinners, there are cries of joy.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: By the blessing of the upright man the town is made great, but it is overturned by the mouth of the evil-doer.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: He who has a poor opinion of his neighbour has no sense, but a wise man keeps quiet.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: He who goes about talking of others makes secrets public, but the true-hearted man keeps things covered.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: When there is no helping suggestion the people will have a fall, but with a number of wise guides they will be safe.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: He who makes himself responsible for a strange man will undergo much loss; but the hater of such undertakings will be safe.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: A woman who is full of grace is honoured, but a woman hating righteousness is a seat of shame: those hating work will undergo loss, but the strong keep their wealth.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: The man who has mercy will be rewarded, but the cruel man is the cause of trouble to himself.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: The sinner gets the payment of deceit; but his reward is certain who puts in the seed of righteousness.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: So righteousness gives life; but he who goes after evil gets death for himself.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: The uncontrolled are hated by the Lord, but those whose ways are without error are his delight

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: Certainly the evil-doer will not go free from punishment, but the seed of the upright man will be safe.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: Like a ring of gold in the nose of a pig, is a beautiful woman who has no sense.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: The desire of the upright man is only for good, but wrath is waiting for the evil-doer.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: A man may give freely, and still his wealth will be increased; and another may keep back more than is right, but only comes to be in need.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: He who gives blessing will be made fat, but the curser will himself be cursed.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: He who keeps back grain will be cursed by the people; but a blessing will be on the head of him who lets them have it for a price.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: He who, with all his heart, goes after what is good is searching for grace; but he who is looking for trouble will get it.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: He who puts his faith in wealth will come to nothing; but the upright man will be full of growth like the green leaf.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: The troubler of his house will have the wind for his heritage, and the foolish will be servant to the wise-hearted.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: The fruit of righteousness is a tree of life, but violent behaviour takes away souls.

title: Proverbs Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: If the upright man is rewarded on earth, how much more the evil-doer and the sinner!

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: A lover of training is a lover of knowledge; but a hater of teaching is like a beast.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: A good man has grace in the eyes of the Lord; but the man of evil designs gets punishment from him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: No man will make himself safe through evil-doing; but the root of upright men will never be moved.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: A woman of virtue is a crown to her husband; but she whose behaviour is a cause of shame is like a wasting disease in his bones.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: The purposes of upright men are right, but the designs of evil-doers are deceit.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: The words of sinners are destruction for the upright; but the mouth of upright men is their salvation.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: Evil-doers are overturned and never seen again, but the house of upright men will keep its place.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: A man will be praised in the measure of his wisdom, but a wrong-minded man will be looked down on.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: He who is of low position and has a servant, is better than one who has a high opinion of himself and is in need of bread.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: An upright man has thought for the life of his beast, but the hearts of evil-doers are cruel.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: He who does work on his land will not be short of bread; but he who goes after foolish men is without sense.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: The resting-place of the sinner will come to destruction, but the root of upright men is for ever.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: In the sin of the lips is a net which takes the sinner, but the upright man will come out of trouble.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: From the fruit of his mouth will a man have good food in full measure, and the work of a man's hands will be rewarded.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: The way of the foolish man seems right to him? but the wise man gives ear to suggestions.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: A foolish man lets his trouble be openly seen, but a sharp man keeps shame secret.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: The breathing out of true words gives knowledge of righteousness; but a false witness gives out deceit.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: There are some whose uncontrolled talk is like the wounds of a sword, but the tongue of the wise makes one well again.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: True lips are certain for ever, but a false tongue is only for a minute.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: Deceit is in the heart of those whose designs are evil, but for those purposing peace there is joy.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: No trouble will come to upright men, but sinners will be full of evil.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: False lips are hated by the Lord, but those whose acts are true are his delight.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: A sharp man keeps back his knowledge; but the heart of foolish men makes clear their foolish thoughts.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: The hand of the ready worker will have authority, but he who is slow in his work will be put to forced work.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: Care in the heart of a man makes it weighted down, but a good word makes it glad.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: The upright man is a guide to his neighbour, but the way of evil-doers is a cause of error to them.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: He who is slow in his work does not go in search of food; but the ready worker gets much wealth.

title: Proverbs Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: In the road of righteousness is life, but the way of the evil-doer goes to death.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: A wise son is a lover of teaching, but the ears of the haters of authority are shut to sharp words.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: A man will get good from the fruit of his lips, but the desire of the false is for violent acts.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: He who keeps a watch on his mouth keeps his life; but he whose lips are open wide will have destruction.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: The hater of work does not get his desires, but the soul of the hard workers will be made fat.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: The upright man is a hater of false words: the evil-doer gets a bad name and is put to shame.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: Righteousness keeps safe him whose way is without error, but evil-doers are overturned by sin.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: A man may be acting as if he had wealth, but have nothing; another may seem poor, but have great wealth.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: A man will give his wealth in exchange for his life; but the poor will not give ear to sharp words.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: There is a glad dawn for the upright man, but the light of the sinner will be put out.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: The only effect of pride is fighting; but wisdom is with the quiet in spirit.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: Wealth quickly got will become less; but he who gets a store by the work of his hands will have it increased.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: Hope put off is a weariness to the heart; but when what is desired comes, it is a tree of life.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: He who makes sport of the word will come to destruction, but the respecter of the law will be rewarded.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life, turning men away from the nets of death.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: Wise behaviour gets approval, but the way of the false is their destruction.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: A sharp man does everything with knowledge, but a foolish man makes clear his foolish thoughts.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: A man taking false news is a cause of trouble, but he who gives news rightly makes things well.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: Need and shame will be the fate of him who is uncontrolled by training; but he who takes note of teaching will be honoured.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: To get one's desire is sweet to the soul, but to give up evil is disgusting to the foolish.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: Go with wise men and be wise: but he who keeps company with the foolish will be broken.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: Evil will overtake sinners, but the upright will be rewarded with good.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: The heritage of the good man is handed down to his children's children; and the wealth of the sinner is stored up for the upright man.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: There is much food in the ploughed land of the poor; but it is taken away by wrongdoing.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: He who keeps back his rod is unkind to his son: the loving father gives punishment with care.

title: Proverbs Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: The upright man has food to the full measure of his desire, but there will be no food for the stomach of evil-doers.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: Wisdom is building her house, but the foolish woman is pulling it down with her hands.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: He who goes on his way in righteousness has before him the fear of the Lord; but he whose ways are twisted gives him no honour.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: In the mouth of the foolish man is a rod for his back, but the lips of the wise will keep them safe.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: Where there are no oxen, their food-place is clean; but much increase comes through the strength of the ox.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: A true witness does not say what is false, but a false witness is breathing out deceit.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: The hater of authority, searching for wisdom, does not get it; but knowledge comes readily to the open-minded man.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: Go away from the foolish man, for you will not see the lips of knowledge.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: The wisdom of the man of good sense makes his way clear; but the unwise behaviour of the foolish is deceit.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: In the tents of those hating authority there is error, but in the house of the upright man there is grace.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: No one has knowledge of a man's grief but himself; and a strange person has no part in his joy.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: The house of the sinner will be overturned, but the tent of the upright man will do well.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: There is a way which seems straight before a man, but its end is the ways of death.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: Even while laughing the heart may be sad; and after joy comes sorrow.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: He whose heart is turned away will have the reward of his ways in full measure; but a good man will have the reward of his doings.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: The simple man has faith in every word, but the man of good sense gives thought to his footsteps.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: The wise man, fearing, keeps himself from evil; but the foolish man goes on in his pride, with no thought of danger.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: He who is quickly angry will do what is foolish, but the man of good sense will have quiet.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: Foolish behaviour is the heritage of the simple, but men of good sense are crowned with knowledge.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: The knees of the evil are bent before the good; and sinners go down in the dust at the doors of the upright.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: The poor man is hated even by his neighbour, but the man of wealth has numbers of friends.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: He who has no respect for his neighbour is a sinner, but he who has pity for the poor is happy.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: Will not the designers of evil come into error? But mercy and good faith are for the designers of good.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: In all hard work there is profit, but talk only makes a man poor.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: Their wisdom is a crown to the wise, but their foolish behaviour is round the head of the unwise.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: A true witness is the saviour of lives; but he who says false things is a cause of deceit.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: For him in whose heart is the fear of the Lord there is strong hope: and his children will have a safe place.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life, by which one may be turned from the nets of death.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: A king's glory is in the number of his people: and for need of people a ruler may come to destruction.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: He who is slow to be angry has great good sense; but he whose spirit is over-quick gives support to what is foolish.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: A quiet mind is the life of the body, but envy is a disease in the bones.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: He who is hard on the poor puts shame on his Maker; but he who has mercy on those who are in need gives him honour.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 32
text: The sinner is overturned in his evil-doing, but the upright man has hope in his righteousness.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 33
text: Wisdom has her resting-place in the mind of the wise, but she is not seen among the foolish.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 34
text: By righteousness a nation is lifted up, but sin is a cause of shame to the peoples.

title: Proverbs Chapter 14 Verse 35
text: The king has pleasure in a servant who does wisely, but his wrath is against him who is a cause of shame.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: By a soft answer wrath is turned away, but a bitter word is a cause of angry feelings.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: Knowledge is dropping from the tongue of the wise; but from the mouth of the foolish comes a stream of foolish words.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: The eyes of the Lord are in every place, keeping watch on the evil and the good.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: A comforting tongue is a tree of life, but a twisted tongue is a crushing of the spirit.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: A foolish man puts no value on his father's training; but he who has respect for teaching has good sense.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: In the house of the upright man there is a great store of wealth; but in the profits of the sinner there is trouble.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: The lips of the wise keep knowledge, but the heart of the foolish man is not right.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: The offering of the evil-doer is disgusting to the Lord, but the prayer of the upright man is his delight.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: The way of the evil-doer is disgusting to the Lord, but he who goes after righteousness is dear to him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: There is bitter punishment for him who is turned from the way; and death will be the fate of the hater of teaching.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 11
text: Before the Lord are the underworld and destruction: how much more, then, the hearts of the children of men!

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: The hater of authority has no love for teaching: he will not go to the wise.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: A glad heart makes a shining face, but by the sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: The heart of the man of good sense goes in search of knowledge, but foolish things are the food of the unwise.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: All the days of the troubled are evil; but he whose heart is glad has an unending feast.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: Better is a little with the fear of the Lord, than great wealth together with trouble.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: Better is a simple meal where love is, than a fat ox and hate with it.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: An angry man makes men come to blows, but he who is slow to get angry puts an end to fighting.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: Thorns are round the way of the hater of work; but the road of the hard worker becomes a highway.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: A wise son makes a glad father, but a foolish man has no respect for his mother.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: Foolish behaviour is joy to the unwise; but a man of good sense makes his way straight.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 22
text: Where there are no wise suggestions, purposes come to nothing; but by a number of wise guides they are made certain.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 23
text: A man has joy in the answer of his mouth: and a word at the right time, how good it is!

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 24
text: Acting wisely is the way of life, guiding a man away from the underworld.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 25
text: The house of the man of pride will be uprooted by the Lord, but he will make safe the heritage of the widow.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 26
text: Evil designs are disgusting to the Lord, but the words of the clean-hearted are pleasing.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 27
text: He whose desires are fixed on profit is a cause of trouble to his family; but he who has no desire for offerings will have life.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 28
text: The heart of the upright gives thought to his answer; but from the mouth of the evil-doer comes a stream of evil things.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 29
text: The Lord is far from sinners, but his ear is open to the prayer of the upright.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 30
text: The light of the eyes is a joy to the heart, and good news makes the bones fat.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 31
text: The man whose ear is open to the teaching of life will have his place among the wise.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 32
text: He who will not be controlled by training has no respect for his soul, but he who gives ear to teaching will get wisdom.

title: Proverbs Chapter 15 Verse 33
text: The fear of the Lord is the teaching of wisdom; and a low opinion of oneself goes before honour.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: The designs of the heart are man's, but the answer of the tongue comes from the Lord.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: All a man's ways are clean to himself; but the Lord puts men's spirits into his scales.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: Put your works into the hands of the Lord, and your purposes will be made certain.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: The Lord has made everything for his purpose, even the sinner for the day of evil.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: Everyone who has pride in his heart is disgusting to the Lord: he will certainly not go free from punishment.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: By mercy and good faith evil-doing is taken away: and by the fear of the Lord men are turned away from evil.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: When a man's ways are pleasing to the Lord, he makes even his haters be at peace with him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: Better is a little with righteousness, than great wealth with wrongdoing.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: A man may make designs for his way, but the Lord is the guide of his steps.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: Decision is in the lips of the king: his mouth will not go wrong in judging.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: True measures and scales are the Lord's: all the weights of the bag are his work.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: Evil-doing is disgusting to kings: for the seat of the ruler is based on righteousness.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: Lips of righteousness are the delight of kings; and he who says what is upright is dear to him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: The wrath of the king is like those who give news of death, but a wise man will put peace in place of it.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: In the light of the king's face there is life; and his approval is like a cloud of spring rain.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: How much better it is to get wisdom than gold! and to get knowledge is more to be desired than silver.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: The highway of the upright is to be turned away from evil: he who takes care of his way will keep his soul.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: Pride goes before destruction, and a stiff spirit before a fall.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: Better it is to have a gentle spirit with the poor, than to take part in the rewards of war with men of pride.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: He who gives attention to the law of right will get good; and whoever puts his faith in the Lord is happy.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: The wise-hearted will be named men of good sense: and by pleasing words learning is increased.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 22
text: Wisdom is a fountain of life to him who has it; but the punishment of the foolish is their foolish behaviour.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 23
text: The heart of the wise man is the teacher of his mouth, and gives increased learning to his lips.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 24
text: Pleasing words are like honey, sweet to the soul and new life to the bones.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 25
text: There is a way which seems straight before a man, but its end is the ways of death.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 26
text: The desire of the working man is working for him, for his need of food is driving him on.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 27
text: A good-for-nothing man is a designer of evil, and in his lips there is a burning fire.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 28
text: A man of twisted purposes is a cause of fighting everywhere: and he who says evil secretly makes trouble between friends.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 29
text: A violent man puts desire of evil into his neighbour's mind, and makes him go in a way which is not good.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 30
text: He whose eyes are shut is a man of twisted purposes, and he who keeps his lips shut tight makes evil come about.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 31
text: The grey head is a crown of glory, if it is seen in the way of righteousness.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 32
text: He who is slow to be angry is better than a man of war, and he who has control over his spirit than he who takes a town.

title: Proverbs Chapter 16 Verse 33
text: A thing may be put to the decision of chance, but it comes about through the Lord.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: Better a bit of dry bread in peace, than a house full of feasting and violent behaviour.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: A servant who does wisely will have rule over a son causing shame, and will have his part in the heritage among brothers.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: The heating-pot is for silver and the oven-fire for gold, but the Lord is the tester of hearts.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: A wrongdoer gives attention to evil lips, and a man of deceit gives ear to a damaging tongue.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: Whoever makes sport of the poor puts shame on his Maker; and he who is glad because of trouble will not go free from punishment.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: Children's children are the crown of old men, and the glory of children is their fathers.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: Fair words are not to be looked for from a foolish man, much less are false lips in a ruler.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: An offering of money is like a stone of great price in the eyes of him who has it: wherever he goes, he does well.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: He who keeps a sin covered is looking for love; but he who keeps on talking of a thing makes division between friends.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: A word of protest goes deeper into one who has sense than a hundred blows into a foolish man.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: An uncontrolled man is only looking for trouble, so a cruel servant will be sent against him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: It is better to come face to face with a bear whose young ones have been taken away than with a foolish man acting foolishly.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: If anyone gives back evil for good, evil will never go away from his house.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: The start of fighting is like the letting out of water: so give up before it comes to blows.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: He who gives a decision for the evil-doer and he who gives a decision against the upright, are equally disgusting to the Lord.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: How will money in the hand of the foolish get him wisdom, seeing that he has no sense?

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: A friend is loving at all times, and becomes a brother in times of trouble.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: A man without sense gives his hand in an agreement, and makes himself responsible before his neighbour.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: The lover of fighting is a lover of sin: he who makes high his doorway is looking for destruction.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: Nothing good comes to him whose heart is fixed on evil purposes: and he who has an evil tongue will come to trouble.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 21
text: He who has an unwise son gets sorrow for himself, and the father of a foolish son has no joy.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: A glad heart makes a healthy body, but a crushed spirit makes the bones dry.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: A sinner takes an offering out of his robe, to get a decision for himself in a cause.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: Wisdom is before the face of him who has sense; but the eyes of the foolish are on the ends of the earth.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 25
text: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitter pain to her who gave him birth.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 26
text: To give punishment to the upright is not good, or to give blows to the noble for their righteousness.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 27
text: He who has knowledge says little: and he who has a calm spirit is a man of good sense.

title: Proverbs Chapter 17 Verse 28
text: Even the foolish man, when he keeps quiet, is taken to be wise: when his lips are shut he is credited with good sense.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: He who keeps himself separate for his private purpose goes against all good sense.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: A foolish man has no pleasure in good sense, but only to let what is in his heart come to light.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: When the evil-doer comes, a low opinion comes with him, and with the loss of honour comes shame.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: The words of a man's mouth are like deep waters: the fountain of wisdom is like a flowing stream.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: To have respect for the person of the evil-doer is not good, or to give a wrong decision against the upright.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: A foolish man's lips are a cause of fighting, and his mouth makes him open to blows.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: The mouth of a foolish man is his destruction, and his lips are a net for his soul.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: The words of one who says evil of his neighbour secretly are like sweet food, and go down into the inner parts of the stomach.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: He who does not give his mind to his work is brother to him who makes destruction.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: The name of the Lord is a strong tower: the upright man running into it is safe.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: The property of a man of wealth is his strong town, and it is as a high wall in the thoughts of his heart.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: Before destruction the heart of man is full of pride, and before honour goes a gentle spirit.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: To give an answer before hearing is a foolish thing and a cause of shame.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: The spirit of a man will be his support when he is ill; but how may a broken spirit be lifted up?

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: The heart of the man of good sense gets knowledge; the ear of the wise is searching for knowledge.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: A man's offering makes room for him, letting him come before great men.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: The man who first puts his cause before the judge seems to be in the right; but then his neighbour comes and puts his cause in its true light.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: The decision of chance puts an end to argument, parting the strong.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: A brother wounded is like a strong town, and violent acts are like a locked tower.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: With the fruit of a man's mouth his stomach will be full; the produce of his lips will be his in full measure.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; and those to whom it is dear will have its fruit for their food.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: Whoever gets a wife gets a good thing, and has the approval of the Lord.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: The poor man makes requests for grace, but the man of wealth gives a rough answer.

title: Proverbs Chapter 18 Verse 24
text: There are friends who may be a man's destruction, but there is a lover who keeps nearer than a brother.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: Better is the poor man whose ways are upright, than the man of wealth whose ways are twisted.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: Further, without knowledge desire is not good; and he who is over-quick in acting goes out of the right way.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: By his foolish behaviour a man's ways are turned upside down, and his heart is bitter against the Lord.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: Wealth makes a great number of friends; but the poor man is parted from his friend.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: A false witness will not go without punishment, and the breather out of deceit will not go free.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: Great numbers will make attempts to get the approval of a ruler: and every man is the special friend of him who has something to give.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: All the brothers of the poor man are against him: how much more do his friends go far from him! ...

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: He who gets wisdom has love for his soul: he who keeps good sense will get what is truly good.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: A false witness will not go without punishment, and the breather out of deceit will be cut off.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: Material comfort is not good for the foolish; much less for a servant to be put over rulers.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: A man's good sense makes him slow to wrath, and the overlooking of wrongdoing is his glory.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: The king's wrath is like the loud cry of a lion, but his approval is like dew on the grass.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: A foolish son is the destruction of his father; and the bitter arguments of a wife are like drops of rain falling without end.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: House and wealth are a heritage from fathers, but a wife with good sense is from the Lord.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: Hate of work sends deep sleep on a man: and he who has no industry will go without food.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 16
text: He who keeps the law keeps his soul; but death will be the fate of him who takes no note of the word.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 17
text: He who has pity on the poor gives to the Lord, and the Lord will give him his reward.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 18
text: Give your son training while there is hope; let not your heart be purposing his death.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 19
text: A man of great wrath will have to take his punishment: for if you get him out of trouble you will have to do it again.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 20
text: Let your ear be open to suggestion and take teaching, so that at the end you may be wise.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 21
text: A man's heart may be full of designs, but the purpose of the Lord is unchanging.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 22
text: The ornament of a man is his mercy, and a poor man is better than one who is false.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 23
text: The fear of the Lord gives life: and he who has it will have need of nothing; no evil will come his way.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 24
text: The hater of work puts his hand deep into the basin, and will not even take it to his mouth again.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 25
text: When blows overtake the man of pride, the simple will get sense; say sharp words to the wise, and knowledge will be made clear to him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 26
text: He who is violent to his father, driving away his mother, is a son causing shame and a bad name.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 27
text: A son who no longer gives attention to teaching is turned away from the words of knowledge.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 28
text: A good-for-nothing witness makes sport of the judge's decision: and the mouth of evil-doers sends out evil like a stream.

title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Verse 29
text: Rods are being made ready for the man of pride, and blows for the back of the foolish.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: Wine makes men foolish, and strong drink makes men come to blows; and whoever comes into error through these is not wise.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: The wrath of a king is like the loud cry of a lion: he who makes him angry does wrong against himself.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: It is an honour for a man to keep from fighting, but the foolish are ever at war.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: The hater of work will not do his ploughing because of the winter; so at the time of grain-cutting he will be requesting food and will get nothing.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: The purpose in the heart of a man is like deep water, but a man of good sense will get it out.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: Most men make no secret of their kind acts: but where is a man of good faith to be seen?

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: An upright man goes on in his righteousness: happy are his children after him!

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: A king on the seat of judging puts to flight all evil with his eyes.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: Who is able to say, I have made my heart clean, I am free from my sin?

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: Unequal weights and unequal measures, they are all disgusting to the Lord.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: Even a child may be judged by his doings, if his work is free from sin and if it is right.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: The hearing ear and the seeing eye are equally the Lord's work.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: Do not be a lover of sleep, or you will become poor: keep your eyes open, and you will have bread enough.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: A poor thing, a poor thing, says he who is giving money for goods: but when he has gone on his way, then he makes clear his pride in what he has got.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: There is gold and a store of corals: but the lips of knowledge are a jewel of great price.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: Take a man's clothing if he makes himself responsible for a strange man, and get an undertaking from him who gives his word for strange men.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but after, his mouth will be full of sand.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: Every purpose is put into effect by wise help: and by wise guiding make war.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 19
text: He who goes about talking of the business of others gives away secrets: so have nothing to do with him whose lips are open wide.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 20
text: If anyone puts a curse on his father or his mother, his light will be put out in the blackest night.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 21
text: A heritage may be got quickly at first, but the end of it will not be a blessing.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 22
text: Do not say, I will give punishment for evil: go on waiting for the Lord, and he will be your saviour.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 23
text: Unequal weights are disgusting to the Lord, and false scales are not good.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 24
text: A man's steps are of the Lord; how then may a man have knowledge of his way?

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 25
text: It is a danger to a man to say without thought, It is holy, and, after taking his oaths, to be questioning if it is necessary to keep them.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 26
text: A wise king puts evil-doers to flight, and makes their evil-doing come back on them.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 27
text: The Lord keeps watch over the spirit of man, searching all the deepest parts of the body.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 28
text: Mercy and good faith keep the king safe, and the seat of his power is based on upright acts.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 29
text: The glory of young men is their strength, and the honour of old men is their grey hairs.

title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Verse 30
text: By the wounds of the rod evil is taken away, and blows make clean the deepest parts of the body.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: The king's heart in the hands of the Lord is like the water streams, and by him it is turned in any direction at his pleasure.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: Every way of a man seems right to himself, but the Lord is the tester of hearts.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: To do what is right and true is more pleasing to the Lord than an offering.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: A high look and a heart of pride, *** of the evil-doer is sin.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: The purposes of the man of industry have their outcome only in wealth; but one who is over-quick in acting will only come to be in need.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: He who gets stores of wealth by a false tongue, is going after what is only breath, and searching for death.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: By their violent acts the evil-doers will be pulled away, because they have no desire to do what is right.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: Twisted is the way of him who is full of crime; but as for him whose heart is clean, his work is upright.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: It is better to be living in an angle of the house-top, than with a bitter-tongued woman in a wide house.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: The desire of the evil-doer is fixed on evil: he has no kind feeling for his neighbour.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: When the man of pride undergoes punishment, the simple man gets wisdom; and by watching the wise he gets knowledge.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: The Upright One, looking on the house of the evil-doer, lets sinners be overturned to their destruction.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: He whose ears are stopped at the cry of the poor, will himself get no answer to his cry for help.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: By a secret offering wrath is turned away, and the heat of angry feelings by money in the folds of the robe.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 15
text: It is a joy to the good man to do right, but it is destruction to the workers of evil.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 16
text: The wanderer from the way of knowledge will have his resting-place among the shades.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 17
text: The lover of pleasure will be a poor man: the lover of wine and oil will not get wealth.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 18
text: The evil-doer will be given as a price for the life of the good man, and the worker of deceit in the place of the upright.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 19
text: It is better to be living in a waste land, than with a bitter-tongued and angry woman.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 20
text: There is a store of great value in the house of the wise, but it is wasted by the foolish man.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 21
text: He who goes after righteousness and mercy will get life, righteousness, and honour.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 22
text: A wise man goes up into the town of the strong ones, and overcomes its strength in which they put their faith.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 23
text: He who keeps watch over his mouth and his tongue keeps his soul from troubles.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 24
text: The man of pride, lifted up in soul, is named high-hearted; he is acting in an outburst of pride.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 25
text: The desire of the hater of work is death to him, for his hands will do no work.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 26
text: All the day the sinner goes after his desire: but the upright man gives freely, keeping nothing back.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 27
text: The offering of evil-doers is disgusting: how much more when they give it with an evil purpose!

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 28
text: A false witness will be cut off, ...

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 29
text: The evil-doer makes his face hard, but as for the upright, he gives thought to his way.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 30
text: Wisdom and knowledge and wise suggestions are of no use against the Lord.

title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Verse 31
text: The horse is made ready for the day of war, but power to overcome is from the Lord.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: A good name is more to be desired than great wealth, and to be respected is better than silver and gold.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: The man of wealth and the poor man come face to face: the Lord is the maker of them all.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: The sharp man sees the evil and takes cover: the simple go straight on and get into trouble.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: The reward of a gentle spirit and the fear of the Lord is wealth and honour and life.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: Thorns and nets are in the way of the twisted: he who keeps watch over his soul will be far from them.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: If a child is trained up in the right way, even when he is old he will not be turned away from it.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: The man of wealth has rule over the poor, and he who gets into debt is a servant to his creditor.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: By planting the seed of evil a man will get in the grain of sorrow, and the rod of his wrath will be broken.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: He who is kind will have a blessing, for he gives of his bread to the poor.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: Send away the man of pride, and argument will go out; truly fighting and shame will come to an end.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: He whose heart is clean is dear to the Lord; for the grace of his lips the king will be his friend.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: The eyes of the Lord keep knowledge, but by him the acts of the false man will be overturned.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: The hater of work says, There is a lion outside: I will be put to death in the streets.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: The mouth of strange women is a deep hole: he with whom the Lord is angry will go down into it.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: Foolish ways are deep-seated in the heart of a child, but the rod of punishment will send them far from him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: He who is cruel to the poor for the purpose of increasing his profit, and he who gives to the man of wealth, will only come to be in need.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: Let your ear be bent down for hearing my words, and let your heart give thought to knowledge.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: For it is a delight to keep them in your heart, to have them ready on your lips.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: So that your faith may be in the Lord, I have made them clear to you this day, even to you.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: Have I not put in writing for you thirty sayings, with wise suggestions and knowledge,

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: To make you see how certain are true words, so that you may give a true answer to those who put questions to you?

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: Do not take away the property of the poor man because he is poor, or be cruel to the crushed ones when they come before the judge:

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: For the Lord will give support to their cause, and take the life of those who take their goods.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: Do not be friends with a man who is given to wrath; do not go in the company of an angry man:

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: For fear of learning his ways and making a net ready for your soul.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: Be not one of those who give their hands in an agreement, or of those who make themselves responsible for debts:

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: If you have nothing with which to make payment, he will take away your bed from under you.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: Let not the old landmark be moved which your fathers have put in place.

title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: Have you seen a man who is expert in his business? he will take his place before kings; his place will not be among low persons.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: When you take your seat at the feast with a ruler, give thought with care to what is before you;

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: And put a knife to your throat, if you have a strong desire for food.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: Have no desire for his delicate food, for it is the bread of deceit.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: Take no care to get wealth; let there be an end to your desire for money.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: Are your eyes lifted up to it? it is gone: for wealth takes to itself wings, like an eagle in flight up to heaven.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: Do not take the food of him who has an evil eye, or have any desire for his delicate meat:

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: For as the thoughts of his heart are, so is he: Take food and drink, he says to you; but his heart is not with you.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: The food which you have taken will come up again, and your pleasing words will be wasted.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: Say nothing in the hearing of a foolish man, for he will put no value on the wisdom of your words.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: Do not let the landmark of the widow be moved, and do not go into the fields of those who have no father;

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: For their saviour is strong, and he will take up their cause against you.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: Give your heart to teaching, and your ears to the words of knowledge.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: Do not keep back training from the child: for even if you give him blows with the rod, it will not be death to him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: Give him blows with the rod, and keep his soul safe from the underworld.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: My son, if your heart becomes wise, I, even I, will be glad in heart;

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: And my thoughts in me will be full of joy when your lips say right things.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 17
text: Have no envy of sinners in your heart, but keep in the fear of the Lord all through the day;

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 18
text: For without doubt there is a future, and your hope will not be cut off.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 19
text: Give ear, my son, and be wise, guiding your heart in the right way.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 20
text: Do not be among those who give themselves to wine-drinking, or among those who make themselves full with meat:

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 21
text: For those who take delight in drink and feasting will come to be in need; and through love of sleep a man will be poorly clothed.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 22
text: Give ear to your father whose child you are, and do not keep honour from your mother when she is old.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 23
text: Get for yourself that which is true, and do not let it go for money; get wisdom and teaching and good sense.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 24
