text: The father of the upright man will be glad, and he who has a wise child will have joy because of him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 25
text: Let your father and your mother be glad, let her who gave you birth have joy.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 26
text: My son, give me your heart, and let your eyes take delight in my ways.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 27
text: For a loose woman is a deep hollow, and a strange woman is a narrow water-hole.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 28
text: Yes, she is waiting secretly like a beast for its food, and deceit by her is increased among men.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 29
text: Who says, Oh! who says, Ah! who has violent arguments, who has grief, who has wounds without cause, whose eyes are dark?

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 30
text: Those who are seated late over the wine: those who go looking for mixed wine.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 31
text: Keep your eyes from looking on the wine when it is red, when its colour is bright in the cup, when it goes smoothly down:

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 32
text: In the end, its bite is like that of a snake, its wound like the wound of a poison-snake.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 33
text: Your eyes will see strange things, and you will say twisted things.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 34
text: Yes, you will be like him who takes his rest on the sea, or on the top of a sail-support.

title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Verse 35
text: They have overcome me, you will say, and I have no pain; they gave me blows without my feeling them: when will I be awake from my wine? I will go after it again.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: Have no envy for evil men, or any desire to be with them:

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: For the purposes of their hearts are destruction, and their lips are talking of trouble.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: The building of a house is by wisdom, and by reason it is made strong:

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: And by knowledge its rooms are full of all dear and pleasing things.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: A wise man is strong; and a man of knowledge makes strength greater.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: For by wise guiding you will overcome in war: and in a number of wise guides there is salvation.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: Wisdom is outside the power of the foolish: he keeps his mouth shut in the public place.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: He whose purposes are bad will be named a man of evil designs.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: The purpose of the foolish is sin: and the hater of authority is disgusting to others.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: If you give way in the day of trouble, your strength is small.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 11
text: Be the saviour of those who are given up to death, and do not keep back help from those who are slipping to destruction.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 12
text: If you say, See, we had no knowledge of this: does not the tester of hearts give thought to it? and he who keeps your soul, has he no knowledge of it? and will he not give to every man the reward of his work?

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 13
text: My son, take honey, for it is good; and the flowing honey, which is sweet to your taste:

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 14
text: So let your desire be for wisdom: if you have it, there will be a future, and your hope will not be cut off.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 15
text: Do not keep a secret watch, O evil-doer, against the fields of the upright man, or send destruction on his resting-place:

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 16
text: For an upright man, after falling seven times, will get up again: but trouble is the downfall of the evil.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 17
text: Do not be glad at the fall of your hater, and let not your heart have joy at his downfall:

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 18
text: For fear that the Lord may see it, and it may be evil in his eyes, and his wrath may be turned away from him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 19
text: Do not be troubled because of evil-doers, or have envy of sinners:

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 20
text: For there will be no future for the evil man; the light of sinners will be put out.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 21
text: My son, go in fear of the Lord and the king: have nothing to do with those who are in high positions:

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 22
text: For their downfall will come suddenly; and who has knowledge of the destruction of those in high positions?

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 23
text: These are more sayings of the wise: To have respect for a person's position when judging is not good.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 24
text: He who says to the evil-doer, You are upright, will be cursed by peoples and hated by nations.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 25
text: But those who say sharp words to him will have delight, and a blessing of good will come on them.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 26
text: He gives a kiss with his lips who gives a right answer.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 27
text: Put your work in order outside, and make it ready in the field; and after that, see to the building of your house.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 28
text: Do not be a violent witness against your neighbour, or let your lips say what is false.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 29
text: Say not, I will do to him as he has done to me; I will give the man the reward of his work.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 30
text: I went by the field of the hater of work, and by the vine-garden of the man without sense;

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 31
text: And it was all full of thorns, and covered with waste plants, and its stone wall was broken down.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 32
text: Then looking at it, I gave thought: I saw, and I got teaching from it.

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 33
text: A little sleep, a little rest, a little folding of the hands in sleep:

title: Proverbs Chapter 24 Verse 34
text: So loss will come on you like an outlaw, and your need like an armed man.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: These are more wise sayings of Solomon, copied out by the men of Hezekiah, king of Judah.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: It is the glory of God to keep a thing secret: but the glory of kings is to have it searched out.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: The heaven is high and the earth is deep, and the hearts of kings may not be searched out.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: Take away the waste from silver, and a vessel will come out for the silver-worker.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: Take away evil-doers from before the king, and the seat of his power will be made strong in righteousness.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: Do not take glory for yourself before the king, and do not put yourself in the place of the great:

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 7
text: For it is better to have it said to you, Come up here; than for you to be put down in a lower place before the ruler.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 8
text: Do not be quick to go to law about what you have seen, for what will you do in the end, when your neighbour has put you to shame?

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 9
text: Have a talk with your neighbour himself about your cause, but do not give away the secret of another:

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 10
text: Or your hearer may say evil of you, and your shame will not be turned away.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 11
text: A word at the right time is like apples of gold in a network of silver.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 12
text: Like a nose-ring of gold and an ornament of the best gold, is a wise man who says sharp words to an ear ready to give attention.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 13
text: As the cold of snow in the time of grain-cutting, so is a true servant to those who send him; for he gives new life to the soul of his master.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 14
text: As clouds and wind without rain, so is one who takes credit for an offering he has not given.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 15
text: A judge is moved by one who for a long time undergoes wrongs without protest, and by a soft tongue even bone is broken.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 16
text: If you have honey, take only as much as is enough for you; for fear that, being full of it, you may not be able to keep it down.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 17
text: Let not your foot be frequently in your neighbour's house, or he may get tired of you, and his feeling be turned to hate.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 18
text: One who gives false witness against his neighbour is a hammer and a sword and a sharp arrow.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 19
text: Putting one's faith in a false man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth and a shaking foot.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 20
text: Like one who takes off clothing in cold weather and like acid on a wound, is he who makes melody to a sad heart.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 21
text: If your hater is in need of food, give him bread; and if he is in need of drink, give him water:

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 22
text: For so you will put coals of fire on his head, and the Lord will give you your reward.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 23
text: As the north wind gives birth to rain, so is an angry face caused by a tongue saying evil secretly.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 24
text: It is better to be living in an angle of the house-top, than with a bitter-tongued woman in a wide house.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 25
text: As cold water to a tired soul, so is good news from a far country.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 26
text: Like a troubled fountain and a dirty spring, is an upright man who has to give way before evil-doers.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 27
text: It is not good to take much honey: so he who is not looking for honour will be honoured.

title: Proverbs Chapter 25 Verse 28
text: He whose spirit is uncontrolled is like an unwalled town which has been broken into.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: Like snow in summer and rain when the grain is being cut, so honour is not natural for the foolish.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: As the sparrow in her wandering and the swallow in her flight, so the curse does not come without a cause.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: A whip for the horse, a mouth-bit for the ass, and a rod for the back of the foolish.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: Do not give to the foolish man a foolish answer, or you will be like him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: Give a foolish man a foolish answer, or he will seem wise to himself.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: He who sends news by the hand of a foolish man is cutting off his feet and drinking in damage.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: The legs of one who has no power of walking are hanging loose; so is a wise saying in the mouth of the foolish.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: Giving honour to a foolish man is like attempting to keep a stone fixed in a cord.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: Like a thorn which goes up into the hand of a man overcome by drink, so is a wise saying in the mouth of a foolish man.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: Like an archer wounding all who go by, is a foolish man overcome by drink.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: Like a dog going back to the food which he has not been able to keep down, is the foolish man doing his foolish acts over again.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: Have you seen a man who seems to himself to be wise? There is more hope for the foolish than for him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 13
text: The hater of work says, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 14
text: A door is turned on its pillar, and the hater of work on his bed.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 15
text: The hater of work puts his hand deep into the basin: lifting it again to his mouth is a weariness to him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 16
text: The hater of work seems to himself wiser than seven men who are able to give an answer with good sense.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 17
text: He who gets mixed up in a fight which is not his business, is like one who takes a dog by the ears while it is going by.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 18
text: As one who is off his head sends about flaming sticks and arrows of death,

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 19
text: So is the man who gets the better of his neighbour by deceit, and says, Am I not doing so in sport?

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 20
text: Without wood, the fire goes out; and where there is no secret talk, argument is ended.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 21
text: Like breath on coals and wood on fire, so a man given to argument gets a fight started.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 22
text: The words of one who says evil of his neighbour secretly are like sweet food, they go down into the inner parts of the stomach.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 23
text: Smooth lips and an evil heart are like a vessel of earth plated with silver waste.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 24
text: With his lips the hater makes things seem what they are not, but deceit is stored up inside him;

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 25
text: When he says fair words, have no belief in him; for in his heart are seven evils:

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 26
text: Though his hate is covered with deceit, his sin will be seen openly before the meeting of the people.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 27
text: He who makes a hole in the earth will himself go falling into it: and on him by whom a stone is rolled the stone will come back again.

title: Proverbs Chapter 26 Verse 28
text: A false tongue has hate for those who have clean hearts, and a smooth mouth is a cause of falling.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: Do not make a noise about tomorrow, for you are not certain what a day's outcome may be.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: Let another man give you praise, and not your mouth; one who is strange to you, and not your lips.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: A stone has great weight, and sand is crushing; but the wrath of the foolish is of greater weight than these.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 4
text: Wrath is cruel, and angry feeling an overflowing stream; but who does not give way before envy?

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 5
text: Better is open protest than love kept secret.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 6
text: The wounds of a friend are given in good faith, but the kisses of a hater are false.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 7
text: The full man has no use for honey, but to the man in need of food every bitter thing is sweet.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 8
text: Like a bird wandering from the place of her eggs is a man wandering from his station.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 9
text: Oil and perfume make glad the heart, and the wise suggestion of a friend is sweet to the soul.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 10
text: Do not give up your friend and your father's friend; and do not go into your brother's house in the day of your trouble: better is a neighbour who is near than a brother far off.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 11
text: My son, be wise and make my heart glad, so that I may give back an answer to him who puts me to shame.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 12
text: The sharp man sees the evil and takes cover: the simple go straight on and get into trouble.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 13
text: Take a man's clothing if he makes himself responsible for a strange man, and get an undertaking from him who gives his word for strange men.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 14
text: He who gives a blessing to his friend with a loud voice, getting up early in the morning, will have it put to his account as a curse.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 15
text: Like an unending dropping on a day of rain is a bitter-tongued woman.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 16
text: He who keeps secret the secret of his friend, will get himself a name for good faith.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 17
text: Iron makes iron sharp; so a man makes sharp his friend.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 18
text: Whoever keeps a fig-tree will have its fruit; and the servant waiting on his master will be honoured.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 19
text: Like face looking at face in water, so are the hearts of men to one another.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 20
text: The underworld and Abaddon are never full, and the eyes of man have never enough.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 21
text: The heating-pot is for silver and the oven-fire for gold, and a man is measured by what he is praised for.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 22
text: Even if a foolish man is crushed with a hammer in a vessel among crushed grain, still his foolish ways will not go from him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 23
text: Take care to have knowledge about the condition of your flocks, looking well after your herds;

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 24
text: For wealth is not for ever, and money does not go on for all generations.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 25
text: The grass comes up and the young grass is seen, and the mountain plants are got in.

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 26
text: The lambs are for your clothing, and the he-goats make the value of a field:

title: Proverbs Chapter 27 Verse 27
text: There will be goats' milk enough for your food, and for the support of your servant-girls.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 1
text: The evil man goes running away when no man is after him, but the upright are without fear, like the lion.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 2
text: Because of the sin of the land, its troubles are increased; but by a man of wisdom and knowledge they will be put out like a fire.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 3
text: A man of wealth who is cruel to the poor is like a violent rain causing destruction of food.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 4
text: Those who have no respect for the law give praise to the evil-doer; but such as keep the law are against him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 5
text: Evil men have no knowledge of what is right; but those who go after the Lord have knowledge of all things.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 6
text: Better is the poor man whose ways are upright, than the man of wealth whose ways are not straight.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 7
text: He who keeps the law is a wise son, but he who keeps company with feasters puts shame on his father.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 8
text: He who makes his wealth greater by taking interest, only gets it together for him who has pity on the poor.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 9
text: As for the man whose ear is turned away from hearing the law, even his prayer is disgusting.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 10
text: Anyone causing the upright to go wandering in an evil way, will himself go down into the hole he has made; but the upright will have good things for their heritage.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 11
text: The man of wealth seems to himself to be wise, but the poor man who has sense has a low opinion of him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 12
text: When the upright do well, there is great glory; but when evil-doers are lifted up, men do not let themselves be seen.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 13
text: He who keeps his sins secret will not do well; but one who is open about them, and gives them up, will get mercy.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 14
text: Happy is the man in whom is the fear of the Lord at all times; but he whose heart is hard will come into trouble.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 15
text: Like a loud-voiced lion and a wandering bear, is an evil ruler over a poor people.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 16
text: The prince who has no sense is a cruel ruler; but he who has no desire to get profit for himself will have long life.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 17
text: One who has been the cause of a man's death will go in flight to the underworld: let no man give him help.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 18
text: He whose ways are upright will be safe, but sudden will be the fall of him whose ways are twisted.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 19
text: By ploughing his land a man will have bread in full measure; but he who goes after good-for-nothing persons will be poor enough.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 20
text: A man of good faith will have great blessing, but one attempting to get wealth quickly will not go free from punishment.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 21
text: It is not good to have respect for a man's position: for a man will do wrong for a bit of bread.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 22
text: He who is ever desiring wealth goes running after money, and does not see that need will come on him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 23
text: He who says words of protest to a man will later have more approval than one who says smooth words with his tongue.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 24
text: He who takes from his father or his mother what is theirs by right, and says, It is no sin; is the same as a taker of life.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 25
text: He who is ever desiring profit is a cause of fighting; but he who puts his faith in the Lord will be made fat.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 26
text: He whose faith is in himself is foolish; but everyone walking wisely will be kept safe.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 27
text: He who gives to the poor will never be in need, but great curses will be on him who gives no attention to them.

title: Proverbs Chapter 28 Verse 28
text: When evil-doers are lifted up, men take cover; but when destruction overtakes them, the upright are increased.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 1
text: A man hating sharp words and making his heart hard, will suddenly be broken and will not be made well again.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 2
text: When the upright have power, the people are glad; when an evil man is ruler, grief comes on the people.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 3
text: A man who is a lover of wisdom is a joy to his father: but he who goes in the company of loose women is a waster of wealth.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 4
text: A king, by right rule, makes the land safe; but one full of desires makes it a waste.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 5
text: A man who says smooth things to his neighbour is stretching out a net for his steps.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 6
text: In the steps of an evil man there is a net for him, but the upright man gets away quickly and is glad.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 7
text: The upright man gives attention to the cause of the poor: the evil-doer gives no thought to it.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 8
text: Men of pride are the cause of violent acts in a town, but by wise men wrath is turned away.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 9
text: If a wise man goes to law with a foolish man, he may be angry or laughing, but there will be no rest.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 10
text: Men of blood are haters of the good man, and evil-doers go after his soul.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 11
text: A foolish man lets out all his wrath, but a wise man keeps it back quietly.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 12
text: If a ruler gives attention to false words, all his servants are evil-doers.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 13
text: The poor man and his creditor come face to face: the Lord gives light to their eyes equally.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 14
text: The king who is a true judge in the cause of the poor, will be safe for ever on the seat of his power.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 15
text: The rod and sharp words give wisdom: but a child who is not guided is a cause of shame to his mother.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 16
text: When evil men are in power, wrongdoing is increased; but the upright will have pleasure when they see their downfall.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 17
text: Give your son training, and he will give you rest; he will give delight to your soul.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 18
text: Where there is no vision, the people are uncontrolled; but he who keeps the law will be happy.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 19
text: A servant will not be trained by words; for though the sense of the words is clear to him, he will not give attention.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 20
text: Have you seen a man who is quick with his tongue? There is more hope for a foolish man than for him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 21
text: If a servant is gently cared for from his early years, he will become a cause of sorrow in the end.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 22
text: An angry man is the cause of fighting, and a man given to wrath does much wrong.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 23
text: A man's pride will be the cause of his fall, but he who has a gentle spirit will get honour.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 24
text: A man who takes part with a thief has hate for his soul; he is put under oath, but says nothing.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 25
text: The fear of man is a cause of danger: but whoever puts his faith in the Lord will have a safe place on high.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 26
text: The approval of a ruler is desired by great numbers: but the decision in a man's cause comes from the Lord.

title: Proverbs Chapter 29 Verse 27
text: An evil man is disgusting to the upright, and he who is upright is disgusting to evil-doers.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 1
text: The words of Agur, the son of Jakeh, from Massa. The man says: I am full of weariness, O God, I am full of weariness; O God, I have come to an end:

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 2
text: For I am more like a beast than any man, I have no power of reasoning like a man:

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 3
text: I have not got wisdom by teaching, so that I might have the knowledge of the Holy One.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 4
text: Who has gone up to heaven and come down? who has taken the winds in his hands, prisoning the waters in his robe? by whom have all the ends of the earth been fixed? what is his name, and what is his son's name, if you are able to say?

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 5
text: Every word of God is tested: he is a breastplate to those who put their faith in him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 6
text: Make no addition to his words, or he will make clear your error, and you will be seen to be false.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 7
text: I have made request to you for two things; do not keep them from me before my death:

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 8
text: Put far from me all false and foolish things: do not give me great wealth or let me be in need, but give me only enough food:

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 9
text: For fear that if I am full, I may be false to you and say, Who is the Lord? or if I am poor, I may become a thief, using the name of my God wrongly.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 10
text: Do not say evil of a servant to his master, or he will put a curse on you, and you will get into trouble.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 11
text: There is a generation who put a curse on their father, and do not give a blessing to their mother.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 12
text: There is a generation who seem to themselves to be free from sin, but are not washed from their unclean ways.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 13
text: There is a generation, O how full of pride are their eyes! O how their brows are lifted up!

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 14
text: There is a generation whose teeth are like swords, their strong teeth like knives, for the destruction of the poor from the earth, and of those who are in need from among men.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 15
text: The night-spirit has two daughters, Give, give. There are three things which are never full, even four which never say, Enough:

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 16
text: The underworld, and the woman without a child; the earth which never has enough water, and the fire which never says, Enough.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 17
text: The eye which makes sport of a father, and sees no value in a mother when she is old will be rooted out by the ravens of the valley, and be food for the young eagles.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 18
text: There are three things, the wonder of which overcomes me, even four things outside my knowledge:

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 19
text: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a snake on a rock; the way of a ship in the heart of the sea; and the way of a man with a girl.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 20
text: This is the way of a false wife; she takes food, and, cleaning her mouth, says, I have done no wrong.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 21
text: For three things the earth is moved, and there are four which it will not put up with:

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 22
text: A servant when he becomes a king; a man without sense when his wealth is increased;

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 23
text: A hated woman when she is married; and a servant-girl who takes the place of her master's wife.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 24
text: There are four things which are little on the earth, but they are very wise:

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 25
text: The ants are a people not strong, but they put by a store of food in the summer;

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 26
text: The conies are only a feeble people, but they make their houses in the rocks;

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 27
text: The locusts have no king, but they all go out in bands;

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 28
text: You may take the lizard in your hands, but it is in kings' houses.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 29
text: There are three things whose steps are good to see, even four whose goings are fair:

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 30
text: The lion, which is strongest among beasts, not turning from his way for any;

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 31
text: The war-horse, and the he-goat, and the king when his army is with him.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 32
text: If you have done foolishly in lifting yourself up, or if you have had evil designs, put your hand over your mouth.

title: Proverbs Chapter 30 Verse 33
text: The shaking of milk makes butter, and the twisting of the nose makes blood come: so the forcing of wrath is a cause of fighting.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 1
text: The words of Lemuel, king of Massa: the teaching which he had from his mother.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 2
text: What am I to say to you, O Lemuel, my oldest son? and what, O son of my body? and what, O son of my oaths?

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 3
text: Do not give your strength to women, or your ways to that which is the destruction of kings.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 4
text: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to take wine, or for rulers to say, Where is strong drink?

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 5
text: For fear that through drinking they may come to have no respect for the law, wrongly judging the cause of those who are in trouble.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 6
text: Give strong drink to him who is near to destruction, and wine to him whose soul is bitter:

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 7
text: Let him have drink, and his need will go from his mind, and the memory of his trouble will be gone.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 8
text: Let your mouth be open for those who have no voice, in the cause of those who are ready for death.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 9
text: Let your mouth be open, judging rightly, and give right decisions in the cause of the poor and those in need.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 10
text: Who may make discovery of a woman of virtue? For her price is much higher than jewels.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 11
text: The heart of her husband has faith in her, and he will have profit in full measure.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 12
text: She does him good and not evil all the days of her life.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 13
text: She gets wool and linen, working at the business of her hands.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 14
text: She is like the trading-ships, getting food from far away.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 15
text: She gets up while it is still night, and gives meat to her family, and their food to her servant-girls.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 16
text: After looking at a field with care, she gets it for a price, planting a vine-garden with the profit of her work.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 17
text: She puts a band of strength round her, and makes her arms strong.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 18
text: She sees that her marketing is of profit to her: her light does not go out by night.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 19
text: She puts her hands to the cloth-working rod, and her fingers take the wheel.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 20
text: Her hands are stretched out to the poor; yes, she is open-handed to those who are in need.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 21
text: She has no fear of the snow for her family, for all those in her house are clothed in red.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 22
text: She makes for herself cushions of needlework; her clothing is fair linen and purple.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 23
text: Her husband is a man of note in the public place, when he takes his seat among the responsible men of the land.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 24
text: She makes linen robes and gets a price for them, and traders take her cloth bands for a price.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 25
text: Strength and self-respect are her clothing; she is facing the future with a smile.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 26
text: Her mouth is open to give out wisdom, and the law of mercy is on her tongue.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 27
text: She gives attention to the ways of her family, she does not take her food without working for it.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 28
text: Her children get up and give her honour, and her husband gives her praise, saying,

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 29
text: Unnumbered women have done well, but you are better than all of them.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 30
text: Fair looks are a deceit, and a beautiful form is of no value; but a woman who has the fear of the Lord is to be praised.

title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Verse 31
text: Give her credit for what her hands have made: let her be praised by her works in the public place.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: All is to no purpose, said the Preacher, all the ways of man are to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: What is a man profited by all his work which he does under the sun?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: One generation goes and another comes; but the earth is for ever.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: The sun comes up and the sun goes down, and goes quickly back to the place where he came up.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: The wind goes to the south, turning back again to the north; circling round for ever.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: All the rivers go down to the sea, but the sea is not full; to the place where the rivers go, there they go again.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: All things are full of weariness; man may not give their story: the eye has never enough of its seeing, or the ear of its hearing.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: That which has been, is that which is to be, and that which has been done, is that which will be done, and there is no new thing under the sun.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Is there anything of which men say, See, this is new? It has been in the old time which was before us.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: There is no memory of those who have gone before, and of those who come after there will be no memory for those who are still to come after them.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: I, the Preacher, was king over Israel in Jerusalem.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And I gave my heart to searching out in wisdom all things which are done under heaven: it is a hard thing which God has put on the sons of men to do.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: I have seen all the works which are done under the sun; all is to no purpose, and desire for wind.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: That which is bent may not be made straight, and that which is not there may not be numbered.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: I said to my heart, See, I have become great and am increased in wisdom more than any who were before me in Jerusalem--yes, my heart has seen much wisdom and knowledge.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And I gave my heart to getting knowledge of wisdom, and of the ways of the foolish. And I saw that this again was desire for wind.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: Because in much wisdom is much grief, and increase of knowledge is increase of sorrow.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: I said in my heart, I will give you joy for a test; so take your pleasure--but it was to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: Of laughing I said, It is foolish; and of joy--What use is it?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: I made a search with my heart to give pleasure to my flesh with wine, still guiding my heart with wisdom, and to go after foolish things, so that I might see what was good for the sons of men to do under the heavens all the days of their life.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: I undertook great works, building myself houses and planting vine-gardens.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: I made myself gardens and fruit gardens, planting in them fruit-trees of all sorts.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: I made pools to give water for the woods with their young trees.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: I got men-servants and women-servants, and they gave birth to sons and daughters in my house. I had great wealth of herds and flocks, more than all who were in Jerusalem before me.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: I got together silver and gold and the wealth of kings and of countries. I got makers of song, male and female; and the delights of the sons of men--girls of all sorts to be my brides.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And I became great; increasing more than all who had been before me in Jerusalem, and my wisdom was still with me.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: And nothing which was desired by my eyes did I keep from them; I did not keep any joy from my heart, because my heart took pleasure in all my work, and this was my reward.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: Then I saw all the works which my hands had made, and everything I had been working to do; and I saw that all was to no purpose and desire for wind, and there was no profit under the sun.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: And I went again in search of wisdom and of foolish ways. What may the man do who comes after the king? The thing which he has done before.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: Then I saw that wisdom is better than foolish ways--as the light is better than the dark.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: The wise man's eyes are in his head, but the foolish man goes walking in the dark; but still I saw that the same event comes to them all.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: Then said I in my heart: As it comes to the foolish man, so will it come to me; so why have I been wise overmuch? Then I said in my heart: This again is to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: Of the wise man, as of the foolish man, there is no memory for ever, seeing that those who now are will have gone from memory in the days to come. See how death comes to the wise as to the foolish!

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: So I was hating life, because everything under the sun was evil to me: all is to no purpose and desire for wind.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: Hate had I for all my work which I had done, because the man who comes after me will have its fruits.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And who is to say if that man will be wise or foolish? But he will have power over all my work which I have done and in which I have been wise under the sun. This again is to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: So my mind was turned to grief for all the trouble I had taken and all my wisdom under the sun.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: Because there is a man whose work has been done with wisdom, with knowledge, and with an expert hand; but one who has done nothing for it will have it for his heritage. This again is to no purpose and a great evil.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: What does a man get for all his work, and for the weight of care with which he has done his work under the sun?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: All his days are sorrow, and his work is full of grief. Even in the night his heart has no rest. This again is to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: There is nothing better for a man than taking meat and drink, and having delight in his work. This again I saw was from the hand of God.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: Who may take food or have pleasure without him?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: To the man with whom he is pleased, God gives wisdom and knowledge and joy; but to the sinner he gives the work of getting goods together and storing up wealth, to give to him in whom God has pleasure. This again is to no purpose and desire for wind.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: For everything there is a fixed time, and a time for every business under the sun.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: A time for birth and a time for death; a time for planting and a time for uprooting;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: A time to put to death and a time to make well; a time for pulling down and a time for building up;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: A time for weeping and a time for laughing; a time for sorrow and a time for dancing;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: A time to take stones away and a time to get stones together; a time for kissing and a time to keep from kissing;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: A time for search and a time for loss; a time to keep and a time to give away;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: A time for undoing and a time for stitching; a time for keeping quiet and a time for talk;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: A time for love and a time for hate; a time for war and a time for peace.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: What profit has the worker in the work which he does?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: I saw the work which God has put on the sons of man.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: He has made everything right in its time; but he has made their hearts without knowledge, so that man is unable to see the works of God, from the first to the last.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: I am certain that there is nothing better for a man than to be glad, and to do good while life is in him.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: And for every man to take food and drink, and have joy in all his work, is a reward from God.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: I am certain that whatever God does will be for ever. No addition may be made to it, nothing may be taken from it; and God has done it so that man may be in fear before him.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: Whatever is has been before, and what is to be is now; because God makes search for the things which are past.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: And again, I saw under the sun, in the place of the judges, that evil was there; and in the place of righteousness, that evil was there.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: I said in my heart, God will be judge of the good and of the bad; because a time for every purpose and for every work has been fixed by him.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: I said in my heart, It is because of the sons of men, so that God may put them to the test and that they may see themselves as beasts.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: Because the fate of the sons of men and the fate of the beasts is the same. As is the death of one so is the death of the other, and all have one spirit. Man is not higher than the beasts; because all is to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: All go to one place, all are of the dust, and all will be turned to dust again.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: Who is certain that the spirit of the sons of men goes up to heaven, or that the spirit of the beasts goes down to the earth?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: So I saw that there is nothing better than for a man to have joy in his work--because that is his reward. Who will make him see what will come after him?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And again I saw all the cruel things which are done under the sun; there was the weeping of those who have evil done to them, and they had no comforter: and from the hands of the evil-doers there went out power, but they had no comforter.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: So my praise was for the dead who have gone to their death, more than for the living who still have life.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Yes, happier than the dead or the living seemed he who has not ever been, who has not seen the evil which is done under the sun.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And I saw that the cause of all the work and of everything which is done well was man's envy of his neighbour. This again is to no purpose and a desire for wind.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: The foolish man, folding his hands, takes the flesh of his body for food.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: One hand full of rest is better than two hands full of trouble and desire for wind.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: Then I came back, and I saw an example of what is to no purpose under the sun.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: It is one who is by himself, without a second, and without son or brother; but there is no end to all his work, and he has never enough of wealth. For whom, then, am I working and keeping myself from pleasure? This again is to no purpose, and a bitter work.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: Two are better than one, because they have a good reward for their work.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: And if one has a fall, the other will give him a hand; but unhappy is the man who is by himself, because he has no helper.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: So again, if two are sleeping together they are warm, but how may one be warm by himself?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: And two attacked by one would be safe, and three cords twisted together are not quickly broken.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: A young man who is poor and wise is better than a king who is old and foolish and will not be guided by the wisdom of others.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Because out of a prison the young man comes to be king, though by birth he was only a poor man in the kingdom.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: I saw all the living under the sun round the young man who was to be ruler in place of the king.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: There was no end of all the people, of all those whose head he was, but they who come later will have no delight in him. This again is to no purpose and desire for wind.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Put your feet down with care when you go to the house of God, for it is better to give ear than to make the burned offerings of the foolish, whose knowledge is only of doing evil.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: Be not unwise with your mouth, and let not your heart be quick to say anything before God, because God is in heaven and you are on the earth--so let not the number of your words be great.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: As a dream comes from much business, so the voice of a foolish man comes with words in great number.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: When you take an oath before God, put it quickly into effect, because he has no pleasure in the foolish; keep the oath you have taken.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: It is better not to take an oath than to take an oath and not keep it.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: Let not your mouth make your flesh do evil. And say not before the angel, It was an error. So that God may not be angry with your words and put an end to the work of your hands.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: Because much talk comes from dreams and things of no purpose. But let the fear of God be in you.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: If you see the poor under a cruel yoke, and law and right being violently overturned in a country, be not surprised, because one authority is keeping watch on another and there are higher than they.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: It is good generally for a country where the land is worked to have a king.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: He who has a love for silver never has enough silver, or he who has love for wealth, enough profit. This again is to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: When goods are increased, the number of those who take of them is increased; and what profit has the owner but to see them?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: The sleep of a working man is sweet, if he has little food or much; but to him who is full, sleep will not come.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: There is a great evil which I have seen under the sun--wealth kept by the owner to be his downfall.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: And I saw the destruction of his wealth by an evil chance; and when he became the father of a son he had nothing in his hand.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: As he came from his mother at birth, so does he go again; he gets from his work no reward which he may take away in his hand.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: And this again is a great evil, that in all points as he came so will he go; and what profit has he in working for the wind?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: All his days are in the dark, and he has much sorrow, pain, disease, and trouble.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: This is what I have seen: it is good and fair for a man to take meat and drink and to have joy in all his work under the sun, all the days of his life which God has given him; that is his reward.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: Every man to whom God has given money and wealth and the power to have pleasure in it and to do his part and have joy in his work: this is given by God.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: He will not give much thought to the days of his life; because God lets him be taken up with the joy of his heart.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, and it is hard on men;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: A man to whom God gives money, wealth, and honour so that he has all his desires but God does not give him the power to have joy of it, and a strange man takes it. This is to no purpose and an evil disease.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: If a man has a hundred children, and his life is long so that the days of his years are great in number, but his soul takes no pleasure in good, and he is not honoured at his death; I say that a birth before its time is better than he.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: In wind it came and to the dark it will go, and with the dark will its name be covered.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: Yes, it saw not the sun, and it had no knowledge; it is better with this than with the other.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: And though he goes on living a thousand years twice over and does not see good, are not the two going to the same place?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: All the work of man is for his mouth, and still he has a desire for food.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: What have the wise more than the foolish? and what has the poor man by walking wisely before the living?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: What the eyes see is better than the wandering of desire. This is to no purpose and a desire for wind.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: That which is, has been named before, and of what man is there is knowledge. He has no power against one stronger than he.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: There are words without number for increasing what is to no purpose, but what is man profited by them?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: Who is able to say what is good for man in life all the days of his foolish life which he goes through like a shade? who will say what is to be after him under the sun?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: A good name is better than oil of great price, and the day of death than the day of birth.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: It is better to go to the house of weeping, than to go to the house of feasting; because that is the end of every man, and the living will take it to their hearts.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Sorrow is better than joy; when the face is sad the mind gets better.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: The hearts of the wise are in the house of weeping; but the hearts of the foolish are in the house of joy.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: It is better to take note of the protest of the wise, than for a man to give ear to the song of the foolish.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: Like the cracking of thorns under a pot, so is the laugh of a foolish man; and this again is to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: The wise are troubled by the ways of the cruel, and the giving of money is the destruction of the heart.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: The end of a thing is better than its start, and a gentle spirit is better than pride.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: Be not quick to let your spirit be angry; because wrath is in the heart of the foolish.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: Say not, Why were the days which have gone by better than these? Such a question comes not from wisdom.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: Wisdom together with a heritage is good, and a profit to those who see the sun.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: Wisdom keeps a man from danger even as money does; but the value of knowledge is that wisdom gives life to its owner.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: Give thought to the work of God. Who will make straight what he has made bent?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: In the day of wealth have joy, but in the day of evil take thought: God has put the one against the other, so that man may not be certain what will be after him.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: These two have I seen in my life which is to no purpose: a good man coming to his end in his righteousness, and an evil man whose days are long in his evil-doing.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: Be not given overmuch to righteousness and be not over-wise. Why let destruction come on you?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: Be not evil overmuch, and be not foolish. Why come to your end before your time?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: It is good to take this in your hand and not to keep your hand from that; he who has the fear of God will be free of the two.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: Wisdom makes a wise man stronger than ten rulers in a town.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: There is no man on earth of such righteousness that he does good and is free from sin all his days.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: Do not give ear to all the words which men say, for fear of hearing the curses of your servant.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: Your heart has knowledge how frequently others have been cursed by you.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: All this I have put to the test by wisdom; I said, I will be wise, but it was far from me.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: Far off is true existence, and very deep; who may have knowledge of it?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: I gave my mind to knowledge and to searching for wisdom and the reason of things, and to the discovery that sin is foolish, and that to be foolish is to be without one's senses.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: And I saw a thing more bitter than death, even the woman whose heart is full of tricks and nets, and whose hands are as bands. He with whom God is pleased will get free from her, but the sinner will be taken by her.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: Look! this I have seen, said the Preacher, taking one thing after another to get the true account,

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: For which my soul is still searching, but I have it not; one man among a thousand have I seen; but a woman among all these I have not seen.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: This only have I seen, that God made men upright, but they have been searching out all sorts of inventions.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Who is like the wise man? and to whom is the sense of anything clear? A man's wisdom makes his face shining, and his hard face will be changed.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: I say to you, Keep the king's law, from respect for the oath of God.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: Be not quick to go from before him. Be not fixed in an evil design, because he does whatever is pleasing to him.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: The word of a king has authority; and who may say to him, What is this you are doing?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: Whoever keeps the law will come to no evil: and a wise man's heart has knowledge of time and of decision.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: For every purpose there is a time and a decision, because the sorrow of man is great in him.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: No one is certain what is to be, and who is able to say to him when it will be?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: No man has authority over the wind, to keep the wind; or is ruler over the day of his death. In war no man's time is free, and evil will not keep the sinner safe.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: All this have I seen, and have given my heart to all the work which is done under the sun: there is a time when man has power over man for his destruction.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: And then I saw evil men put to rest, taken even from the holy place; and they went about and were praised in the town because of what they had done. This again is to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: Because punishment for an evil work comes not quickly, the minds of the sons of men are fully given to doing evil.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: Though a sinner does evil a hundred times and his life is long, I am certain that it will be well for those who go in fear of God and are in fear before him.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: But it will not be well for the evil-doer; he will not make his days long like a shade, because he has no fear before God.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: There is a thing which is to no purpose done on the earth: that there are good men to whom is given the same punishment as those who are evil, and there are evil men who get the reward of the good. I say that this again is to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: So I gave praise to joy, because there is nothing better for a man to do under the sun than to take meat and drink and be happy; for that will be with him in his work all the days of his life which God gives him under the sun.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: When I gave my mind to the knowledge of wisdom and to seeing the business which is done on the earth (and there are those whose eyes see not sleep by day or by night),

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: Then I saw all the work of God, and that man may not get knowledge of the work which is done under the sun; because, if a man gives hard work to the search he will not get knowledge, and even if the wise man seems to be coming to the end of his search, still he will be without knowledge.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: All this I took to heart, and my heart saw it all: that the upright and the wise and their works are in the hand of God; and men may not be certain if it will be love or hate; all is to no purpose before them.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: Because to all there is one event, to the upright man and to the evil, to the clean and to the unclean, to him who makes an offering and to him who makes no offering; as is the good so is the sinner; he who takes an oath is as he who has fear of it.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: This is evil in all things which are done under the sun: that there is one fate for all, and the hearts of the sons of men are full of evil; while they have life their hearts are foolish, and after that--to the dead.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: For him who is joined to all the living there is hope; a living dog is better than a dead lion.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: The living are conscious that death will come to them, but the dead are not conscious of anything, and they no longer have a reward, because there is no memory of them.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: Their love and their hate and their envy are now ended; and they have no longer a part for ever in anything which is done under the sun.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: Come, take your bread with joy, and your wine with a glad heart. God has taken pleasure in your works.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: Let your clothing be white at all times, and let not your head be without oil.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: Have joy with the woman of your love all the days of your foolish life which he gives you under the sun. Because that is your part in life and in your work which you do under the sun.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: Whatever comes to your hand to do with all your power, do it because there is no work, or thought, or knowledge, or wisdom in the place of the dead to which you are going.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: And again I saw under the sun that the reward goes not to him who is quick, or the fruits of war to the strong; and there is no bread for the wise, or wealth for men of learning, or respect for those who have knowledge; but time and chance come to all.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: Even man has no knowledge of his time; like fishes taken in an evil net, or like birds taken by deceit, are the sons of men taken in an evil time when it comes suddenly on them.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: This again I have seen under the sun as wisdom and it seemed great to me.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: There was a little town and the number of its men was small, and there came a great king against it and made an attack on it, building works of war round about it.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: Now there was in the town a poor, wise man, and he, by his wisdom, kept the town safe. But no one had any memory of that same poor man.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: Then I said, Wisdom is better than strength, but the poor man's wisdom is not respected, and his words are not given a hearing.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: The words of the wise which come quietly to the ear are noted more than the cry of a ruler among the foolish.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: Wisdom is better than instruments of war, but one sinner is the destruction of much good.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Dead flies make the oil of the perfumer give out an evil smell; more valued is a little wisdom than the great glory of the foolish.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: The heart of the wise man goes in the right direction; but the heart of a foolish man in the wrong.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: And when the foolish man is walking in the way, he has no sense and lets everyone see that he is foolish.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: If the wrath of the ruler is against you, keep in your place; in him who keeps quiet even great sins may be overlooked.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, like an error which comes by chance from a ruler:

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: The foolish are placed in high positions, but men of wealth are kept low.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: I have seen servants on horses, and rulers walking on the earth as servants.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: He who makes a hole for others will himself go into it, and for him who makes a hole through a wall the bite of a snake will be a punishment.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: He who gets out stones from the earth will be damaged by them, and in the cutting of wood there is danger.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: If the iron has no edge, and he does not make it sharp, then he has to put out more strength; but wisdom makes things go well.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: If a snake gives a bite before the word of power is said, then there is no longer any use in the word of power.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: The words of a wise man's mouth are sweet to all, but the lips of a foolish man are his destruction.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: The first words of his mouth are foolish, and the end of his talk is evil crime.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: The foolish are full of words; man has no knowledge of what will be; and who is able to say what will be after him?

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: The work of the foolish will be a weariness to him, because he has no knowledge of the way to the town.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: Unhappy is the land whose king is a boy, and whose rulers are feasting in the morning.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: Happy is the land whose ruler is of noble birth, and whose chiefs take food at the right time, for strength and not for feasting.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: When no work is done the roof goes in, and when the hands do nothing water comes into the house.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: A feast is for laughing, and wine makes glad the heart; but by the one and the other money is wasted.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: Say not a curse against the king, even in your thoughts; and even secretly say not a curse against the man of wealth; because a bird of the air will take the voice, and that which has wings will give news of it.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Put out your bread on the face of the waters; for after a long time it will come back to you again.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: Give a part to seven or even to eight, because you have no knowledge of the evil which will be on the earth.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: If the clouds are full of rain, they send it down on the earth; and if a tree comes down to the south, or the north, in whatever place it comes down, there it will be.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: He who is watching the wind will not get the seed planted, and he who is looking at the clouds will not get in the grain.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: As you have no knowledge of the way of the wind, or of the growth of the bones in the body of her who is with child, even so you have no knowledge of the works of God who has made all.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: In the morning put your seed into the earth, and till the evening let not your hand be at rest; because you are not certain which will do well, this or that--or if the two will be equally good.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: Truly the light is sweet, and it is good for the eyes to see the sun.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: But even if a man's life is long and he has joy in all his years, let him keep in mind the dark days, because they will be great in number. Whatever may come is to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: Have joy, O young man, while you are young; and let your heart be glad in the days of your strength, and go in the ways of your heart, and in the desire of your eyes; but be certain that for all these things God will be your judge.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: So put away trouble from your heart, and sorrow from your flesh; because the early years and the best years are to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: Let your mind be turned to your Maker in the days of your strength, while the evil days come not, and the years are far away when you will say, I have no pleasure in them;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: While the sun, or the light, or the moon, or the stars, are not dark, and the clouds come not back after the rain;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: In the day when the keepers of the house are shaking for fear, and the strong men are bent down, and the women who were crushing the grain are at rest because their number is small, and those looking out of the windows are unable to see;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: When the doors are shut in the street, and the sound of the crushing is low, and the voice of the bird is soft, and the daughters of music will be made low;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: And he is in fear of that which is high, and danger is in the road, and the tree is white with flower, and the least thing is a weight, and desire is at an end, because man goes to his last resting-place, and those who are sorrowing are in the streets;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: Before ever the silver cord is cut, or the vessel of gold is broken, or the pot is broken at the fountain, or the wheel broken at the water-hole;

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: And the dust goes back to the earth as it was, and the spirit goes back to God who gave it.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: All things are to no purpose, says the Preacher, all is to no purpose.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: And because the Preacher was wise he still gave the people knowledge; searching out, testing, and putting in order a great number of wise sayings.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: The Preacher made search for words which were pleasing, but his writing was in words upright and true.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: The words of the wise are pointed, and sayings grouped together are like nails fixed with a hammer; they are given by one guide.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: And further, my son, take note of this: of the making of books there is no end, and much learning is a weariness to the flesh.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: This is the last word. All has been said. Have fear of God and keep his laws; because this is right for every man.

title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: God will be judge of every work, with every secret thing, good or evil.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The song of Songs, which is Solomon's.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Let him give me the kisses of his mouth: for his love is better than wine.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Sweet is the smell of your perfumes; your name is as perfume running out; so the young girls give you their love.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Take me to you, and we will go after you: the king has taken me into his house. We will be glad and full of joy in you, we will give more thought to your love than to wine: rightly are they your lovers.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: I am dark, but fair of form, O daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: Let not your eyes be turned on me, because I am dark, because I was looked on by the sun; my mother's children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vine-gardens; but my vine-garden I have not kept.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: Say, O love of my soul, where you give food to your flock, and where you make them take their rest in the heat of the day; why have I to be as one wandering by the flocks of your friends?

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: If you have not knowledge, O most beautiful among women, go on your way in the footsteps of the flock, and give your young goats food by the tents of the keepers.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: I have made a comparison of you, O my love, to a horse in Pharaoh's carriages.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Your face is a delight with rings of hair, your neck with chains of jewels.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: We will make you chains of gold with ornaments of silver.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: While the king is seated at his table, my spices send out their perfume.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: As a bag of myrrh is my well-loved one to me, when he is at rest all night between my breasts.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: My love is to me as a branch of the cypress-tree in the vine-gardens of En-gedi.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: See, you are fair, my love, you are fair; you have the eyes of a dove.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: See, you are fair, my loved one, and a pleasure; our bed is green.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: Cedar-trees are the pillars of our house; and our boards are made of fir-trees.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: I am a rose of Sharon, a flower of the valleys.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: As the lily-flower among the thorns of the waste, so is my love among the daughters.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: As the apple-tree among the trees of the wood, so is my loved one among the sons. I took my rest under his shade with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: He took me to the house of wine, and his flag over me was love.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Make me strong with wine-cakes, let me be comforted with apples; I am overcome with love.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: His left hand is under my head, and his right hand is round about me.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: I say to you, O daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes of the field, do not let love be moved till it is ready.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: The voice of my loved one! See, he comes dancing on the mountains, stepping quickly on the hills.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: My loved one is like a roe; see, he is on the other side of our wall, he is looking in at the windows, letting himself be seen through the spaces.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: My loved one said to me, Get up, my love, my fair one, and come away.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: For, see, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone;

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: The flowers are come on the earth; the time of cutting the vines is come, and the voice of the dove is sounding in our land;

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: The fig-tree puts out her green fruit and the vines with their young fruit give a good smell. Get up from your bed, my beautiful one, and come away.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: O my dove, you are in the holes of the mountain sides, in the cracks of the high hills; let me see your face, let your voice come to my ears; for sweet is your voice, and your face is fair.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: Take for us the foxes, the little foxes, which do damage to the vines; our vines have young grapes.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: My loved one is mine, and I am his: he takes his food among the flowers.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: Till the evening comes, and the sky slowly becomes dark, come, my loved one, and be like a roe on the mountains of Bether.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: By night on my bed I was looking for him who is the love of my soul: I was looking for him, but I did not see him.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: I will get up now and go about the town, in the streets and in the wide ways I will go after him who is the love of my soul: I went after him, but I did not see him.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: The watchmen who go about the town came by me; to them I said, Have you seen him who is my heart's desire?

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: I was but a little way from them, when I came face to face with him who is the love of my soul. I took him by the hands, and did not let him go, till I had taken him into my mother's house, and into the room of her who gave me birth.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: I say to you, O daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes of the field, let not love be moved till it is ready.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: Who is this coming out of the waste places like pillars of smoke, perfumed with sweet spices, with all the spices of the trader?

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: See, it is the bed of Solomon; sixty men of war are about it, of the army of Israel,

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: All of them armed with swords, trained in war; every man has his sword at his side, because of fear in the night.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 3 Verse 9
