text: King Solomon made himself a bed of the wood of Lebanon.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: He made its pillars of silver, its base of gold, its seat of purple, the middle of it of ebony.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Go out, O daughters of Jerusalem, and see King Solomon, with the crown which his mother put on his head on the day when he was married, and on the day of the joy of his heart.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: See, you are fair, my love, you are fair; you have the eyes of a dove; your hair is as a flock of goats, which take their rest on the side of Gilead.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: Your teeth are like a flock of sheep whose wool is newly cut, which come up from the washing; every one has two lambs, and there is not one without young.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Your red lips are like a bright thread, and your mouth is fair of form; the sides of your head are like pomegranate fruit under your veil.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Your neck is like the tower of David made for a store-house of arms, in which a thousand breastplates are hanging, breastplates for fighting-men.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Your two breasts are like two young roes of the same birth, which take their food among the lilies.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: Till the evening comes, and the sky slowly becomes dark, I will go to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: You are all fair, my love; there is no mark on you.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: Come with me from Lebanon, my bride, with me from Lebanon; see from the top of Amana, from the top of Senir and Hermon, from the places of the lions, from the mountains of the leopards.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: You have taken away my heart, my sister, my bride; you have taken away my heart, with one look you have taken it, with one chain of your neck!

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: How fair is your love, my sister! How much better is your love than wine, and the smell of your oils than any perfume!

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: Your lips are dropping honey; honey and milk are under your tongue; and the smell of your clothing is like the smell of Lebanon.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: A garden walled-in is my sister, my bride; a garden shut up, a spring of water stopped.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: The produce of the garden is pomegranates; with all the best fruits, henna and spikenard,

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Spikenard and safron; calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: You are a fountain of gardens, a spring of living waters, and flowing waters from Lebanon.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: Be awake, O north wind; and come, O south, blowing on my garden, so that its spices may come out. Let my loved one come into his garden, and take of his good fruits.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: I have come into my garden, my sister, my bride; to take my myrrh with my spice; my wax with my honey; my wine with my milk. Take meat, O friends; take wine, yes, be overcome with love.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: I am sleeping, but my heart is awake; it is the sound of my loved one at the door, saying, Be open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my very beautiful one; my head is wet with dew, and my hair with the drops of the night.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: I have put off my coat; how may I put it on? My feet are washed; how may I make them unclean?

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: My loved one put his hand on the door, and my heart was moved for him.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: I got up to let my loved one in; and my hands were dropping with myrrh, and my fingers with liquid myrrh, on the lock of the door.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: I made the door open to my loved one; but my loved one had taken himself away, and was gone, my soul was feeble when his back was turned on me; I went after him, but I did not come near him; I said his name, but he gave me no answer.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: The keepers who go about the town overtook me; they gave me blows and wounds; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: I say to you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if you see my loved one, what will you say to him? That I am overcome with love.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: What is your loved one more than another, O fairest among women? What is your loved one more than another, that you say this to us?

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: My loved one is white and red, the chief among ten thousand.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: His head is as the most delicate gold; his hair is thick, and black as a raven.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: His eyes are as the eyes of doves by the water streams, washed with milk, and rightly placed.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: His face is as beds of spices, giving out perfumes of every sort; his lips like lilies, dropping liquid myrrh.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: His hands are as rings of gold ornamented with beryl-stones; his body is as a smooth plate of ivory covered with sapphires.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: His legs are as pillars of stone on a base of delicate gold; his looks are as Lebanon, beautiful as the cedar-tree.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: His mouth is most sweet; yes, he is all beautiful. This is my loved one, and this is my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Where is your loved one gone, O most fair among women? Where is your loved one turned away, that we may go looking for him with you?

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: My loved one is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to take food in the gardens, and to get lilies.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: I am for my loved one, and my loved one is for me; he takes food among the lilies.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: You are beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, as fair as Jerusalem; you are to be feared like an army with flags.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: Let your eyes be turned away from me; see, they have overcome me; your hair is as a flock of goats which take their rest on the side of Gilead.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: Your teeth are like a flock of sheep which come up from the washing; every one has two lambs, and there is not one without young.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: Like pomegranate fruit are the sides of your head under your veil.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: There are sixty queens, and eighty servant-wives, and young girls without number.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: My dove, my very beautiful one, is but one; she is the only one of her mother, she is the dearest one of her who gave her birth. The daughters saw her, and gave her a blessing; yes, the queens and the servant-wives, and they gave her praises.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: Who is she, looking down as the morning light, fair as the moon, clear as the sun, who is to be feared like an army with flags?

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the green plants of the valley, and to see if the vine was in bud, and the pomegranate-trees were in flower.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: Before I was conscious of it, ...

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: Come back, come back, O Shulammite; come back, come back, so that our eyes may see you. What will you see in the Shulammite? A sword-dance.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: How beautiful are your feet in their shoes, O king's daughter! The curves of your legs are like jewels, the work of the hands of a good workman:

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: Your stomach is a store of grain with lilies round it, and in the middle a round cup full of wine.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Your two breasts are like two young roes of the same birth.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: Your neck is as a tower of ivory; your eyes like the waters in Heshbon, by the doorway of Bath-rabbim; your nose is as the tower on Lebanon looking over Damascus:

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: Your head is like Carmel, and the hair of your head is like purple, in whose net the king is prisoner.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: How beautiful and how sweet you are, O love, for delight.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: You are tall like a palm-tree, and your breasts are like the fruit of the vine.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: I said, Let me go up the palm-tree, and let me take its branches in my hands: your breasts will be as the fruit of the vine, and the smell of your breath like apples;

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: And the roof of your mouth like good wine flowing down smoothly for my loved one, moving gently over my lips and my teeth.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: I am for my loved one, and his desire is for me.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: Come, my loved one, let us go out into the field; let us take rest among the cypress-trees.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: Let us go out early to the vine-gardens; let us see if the vine is in bud, if it has put out its young fruit, and the pomegranate is in flower. There I will give you my love.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: The mandrakes give out a sweet smell, and at our doors are all sorts of good fruits, new and old, which I have kept for my loved one.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Oh that you were my brother, who took milk from my mother's breasts! When I came to you in the street, I would give you kisses; yes, I would not be looked down on.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: I would take you by the hand into my mother's house, and she would be my teacher. I would give you drink of spiced wine, drink of the pomegranate.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: His left hand would be under my head, and his right hand about me.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: I say to you, O daughters of Jerusalem, do not let love be moved till it is ready.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: Who is this, who comes up from the waste places, resting on her loved one? It was I who made you awake under the apple-tree, where your mother gave you birth; there she was in pain at your birth.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: Put me as a sign on your heart, as a sign on your arm; love is strong as death, and wrath bitter as the underworld: its coals are coals of fire; violent are its flames.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: Much water may not put out love, or the deep waters overcome it: if a man would give all the substance of his house for love, it would be judged a price not great enough.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: We have a young sister, and she has no breasts; what are we to do for our sister in the day when she is given to a man?

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: If she is a wall, we will make on her a strong base of silver; and if she is a door, we will let her be shut up with cedar-wood.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: I am a wall, and my breasts are like towers; then was I in his eyes as one to whom good chance had come.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: Solomon had a vine-garden at Baal-hamon; he let out the vine-garden to keepers; every one had to give a thousand bits of silver for its fruit.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: My vine-garden, which is mine, is before me: you, O Solomon, will have the thousand, and those who keep the fruit of them two hundred.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: You who have your resting-place in the gardens, the friends give ear to your voice; make me give ear to it.

title: Song of Solomon Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: Come quickly, my loved one, and be like a roe on the mountains of spice.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The vision of Isaiah, the son of Amoz, which he saw about Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Give ear, O heavens, and you, O earth, to the word which the Lord has said: I have taken care of my children till they became men, but their hearts have been turned away from me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Even the ox has knowledge of its owner, and the ass of the place where its master puts its food: but Israel has no knowledge, my people give no thought to me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: O nation full of sin, a people weighted down with crime, a generation of evil-doers, false-hearted children: they have gone away from the Lord, they have no respect for the Holy One of Israel, their hearts are turned back from him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Why will you have more and more punishment? why keep on in your evil ways? Every head is tired and every heart is feeble.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: The body, from head to foot, is all diseased; it is a mass of open wounds, marks of blows, and broken flesh: the flow of blood has not been stopped, and no oil has been put on the wounds.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: Your country has become waste; your towns are burned with fire; as for your land, it is overturned before your eyes, made waste and overcome by men from strange lands.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: And the daughter of Zion has become like a tent in a vine-garden, like a watchman's house in a field of fruit, like a town shut in by armies.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: If the Lord of armies had not kept some at least of us safe, we would have been like Sodom, and the fate of Gomorrah would have been ours.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: Give ear to the word of the Lord, you rulers of Sodom; let your hearts be turned to the law of our God, you people of Gomorrah.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: What use to me is the number of the offerings which you give me? says the Lord; your burned offerings of sheep, and the best parts of fat cattle, are a weariness to me; I take no pleasure in the blood of oxen, or of lambs, or of he-goats.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: At whose request do you come before me, making my house unclean with your feet?

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Give me no more false offerings; the smoke of burning flesh is disgusting to me, so are your new moons and Sabbaths and your holy meetings.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: Your new moons and your regular feasts are a grief to my soul: they are a weight in my spirit; I am crushed under them.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: And when your hands are stretched out to me, my eyes will be turned away from you: even though you go on making prayers, I will not give ear: your hands are full of blood.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: Be washed, make yourselves clean; put away the evil of your doings from before my eyes; let there be an end of sinning;

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: Take pleasure in well-doing; let your ways be upright, keep down the cruel, give a right decision for the child who has no father, see to the cause of the widow.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: Come now, and let us have an argument together, says the Lord: how may your sins which are red like blood be white as snow? how may their dark purple seem like wool?

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: If you will give ear to my word and do it, the good things of the land will be yours;

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: But if your hearts are turned against me, I will send destruction on you by the sword; so the Lord has said.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: The upright town has become untrue; there was a time when her judges gave right decisions, when righteousness had a resting-place in her, but now she is full of those who take men's lives.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: Your silver is no longer true metal, your wine is mixed with water.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: Your chiefs have gone against the Lord, they have become friends of thieves; every one of them is looking for profit and going after rewards; they do not give right decisions for the child who has no father, and they do not let the cause of the widow come before them.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: For this reason the Lord, the Lord of armies, the Strong One of Israel, has said, I will put an end to my haters, and send punishment on those who are against me;

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: And my hand will again be on you, washing away what is unclean as with soap, and taking away all your false metal;

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: And I will give you judges again as at the first, and wise guides as in the past; then you will be named, The Town of Righteousness, the true town.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: Upright acts will be the price of Zion's forgiveness, and by righteousness will men be living there.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 28
text: But a common destruction will overtake sinners and evil-doers together, and those who have gone away from the Lord will be cut off.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 29
text: For you will be put to shame because of the trees of your desire, and because of the gardens of your pleasure.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 30
text: For you will be like a tree whose leaves have become dry, and like a garden without water.

title: Isaiah Chapter 1 Verse 31
text: And the strong will be as food for the fire, and his work as a flame; and they will be burned together, with no one to put out the fire.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: The word which Isaiah, the son of Amoz, saw about Judah and Jerusalem.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: And it will come about in the last days, that the mountain of the Lord will be placed on the top of the mountains, and be lifted up over the hills; and all nations will come to it.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And the peoples will say, Come, and let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, to the house of the God of Jacob: and he will give us knowledge of his ways, and we will be guided by his word; for out of Zion the law will go out, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: And he will be the judge between the nations, and the peoples will be ruled by his decisions: and their swords will be turned into plough-blades, and their spears into vine-knives: no longer will the nations be turning their swords against one another, and the knowledge of war will be gone for ever.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: O family of Jacob, come, and let us go in the light of the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: For you, O Lord, have given up your people, the family of Jacob, because they are full of the evil ways of the east, and make use of secret arts like the Philistines, and are friends with the children of strange countries.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And their land is full of silver and gold, and there is no end to their stores; their land is full of horses, and there is no end to their carriages.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: Their land is full of images; they give worship to the work of their hands, even to that which their fingers have made.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: And the poor man's head is bent, and the great man goes down on his face: for this cause there will be no forgiveness for their sin.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: Go into a hole in the rock, covering yourselves with dust, in fear of the Lord, before the glory of his power.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: The high looks of man will be put to shame, and the pride of men will be made low, and only the Lord will be lifted up in that day.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: For the day of the Lord of armies is coming on all the pride of men, and on all who are high and lifted up;

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: And on all the high trees of Lebanon, and on all the strong trees of Bashan;

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And on all the high mountains, and on all the hills which are lifted up;

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: And on every high tower, and on every strong wall;

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And on all the ships of Tarshish, and on all the fair boats.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: And the high looks of man will be put to shame, and the pride of men will be made low: and only the Lord will be lifted up in that day.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And the images will never be seen again.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: And men will go into cracks of the rocks, and into holes of the earth, for fear of the Lord, and before the glory of his power, when he comes out of his place, shaking the earth with his strength.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: In that day men will put their images of silver and of gold, which they made for worship, in the keeping of the beasts of the dark places;

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: To take cover in the cracks of the rocks, and in the holes of the hills, for fear of the Lord, and before the glory of his power, when he comes out of his place, shaking the earth with his strength.

title: Isaiah Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: Have no more to do with man, whose life is only a breath, for he is of no value.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: For the Lord, the Lord of armies, is about to take away from Jerusalem and from Judah all their support; their store of bread and of water;

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: The strong man and the man of war; the judge and the prophet; the man who has knowledge of secret arts, and the man who is wise because of his years;

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: The captain of fifty, and the man of high position, and the wise guide, and the wonder-worker, and he who makes use of secret powers.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And I will make children their chiefs, and foolish ones will have rule over them.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And the people will be crushed, every one by his neighbour; the young will be full of pride against the old, and those of low position will be lifted up against the noble.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: When one man puts his hand on another in his father's house, and says, You have clothing, be our ruler and be responsible for us in our sad condition:

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: Then he will say with an oath, I will not be a helper, for in my house there is no bread or clothing: I will not let you make me a ruler of the people.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: For Jerusalem has become feeble, and destruction has come on Judah, because their words and their acts are against the Lord, moving the eyes of his glory to wrath.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Their respect for a man's position is a witness against them; and their sin is open to the view of all; like that of Sodom, it is not covered. A curse on their soul! for the measure of their sin is full.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: Happy is the upright man! for he will have joy of the fruit of his ways.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Unhappy is the sinner! for the reward of his evil doings will come on him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: As for my people, their ruler is acting like a child, and those who have authority over them are women. O my people, your guides are the cause of your wandering, turning your footsteps out of the right way.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: The Lord is ready to take up his cause against his people, and is about to come forward as their judge.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: The Lord comes to be the judge of their responsible men and of their rulers: it is you who have made waste the vine-garden, and in your houses is the property of the poor which you have taken by force.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: By what right are you crushing my people, and putting a bitter yoke on the necks of the poor? This is the word of the Lord, the Lord of armies.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Again, the Lord has said, Because the daughters of Zion are full of pride, and go with outstretched necks and wandering eyes, with their foot-chains sounding when they go:

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: The Lord will send disease on the heads of the daughters of Zion, and the Lord will let their secret parts be seen.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: In that day the Lord will take away the glory of their foot-rings, and their sun-jewels, and their moon-ornaments,

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: The ear-rings, and the chains, and the delicate clothing,

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: The head-bands, and the arm-chains, and the worked bands, and the perfume-boxes, and the jewels with secret powers,

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: The rings, and the nose-jewels,

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: The feast-day dresses, and the robes, and the wide skirts, and the handbags,

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: The looking-glasses, and the fair linen, and the high head-dresses, and the veils.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: And in the place of sweet spices will be an evil smell, and for a fair band a thick cord; for a well-dressed head there will be the cutting-off of the hair, and for a beautiful robe there will be the clothing of sorrow; the mark of the prisoner in place of the ornaments of the free.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: Your men will be put to the sword, and your men of war will come to destruction in the fight.

title: Isaiah Chapter 3 Verse 26
text: And in the public places of her towns will be sorrow and weeping; and she will be seated on the earth, waste and uncovered.

title: Isaiah Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: And in that day seven women will put their hands on one man, saying, There will be no need for you to give us food or clothing, only let us go under your name, so that our shame may be taken away.

title: Isaiah Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: In that day will the young growth of the Lord be beautiful in glory, and the fruit of the earth will be the pride of those who are still living in Israel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: And it will come about that the rest of the living in Zion, and of those who have been kept from destruction in Jerusalem, will be named holy, even everyone who has been recorded for life in Jerusalem:

title: Isaiah Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: When Zion has been washed from her sin by the Lord, and Jerusalem made clean from her blood by a judging and a burning wind.

title: Isaiah Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: And over every living-place on Mount Zion, all over all her meetings, the Lord will make a cloud and smoke by day, and the shining of a flaming fire by night, for over all, the glory of the Lord will be a cover and a tent;

title: Isaiah Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: And a shade in the daytime from the heat, and a safe cover from storm and from rain.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Let me make a song about my loved one, a song of love for his vine-garden. My loved one had a vine-garden on a fertile hill:

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: And after working the earth of it with a spade, he took away its stones, and put in it a very special vine; and he put up a watchtower in the middle of it, hollowing out in the rock a place for the grape-crushing; and he was hoping that it would give the best grapes, but it gave common grapes.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: And now, you people of Jerusalem and you men of Judah, be the judges between me and my vine-garden.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: Is there anything which might have been done for my vine-garden which I have not done? why then, when I was hoping for the best grapes did it give me common grapes?

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: And now, this is what I will do to my vine-garden: I will take away the circle of thorns round it, and it will be burned up; its wall will be broken down and the beasts of the field will go through it;

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And I will make it waste; its branches will not be touched with the knife, or the earth worked with the spade; but blackberries and thorns will come up in it: and I will give orders to the clouds not to send rain on it.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: For the vine-garden of the Lord of armies is the people of Israel, and the men of Judah are the plant of his delight: and he was looking for upright judging, and there was blood; for righteousness, and there was a cry for help.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: Cursed are those who are joining house to house, and putting field to field, till there is no more living-space for any but themselves in all the land!

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: The Lord of armies has said to me secretly, Truly, numbers of great and fair houses will be waste, with no one living in them.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: For ten fields of vines will only give one measure of wine, and a great amount of seed will only give a small measure of grain.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: Cursed are those who get up early in the morning to give themselves up to strong drink; who keep on drinking far into the night till they are heated with wine!

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And corded instruments and wind-instruments and wine are in their feasts: but they give no thought to the work of the Lord, and they are not interested in what his hands are doing.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: For this cause my people are taken away as prisoners into strange countries for need of knowledge: and their rulers are wasted for need of food, and their loud-voiced feasters are dry for need of water.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: For this cause the underworld has made wide its throat, opening its mouth without limit: and her glory, and the noise of her masses, and her loud-voiced feasters, will go down into it.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And the poor man's head is bent, and the great man goes down on his face, and the eyes of pride are put to shame:

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: But the Lord of armies is lifted up as judge, and the Holy God is seen to be holy in righteousness.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: Then the lambs will get food as in their grass-lands, and the fat cattle will be feasting in the waste places.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: Cursed are those who make use of ox-cords for pulling the evil thing, and the bands of a young ox for their sin!

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: Who say, Let him do his work quickly, let him make it sudden, so that we may see it: let the design of the Holy One of Israel come near, so that it may be clear to us.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: Cursed are those who give the name of good to evil, and of evil to what is good: who make light dark, and dark light: who make bitter sweet, and sweet bitter!

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: Cursed are those who seem wise to themselves, and who take pride in their knowledge!

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: Cursed are those who are strong to take wine, and great in making mixed drinks!

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: Who for a reward give support to the cause of the sinner, and who take away the righteousness of the upright from him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: For this cause, as the waste of the grain is burned up by tongues of fire, and as the dry grass goes down before the flame, so their root will be like the dry stems of grain, and their flower will go up in dust: because they have gone against the law of the Lord of armies, and have given no honour to the word of the Holy One of Israel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: For this reason the wrath of the Lord has been burning against his people, and his hand has been stretched out against them in punishment, and the hills were shaking, and their dead bodies were like waste in the open places of the town.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: And he will let a flag be lifted up as a sign to a far-off nation, whistling to them from the ends of the earth: and they will come quickly and suddenly.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: There is no weariness among them, and no man is feeble-footed: they come without resting or sleeping, and the cord of their shoes is not broken.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 28
text: Their arrows are sharp, and every bow is bent: the feet of their horses are like rock, and their wheels are like a rushing storm.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 29
text: The sound of their armies will be like the voice of a lion, and their war-cry like the noise of young lions: with loud cries they will come down on their food and will take it away safely, and there will be no one to take it out of their hands.

title: Isaiah Chapter 5 Verse 30
text: And his voice will be loud over him in that day like the sounding of the sea: and if a man's eyes are turned to the earth, it is all dark and full of trouble; and the light is made dark by thick clouds.

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: In the year of King Uzziah's death I saw the Lord seated in his place, high and lifted up, and the Temple was full of the wide skirts of his robe.

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: Over him were the winged ones: every one had six wings; two for covering his face, two for covering his feed, and two for flight.

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: And one said in a loud voice to another, Holy, holy, holy, is the Lord of armies: all the earth is full of his glory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: And the bases of the door-pillars were shaking at the sound of his cry, and the house was full of smoke.

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: Then I said, The curse is on me, and my fate is destruction; for I am a man of unclean lips, living among a people of unclean lips; for my eyes have seen the King, the Lord of armies.

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: Then a winged one came to me with a burning coal in his hand, which he had taken from off the altar with the fire-spoon.

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: And after touching my mouth with it, he said, See, your lips have been touched with this; and your evil is taken away, and you are made clean from sin.

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: And the voice of the Lord came to my ears, saying, Whom am I to send, and who will go for us? Then I said, Here am I, send me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: And he said, Go, and say to this people, You will go on hearing, but learning nothing; you will go on seeing, but without getting wiser.

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: Make the hearts of this people fat, and let their ears be stopped, and their eyes shut; for fear that they may see with their eyes, and be hearing with their ears, and their heart may become wise, and they may be turned to me and made well.

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: Then I said, Lord, how long? And he said in answer, Till the towns are waste and unpeopled, and the houses have no men, and the land becomes completely waste,

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And the Lord has taken men far away, and there are wide waste places in the land.

title: Isaiah Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: And even if there is still a tenth part in it, it will again be burned, like a tree of the woods whose broken end is still in the earth after the tree has been cut down (the holy seed is the broken end).

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: Now it came about in the days of Ahaz, the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that Rezin, the king of Aram, and Pekah, the son of Remaliah, the king of Israel, came up to Jerusalem to make war against it, but were not able to overcome it.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And word came to the family of David that Aram had put up its tents in Ephraim. And the king's heart, and the hearts of his people, were moved, like the trees of the wood shaking in the wind.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Then the Lord said to Isaiah, Go out now, you and Shear-jashub, your son, and you will come across Ahaz at the end of the stream flowing from the higher pool, in the highway of the washerman's field;

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: And say to him, Take care and be quiet; have no fear, and do not let your heart be feeble, because of these two ends of smoking fire-wood, because of the bitter wrath of Rezin and Aram, and of the son of Remaliah.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: Because Aram has made evil designs against you, saying,

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: Let us go up against Judah, troubling her, and forcing our way into her, and let us put up a king in her, even the son of Tabeel:

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: This is the word of the Lord God: This design will not come about or be effected.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: For the head of Aram is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin (and in sixty-five years from now Ephraim will be broken, and will no longer be a people):

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah's son. If you will not have faith, your kingdom will be broken.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And Isaiah said again to Ahaz,

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: Make a request to the Lord your God for a sign, a sign in the deep places of the underworld, or in the high heavens.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: But Ahaz said, I will not put the Lord to the test by making such a request.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: And he said, Give ear now, O family of David: is it not enough that you are driving men to disgust? will you do the same to my God?

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: For this cause the Lord himself will give you a sign; a young woman is now with child, and she will give birth to a son, and she will give him the name Immanuel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: Butter and honey will be his food, when he is old enough to make a decision between evil and good.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: For before the child is old enough to make a decision between evil and good, the land whose two kings you are now fearing will have become waste.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: The Lord is about to send on you, and on your people, and on your father's house, such a time of trouble as there has not been from the days of the separating of Ephraim from Judah; even the coming of the king of Assyria.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: And it will be in that day that the Lord will make a piping sound for the fly which is in the end of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee which is in the land of Assyria.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: And they will come, covering all the waste valleys, and the holes of the rocks, and the thorns, and all the watering-places.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: In that day will the Lord take away the hair of the head and of the feet, as well as the hair of the face, with a blade got for a price from the other side of the River; even with the king of Assyria.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: And it will be in that day that a man will give food to a young cow and two sheep;

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: And they will give so much milk that he will be able to have butter for his food: for butter and honey will be the food of all who are still living in the land.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: And it will be in that day that in every place where before there were a thousand vines valued at a thousand shekels of silver, there will be nothing but blackberries and thorns.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: Men will come there with bows and arrows, because all the land will be full of blackberries and thorns.

title: Isaiah Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: And they will send out the oxen and the sheep on all the hills which before were worked with the spade, ... fear of blackberries and thorns.

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: And the Lord said to me, Take a great writing-board, and on it put down in common letters, Maher-shalal-hash-baz;

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And take true witnesses to the writing, Uriah the priest, and Zechariah, the son of Jeberechiah.

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And I went in to my wife, and she became with child, and gave birth to a son. Then the Lord said to me, Give him the name Maher-shalal-hash-baz,

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: For before the child is able to say, Father, or, Mother, the wealth of Damascus and the goods of Samaria will be taken away by the king of Assyria.

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: And the Lord said again to me,

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: Because this people will have nothing to do with the softly-flowing waters of Shiloah, and have fear of Rezin and Remaliah's son;

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: For this cause the Lord is sending on them the waters of the River, deep and strong, even the king of Assyria and all his glory: and it will come up through all its streams, overflowing all its edges:

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: And it will come on into Judah; rushing on and overflowing, till the waters are up to the neck; *** and his outstretched wings will be covering the land from side to side: for God is with us.

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: Have knowledge, O peoples, and be in fear; give ear, all you far-off parts of the earth:

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: Let your designs be formed, and they will come to nothing; give your orders, and they will not be effected: for God is with us.

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: For the Lord, controlling me with a strong hand, gave me orders not to go in the way of this people, saying,

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: Do not say, It is holy, about everything of which this people says, It is holy; and do not be in fear of what they go in fear of.

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: But let the Lord of armies be holy to you, and go in fear of him, giving honour to him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: And he will be for a holy place: but for a stone of falling and a rock of trouble to the two houses of Israel, and to the men of Jerusalem, for a net in which they may be taken.

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: And numbers of them, falling on the stone, will be broken, and will be taken in the net.

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: Let my teaching be kept secret: and my words be given to my disciples only.

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: And I will be waiting for the Lord, whose face is veiled from the house of Jacob, and I will be looking for him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: See, I and the children whom the Lord has given me, are for signs and for wonders in Israel from the Lord of armies, whose resting-place is in Mount Zion.

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: And when they say to you, Make request for us to those who have control of spirits, and to those wise in secret arts, who make hollow bird-like sounds; is it not right for a people to make request to their gods, to make request for the living to the dead?

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: Then say to them, Put your faith in the teaching and the witness. ... If they do not say such things. ... For him there is no dawn. ...

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: And he will go through the land in bitter trouble and in need of food; and when he is unable to get food, he will become angry, cursing his king and his God, and his eyes will be turned to heaven on high;

title: Isaiah Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: And he will be looking down on the earth, and there will be trouble and dark clouds, black night where there is no seeing.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: In earlier times he made the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali of small value, but after that he gave it glory, by the way of the sea, on the other side of Jordan, Galilee of the nations.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: The people who went in the dark have seen a great light, and for those who were living in the land of the deepest night, the light is shining.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: You have made them very glad, increasing their joy. They are glad before you as men are glad in the time of getting in the grain, or when they make division of the goods taken in war.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: For by your hand the yoke on his neck and the rod on his back, even the rod of his cruel master, have been broken, as in the day of Midian.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: For every boot of the man of war with his sounding step, and the clothing rolled in blood, will be for burning, food for the fire.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: For to us a child has come, to us a son is given; and the government has been placed in his hands; and he has been named Wise Guide, Strong God, Father for ever, Prince of Peace.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: Of the increase of his rule and of peace there will be no end, on the seat of David, and in his kingdom; to make it strong, supporting it with wise decision and righteousness, now and for ever. By the fixed purpose of the Lord of armies this will be done.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: The Lord has sent a word to Jacob, and it has come on Israel;

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And all the people will have experience of it, even Ephraim and the men of Samaria, who say in the pride of their uplifted hearts,

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: The bricks have come down, but we will put up buildings of cut stone in their place: the sycamores are cut down, but they will be changed to cedars.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: For this cause the Lord has made strong the haters of Israel, driving them on to make war against him;

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: Aram on the east, and the Philistines on the west, who have come against Israel with open mouths. For all this his wrath is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: But the heart of the people was not turned to him who sent punishment on them, and they made no prayer to the Lord of armies.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: For this cause the Lord took away from Israel head and tail, high and low, in one day.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: The man who is honoured and responsible is the head, and the prophet who gives false teaching is the tail.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: For the guides of this people are the cause of their wandering from the right way, and those who are guided by them come to destruction.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: For this cause the Lord will have no pleasure in their young men, and no pity on their widows and the children without fathers: for they are all haters of God and evil-doers, and foolish words come from every mouth. For all this his wrath is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: For evil was burning like a fire; the blackberries and thorns were burned up; the thick woods took fire, rolling up in dark clouds of smoke.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: The land was dark with the wrath of the Lord of armies: the people were like those who take men's flesh for food.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: On the right a man was cutting off bits and was still in need; on the left a man took a meal but had not enough; no man had pity on his brother; every man was making a meal of the flesh of his neighbour.

title: Isaiah Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: Manasseh was making a meal of Ephraim, and Ephraim of Manasseh; and together they were attacking Judah. For all this his wrath is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Cursed are those who make evil decisions, and the writers who make the records of their cruel acts:

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: Who do wrong to the poor in their cause, and take away the right of the crushed among my people, so that they may have the property of widows, and get under their power those who have no father.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: And what will you do in the day of punishment, and in the destruction which is coming from far? to whom will you go for help, and what will become of your glory?

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: ... For all this his wrath is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: Ho! Assyrian, the rod of my wrath, the instrument of my punishment!

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: I will send him against a nation of wrongdoers, and against the people of my wrath I will give him orders, to take their wealth in war, crushing them down like the dust in the streets.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: But this is not what is in his mind, and this is not his design; but his purpose is destruction, and the cutting off of more and more nations.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: For he says, Are not all my captains kings?

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: Will not the fate of Calno be like that of Carchemish? is not Hamath as Arpad? is not Samaria as Damascus?

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: As my hand has come on the kingdoms of the images, whose pictured images were more in number than those of Jerusalem and Samaria;

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: So, as I have done to Samaria and her images, I will do to Jerusalem and her images.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: For this cause it will be that, when the purpose of the Lord against Mount Zion and Jerusalem is complete, I will send punishment on the pride of the heart of the king of Assyria, and on the glory of his uplifted eyes.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: For he has said, By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my knowledge, for I am wise: and I have taken away the limits of the peoples' lands, and the stores of their wealth have become mine; and I have made towns low in the dust, sending destruction on those living in them;

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: And I have put my hands on the wealth of the peoples, as on the place where a bird has put her eggs; and as a man may take the eggs from which a bird has gone, so I have taken all the earth for myself: and not a wing was moved, and not a mouth gave out a sound.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: Will the axe say high-sounding words against him who is using it, or the blade be full of pride against him who is cutting with it? As if a rod had the power of shaking him who is using it, or as if a stick might take up him who is not wood.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: For this cause the Lord, the Lord of armies, will make his fat become wasted; and in his inner parts a fire will be lighted like a burning flame.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: And the light of Israel will be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame: wasting and burning up his thorns in one day.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: And he will put an end to the glory of his woods and of his planted fields, soul and body together; and it will be as when a man is wasted by disease.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: And the rest of the trees of his wood will be small in number, so that a child may put them down in writing.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: And it will be in that day that the rest of Israel, and those of Jacob who have come safely through these troubles, will no longer go for help to him whose rod was on their back, but their faith will be in the Lord, the Holy One of Israel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: The rest, even the rest of Jacob, will come back to the Strong God.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: For though your people, O Israel, are as the sand of the sea, only a small number will come back: for the destruction is fixed, overflowing in righteousness.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: For the Lord, the Lord of armies, is about to make destruction complete in all the land.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: For this cause the Lord, the Lord of armies, says, O my people living in Zion, have no fear of the Assyrian, even if his rod comes on your back, and his stick is lifted up as in Egypt.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: For in a very short time my passion will be over, and my wrath will be turned to their destruction.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: And the Lord of armies will be shaking a whip against him, as when he overcame Midian at the rock of Oreb: and his rod will be lifted up against them as it was against the Egyptians.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: And in that day the weight which he put on your back will be taken away, and his yoke broken from off your neck.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: He has gone up from Pene-Rimmon, he has come to Aiath; he has gone past Migron, at Michmash he puts his forces in order.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: They have gone across the mountain; Geba will be our resting-place tonight, they say: Ramah is shaking with fear; Gibeah of Saul has gone in flight.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: Give a loud cry, daughter of Gallim; let Laishah give ear; let Anathoth give answer to her.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: Madmenah has gone; the men of Gebim are putting their goods in a safe place.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: This very day he is stopping at Nob; he is shaking his hand against the mountain of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: See, the Lord, the Lord of armies, is cutting off his branches with a great noise, and his strong ones are falling and his high ones are coming down.

title: Isaiah Chapter 10 Verse 34
text: And he is cutting down the thick places of the wood with an axe, and Lebanon with its tall trees is coming down.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: And there will come a rod out of the broken tree of Jesse, and a branch out of his roots will give fruit.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: And the spirit of the Lord will be resting on him, the spirit of wisdom and good sense, the spirit of wise guiding and strength, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the Lord;

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: And he will not be guided in his judging by what he sees, or give decisions by the hearing of his ears:

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: But he will do right in the cause of the poor, and give wise decisions for those in the land who are in need; and the rod of his mouth will come down on the cruel, and with the breath of his lips he will put an end to the evil-doer.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: And righteousness will be the cord of his robe, and good faith the band round his breast.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And the wolf will be living with the lamb, and the leopard will take his rest with the young goat; and the lion will take grass for food like the ox; and the young lion will go with the young ones of the herd; and a little child will be their guide.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: And the cow and the bear will be friends while their young ones are sleeping together.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: And the child at the breast will be playing by the hole of the snake, and the older child will put his hand on the bright eye of the poison-snake.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: There will be no cause of pain or destruction in all my holy mountain: for the earth will be full of the knowledge of the Lord as the sea is covered by the waters.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: And in that day, the eyes of the nations will be turned to the root of Jesse which will be lifted up as the flag of the peoples; and his resting-place will be glory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: And in that day the hand of the Lord will be stretched out the second time to get back the rest of his people, from Assyria, and from Egypt, and from Pathros, and from Cush, and from Elam, and from Shinar, and from Hamath, and from the sea-lands.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: And he will put up a flag as a sign to the nations, and he will get together those of Israel who had been sent away, and the wandering ones of Judah, from the four ends of the earth.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: And the envy of Ephraim will be gone, and those who make trouble for Judah will come to an end: Ephraim will have no more envy of Judah, and there will be an end of Judah's hate for Ephraim.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And they will be united in attacking the Philistines on the west, and together they will take the goods of the children of the east: their hand will be on Edom and Moab; and the children of Ammon will be under their rule.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: And the Lord will make the tongue of the Egyptian sea completely dry; and with his burning wind his hand will be stretched out over the River, and it will be parted into seven streams, so that men may go over it with dry feet.

title: Isaiah Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: And there will be a highway for the rest of his people from Assyria; as there was for Israel in the day when he came up out of the land of Egypt.

title: Isaiah Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: And in that day you will say I will give praise to you, O Lord; for though you were angry with me, your wrath is turned away, and I am comforted.

title: Isaiah Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: See, God is my salvation; I will have faith in the Lord, without fear: for the Lord Jah is my strength and song; and he has become my salvation.

title: Isaiah Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: So with joy will you get water out of the springs of salvation.

title: Isaiah Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: And in that day you will say, Give praise to the Lord, let his name be honoured, give word of his doings among the peoples, say that his name is lifted up.

title: Isaiah Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: Make a song to the Lord; for he has done noble things: give news of them through all the earth.

title: Isaiah Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: Let your voice be sounding in a cry of joy, O daughter of Zion, for great is the Holy One of Israel among you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord about Babylon which Isaiah, the son of Amoz, saw.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: Put up a flag on a clear mountain-top, make a loud outcry to them, give directions with the hand, so that they may go into the doors of the great ones.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: I have given orders to my holy ones, I have sent out my men of war, those of mine who take pride in their power, to give effect to my wrath.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: The noise of great numbers in the mountains, like the noise of a strong people! The noise of the kingdoms of the nations meeting together! The Lord of armies is numbering his forces for war.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: They come from a far country, from the farthest part of heaven, even the Lord and the instruments of his wrath, with destruction for all the land.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: Send out a cry of grief; for the day of the Lord is near; it comes as destruction from the Most High.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: For this cause all hands will be feeble, and every heart of man be turned to water;

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: Their hearts will be full of fear; pains and sorrows will overcome them; they will be in pain like a woman in childbirth; they will be shocked at one another; their faces will be like flames.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: See, the day of the Lord is coming, cruel, with wrath and burning passion: to make the land a waste, driving the sinners in it to destruction.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: For the stars of heaven and its bright armies will not give their light: the sun will be made dark in his journey through the heaven, and the moon will keep back her light.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: And I will send punishment on the world for its evil, and on the sinners for their wrongdoing; and I will put an end to all pride, and will make low the power of the cruel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: I will make men so small in number, that a man will be harder to get than gold, even the best gold of Ophir.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: For this cause the heavens will be shaking, and the earth will be moved out of its place, in the wrath of the Lord of armies, and in the day of his burning passion.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: And it will be that, like a roe in flight, and like wandering sheep, they will go every man to his people and to his land.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: Everyone who is overtaken will have a spear put through him, and everyone who goes in flight will be put to the sword.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: Their young children will be broken up before their eyes; their goods will be taken away, and their wives made the property of others.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: See, I am driving the Medes against them, who put no value on silver and have no pleasure in gold.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: In their hands are bows and spears; they are cruel, violently putting the young men to death, and crushing the young women; they have no pity for children, and no mercy for the fruit of the body.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beautiful town which is the pride of the Chaldaeans, will be like God's destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: People will never be living in it again, and it will have no more men from generation to generation: the Arab will not put up his tent there; and those who keep sheep will not make it a resting-place for their flocks.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: But the beasts of the waste land will have their holes there; and the houses will be full of crying jackals, and ostriches will have their place there, and evil spirits will be dancing there.

title: Isaiah Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: And wolves will be answering one another in their towers, and jackals in their houses of pleasure: her time is near, and her days of power will quickly be ended.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: For the Lord will have mercy on Jacob, and will again make Israel his special people, and will put them in their land; and the man from a strange country will take his place among them and be joined to the family of Jacob.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: And the people will take them with them to their place: and the children of Israel will give them a heritage in the Lord's land as men-servants and women-servants, making them prisoners whose prisoners they were; and they will be rulers over their masters.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: And it will be, in the day when the Lord gives you rest from your sorrow, and from your trouble, and from the hard yoke which they had put on you,

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: That you will take up this bitter song against the king of Babylon, and say, How has the cruel overseer come to an end! He who was lifted up in pride is cut off;

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: The stick of the evil-doers, the rod of the rulers, is broken by the Lord;

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: He whose rod was on the peoples with an unending wrath, ruling the nations in passion, with an uncontrolled rule.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: All the earth is at rest and is quiet: they are bursting into song.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: Even the trees of the wood are glad over you, the trees of Lebanon, saying, From the time of your fall no wood-cutter has come up against us with an axe.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: The underworld is moved at your coming: the shades of the dead are awake before you, even the strong ones of the earth; all the kings of the world have got up from their seats.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: They all make answer and say to you, Have you become feeble like us? have you been made even as we are?

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: Your pride has gone down into the underworld, and the noise of your instruments of music; the worms are under you, and your body is covered with them.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: How great is your fall from heaven, O shining one, son of the morning! How are you cut down to the earth, low among the dead bodies!

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: For you said in your heart, I will go up to heaven, I will make my seat higher than the stars of God; I will take my place on the mountain of the meeting-place of the gods, in the inmost parts of the north.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: I will go higher than the clouds; I will be like the Most High.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: But you will come down to the underworld, even to its inmost parts.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: Those who see you will be looking on you with care, they will be in deep thought, saying, Is this the troubler of the earth, the shaker of kingdoms?

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: Who made the world a waste, overturning its towns; who did not let his prisoners loose from the prison-house.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: All the kings of the earth are at rest in glory, every man in his house,

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: But you, like a birth before its time, are stretched out with no resting-place in the earth; clothed with the bodies of the dead who have been put to the sword, who go down to the lowest parts of the underworld; a dead body, crushed under foot.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: As for your fathers, you will not be united with them in their resting-place, because you have been the cause of destruction to your land, and of death to your people; the seed of the evil-doer will have no place in the memory of man.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: Make ready a place of death for his children, because of the evil-doing of their father; so that they may not come up and take the earth for their heritage, covering the face of the world with waste places.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: For I will come up against them, says the Lord of armies, cutting off from Babylon name and offspring, son and son's son, says the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 23
text: And I will make you a heritage for the hedgehog, and pools of water: and I will go through it with the brush of destruction, says the Lord of armies.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 24
text: The Lord has taken an oath, saying, My design will certainly come about, and my purpose will be effected:

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 25
text: To let the Assyrian be broken in my land, and crushed under foot on my mountains: there will his yoke be taken away from them, and his rule over them come to an end.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 26
text: This is the purpose for all the earth: and this is the hand stretched out over all nations.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 27
text: For it is the purpose of the Lord of armies, and who will make it of no effect? when his hand is stretched out, by whom may it be turned back?

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 28
text: In the year of the death of King Ahaz this word came to the prophet:

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 29
text: Be not glad, O Philistia, all of you, because the rod which was on you is broken: for out of the snake's root will come a poison-snake, and its fruit will be a winged poison-snake.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 30
text: And the poorest of the land will have food, and those in need will be given a safe resting-place: but your seed will come to an end for need of food, and the rest of you will be put to the sword.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 31
text: Send out a cry, O door! Make sounds of sorrow, O town! All your land has come to nothing, O Philistia; for there comes a smoke out of the north, and everyone keeps his place in the line.

title: Isaiah Chapter 14 Verse 32
text: What answer, then, will my people give to the representatives of the nation? That the Lord is the builder of Zion, and she will be a safe place for the poor of his people.

title: Isaiah Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: The word about Moab. For in a night Ar of Moab has become waste, and is seen no longer; for in a night Kir of Moab has become waste, and is seen no longer.

title: Isaiah Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: The daughter of Dibon has gone up to the high places, weeping: Moab is sounding her cry of sorrow over Nebo, and over Medeba: everywhere the hair of the head and of the face is cut off.

title: Isaiah Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: In their streets they are covering themselves with haircloth: on the tops of their houses, and in their public places, there is crying and bitter weeping.

title: Isaiah Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: Heshbon is crying out, and Elealeh; their voice is sounding even to Jahaz: for this cause the heart of Moab is shaking; his soul is shaking with fear.

title: Isaiah Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: My heart is crying out for Moab; her people go in flight to Zoar, and to Eglath-shelishiyah: for they go up with weeping by the slope of Luhith; on the way to Horonaim they send up a cry of destruction.

title: Isaiah Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: The waters of Nimrim will become dry: for the grass is burned up, the young grass is coming to an end, every green thing is dead.

title: Isaiah Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: For this cause they will take away their wealth, and the stores they have got together, over the stream of the water-plants.

title: Isaiah Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: For the cry has gone round the limits of Moab; as far as to Eglaim and Beer-elim.

title: Isaiah Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: For the waters of Dimon are full of blood: and I'm sending even more on Moab, a lion on those of Moab who go in flight, and on the rest of the land.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: And they will send ... to the mountain of the daughter of Zion.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: For the daughters of Moab will be like wandering birds, like a place from which the young birds have gone in flight, at the ways across the Arnon.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: Give wise directions, make a decision; let your shade be as night in full day: keep safe those who are in flight; do not give up the wandering ones.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: Let those who have been forced out of Moab have a resting-place with you; be a cover to them from him who is making waste their land: till the cruel ones are cut off, and wasting has come to an end, and those who take pleasure in crushing the poor are gone from the land.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: Then a king's seat will be based on mercy, and one will be seated on it in the tent of David for ever; judging uprightly, and quick to do righteousness.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: We have had word of the pride of Moab, how great it is; how he is lifted up in pride and passion: his high words about himself are false.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: For this cause everyone in Moab will give cries of grief for Moab: crushed to the earth, they will be weeping for the men of Kir-hareseth.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: For the fields of Heshbon are waste, the vine of Sibmah is dead; the lords of nations were overcome by the produce of her vines; her vine-plants went as far as Jazer, and came even to the waste land; her branches were stretched out to the sea.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: For this cause my sorrow for the vine of Sibmah will be like the weeping for Jazer: my eyes are dropping water on you, O Heshbon and Elealeh! For they are sounding the war-cry over your summer fruits and the getting in of your grain;

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: And all joy is gone; no longer are they glad for the fertile field; and in the vine-gardens there are no songs or sounds of joy: the crushing of grapes has come to an end, and its glad cry has been stopped.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: For this cause the cords of my heart are sounding for Moab, and I am full of sorrow for Kir-heres.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: And when Moab goes up to the high place, and makes prayer in the house of his god, it will have no effect.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: This is the word which the Lord said about Moab in the past.

title: Isaiah Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: But now the Lord has said, In three years, the years of a servant working for payment, the glory of Moab, all that great people, will be turned to shame, and the rest of Moab will be very small and without honour.

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: The word about Damascus. See, they have made Damascus a town no longer; it has become a waste place.

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: Her towns are unpeopled for ever; there the flocks take their rest in peace, without fear.

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: The strong tower has gone from Ephraim, and the kingdom from Damascus: the rest of Aram will come to destruction, and be made like the glory of the children of Israel, says the Lord of armies.

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: And it will be in that day that the glory of Jacob will be made small, and the strength of his body will become feeble.

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: And it will be like a man cutting the growth of his grain, pulling together the heads of the grain with his arm; even as when they get in the grain in the valley of Rephaim.

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: But it will be like a man shaking an olive-tree, something will still be there, two or three berries on the top of the highest branch, four or five on the outside branches of a fertile tree, says the Lord, the God of Israel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: In that day a man's heart will be turned to his Maker, and his eyes to the Holy One of Israel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: He will not be looking to the altars, the work of his hands, or to the wood pillars or to the sun-images which his fingers have made.

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: In that day your towns will be like the waste places of the Hivites and the Amorites which the children of Israel took for a heritage, and they will come to destruction.

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: For you have not given honour to the God of your salvation, and have not kept in mind the Rock of your strength; for this cause you made a garden of Adonis, and put in it the vine-cuttings of a strange god;

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: In the day of your planting you were watching its growth, and in the morning your seed was flowering: but its fruit is wasted away in the day of grief and bitter sorrow.

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: Ah! the voice of peoples, like the loud sounding of the seas, and the thundering of great nations rushing on like the bursting out of waters!

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: But he will put a stop to them, and make them go in flight far away, driving them like the waste of the grain on the tops of the mountains before the wind, and like the circling dust before the storm.

title: Isaiah Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: In the evening there is fear, and in the morning they are gone. This is the fate of those who take our goods, and the reward of those who violently take our property for themselves.

title: Isaiah Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: Ho! land of the sounding of wings, on the other side of the rivers of Ethiopia:

title: Isaiah Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: Which sends its representatives by the sea, even in ships of papyrus on the waters. Go back quickly, O representatives, to a nation tall and smooth, to a people causing fear through all their history; a strong nation, crushing down its haters, whose land is cut through by rivers.

title: Isaiah Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: All you peoples of the world, and you who are living on the earth, when a flag is lifted up on the mountains, give attention; and when the horn is sounded, give ear.

title: Isaiah Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: For this is what the Lord has said to me: I will be quiet, watching from my place; like the clear heat when the sun is shining, like a mist of dew in the heat of summer.

title: Isaiah Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: For before the time of getting in the grapes, after the opening of the bud, when the flower has become a grape ready for crushing, he will take away the small branches with knives, cutting down and taking away the wide-stretching branches.

title: Isaiah Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: They will be for the birds of the mountains, and for the beasts of the earth: the birds will come down on them in the summer, and the beasts of the earth in the winter.

title: Isaiah Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: In that time an offering will be made to the Lord of armies from a people tall and smooth, causing fear through all their history; a strong nation, crushing down its haters, whose land is cut through by rivers, an offering taken to the place of the name of the Lord of armies, even Mount Zion.

title: Isaiah Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: The word about Egypt. See, the Lord is seated on a quick-moving cloud, and is coming to Egypt: and the false gods of Egypt will be troubled at his coming, and the heart of Egypt will be turned to water.

title: Isaiah Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And I will send the Egyptians against the Egyptians: and they will be fighting every one against his brother, and every one against his neighbour; town against town, and kingdom against kingdom.

title: Isaiah Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: And the spirit of Egypt will be troubled in her, and I will make her decisions without effect: and they will be turning to the false gods, and to those who make hollow sounds, and to those who have control of spirits, and to those who are wise in secret arts.

title: Isaiah Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: And I will give the Egyptians into the hand of a cruel lord; and a hard king will be their ruler, says the Lord, the Lord of armies.

title: Isaiah Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: And the waters of the sea will be cut off, and the river will become dry and waste:

title: Isaiah Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: And the rivers will have an evil smell; the stream of Egypt will become small and dry: all the water-plants will come to nothing.

title: Isaiah Chapter 19 Verse 7
