text: In the hollow of whose hand have the waters been measured? and who is able to take the heavens in his stretched-out fingers? who has got together the dust of the earth in a measure? who has taken the weight of the mountains, or put the hills into the scales?

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 13
text: By whom has the spirit of the Lord been guided, or who has been his teacher?

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 14
text: Who gave him suggestions, and made clear to him the right way? who gave him knowledge, guiding him in the way of wisdom?

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 15
text: See, the nations are to him like a drop hanging from a bucket, and like the small dust in the scales: he takes up the islands like small dust.

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 16
text: And Lebanon is not enough to make a fire with, or all its cattle enough for a burned offering.

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 17
text: All the nations are as nothing before him; even less than nothing, a thing of no value.

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 18
text: Whom then is God like, in your opinion? or what will you put forward as a comparison with him?

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 19
text: The workman makes an image, and the gold-worker puts gold plates over it, and makes silver bands for it.

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 20
text: The wise workman makes selection of the mulberry-tree of the offering, a wood which will not become soft; so that the image may be fixed to it and not be moved.

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 21
text: Have you no knowledge of it? has it not come to your ears? has not news of it been given to you from the first? has it not been clear to you from the time when the earth was placed on its base?

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 22
text: It is he who is seated over the arch of the earth, and the people in it are as small as locusts; by him the heavens are stretched out like an arch, and made ready like a tent for a living-place.

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 23
text: He makes rulers come to nothing; the judges of the earth are of no value.

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 24
text: They have only now been planted, and their seed put into the earth, and they have only now taken root, when he sends out his breath over them and they become dry, and the storm-wind takes them away like dry grass.

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 25
text: Who then seems to you to be my equal? says the Holy One.

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 26
text: Let your eyes be lifted up on high, and see: who has made these? He who sends out their numbered army: who has knowledge of all their names: by whose great strength, because he is strong in power, all of them are in their places.

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 27
text: Why do you say, O Jacob, such words as these, O Israel, The Lord's eyes are not on my way, and my God gives no attention to my cause?

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 28
text: Have you no knowledge of it? has it not come to your ears? The eternal God, the Lord, the Maker of the ends of the earth, is never feeble or tired; there is no searching out of his wisdom.

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 29
text: He gives power to the feeble, increasing the strength of him who has no force.

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 30
text: Even the young men will become feeble and tired, and the best of them will come to the end of his strength;

title: Isaiah Chapter 40 Verse 31
text: But those who are waiting for the Lord will have new strength; they will get wings like eagles: running, they will not be tired, and walking, they will have no weariness.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 1
text: Come quietly before me, O sea-lands, and let the peoples get together their strength: let them come near; then let them say what they have to say: let us put forward our cause against one another.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 2
text: Who sent out from the east one who is right wherever he goes? he gives the nations into his hands, and makes him ruler over kings; he gives them as the dust to his sword, as dry stems before the wind to his bow.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 3
text: He goes after them safely, not touching the road with his feet.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 4
text: Whose purpose and work was it? His who sent out the generations from the start. I the Lord, the first, and with the last, I am he.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 5
text: The sea-lands saw it, and were in fear; the ends of the earth were shaking: they came near.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 6
text: They gave help everyone to his neighbour; and everyone said to his brother, Take heart!

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 7
text: So the metal-worker put heart into the gold-worker, and he who was hammering the metal smooth said kind words to the iron-worker, saying of the plate, It is ready: and he put it together with nails, so that there might be no slipping.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 8
text: But as for you, Israel, my servant, and you, Jacob, whom I have taken for myself, the seed of Abraham my friend:

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 9
text: You whom I have taken from the ends of the earth, and sent for from its farthest parts, saying to you, You are my servant, whom I have taken for myself, and whom I have not given up:

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 10
text: Have no fear, for I am with you; do not be looking about in trouble, for I am your God; I will give you strength, yes, I will be your helper; yes, my true right hand will be your support.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 11
text: Truly, all those who are angry with you will be made low and put to shame: those desiring to do you wrong will come to nothing and never again be seen.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 12
text: You will make search for your haters but they will not be there; those who make war against you will be as nothing and will come to destruction.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 13
text: For I, the Lord your God, have taken your right hand in mine, saying to you, Have no fear; I will be your helper.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 14
text: Have no fear, you worm Jacob, and you men of Israel; I will be your helper, says the Lord, even he who takes up your cause, the Holy One of Israel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 15
text: See, I will make you like a new grain-crushing instrument with teeth, crushing the mountains small, and making the hills like dry stems.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 16
text: You will send the wind over them, and it will take them away; they will go in all directions before the storm-wind: you will have joy in the Lord, and be glad in the Holy One of Israel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 17
text: The poor and crushed are looking for water where no water is, and their tongue is dry for need of it: I the Lord will give ear to their prayer, I the God of Israel will not give them up.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 18
text: I will make rivers on the dry mountain-tops, and fountains in the valleys: I will make the waste land a pool of water, and the dry land springs of water.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 19
text: I will put in the waste land the cedar, the acacia, the myrtle, and the olive-tree; and in the lowland will be planted the fir-tree, the plane, and the cypress together:

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 20
text: So that they may see and be wise and give their mind to it, and that it may be clear to them all that the hand of the Lord has done this, and that the Holy One of Israel has made it.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 21
text: Put forward your cause, says the Lord; let your strong argument come out, says the King of Jacob.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 22
text: Let the future be made clear to us: give us news of the past things, so that we may give thought to them; or of the things to come, so that we may see if they are true.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 23
text: Give us word of what will be after this, so that we may be certain that you are gods: yes, do good or do evil, so that we may all see it and be surprised.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 24
text: But you are nothing, and your work is of no value: foolish is he who takes you for his gods.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 25
text: I have sent for one from the north, and from the dawn he has come; in my name he will get rulers together and go against them; they will be like dust, even as the wet earth is stamped on by the feet of the potter.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 26
text: Who has given knowledge of it from the first, so that we may be certain of it? and from the start, so that we may say, His word is true? There is no one who gives news, or says anything, or who gives ear to your words.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 27
text: I was the first to give word of it to Zion, and I gave the good news to Jerusalem.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 28
text: And I saw that there was no man, even no wise man among them, who might give an answer to my questions.

title: Isaiah Chapter 41 Verse 29
text: Truly they are all nothing, their works are nothing and of no value: their metal images are of no more use than wind.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 1
text: See my servant, whom I am supporting, my loved one, in whom I take delight: I have put my spirit on him; he will give the knowledge of the true God to the nations.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 2
text: He will make no cry, his voice will not be loud: his words will not come to men's ears in the streets.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 3
text: He will not let a crushed stem be quite broken, and he will not let a feebly burning light be put out: he will go on sending out the true word to the peoples.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 4
text: His light will not be put out, and he will not be crushed, till he has given the knowledge of the true God to the earth, and the sea-lands will be waiting for his teaching.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 5
text: God the Lord, even he who made the heavens, measuring them out on high; stretching out the earth, and giving its produce; he who gives breath to the people on it, and life to those who go about on it, says:

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 6
text: I the Lord have made you the vessel of my purpose, I have taken you by the hand, and kept you safe, and I have given you to be an agreement to the people, and a light to the nations:

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 7
text: To give eyes to the blind, to make free the prisoners from the prison, to let out those who are shut up in the dark.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 8
text: I am the Lord; that is my name: I will not give my glory to another, or my praise to pictured images.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 9
text: See, the things said before have come about, and now I give word of new things: before they come I give you news of them.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 10
text: Make a new song to the Lord, and let his praise be sounded from the end of the earth; you who go down to the sea, and everything in it, the sea-lands and their people.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 11
text: Let the waste land and its flocks be glad, the tent-circles of Kedar; let the people of the rock give a glad cry, from the top of the mountains let them make a sound of joy.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 12
text: Let them give glory to the Lord, sounding his praise in the sea-lands.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 13
text: The Lord will go out as a man of war, he will be moved to wrath like a fighting-man: his voice will be strong, he will give a loud cry; he will go against his attackers like a man of war.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 14
text: I have long been quiet, I have kept myself in and done nothing: now I will make sounds of pain like a woman in childbirth, breathing hard and quickly.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 15
text: I will make waste mountains and hills, drying up all their plants; and I will make rivers dry, and pools dry land.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 16
text: And I will take the blind by a way of which they had no knowledge, guiding them by roads strange to them: I will make the dark places light before them, and the rough places level. These things will I do and will not give them up.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 17
text: They will be turned back and be greatly shamed who put their hope in pictured images, who say to metal images, You are our gods.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 18
text: Give ear, you whose ears are shut; and let your eyes be open, you blind, so that you may see.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 19
text: Who is blind, but my servant? who has his ears stopped, but he whom I send? who is blind as my true one, or who has his ears shut like the Lord's servant?

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 20
text: Seeing much, but keeping nothing in mind; his ears are open, but there is no hearing.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 21
text: It was the Lord's pleasure, because of his righteousness, to make the teaching great and give it honour.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 22
text: But this is a people whose property has been taken away from them by force; they are all taken in holes, and shut up in prisons: they are made prisoners, and no one makes them free; they are taken by force and no one says, Give them back.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 23
text: Who is there among you who will give ear to this? who will give attention to it for the time to come?

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 24
text: Who gave up Jacob to those who took away his goods, and Israel to his attackers? Did not the Lord? he against whom they did wrong, and in whose ways they would not go, turning away from his teaching.

title: Isaiah Chapter 42 Verse 25
text: For this reason he let loose on him the heat of his wrath, and his strength was like a flame; and it put fire round about him, but he did not see it; he was burned, but did not take it to heart.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 1
text: But now, says the Lord your Maker, O Jacob, and your life-giver, O Israel: have no fear, for I have taken up your cause; naming you by your name, I have made you mine.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 2
text: When you go through the waters, I will be with you; and through the rivers, they will not go over you: when you go through the fire, you will not be burned; and the flame will have no power over you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 3
text: For I am the Lord your God, the Holy One of Israel, your saviour; I have given Egypt as a price for you, Ethiopia and Seba for you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 4
text: Because of your value in my eyes, you have been honoured, and loved by me; so I will give men for you, and peoples for your life.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 5
text: Have no fear, for I am with you: I will take your seed from the east, and get you together from the west;

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 6
text: I will say to the north, Give them up; and to the south, Do not keep them back; send back my sons from far, and my daughters from the end of the earth;

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 7
text: Every one who is named by my name, and whom I have made for my glory, who has been formed and designed by me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 8
text: Send out the blind people who have eyes, and those who have ears, but they are shut.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 9
text: Let all the nations come together, and let the peoples be present: who among them is able to make this clear, and give us word of earlier things? let their witnesses come forward, so that they may be seen to be true, and that they may give ear, and say, It is true.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 10
text: You are my witnesses, says the Lord, and my servant whom I have taken for myself: so that you may see and have faith in me, and that it may be clear to you that I am he; before me there was no God formed, and there will not be after me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 11
text: I, even I, am the Lord; and there is no saviour but me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 12
text: I gave the word, and made it clear, and there was no strange god among you: for this reason you are my witnesses, says the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 13
text: From time long past I am God, and from this day I am he: there is no one who is able to take you out of my hand: when I undertake a thing, by whom will my purpose be changed?

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 14
text: The Lord, who has taken up your cause, the Holy One of Israel, says, Because of you I have sent to Babylon, and made all their seers come south, and the Chaldaeans whose cry is in the ships.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 15
text: I am the Lord, your Holy One, the Maker of Israel, your King.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 16
text: This is the word of the Lord, who makes a way in the sea, and a road through the deep waters;

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 17
text: Who sends out the war-carriages and the horses, the army with all its force; they have come down, they will not get up again; like a feebly burning light they are put out.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 18
text: Give no thought to the things which are past; let the early times go out of your minds.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 19
text: See, I am doing a new thing; now it is starting; will you not take note of it? I will even make a way in the waste land, and rivers in the dry country.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 20
text: The beasts of the field will give me honour, the jackals and the ostriches: because I send out waters in the waste land, and rivers in the dry country, to give drink to the people whom I have taken for myself:

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 21
text: Even the people whom I made to be the witnesses of my praise.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 22
text: But you have made no prayer to me, O Jacob: and you have given no thought to me, O Israel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 23
text: You have not made me burned offerings of sheep, or given me honour with your offerings of beasts; I did not make you servants to give me an offering, and I did not make you tired with requests for perfumes.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 24
text: You have not got me sweet-smelling plants with your money, or given me pleasure with the fat of your offerings: but you have made me a servant to your sins, and you have made me tired with your evil doings.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 25
text: I, even I, am he who takes away your sins; and I will no longer keep your evil doings in mind.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 26
text: Put me in mind of this; let us take up the cause between us: put forward your cause, so that you may be seen to be in the right.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 27
text: Your first father was a sinner, and your guides have gone against my word.

title: Isaiah Chapter 43 Verse 28
text: Your chiefs have made my holy place unclean, so I have made Jacob a curse, and Israel a thing of shame.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 1
text: And now, give ear, O Jacob my servant, and Israel whom I have taken for myself:

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 2
text: The Lord who made you, forming you in your mother's body, the Lord, your helper, says, Have no fear, O Jacob my servant, and you, Jeshurun, whom I have taken for myself.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 3
text: For I will send water on the land needing it, and streams on the dry earth: I will let my spirit come down on your seed, and my blessing on your offspring.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 4
text: And they will come up like grass in a well-watered field, like water-plants by the streams.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 5
text: One will say, I am the Lord's; and another will give himself the name, Jacob; another will put a mark on his hand, I am the Lord's, and another will take the name of Israel for himself.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 6
text: The Lord, the King of Israel, even the Lord of armies who has taken up his cause, says, I am the first and the last, and there is no God but me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 7
text: If there is one like me, let him come forward and say it, let him make it clear and put it in order before me: who has made clear in the past the things to come? let him make clear the future to me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 8
text: Have no fear, be strong in heart; have I not made it clear to you in the past, and let you see it? and you are my witnesses. Is there any God but me, or a Rock of whom I have no knowledge?

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 9
text: Those who make a pictured image are all of them as nothing, and the things of their desire will be of no profit to them: and their servants see not, and have no knowledge; so they will be put to shame.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 10
text: Whoever makes a god, makes nothing but a metal image in which there is no profit.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 11
text: Truly, all those who make use of secret arts will be put to shame, and their words of power are only words of men: let them all come forward together; they will all be in fear and be put to shame.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 12
text: The iron-worker is heating the metal in the fire, giving it form with his hammers, and working on it with his strong arm: then for need of food his strength gives way, and for need of water he becomes feeble.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 13
text: The woodworker is measuring out the wood with his line, marking it out with his pencil: after smoothing it with his plane, and making circles on it with his instrument, he gives it the form and glory of a man, so that it may be placed in the house.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 14
text: He has cedars cut down for himself, he takes an oak and lets it get strong among the trees of the wood; he has an ash-tree planted, and the rain gives it growth.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 15
text: Then it will be used to make a fire, so that a man may get warm; he has the oven heated with it and makes bread: he makes a god with it, to which he gives worship: he makes a pictured image out of it, and goes down on his face before it.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 16
text: With part of it he makes a fire, and on the fire he gets meat cooked and takes a full meal: he makes himself warm, and says, Aha! I am warm, I have seen the fire:

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 17
text: And the rest of it he makes into a god, even his pictured image: he goes down on his face before it, giving worship to it, and making prayer to it, saying, Be my saviour; for you are my god.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 18
text: They have no knowledge or wisdom; for he has put a veil over their eyes, so that they may not see; and on their hearts, so that they may not give attention.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 19
text: And no one takes note, no one has enough knowledge or wisdom to say, I have put part of it in the fire, and made bread on it; I have had a meal of the flesh cooked with it: and am I now to make the rest of it into a false god? am I to go down on my face before a bit of wood?

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 20
text: As for him whose food is the dust of a dead fire, he has been turned from the way by a twisted mind, so that he is unable to keep himself safe by saying, What I have here in my hand is false.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 21
text: Keep these things in mind, O Jacob; and you Israel, for you are my servant: I have made you; you are my servant; O Israel, I will not let you go out of my memory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 22
text: I have put your evil doings out of my mind like a thick cloud, and your sins like a mist: come back to me; for I have taken up your cause.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 23
text: Make a song, O heavens, for the Lord has done it: give a loud cry, you deep parts of the earth: let your voices be loud in song, you mountains, and you woods with all your trees: for the Lord has taken up the cause of Jacob, and will let his glory be seen in Israel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 24
text: The Lord, who has taken up your cause, and who gave you life in your mother's body, says, I am the Lord who makes all things; stretching out the heavens by myself, and giving the earth its limits; who was with me?

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 25
text: Who makes the signs of those who give word of the future come to nothing, so that those who have knowledge of secret arts go off their heads; turning the wise men back, and making their knowledge foolish:

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 26
text: Who makes the word of his servants certain, and gives effect to the purposes of his representatives; who says of Jerusalem, Her people will come back to her; and of the towns of Judah, I will give orders for their building, and will make her waste places fertile again:

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 27
text: Who says to the deep, Be dry, and I will make your rivers dry:

title: Isaiah Chapter 44 Verse 28
text: Who says of Cyrus, He will take care of my sheep, and will do all my pleasure: who says of Jerusalem, I will give the word for your building; and of the Temple, Your bases will be put in place.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 1
text: The Lord says to the man of his selection, to Cyrus, whom I have taken by the right hand, putting down nations before him, and taking away the arms of kings; making the doors open before him, so that the ways into the towns may not be shut;

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 2
text: I will go before you, and make the rough places level: the doors of brass will be broken, and the iron rods cut in two:

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 3
text: And I will give you the stores of the dark, and the wealth of secret places, so that you may be certain that I am the Lord, who gave you your name, even the God of Israel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 4
text: Because of Jacob my servant, and Israel whom I have taken for myself, I have sent for you by name, giving you a name of honour, though you had no knowledge of me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 5
text: I am the Lord, and there is no other; there is no God but me: I will make you ready for war, though you had no knowledge of me:

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 6
text: So that they may see from the east and from the west that there is no God but me: I am the Lord, and there is no other.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 7
text: I am the giver of light and the maker of the dark; causing blessing, and sending troubles; I am the Lord, who does all these things.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 8
text: Let righteousness come down, O heavens, from on high, and let the sky send it down like rain: let the earth be open to give the fruit of salvation, causing righteousness to come up with it; I the Lord have made it come about.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 9
text: Cursed is he who has an argument with his Maker, the pot which has an argument with the Potter! Will the wet earth say to him who is working with it, What are you doing, that your work has nothing by which it may be gripped?

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 10
text: Cursed is he who says to a father, To what are you giving life? or to a woman, What are you in birth-pains with?

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 11
text: The Lord, the Holy One of Israel, and his Maker, says, Will you put a question to me about the things which are to come, or will you give me orders about my sons, and the work of my hands?

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 12
text: I have made the earth, forming man on it: by my hands the heavens have been stretched out, and all the stars put in their ordered places.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 13
text: I have sent him out to overcome the nations, and I will make all his ways straight: I will give him the work of building my town, and he will let my prisoners go free, without price or reward, says the Lord of armies.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 14
text: The Lord says, The workmen of Egypt, and the traders of Ethiopia, and the tall Sabaeans, will come over the sea to you, and they will be yours; they will go after you; in chains they will come over: and they will go down on their faces before you, and will make prayer to you, saying, Truly, God is among you; and there is no other God.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 15
text: Truly, you have a secret God, the God of Israel is a Saviour!

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 16
text: All those who have gone against him will be put to shame; the makers of images will be made low.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 17
text: But the Lord will make Israel free with an eternal salvation: you will not be put to shame or made low for ever and ever.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 18
text: For this is the word of the Lord who made the heavens; he is God; the maker and designer of the earth; who made it not to be a waste, but as a living-place for man: I am the Lord, and there is no other.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 19
text: I have not given my word in secret, in a place in the underworld; I did not say to the seed of Jacob, Go into a waste land to make request of me: I the Lord say what is true, my word is righteousness.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 20
text: Come together, even come near, you nations who are still living: they have no knowledge who take up their image of wood, and make prayer to a god in whom is no salvation.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 21
text: Give the word, put forward your cause, let us have a discussion together: who has given news of this in the past? who made it clear in early times? did not I, the Lord? and there is no God but me; a true God and a saviour; there is no other.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 22
text: Let your hearts be turned to me, so that you may have salvation, all the ends of the earth: for I am God, and there is no other.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 23
text: By myself have I taken an oath, a true word has gone from my mouth, and will not be changed, that to me every knee will be bent, and every tongue will give honour.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 24
text: Only in the Lord will Jacob overcome and be strong: together all those who were angry with him will be put to shame and come to destruction.

title: Isaiah Chapter 45 Verse 25
text: In the Lord will all the seed of Israel get their rights, and they will give glory to him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 1
text: Bel is bent down, Nebo is falling; their images are on the beasts and on the cattle: the things which you took about have become a weight to the tired beast.

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 2
text: They are bent down, they are falling together: they were not able to keep their images safe, but they themselves have been taken prisoner.

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 3
text: Give ear to me, O family of Jacob, and all the rest of the people of Israel, who have been supported by me from their birth, and have been my care from their earliest days:

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 4
text: Even when you are old I will be the same, and when you are grey-haired I will take care of you: I will still be responsible for what I made; yes, I will take you and keep you safe.

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 5
text: Who in your eyes is my equal? or what comparison will you make with me?

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 6
text: As for those who take gold out of a bag, and put silver in the scales, they give payment to a gold-worker, to make it into a god; they go down on their faces and give it worship.

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 7
text: They put him on their backs, and take him up, and put him in his fixed place, from which he may not be moved; if a man gives a cry for help to him, he is unable to give an answer, or get him out of his trouble.

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 8
text: Keep this in mind and be shamed; let it come back to your memory, you sinners.

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 9
text: Let the things which are past come to your memory: for I am God, and there is no other; I am God, and there is no one like me;

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 10
text: Making clear from the first what is to come, and from past times the things which have not so far come about; saying, My purpose is fixed, and I will do all my pleasure;

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 11
text: Sending for a bird of strong flight from the east, the man of my purpose from a far country; I have said it, and I will give effect to it; the thing designed by me will certainly be done.

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 12
text: Give ear to me, you feeble-hearted, who have no faith in my righteousness:

title: Isaiah Chapter 46 Verse 13
text: My righteousness is near, it is not far off; salvation will come quickly; and I will make Zion free, and give Israel my glory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 1
text: Come and take your seat in the dust, O virgin daughter of Babylon; come down from your seat of power, and take your place on the earth, O daughter of the Chaldaeans: for you will never again seem soft and delicate.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 2
text: Take the crushing-stones and get the meal crushed: take off your veil, put away your robe, let your legs be uncovered, go through the rivers.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 3
text: The shame of your unclothed condition will be seen by all: I will give punishment without mercy,

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 4
text: Says the Lord who takes up our cause; the Lord of armies is his name, the Holy One of Israel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 5
text: Be seated in the dark without a word, O daughter of the Chaldaeans: for you will no longer be named, The Queen of Kingdoms.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 6
text: I was angry with my people, I put shame on my heritage, and gave them into your hands: you had no mercy on them; you put a cruel yoke on those who were old;

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 7
text: And you said, I will be a queen for ever: you did not give attention to these things, and did not keep in mind what would come after.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 8
text: So now take note of this, you who are given up to pleasure, living without fear of evil, saying in your heart, I am, and there is no one like me; I will never be a widow, or have my children taken from me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 9
text: But these two things will come on you suddenly in one day, the loss of children and of husband: in full measure they will come on you, for all your secret arts, and all your wonders.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 10
text: For you had faith in your evil-doing; you said, No one sees me; by your wisdom and knowledge you have been turned out of the way: and you have said in your heart, I am, and there is no other.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 11
text: Because of this evil will come on you, which may not be turned away for any price: and trouble will overtake you, from which no money will give salvation: destruction will come on you suddenly, without your knowledge.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 12
text: Go on now with your secret arts, and all your wonder-working, to which you have given yourself up from your earliest days; it may be that they will be of profit to you, or by them you may put fear into your attackers.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 13
text: But your mind is troubled by the number of your guides: let them now come forward for your salvation: the measurers of the heavens, the watchers of the stars, and those who are able to say from month to month what things are coming on you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 14
text: Truly, they have become like dry stems, they have been burned in the fire; they are not able to keep themselves safe from the power of the flame: it is not a coal for warming them, or a fire by which a man may be seated.

title: Isaiah Chapter 47 Verse 15
text: Small profit have you had from those who, from your earliest days, got great profit out of you; they have gone in flight, every one straight before him, and you have no saviour.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 1
text: Give ear to this, O family of Jacob, you who are named by the name of Israel, and have come out of the body of Judah; who take oaths by the name of the Lord, and make use of the name of the God of Israel, but not truly and not in good faith.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 2
text: For they say that they are of the holy town, and put their faith in the God of Israel: the Lord of armies is his name.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 3
text: I gave word in the past of the things which came about; they came from my mouth, and I made them clear: suddenly I did them, and they came about.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 4
text: Because I saw that your heart was hard, and that your neck was an iron cord, and your brow brass;

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 5
text: For this reason I made it clear to you in the past, before it came I gave you word of it: for fear that you might say, My god did these things, and my pictured and metal images made them come about.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 6
text: All this has come to your ears and you have seen it; will you not give witness to it? I am now making clear new things, even secret things, of which you had no knowledge.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 7
text: They have only now been effected, and not in the past: and before this day they had not come to your ears; for fear that you might say, I had knowledge of them.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 8
text: Truly you had no word of them, no knowledge of them; no news of them in the past had come to your ears; because I saw how false was your behaviour, and that your heart was turned against me from your earliest days.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 9
text: Because of my name I will put away my wrath, and for my praise I will keep myself from cutting you off.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 10
text: See, I have been testing you for myself like silver; I have put you through the fire of trouble.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 11
text: For myself, even because of my name, I will do it; for I will not let my name be shamed; and my glory I will not give to another.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 12
text: Give ear to me, Jacob, and Israel, my loved one; I am he, I am the first and I am the last.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 13
text: Yes, by my hand was the earth placed on its base, and by my right hand the heavens were stretched out; at my word they take up their places.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 14
text: Come together, all of you, and give ear; who among you has given news of these things? the Lord's loved one will do his pleasure with Babylon, and with the seed of the Chaldaeans.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 15
text: I, even I, have given the word; I have sent for him: I have made him come, and have given effect to his undertakings.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 16
text: Come near to me, and give ear to this; from the start I did not keep it secret; from the time of its coming into existence I was there: and now the Lord God has sent me, and given me his spirit.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 17
text: The Lord who takes up your cause, the Holy One of Israel, says, I am the Lord your God, who is teaching you for your profit, guiding you by the way in which you are to go.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 18
text: If only you had given ear to my orders, then your peace would have been like a river, and your righteousness as the waves of the sea:

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 19
text: Your seed would have been like the sand, and your offspring like the dust: your name would not be cut off or come to an end before me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 20
text: Go out of Babylon, go in flight from the Chaldaeans; with the sound of song make it clear, give the news, let the word go out even to the end of the earth: say, The Lord has taken up the cause of his servant Jacob.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 21
text: They had no need of water when he was guiding them through the waste lands: he made water come out of the rock for them: the rock was parted and the waters came flowing out.

title: Isaiah Chapter 48 Verse 22
text: There is no peace, says the Lord, for the evil-doers.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 1
text: Give ear, O sea-lands, to me; and take note, you peoples from far: I have been marked out by the Lord from the first; when I was still in my mother's body, he had my name in mind:

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 2
text: And he has made my mouth like a sharp sword, in the shade of his hand he has kept me; and he has made me like a polished arrow, keeping me in his secret place;

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 3
text: And he said to me, You are my servant, Israel, in whom my glory will be seen;

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 4
text: And I said, I have undergone weariness for nothing, I have given my strength for no purpose or profit: but still the Lord will take up my cause, and my God will give me my reward.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 5
text: And now, says the Lord, who made me his servant when I was still in my mother's body, so that I might make Jacob come back to him, and so that Israel might come together to him: and I was honoured in the eyes of the Lord, and my God became my strength.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 6
text: It is not enough for one who is my servant to put the tribes of Jacob again in their place, and to get back those of Israel who have been sent away: my purpose is to give you as a light to the nations, so that you may be my salvation to the end of the earth.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 7
text: The Lord who takes up Israel's cause, even his Holy One, says to him whom men make sport of, who is hated by the nations, a servant of rulers: Kings will see and get up from their places, and chiefs will give worship: because of the Lord who keeps faith; even the Holy One of Israel who has taken you for himself.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 8
text: This is the word of the Lord: I have given ear to you at a good time, and I have been your helper in a day of salvation: and I will keep you safe, and will make you a glory for the people, putting the land in order, and giving them the heritages which now are waste;

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 9
text: Saying to those who are in chains, Go free; to those who are in the dark, Come out into the light. They will get food by the way wherever they go, and have grass-lands on all the dry mountain-tops.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 10
text: They will not be in need of food or drink, or be troubled by the heat or the sun: for he who has mercy on them will be their guide, taking them by the springs of water.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 11
text: And I will make all my mountains a way, and my highways will be lifted up.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 12
text: See, these are coming from far; and these from the north and the west; and these from the land of Sinim.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 13
text: Let your voice be loud in song, O heavens; and be glad, O earth; make sounds of joy, O mountains, for the Lord has given comfort to his people, and will have mercy on his crushed ones.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 14
text: But Zion said, The Lord has given me up, I have gone from his memory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 15
text: Will a woman give up the child at her breast, will she be without pity for the fruit of her body? yes, these may, but I will not let you go out of my memory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 16
text: See, your name is marked on my hands; your walls are ever before me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 17
text: Your builders are coming quickly; your haters and those who made you waste will go out of you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 18
text: Let your eyes be lifted up round about, and see: they are all coming together to you. By my life, says the Lord, truly you will put them all on you as an ornament, and be clothed with them like a bride.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 19
text: For though the waste places of your land have been given to destruction, now you will not be wide enough for your people, and those who made you waste will be far away.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 20
text: The children to whom you gave birth in other lands will say in your ears, The place is not wide enough for me: make room for me to have a resting-place.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 21
text: Then you will say in your heart, Who has given me all these children? when my children had been taken from me, and I was no longer able to have others, who took care of these? when I was by myself, where then were these?

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 22
text: This is the word of the Lord God: See, I will make a sign with my hand to the nations, and put up my flag for the peoples; and they will take up your sons on their beasts, and your daughters on their backs.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 23
text: And kings will take care of you, and queens will give you their milk: they will go down on their faces before you, kissing the dust of your feet; and you will be certain that I am the Lord, and that those who put their hope in me will not be shamed.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 24
text: Will the goods of war be taken from the strong man, or the prisoners of the cruel one be let go?

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 25
text: But the Lord says, Even the prisoners of the strong will be taken from him, and the cruel made to let go his goods: for I will take up your cause against your haters, and I will keep your children safe.

title: Isaiah Chapter 49 Verse 26
text: And the flesh of your attackers will be taken by themselves for food; and they will take their blood for drink, as if it was sweet wine: and all men will see that I the Lord am your saviour, even he who takes up your cause, the Strong One of Jacob.

title: Isaiah Chapter 50 Verse 1
text: This is the word of the Lord: Where is the statement which I gave your mother when I put her away? or to which of my creditors have I given you for money? It was for your sins that you were given into the hands of others, and for your evil-doing was your mother put away.

title: Isaiah Chapter 50 Verse 2
text: Why, then, when I came, was there no man? and no one to give answer to my voice? has my hand become feeble, so that it is unable to take up your cause? or have I no power to make you free? See, at my word the sea becomes dry, I make the rivers a waste land: their fish are dead for need of water, and make an evil smell.

title: Isaiah Chapter 50 Verse 3
text: By me the heavens are clothed with black, and I make haircloth their robe.

title: Isaiah Chapter 50 Verse 4
text: The Lord God has given me the tongue of those who are experienced, so that I may be able to give the word a special sense for the feeble: every morning my ear is open to his teaching, like those who are experienced:

title: Isaiah Chapter 50 Verse 5
text: And I have not put myself against him, or let my heart be turned back from him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 50 Verse 6
text: I was offering my back to those who gave me blows, and my face to those who were pulling out my hair: I did not keep my face covered from marks of shame.

title: Isaiah Chapter 50 Verse 7
text: For the Lord God is my helper; I will not be put to shame: so I have made my face like a rock, and I am certain that he will give me my right.

title: Isaiah Chapter 50 Verse 8
text: He who takes up my cause is near; who will go to law with me? let us come together before the judge: who is against me? let him come near to me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 50 Verse 9
text: See, the Lord God is my helper; who will give a decision against me? truly, all of them will become old like a robe; they will be food for the worm.

title: Isaiah Chapter 50 Verse 10
text: Who among you has the fear of the Lord, giving ear to the voice of his servant who has been walking in the dark and has no light? Let him put his faith in the name of the Lord, looking to his God for support.

title: Isaiah Chapter 50 Verse 11
text: See, all you who make a fire, arming yourselves with burning branches: go in the flame of your fire, and among the branches you have put a light to. This will you have from my hand, you will make your bed in sorrow.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 1
text: Give ear to me, you who are searching for righteousness, who are looking for the Lord: see the rock from which you were cut out, and the hole out of which you were taken.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 2
text: Let your thoughts be turned to Abraham, your father, and to Sarah, who gave you birth: for when he was but one, my voice came to him, and I gave him my blessing, and made him a great people.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 3
text: For the Lord has given comfort to Zion: he has made glad all her broken walls; making her waste places like Eden, and changing her dry land into the garden of the Lord; joy and delight will be there, praise and the sound of melody.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 4
text: Give attention to me, O my people; and give ear to me, O my nation; for teaching will go out from me, and the knowledge of the true God will be a light to the peoples.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 5
text: Suddenly will my righteousness come near, and my salvation will be shining out like the light; the sea-lands will be waiting for me, and they will put their hope in my strong arm.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 6
text: Let your eyes be lifted up to the heavens, and turned to the earth which is under them: for the heavens will go in flight like smoke, and the earth will become old like a coat, and its people will come to destruction like insects: but my salvation will be for ever, and my righteousness will not come to an end.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 7
text: Give ear to me, you who have knowledge of righteousness, in whose heart is my law; have no fear of the evil words of men, and give no thought to their curses.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 8
text: For like a coat they will be food for the insect, the worm will make a meal of them like wool: but my righteousness will be for ever, and my salvation to all generations.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 9
text: Awake! awake! put on strength, O arm of the Lord, awake! as in the old days, in the generations long past. Was it not by you that Rahab was cut in two, and the dragon Wounded?

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 10
text: Did you not make the sea dry, the waters of the great deep? did you not make the deep waters of the sea a way for the Lord's people to go through?

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 11
text: Those whom the Lord has made free will come back with songs to Zion; and on their heads will be eternal joy: delight and joy will be theirs, and sorrow and sounds of grief will be gone for ever.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 12
text: I, even I, am your comforter: are you so poor in heart as to be in fear of man who will come to an end, and of the son of man who will be like grass?

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 13
text: And you have given no thought to the Lord your Maker, by whom the heavens were stretched out, and the earth placed on its base; and you went all day in fear of the wrath of the cruel one, when he was making ready for your destruction. And where is the wrath of the cruel one?

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 14
text: The prisoner, bent under his chain, will quickly be made free, and will not go down into the underworld, and his bread will not come to an end.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 15
text: For I am the Lord your God, who makes the sea calm when its waves are thundering: the Lord of armies is his name.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 16
text: And I have put my words in your mouth, covering you with the shade of my hand, stretching out the heavens, and placing the earth on its base, and saying to Zion, You are my people.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 17
text: Awake! awake! up! O Jerusalem, you who have taken from the Lord's hand the cup of his wrath; tasting in full measure the wine which overcomes.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 18
text: She has no one among all her children to be her guide; not one of the sons she has taken care of takes her by the hand.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 19
text: These two things have come on you; who will be weeping for you? wasting and destruction; death from need of food, and from the sword; how may you be comforted?

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 20
text: Your sons are overcome, like a roe in a net; they are full of the wrath of the Lord, the punishment of your God.

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 21
text: So now give ear to this, you who are troubled and overcome, but not with wine:

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 22
text: This is the word of the Lord your master, even your God who takes up the cause of his people: See, I have taken out of your hand the cup which overcomes, even the cup of my wrath; it will not again be given to you:

title: Isaiah Chapter 51 Verse 23
text: And I will put it into the hand of your cruel masters, and of those whose yoke has been hard on you; who have said to your soul, Down on your face! so that we may go over you: and you have given your backs like the earth, even like the street, for them to go over.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 1
text: Awake! awake! put on your strength, O Zion; put on your beautiful robes, O Jerusalem, the holy town: for from now there will never again come into you the unclean and those without circumcision.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 2
text: Make yourself clean from the dust; up! and take the seat of your power, O Jerusalem: the bands of your neck are loose, O prisoned daughter of Zion.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 3
text: For the Lord says, You were given for nothing, and you will be made free without price.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 4
text: For the Lord God says, My people went down at first into Egypt, to get a place for themselves there: and the Assyrian put a cruel yoke on them without cause.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 5
text: Now then, what have I here? says the Lord, for my people are taken away without cause; they are made waste and give cries of sorrow, says the Lord, and all the day the nations put shame on my name.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 6
text: For this cause I will make my name clear to my people; in that day they will be certain that it is my word which comes to them; see, here am I.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 7
text: How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of him who comes with good news, who gives word of peace, saying that salvation is near; who says to Zion, Your God is ruling!

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 8
text: The voice of your watchmen! their voices are loud in song together; for they will see him, eye to eye, when the Lord comes back to Zion.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 9
text: Give sounds of joy, make melody together, waste places of Jerusalem: for the Lord has given comfort to his people, he has taken up the cause of Jerusalem.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 10
text: The Lord has let his holy arm be seen by the eyes of all nations; and all the ends of the earth will see the salvation of our God.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 11
text: Away! away! go out from there, touching no unclean thing; go out from among her; be clean, you who take up the vessels of the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 12
text: For you will not go out suddenly, and you will not go in flight: for the Lord will go before you, and the God of Israel will come after you to keep you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 13
text: See, my servant will do well in his undertakings, he will be honoured, and lifted up, and be very high.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 14
text: As peoples were surprised at him, And his face was not beautiful, so as to be desired: his face was so changed by disease as to be unlike that of a man, and his form was no longer that of the sons of men.

title: Isaiah Chapter 52 Verse 15
text: So will nations give him honour; kings will keep quiet because of him: for what had not been made clear to them they will see; and they will give their minds to what had not come to their ears.

title: Isaiah Chapter 53 Verse 1
text: Who would have had faith in the word which has come to our ears, and to whom had the arm of the Lord been unveiled?

title: Isaiah Chapter 53 Verse 2
text: For his growth was like that of a delicate plant before him, and like a root out of a dry place: he had no grace of form, to give us pleasure;

title: Isaiah Chapter 53 Verse 3
text: Men made sport of him, turning away from him; he was a man of sorrows, marked by disease; and like one from whom men's faces are turned away, he was looked down on, and we put no value on him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 53 Verse 4
text: But it was our pain he took, and our diseases were put on him: while to us he seemed as one diseased, on whom God's punishment had come.

title: Isaiah Chapter 53 Verse 5
text: But it was for our sins he was wounded, and for our evil doings he was crushed: he took the punishment by which we have peace, and by his wounds we are made well.

title: Isaiah Chapter 53 Verse 6
text: We all went wandering like sheep; going every one of us after his desire; and the Lord put on him the punishment of us all.

title: Isaiah Chapter 53 Verse 7
text: Men were cruel to him, but he was gentle and quiet; as a lamb taken to its death, and as a sheep before those who take her wool makes no sound, so he said not a word.

title: Isaiah Chapter 53 Verse 8
text: They took away from him help and right, and who gave a thought to his fate? for he was cut off from the land of the living: he came to his death for the sin of my people.

title: Isaiah Chapter 53 Verse 9
text: And they put his body into the earth with sinners, and his last resting-place was with the evil-doers, though he had done no wrong, and no deceit was in his mouth.

title: Isaiah Chapter 53 Verse 10
text: And the Lord was pleased ... see a seed, long life, ... will do well in his hand. ...

title: Isaiah Chapter 53 Verse 11
text: ... made clear his righteousness before men ... had taken their sins on himself.

title: Isaiah Chapter 53 Verse 12
text: For this cause he will have a heritage with the great, and he will have a part in the goods of war with the strong, because he gave up his life, and was numbered with the evil-doers; taking on himself the sins of the people, and making prayer for the wrongdoers.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 1
text: Let your voice be loud in song, O woman without children; make melody and sounds of joy, you who did not give birth: for the children of her who had no husband are more than those of the married wife, says the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 2
text: Make wide the place of your tent, and let the curtains of your house be stretched out without limit: make your cords long, and your tent-pins strong.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 3
text: For I will make wide your limits on the right hand and on the left; and your seed will take the nations for a heritage, and make the waste towns full of people.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 4
text: Have no fear; for you will not be shamed or without hope: you will not be put to shame, for the shame of your earlier days will go out of your memory, and you will no longer keep in mind the sorrows of your widowed years.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 5
text: For your Maker is your husband; the Lord of armies is his name: and the Holy One of Israel is he who takes up your cause; he will be named the God of all the earth.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 6
text: For the Lord has made you come back to him, like a wife who has been sent away in grief of spirit; for one may not give up the wife of one's early days.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 7
text: For a short time I gave you up; but with great mercies I will take you back again.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 8
text: In overflowing wrath my face was veiled from you for a minute, but I will have pity on you for ever, says the Lord who takes up your cause.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 9
text: For this is like the days of Noah to me: for as I took an oath that the waters of Noah would never again go over the earth, so have I taken an oath that I will not again be angry with you, or say bitter words to you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 10
text: For the mountains may be taken away, and the hills be moved out of their places, but my love will not be taken from you, or my agreement of peace broken, says the Lord, who has had mercy on you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 11
text: O troubled one, storm-crushed, uncomforted! see, your stones will be framed in fair colours, and your bases will be sapphires.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 12
text: I will make your towers of rubies, and your doors of carbuncles, and the wall round you will be of all sorts of beautiful stones.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 13
text: And all your builders will be made wise by the Lord; and great will be the peace of your children.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 14
text: All your rights will be made certain to you: have no fear of evil, and destruction will not come near you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 15
text: See, they may be moved to war, but not by my authority: all those who come together to make an attack on you, will be broken against you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 16
text: See, I have made the iron-worker, blowing on the burning coals, and making the instrument of war by his work; and I have made the waster for destruction.

title: Isaiah Chapter 54 Verse 17
text: No instrument of war which is formed against you will be of any use; and every tongue which says evil against you will be judged false. This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord, and their righteousness comes from me, says the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 1
text: Ho! everyone in need, come to the waters, and he who has no strength, let him get food: come, get bread without money; wine and milk without price.

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 2
text: Why do you give your money for what is not bread, and the fruit of your work for what will not give you pleasure? Give ear to me, so that your food may be good, and you may have the best in full measure.

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 3
text: Give ear, and come to me, take note with care, so that your souls may have life: and I will make an eternal agreement with you, even the certain mercies of David.

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 4
text: See, I have given him as a witness to the peoples, a ruler and a guide to the nations.

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 5
text: See, you will send for a nation of which you had no knowledge, and those who had no knowledge of you will come running to you, because of the Lord your God, and because of the Holy One of Israel, for he has given you glory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 6
text: Make search for the Lord while he is there, make prayer to him while he is near:

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 7
text: Let the sinner give up his way, and the evil-doer his purpose: and let him come back to the Lord, and he will have mercy on him; and to our God, for there is full forgiveness with him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 8
text: For my thoughts are not your thoughts, or your ways my ways, says the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 9
text: For as the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways, and my thoughts than your thoughts.

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 10
text: For as the rain comes down, and the snow from heaven, and does not go back again, but gives water to the earth, and makes it fertile, giving seed to the planter, and bread for food;

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 11
text: So will my word be which goes out of my mouth: it will not come back to me with nothing done, but it will give effect to my purpose, and do that for which I have sent it.

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 12
text: For you will go out with joy, and be guided in peace: the mountains and the hills will make melody before you, and all the trees of the fields will make sounds of joy.

title: Isaiah Chapter 55 Verse 13
text: In place of the thorn will come up the fir-tree, and in place of the blackberry the myrtle: and it will be to the Lord for a name, for an eternal sign which will not be cut off.

title: Isaiah Chapter 56 Verse 1
text: The Lord says, Let your way of life be upright, and let your behaviour be rightly ordered: for my salvation is near, and my righteousness will quickly be seen.

title: Isaiah Chapter 56 Verse 2
text: Happy is the man who does this, and the son of man whose behaviour is so ordered; who keeps the Sabbath holy, and his hand from doing any evil.

title: Isaiah Chapter 56 Verse 3
text: And let not the man from a strange country, who has been joined to the Lord, say, The Lord will certainly put a division between me and his people: and let not the unsexed man say, See, I am a dry tree.

title: Isaiah Chapter 56 Verse 4
text: For the Lord says, As for the unsexed who keep my Sabbaths, and give their hearts to pleasing me, and keep their agreement with me:

title: Isaiah Chapter 56 Verse 5
text: I will give to them in my house, and inside my walls, a place and a name better than that of sons and daughters; I will give them an eternal name which will not be cut off.

title: Isaiah Chapter 56 Verse 6
text: And as for those from a strange country, who are joined to the Lord, to give worship to him and honour to his name, to be his servants, even everyone who keeps the Sabbath holy, and keeps his agreement with me:

title: Isaiah Chapter 56 Verse 7
text: I will make them come to my holy mountain, and will give them joy in my house of prayer; I will take pleasure in the burned offerings which they make on my altar: for my house will be named a house of prayer for all peoples.

title: Isaiah Chapter 56 Verse 8
text: The Lord God, who gets together the wandering ones of Israel, says, I will get together others in addition to those of Israel who have come back.

title: Isaiah Chapter 56 Verse 9
text: All you beasts of the field, come together for your meat, even all you beasts of the wood.

title: Isaiah Chapter 56 Verse 10
text: His watchmen are blind, they are all without knowledge; they are all dogs without tongues, unable to make a sound; stretched out dreaming, loving sleep.

title: Isaiah Chapter 56 Verse 11
text: Yes, the dogs are for ever looking for food; while these, the keepers of the sheep, are without wisdom: they have all gone after their pleasure, every one looking for profit; they are all the same.

title: Isaiah Chapter 56 Verse 12
text: Come, they say, I will get wine, and we will take strong drink in full measure; and tomorrow will be like today, full of pleasure.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 1
text: The upright man goes to his death, and no one gives a thought to it; and god-fearing men are taken away, and no one is troubled by it; for the upright man is taken away because of evil-doing, and goes into peace.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 2
text: They are at rest in their last resting-places, every one going straight before him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 3
text: But come near, you sons of her who is wise in secret arts, the seed of her who is false to her husband, and of the loose woman.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 4
text: Of whom do you make sport? against whom is your mouth open wide and your tongue put out? are you not uncontrolled children, a false seed,

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 5
text: You who are burning with evil desire among the oaks, under every green tree; putting children to death in the valleys, under the cracks of the rocks?

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 6
text: Among the smooth stones of the valley is your heritage; they, even they, are your part: even to them have you made a drink offering and a meal offering. Is it possible for such things to be overlooked by me?

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 7
text: You have put your bed on a high mountain: there you went up to make your offering.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 8
text: And on the back of the doors and on the pillars you have put your sign: for you have been false to me with another; you have made your bed wide, and made an agreement with them; you had a desire for their bed where you saw it

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 9
text: And you went to Melech with oil and much perfume, and you sent your representatives far off, and went as low as the underworld.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 10
text: You were tired with your long journeys; but you did not say, There is no hope: you got new strength, and so you were not feeble.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 11
text: And of whom were you in fear, so that you were false, and did not keep me in mind, or give thought to it? Have I not been quiet, keeping myself secret, and so you were not in fear of me?

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 12
text: I will make clear what your righteousness is like and your works; you will have no profit in them.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 13
text: Your false gods will not keep you safe in answer to your cry; but the wind will take them, they will be gone like a breath: but he who puts his hope in me will take the land, and will have my holy mountain as his heritage.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 14
text: And I will say, Make it high, make it high, get ready the way, take the stones out of the way of my people.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 15
text: For this is the word of him who is high and lifted up, whose resting-place is eternal, whose name is Holy: my resting-place is in the high and holy place, and with him who is crushed and poor in spirit, to give life to the spirit of the poor, and to make strong the heart of the crushed.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 16
text: For I will not give punishment for ever, or be angry without end: for from me breath goes out; and I it was who made the souls.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 17
text: I was quickly angry with his evil ways, and sent punishment on him, veiling my face in wrath: and he went on, turning his heart from me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 18
text: I have seen his ways, and I will make him well: I will give him rest, comforting him and his people who are sad.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 19
text: I will give the fruit of the lips: Peace, peace, to him who is near and to him who is far off, says the Lord; and I will make him well.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 20
text: But the evil-doers are like the troubled sea, for which there is no rest, and its waters send up earth and waste.

title: Isaiah Chapter 57 Verse 21
text: There is no peace, says my God, for the evil-doers.

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 1
text: Make a loud cry, do not be quiet, let your voice be sounding like a horn, and make clear to my people their evil doings, and to the family of Jacob their sins.

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 2
text: Though they make prayer to me every day, and take pleasure in the knowledge of my ways: like a nation which has done righteousness, and has not given up the rules of their God, they make requests to me for the right orders, it is their delight to come near to God.

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 3
text: They say, Why have we kept ourselves from food, and you do not see it? why have we kept ourselves from pleasure, and you take no note of it? If, in the days when you keep from food, you take the chance to do your business, and get in your debts;

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 4
text: If keeping from food makes you quickly angry, ready for fighting and giving blows with evil hands; your holy days are not such as to make your voice come to my ears on high.

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 5
text: Have I given orders for such a day as this? a day for keeping yourselves from pleasure? is it only a question of the bent head, of putting on haircloth, and being seated in the dust? is this what seems to you a holy day, well-pleasing to the Lord?

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 6
text: Is not this the holy day for which I have given orders: to let loose those who have wrongly been made prisoners, to undo the bands of the yoke, and to let the crushed go free, and every yoke be broken?

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 7
text: Is it not to give your bread to those in need, and to let the poor who have no resting-place come into your house? to put a robe on the unclothed one when you see him, and not to keep your eyes shut for fear of seeing his flesh?

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 8
text: Then will light be shining on you like the morning, and your wounds will quickly be well: and your righteousness will go before you, and the glory of the Lord will come after you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 9
text: Then at the sound of your voice, the Lord will give an answer; at your cry he will say, Here am I. If you take away from among you the yoke, the putting out of the finger of shame, and the evil word;

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 10
text: And if you give your bread to those in need of it, so that the troubled one may have his desire; then you will have light in the dark, and your night will be as the full light of the sun:

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 11
text: And the Lord will be your guide at all times; in dry places he will give you water in full measure, and will make strong your bones; and you will be like a watered garden, and like an ever-flowing spring.

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 12
text: And your sons will be building again the old waste places: you will make strong the bases of old generations: and you will be named, He who puts up the broken walls, and, He who makes ready the ways for use.

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 13
text: If you keep the Sabbath with care, not doing your business on my holy day; and if the Sabbath seems to you a delight, and the new moon of the Lord a thing to be honoured; and if you give respect to him by not doing your business, or going after your pleasure, or saying unholy words;

title: Isaiah Chapter 58 Verse 14
text: Then the Lord will be your delight; and I will put you on the high places of the earth; and I will give you the heritage of Jacob your father: for the mouth of the Lord has said it.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 1
text: Truly, the Lord's hand has not become short, so that he is unable to give salvation; and his ear is not shut from hearing:

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 2
text: But your sins have come between you and your God, and by your evil doings his face has been veiled from you, so that he will give you no answer.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 3
text: For your hands are unclean with blood, and your fingers with sin; your lips have said false things, and your tongue gives out deceit.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 4
text: No one puts forward an upright cause, or gives a true decision: their hope is in deceit, and their words are false; they are with child with sin, and give birth to evil.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 5
text: They give birth to snake's eggs, and make spider's threads: whoever takes their eggs for food comes to his death, and the egg which is crushed becomes a poison-snake.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 6
text: Their twisted threads will not make clothing, and their works will give them nothing for covering themselves: their works are works of sin, and violent acts are in their hands.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 7
text: Their feet go quickly to evil, and they take delight in the death of the upright; their thoughts are thoughts of sin; wasting and destruction are in their ways.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 8
text: They have no knowledge of the way of peace, and there is no sense of what is right in their behaviour: they have made for themselves ways which are not straight; whoever goes in them has no knowledge of peace.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 9
text: For this cause our right is far from us, and righteousness does not overtake us: we are looking for light, but there is only the dark; for the shining of the sun, but our way is in the night.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 10
text: We go on our way, like blind men feeling for the wall, even like those who have no eyes: we are running against things in daylight as if it was evening; our place is in the dark like dead men.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 11
text: We make noises of grief, like bears, and sad sounds like doves: we are looking for our right, but it is not there; for salvation, but it is far from us.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 12
text: For our evil doings are increased before you, and our sins give witness against us: for our evil doings are with us, and we have knowledge of our sins:

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 13
text: We have gone against the Lord, and been false to him, turning away from our God, our words have been uncontrolled, and in our hearts are thoughts of deceit.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 14
text: And the right is turned back, and righteousness is far away: for good faith is not to be seen in the public places, and upright behaviour may not come into the town.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 15
text: Yes, faith is gone; and he whose heart is turned from evil comes into the power of the cruel: and the Lord saw it, and he was angry that there was no one to take up their cause.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 16
text: And he saw that there was no man, and was surprised that there was no one to take up their cause: so his arm gave salvation, and he made righteousness his support.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 17
text: Yes, he put on righteousness as a breastplate, and salvation as a head-dress; and he put on punishment as clothing, and wrath as a robe.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 18
text: He will give them the right reward of their doings, wrath to his attackers, punishment to his haters, and even on the sea-lands he will send punishment.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 19
text: So they will see the name of the Lord from the west, and his glory from the east: for he will come like a rushing stream, forced on by a wind of the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 20
text: And as a saviour he will come to Zion, turning away sin from Jacob, says the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 59 Verse 21
text: And as for me, this is my agreement with them, says the Lord: my spirit which is on you, and my words which I have put in your mouth, will not go away from your mouth, or from the mouth of your seed, or from the mouth of your seed's seed, says the Lord, from now and for ever.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 1
text: Up! let your face be bright, for your light has come, and the glory of the Lord is shining on you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 2
text: For truly, the earth will be dark, and the peoples veiled in blackest night; but the Lord will be shining on you, and his glory will be seen among you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 3
text: And nations will come to your light, and kings to your bright dawn.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 4
text: Let your eyes be lifted up, and see: they are all coming together to you: your sons will come from far, and your daughters taken with loving care.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 5
text: Then you will see, and be bright with joy, and your heart will be shaking with increase of delight: for the produce of the sea will be turned to you, the wealth of the nations will come to you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 6
text: You will be full of camel-trains, even the young camels of Midian and Ephah; all from Sheba will come, with gold and spices, giving word of the great acts of the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 7
text: All the flocks of Kedar will come together to you, the sheep of Nebaioth will be ready for your need; they will be pleasing offerings on my altar, and my house of prayer will be beautiful.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 8
text: Who are these coming like a cloud, like a flight of doves to their windows?

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 9
