text: Vessels of the sea-lands are waiting for me, and the ships of Tarshish first, so that your sons may come from far, and their silver and gold with them, to the place of the name of the Lord your God, and to the Holy One of Israel, because he has made you beautiful.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 10
text: And men from strange countries will be building up your walls, and their kings will be your servants: for in my wrath I sent punishment on you, but in my grace I have had mercy on you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 11
text: Your doors will be open at all times; they will not be shut day or night; so that men may come into you with the wealth of the nations, with their kings at their head.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 12
text: For the nation or kingdom which will not be your servant will come to destruction; such nations will be completely waste.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 13
text: The glory of Lebanon will come to you, the cypress, the plane, and the sherbin-tree together, to make my holy place beautiful; and the resting-place of my feet will be full of glory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 14
text: And the sons of those who were cruel to you will come before you with bent heads; and those who made sport of you will go down on their faces at your feet; and you will be named, The Town of the Lord, The Zion of the Holy One of Israel.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 15
text: And though you were turned away from, and hated, and had no helper, I will make you a pride for ever, a joy from generation to generation.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 16
text: And you will take the milk of the nations, flowing from the breast of kings; and you will see that I, the Lord, am your saviour, and he who takes up your cause, the Strong One of Jacob.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 17
text: In place of brass, I will give gold, and for iron silver, and for wood brass, and for stones iron: and I will make Peace your judge, and Righteousness your overseer.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 18
text: Violent acts will no longer be seen in your land, wasting or destruction in your limits; but your walls will be named, Salvation, and your doors Praise.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 19
text: The sun will not be your light by day, and the moon will no longer be bright for you by night: but the Lord will be to you an eternal light, and your God your glory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 20
text: Your sun will never again go down, or your moon keep back her light: for the Lord will be your eternal light, and the days of your sorrow will be ended.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 21
text: Your people will all be upright, the land will be their heritage for ever; the branch of my planting, the work of my hands, to be for my glory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 60 Verse 22
text: The smallest of their families will become a thousand, and a small one a strong nation: I, the Lord, will make it come quickly in its time.

title: Isaiah Chapter 61 Verse 1
text: The spirit of the Lord is on me, because I am marked out by him to give good news to the poor; he has sent me to make the broken-hearted well, to say that the prisoners will be made free, and that those in chains will see the light again;

title: Isaiah Chapter 61 Verse 2
text: To give knowledge that the year of the Lord's good pleasure has come, and the day of punishment from our God; to give comfort to all who are sad;

title: Isaiah Chapter 61 Verse 3
text: To give them a fair head-dress in place of dust, the oil of joy in place of the clothing of grief, praise in place of sorrow; so that they may be named trees of righteousness, the planting of the Lord, and so that he may have glory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 61 Verse 4
text: And they will be building again the old broken walls, and will make new the old waste places, and will put up again the towns which have been waste for long generations.

title: Isaiah Chapter 61 Verse 5
text: And men from strange countries will be your herdsmen, and those who are not Israelites will be your ploughmen and vine-keepers.

title: Isaiah Chapter 61 Verse 6
text: But you will be named the priests of the Lord, the servants of our God: you will have the wealth of the nations for your food, and you will be clothed with their glory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 61 Verse 7
text: As they had twice as much grief, and marks of shame were their heritage, so in their land they will be rewarded twice over, and will have eternal joy.

title: Isaiah Chapter 61 Verse 8
text: For I, the Lord, take pleasure in upright judging; I will not put up with the violent taking away of right; and I will certainly give them their reward, and I will make an eternal agreement with them.

title: Isaiah Chapter 61 Verse 9
text: And their seed will be noted among the nations, and their offspring among the peoples: it will be clear to all who see them that they are the seed to which the Lord has given his blessing.

title: Isaiah Chapter 61 Verse 10
text: I will be full of joy in the Lord, my soul will be glad in my God; for he has put on me the clothing of salvation, covering me with the robe of righteousness, as the husband puts on a fair head-dress, and the bride makes herself beautiful with jewels.

title: Isaiah Chapter 61 Verse 11
text: For as the earth puts out buds, and as the garden gives growth to the seeds which are planted in it, so the Lord will make righteousness and praise to be flowering before all the nations.

title: Isaiah Chapter 62 Verse 1
text: Because of Zion I will not keep quiet, and because of Jerusalem I will take no rest, till her righteousness goes out like the shining of the sun, and her salvation like a burning light.

title: Isaiah Chapter 62 Verse 2
text: And the nations will see your righteousness, and all kings your glory: and you will have a new name, given by the mouth of the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 62 Verse 3
text: And you will be a fair crown in the hand of the Lord, and a king's head-dress in the hand of your God.

title: Isaiah Chapter 62 Verse 4
text: You will not now be named, She who is given up; and your land will no longer be named, The waste land: but you will have the name, My pleasure is in her, and your land will be named, Married: for the Lord has pleasure in you, and your land will be married.

title: Isaiah Chapter 62 Verse 5
text: For as a young man takes a virgin for his wife, so will your maker be married to you: and as a husband has joy in his bride, so will the Lord your God be glad over you.

title: Isaiah Chapter 62 Verse 6
text: I have put watchmen on your walls, O Jerusalem; they will not keep quiet day or night: you who are the Lord's recorders, take no rest,

title: Isaiah Chapter 62 Verse 7
text: And give him no rest, till he puts Jerusalem in her place to be praised in the earth.

title: Isaiah Chapter 62 Verse 8
text: The Lord has taken an oath by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, Truly, I will no longer give your grain to be food for your haters; and men of strange countries will not take the wine for which your work has been done:

title: Isaiah Chapter 62 Verse 9
text: But those who have got in the grain will have it for their food, and will give praise to the Lord; and those who have got in the grapes will take the wine of them in the open places of my holy house.

title: Isaiah Chapter 62 Verse 10
text: Go through, go through the doors; make ready the way of the people; let the highway be lifted up; let the stones be taken away; let a flag be lifted up over the peoples.

title: Isaiah Chapter 62 Verse 11
text: The Lord has sent out word to the end of the earth, Say to the daughter of Zion, See, your saviour comes; those whom he has made free are with him, and those to whom he has given salvation go before him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 62 Verse 12
text: And they will be named, The holy people, Those whose cause has been taken up by the Lord: and you will be named, Desired, A town not given up.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 1
text: Who is this who comes from Edom, with blood-red robes from Bozrah? he whose clothing is fair, stepping with pride in his great strength? I whose glory is in the right, strong for salvation.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 2
text: Why is your clothing red, and why are your robes like those of one who is crushing the grapes?

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 3
text: I have been crushing the grapes by myself, and of the peoples there was no man with me: in my wrath and in my passion, they were crushed under my feet; and my robes are marked with their life-blood, and all my clothing is red.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 4
text: For the day of punishment is in my heart, and the year for the payment of the price for my people has come.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 5
text: And I saw that there was no helper, and I was wondering that no one gave them support: so my arm did the work of salvation, and my wrath was my support.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 6
text: And in my passion the peoples were crushed under my feet, and broken in my wrath, and I put down their strength to the earth.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 7
text: I will give news of the mercies of the Lord, and his great acts, even all the things the Lord has done for us, in his great grace to the house of Israel; even all he has done for us in his unnumbered mercies.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 8
text: For he said, Truly they are my people, children who will not be false: so he was their saviour out of all their trouble.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 9
text: It was no sent one or angel, but he himself who was their saviour: in his love and in his pity he took up their cause, and he took them in his arms, caring for them all through the years.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 10
text: But they went against him, causing grief to his holy spirit: so he was turned against them, and made war on them.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 11
text: Then the early days came to their minds, the days of Moses his servant: and they said, Where is he who made the keeper of his flock come up from the sea? where is he who put his holy spirit among them,

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 12
text: He who made the arm of his glory go at the right hand of Moses, by whom the waters were parted before them, to make himself an eternal name;

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 13
text: He who made them go through the deep waters, like a horse in the waste land?

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 14
text: Like the cattle which go down into the valley, they went without falling, the spirit of the Lord guiding them: so you went before your people, to make yourself a great name.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 15
text: Let your eyes be looking down from heaven, from your holy and beautiful house: where is your deep feeling, the working of your power? do not keep back the moving of your pity and your mercies:

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 16
text: For you are our father, though Abraham has no knowledge of us, and Israel gives no thought to us: you, O Lord, are our father; from the earliest days you have taken up our cause.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 17
text: O Lord, why do you send us wandering from your ways, making our hearts hard, so that we have no fear of you? Come back, because of your servants, the tribes of your heritage.

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 18
text: Why have evil men gone over your holy place, so that it has been crushed under the feet of our haters?

title: Isaiah Chapter 63 Verse 19
text: We have become as those who were never ruled by you, on whom your name was not named.

title: Isaiah Chapter 64 Verse 1
text: O let the heavens be broken open and come down, so that the mountains may be shaking before you,

title: Isaiah Chapter 64 Verse 2
text: As when fire puts the brushwood in flames, or as when water is boiling from the heat of the fire: to make your name feared by your haters, so that the nations may be shaking before you;

title: Isaiah Chapter 64 Verse 3
text: While you do acts of power for which we are not looking, and which have not come to the ears of men in the past.

title: Isaiah Chapter 64 Verse 4
text: The ear has not had news of, or the eye seen, ... any God but you, working for the man who is waiting for him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 64 Verse 5
text: Will you not have mercy on him who takes pleasure in doing righteousness, even on those who keep in mind your ways? Truly you were angry, and we went on doing evil, and sinning against you in the past.

title: Isaiah Chapter 64 Verse 6
text: For we have all become like an unclean person, and all our good acts are like a dirty robe: and we have all become old like a dead leaf, and our sins, like the wind, take us away.

title: Isaiah Chapter 64 Verse 7
text: And there is no one who makes prayer to your name, or who is moved to keep true to you: for your face is veiled from us, and you have given us into the power of our sins.

title: Isaiah Chapter 64 Verse 8
text: But now, O Lord, you are our father; we are the earth, and you are our maker; and we are all the work of your hand.

title: Isaiah Chapter 64 Verse 9
text: Be not very angry, O Lord, and do not keep our sins in mind for ever: give ear to our prayer, for we are all your people.

title: Isaiah Chapter 64 Verse 10
text: Your holy towns have become a waste, Zion has become a waste, Jerusalem is a mass of broken walls.

title: Isaiah Chapter 64 Verse 11
text: Our holy and beautiful house, where our fathers gave praise to you, is burned with fire; and all the things of our desire have come to destruction.

title: Isaiah Chapter 64 Verse 12
text: In view of all this, will you still do nothing, O Lord? will you keep quiet, and go on increasing our punishment?

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 1
text: I have been ready to give an answer to those who did not make prayer to me; I have been offering myself to those who were not searching for me; I said, Here am I, here am I, to a nation which gave no respect to my name.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 2
text: All day my hands have been stretched out to an uncontrolled people, who go in an evil way, after the purposes of their hearts;

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 3
text: A people who make me angry every day, making offerings in gardens, and burning perfumes on bricks.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 4
text: Who are seated in the resting-places of the dead, and by night are in the secret places; who take pig's flesh for food, and have the liquid of disgusting things in their vessels.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 5
text: Who say, Keep away, do not come near me, for fear that I make you holy: these are a smoke in my nose, a fire burning all day.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 6
text: See, it is recorded before me, says the Lord: I will not keep back my hand, till I have sent punishment,

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 7
text: For their sins and the sins of their fathers, who were burning perfumes on the mountains, and saying evil things against me on the hills: so I will take the measure of their sins, and will send the punishment for them into their breast.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 8
text: This is the word of the Lord: As the new wine is seen in the grapes, and they say, Do not send destruction on it, for a blessing is in it: so will I do for my servants, in order that I may not put an end to them all.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 9
text: And I will take a seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah one who will have my mountains for a heritage: and the people I have taken to be mine will have it for themselves, and my servants will have their resting-place there.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 10
text: And Sharon will be a grass-land for the flocks, and the valley of Achor a resting-place for the herds: for my people whose hearts have been turned back to me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 11
text: But as for you who have given up the Lord, who have no care for my holy mountain, who get ready a table for Chance, and make offerings of mixed wine to Fate;

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 12
text: Your fate will be the sword, and you will all go down to death: because when my voice came to you, you made no answer; you did not give ear to my word; but you did what was evil in my eyes, desiring what was not pleasing to me.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 13
text: For this cause says the Lord God, My servants will have food, but you will be in need of food: my servants will have drink, but you will be dry: my servants will have joy, but you will be shamed:

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 14
text: My servants will make songs in the joy of their hearts, but you will be crying for sorrow, and making sounds of grief from a broken spirit.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 15
text: And your name will become a curse to my people, and the Lord God will put you to death, and give his servants another name:

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 16
text: So that he who is requesting a blessing will make use of the name of the true God, and he who takes an oath will do so by the true God; because the past troubles are gone out of mind, and because they are covered from my eyes.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 17
text: For see, I am making a new heaven and a new earth: and the past things will be gone completely out of mind.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 18
text: But men will be glad and have joy for ever in what I am making; for I am making Jerusalem a delight, and her people a joy.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 19
text: And I will be glad over Jerusalem, and have joy in my people: and the voice of weeping will no longer be sounding in her, or the voice of grief.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 20
text: No longer will there be there a child whose days are cut short, or an old man whose days have not come to their full measure: for the young man at his death will be a hundred years old, and he whose life is shorter than a hundred years will seem as one cursed.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 21
text: And they will be building houses and living in them; planting vine-gardens and getting the fruit of them.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 22
text: They will no longer be building for the use of others, or planting for others to have the fruit: for the days of my people will be like the days of a tree, and my loved ones will have joy in full measure in the work of their hands.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 23
text: Their work will not be for nothing, and they will not give birth to children for destruction; for they are a seed to whom the Lord has given his blessing, and their offspring will be with them.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 24
text: And before they make their request I will give an answer, and while they are still making prayer to me, I will give ear.

title: Isaiah Chapter 65 Verse 25
text: The wolf and the lamb will take their food together, and the lion will make a meal of grass like the ox: but dust will be the snake's food. There will be no cause of pain or destruction in all my holy mountain, says the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 1
text: The Lord says, Heaven is the seat of my power, and earth is the resting-place for my feet: what sort of house will you make for me, and what place will be my resting-place?

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 2
text: For all these things my hand has made, and they are mine, says the Lord; but to this man only will I give attention, to him who is poor and broken in spirit, fearing my word.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 3
text: He who puts an ox to death puts a man to death; he who makes an offering of a lamb puts a dog to death; he who makes a meal offering makes an offering of pig's blood; he who makes an offering of perfumes for a sign gives worship to an image: as they have gone after their desires, and their soul takes pleasure in their disgusting things;

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 4
text: So I will go after trouble for them, and will send on them what they are fearing: because no one made answer to my voice, or gave ear to my word; but they did what was evil in my eyes, going after that in which I took no pleasure.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 5
text: Give ear to the word of the Lord, you who are in fear at his word: your countrymen, hating you, and driving you out because of my name, have said, Let the Lord's glory be made clear, so that we may see your joy; but they will be put to shame.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 6
text: There is a noise of war from the town, a sound from the Temple, the voice of the Lord giving punishment to his haters.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 7
text: Before her pains came, she gave birth; before her pains, she gave birth to a man-child.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 8
text: When has such a story come to men's ears? who has seen such things? will a land come to birth in one day? will a nation be given birth in a minute? For when Zion's pains came on her, she gave birth to her children straight away.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 9
text: Will I by whom the birth was started, not make it complete? says the Lord. Will I who make children come to birth, let them be kept back? says your God.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 10
text: Have joy with Jerusalem, and be glad with her, all you her lovers: take part in her joy, all you who are sorrowing for her:

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 11
text: So that you may take of the comfort flowing from her breasts, and be delighted with the full measure of her glory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 12
text: For the Lord says, See, I will make her peace like a river, and the glory of the nations like an overflowing stream, and she will take her children in her arms, gently caring for them on her knees.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 13
text: As to one who is comforted by his mother, so will I give you comfort: and you will be comforted in Jerusalem.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 14
text: And you will see it and your heart will be glad, and your bones will get new strength, like young grass: and the hand of the Lord will be seen at work for his servants, and his wrath against his haters.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 15
text: For the Lord is coming with fire, and his war-carriages will be like the storm-wind; to give punishment in the heat of his wrath, and his passion is like flames of fire.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 16
text: For with fire and sword will the Lord come, judging all the earth, and his sword will be on all flesh: and great numbers will be put to death by him.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 17
text: As for those who keep themselves separate, and make themselves clean in the gardens, going after one in the middle, taking pig's flesh for food, and other disgusting things, such as the mouse: their works and their thoughts will come to an end together, says the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 18
text: And I am coming to get together all nations and tongues: and they will come and will see my glory.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 19
text: And I will put a sign among them, and I will send those who are still living to the nations, to Tarshish, Put, and Lud, Meshech and Rosh, Tubal and Javan, to the sea-lands far away, who have not had word of me, or seen my glory; and they will give the knowledge of my glory to the nations.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 20
text: And they will take your countrymen out of all the nations for an offering to the Lord, on horses, and in carriages, and in carts, and on asses, and on camels, to my holy mountain Jerusalem, says the Lord, as the children of Israel take their offering in a clean vessel into the house of the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 21
text: And some of them will I take for priests and Levites, says the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 22
text: For as the new heaven and the new earth which I will make will be for ever before me, says the Lord, so will your seed and your name be for ever.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 23
text: And it will be, that from new moon to new moon, and from Sabbath to Sabbath, all flesh will come to give worship before me, says the Lord.

title: Isaiah Chapter 66 Verse 24
text: And they will go out to see the dead bodies of the men who have done evil against me: for their worm will ever be living, and their fire will never be put out, and they will be a thing of fear to all flesh.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: The words of Jeremiah, the son of Hilkiah, of the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: To whom the word of the Lord came in the days of Josiah, the son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his rule.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: And it came again in the days of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, up to the eleventh year of Zedekiah, the son of Josiah, king of Judah; till Jerusalem was taken away in the fifth month.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: Now the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Before you were formed in the body of your mother I had knowledge of you, and before your birth I made you holy; I have given you the work of being a prophet to the nations.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: Then said I, O Lord God! see, I have no power of words, for I am a child.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: But the Lord said to me, Do not say, I am a child: for wherever I send you, you are to go, and whatever I give you orders to say, you are to say.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: Have no fear because of them: for I am with you, to keep you safe, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: Then the Lord put out his hand, touching my mouth; and the Lord said to me, See, I have put my words in your mouth:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: See, this day I have put you over the nations and over the kingdoms, for uprooting and smashing down, for destruction and overturning, for building up and planting.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying, Jeremiah, what do you see? And I said, I see a branch of an almond-tree.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: Then the Lord said to me, You have seen well: for I keep watch over my word to give effect to it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: And the word of the Lord came to me a second time, saying, What do you see? And I said, I see a boiling pot, and its face is from the north.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: Then the Lord said to me, Out of the north evil will come, bursting out on all the people of the land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: For see, I will send for all the families of the kingdoms of the north, says the Lord; and they will come, everyone placing his high seat at the way into Jerusalem, and against its walls on every side, and against all the towns of Judah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: And I will give my decision against them on account of all their evil-doing; because they have given me up, burning perfumes to other gods and worshipping the works of their hands.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: So make yourself ready, and go and say to them everything I give you orders to say: do not be overcome by fear of them, or I will send fear on you before them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: For see, this day have I made you a walled town, and an iron pillar, and walls of brass, against all the land, against the kings of Judah, against its captains, against its priests, and against the people of the land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: They will be fighting against you, but they will not overcome you: for I am with you, says the Lord, to give you salvation.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: Go and say in the ears of Jerusalem, The Lord says, I still keep the memory of your kind heart when you were young, and your love when you became my bride; how you went after me in the waste of sand, in an unplanted land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: Israel was holy to the Lord, the first-fruits of his increase: all who made attacks on him were judged as wrongdoers, evil came on them, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: Give ear to the words of the Lord, O sons of Jacob and all the families of Israel:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: These are the words of the Lord: What evil have your fathers seen in me that they have gone far from me, and, walking after what is false, have become false?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: And they never said, Where is the Lord, who took us up out of the land of Egypt; who was our guide through the waste of sand, through an unplanted land full of deep holes, through a dry land of deep shade, which no one went through and where no man was living?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And I took you into a fertile land, where you were living on its fruit and its wealth; but when you came in, you made my land unclean, and made my heritage a disgusting thing.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: The priests did not say, Where is the Lord? and those who were expert in the law had no knowledge of me: and the rulers did evil against me, and the prophets became prophets of the Baal, going after things without value.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: For this reason, I will again put forward my cause against you, says the Lord, even against you and against your children's children.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: For go over to the sea-lands of Kittim and see; send to Kedar and give deep thought to it; and see if there has ever been such a thing.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: Has any nation ever made a change in their gods, though they are no gods? but my people have given up their glory in exchange for what is of no profit.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: Be full of wonder, O heavens, at this; be overcome with fear, be completely waste, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: For my people have done two evils; they have given up me, the fountain of living waters, and have made for themselves water-holes, cut out from the rock, broken water-holes, of no use for storing water.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: Is Israel a servant? has he been a house-servant from birth? why has he been made waste?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: The young lions have made an outcry against him with a loud voice: they have made his land waste; his towns are burned up, with no one living in them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: Even the children of Noph and Tahpanhes have put shame on you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: Has not this come on you because you have given up the Lord your God, who was your guide by the way?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: And now, what have you to do on the way to Egypt, to get your drink from the waters of the Nile? or what have you to do on the way to Assyria, to get your drink from the waters of the River?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: The evil you yourselves have done will be your punishment, your errors will be your judge: be certain then, and see that it is an evil and a bitter thing to give up the Lord your God, and no longer to be moved by fear of me, says the Lord, the Lord of armies.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: For in the past, your yoke was broken by your hands and your cords parted; and you said, I will not be your servant; for on every high hill and under every branching tree, your behaviour was like that of a loose woman

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: But when you were planted by me, you were a noble vine, in every way a true seed: how then have you been changed into the branching plant of a strange vine?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: For even if you are washed with soda and take much soap, still your evil-doing is marked before me, says the Lord God.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: How are you able to say, I am not unclean, I have not gone after the Baals? see your way in the valley, be clear about what you have done: you are a quick-footed camel twisting her way in and out;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: An untrained ass, used to the waste land, breathing up the wind in her desire; at her time, who is able to send her away? all those who are looking for her will have no need to make themselves tired; in her month they will get her.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: Do not let your foot be without shoes, or your throat dry from need of water: but you said, There is no hope: no, for I have been a lover of strange gods, and after them I will go.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: As the thief is shamed when he is taken, so is Israel shamed; they, their kings and their rulers, their priests and their prophets;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 27
text: Who say to a tree, You are my father; and to a stone, You have given me life: for their backs have been turned to me, not their faces: but in the time of their trouble they will say, Up! and be our saviour.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 28
text: But where are the gods you have made for yourselves? let them come, if they are able to give you salvation in the time of your trouble: for the number of your gods is as the number of your towns, O Judah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 29
text: Why will you put forward your cause against me? You have all done evil against me, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 30
text: I gave your children blows to no purpose; they got no good from training: your sword has been the destruction of your prophets, like a death-giving lion.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 31
text: O generation, see the word of the Lord. Have I been a waste land to Israel? or a land of dark night? why do my people say, We have got loose, we will not come to you again?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 32
text: Is it possible for a virgin to put out of her memory her ornaments, or a bride her robes? but my people have put me out of their memories for unnumbered days.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 33
text: With what care are your ways ordered when you are looking for love! so ... your ways.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 34
text: And in the skirts of your robe may be seen the life-blood of those who have done no wrong: ...

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 35
text: And still you said, I have done no wrong; truly, his wrath is turned away from me. See, I will take up the cause against you, because you say, I have done no wrong.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 36
text: Why do you go about so much for the purpose of changing your way? you will be shamed on account of Egypt, as you were shamed on account of Assyria.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 2 Verse 37
text: Truly, you will go out from him with your hands on your head: for the Lord has given up those in whom you have put your faith, and they will be of no help to you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: They say, If a man puts away his wife and she goes from him and becomes another man's, will he go back to her again? will not that land have been made unclean? but though you have been acting like a loose woman with a number of lovers, will you now come back to me? says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: Let your eyes be lifted up to the open hilltops, and see; where have you not been taken by your lovers? You have been seated waiting for them by the wayside like an Arabian in the waste land; you have made the land unclean with your loose ways and your evil-doing.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: So the showers have been kept back, and there has been no spring rain; still your brow is the brow of a loose woman, you will not let yourself be shamed.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: Will you not, from this time, make your prayer to me, crying, My father, you are the friend of my early years?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Will he be angry for ever? will he keep his wrath to the end? These things you have said, and have done evil and have had your way.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And the Lord said to me in the days of Josiah the king, Have you seen what Israel, turning away from me, has done? She has gone up on every high mountain and under every branching tree, acting like a loose woman there.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And I said, After she has done all these things she will come back to me; but she did not. And her false sister Judah saw it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: And though she saw that, because Israel, turning away from me, had been untrue to me, I had put her away and given her a statement in writing ending the relation between us, still Judah, her false sister, had no fear, but went and did the same.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: So that through all her loose behaviour the land became unclean, and she was untrue, giving herself to stones and trees.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: But for all this, her false sister Judah has not come back to me with all her heart, but with deceit, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And the Lord said to me, Israel in her turning away is seen to be more upright than false Judah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Go, and give out these words to the north, and say, Come back, O Israel, though you have been turned away from me, says the Lord; my face will not be against you in wrath: for I am full of mercy, says the Lord, I will not be angry for ever.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Only be conscious of your sin, the evil you have done against the Lord your God; you have gone with strange men under every branching tree, giving no attention to my voice, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: Come back, O children who are turned away, says the Lord; for I am a husband to you, and I will take you, one from a town and two from a family, and will make you come to Zion;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: And I will give you keepers, pleasing to my heart, who will give you your food with knowledge and wisdom.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: And it will come about, when your numbers are increased in the land, in those days, says the Lord, that they will no longer say, The ark of the agreement of the Lord: it will not come into their minds, they will not have any memory of it, or be conscious of the loss of it, and it will not be made again.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: At that time Jerusalem will be named the seat of the Lord's kingdom; and all the nations will come together to it, to the name of the Lord, to Jerusalem: and no longer will their steps be guided by the purposes of their evil hearts.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: In those days the family of Judah will go with the family of Israel, and they will come together out of the land of the north into the land which I gave for a heritage to your fathers.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: But I said, How am I to put you among the children, and give you a desired land, a heritage of glory among the armies of the nations? and I said, You are to say to me, My father; and not be turned away from me.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: Truly, as a wife is false to her husband, so have you been false to me, O Israel, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: A voice is sounding on the open hilltops, the weeping and the prayers of the children of Israel; because their way is twisted, they have not kept the Lord their God in mind.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: Come back, you children who have been turned away, and I will take away your desire for wandering. See, we have come to you, for you are the Lord our God.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 23
text: Truly, the hills, and the noise of an army on the mountains, are a false hope: truly, in the Lord our God is the salvation of Israel.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 24
text: But the Baal has taken all the work of our fathers from our earliest days; their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 3 Verse 25
text: Let us be stretched on the earth in our downfall, covering ourselves with our shame: for we have been sinners against the Lord our God, we and our fathers, from our earliest years even till this day: and we have not given ear to the voice of the Lord our God.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: If you will come back, O Israel, says the Lord, you will come back to me: and if you will put away your disgusting ways, you will not be sent away from before me.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And you will take your oath, By the living Lord, in good faith and wisdom and righteousness; and the nations will make use of you as a blessing, and in you will they take a pride.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: For this is what the Lord says to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem: Get your unworked land ploughed up, do not put in your seeds among thorns.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: Undergo a circumcision of the heart, you men of Judah and people of Jerusalem: or my wrath may come out like fire, burning so that no one is able to put it out, because of the evil of your doings.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Say openly in Judah, give it out in Jerusalem, and say, Let the horn be sounded in the land: crying out in a loud voice, Come together, and let us go into the walled towns.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: Put up a flag for a sign to Zion: go in flight so that you may be safe, waiting no longer: for I will send evil from the north, and a great destruction.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: A lion has gone up from his secret place in the woods, and one who makes waste the nations is on his way; he has gone out from his place, to make your land unpeopled, so that your towns will be made waste, with no man living in them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: For this put on haircloth, with weeping and loud crying: for the burning wrath of the Lord is not turned back from us.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: And it will come about in that day, says the Lord, that the heart of the king will be dead in him, and the hearts of the rulers; and the priests will be overcome with fear, and the prophets with wonder.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: Then said I, Ah, Lord God! your words were not true when you said to this people and to Jerusalem, You will have peace; when the sword has come even to the soul.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: At that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem, A burning wind from the open hilltops in the waste land is blowing on the daughter of my people, not for separating or cleaning the grain;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: A full wind will come for me: and now I will give my decision against them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: See, he will come up like the clouds, and his war-carriages like the storm-wind: his horses are quicker than eagles. Sorrow is ours, for destruction has come on us.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: O Jerusalem, make your heart clean from evil, so that you may have salvation. How long are evil purposes to have a resting-place in you?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: For a voice is sounding from Dan, giving out evil from the hills of Ephraim:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: Make this come to the minds of the nations, make a statement openly against Jerusalem, that attackers are coming from a far country and their voices will be loud against the towns of Judah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: Like keepers of a field they are against her on every side; because she has been fighting against me, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 18
text: Your ways and your doings have made these things come on you; this is your sin; truly it is bitter, going deep into your heart.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 19
text: My soul, my soul! I am pained to my inmost heart; my heart is troubled in me; I am not able to be quiet, because the sound of the horn, the note of war, has come to my ears.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 20
text: News is given of destruction on destruction; all the land is made waste: suddenly my tents, straight away my curtains, are made waste.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 21
text: How long will I go on seeing the flag and hearing the sound of the war-horn?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 22
text: For my people are foolish, they have no knowledge of me; they are evil-minded children, without sense, all of them: they are wise in evil-doing, but have no knowledge of doing good.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 23
text: Looking at the earth, I saw that it was waste and without form; and to the heavens, that they had no light.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 24
text: Looking at the mountains, I saw them shaking, and all the hills were moved about.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 25
text: Looking, I saw that there was no man, and all the birds of heaven had gone in flight.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 26
text: Looking, I saw that the fertile field was a waste, and all its towns were broken down before the Lord and before his burning wrath.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 27
text: For this is what the Lord has said: All the land will become a waste; I will make destruction complete.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 28
text: The earth will be weeping for this, and the heavens on high will be black: because I have said it, and I will not go back from it; it is my purpose, and it will not be changed.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 29
text: All the land is in flight because of the noise of the horsemen and the bowmen; they have taken cover in the woodland and up on the rocks: every town has been given up, not a man is living in them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 30
text: And you, when you are made waste, what will you do? Though you are clothed in red, though you make yourself beautiful with ornaments of gold, though you make your eyes wide with paint, it is for nothing that you make yourself fair; your lovers have no more desire for you, they have designs on your life.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 4 Verse 31
text: A voice has come to my ears like the voice of a woman in birth-pains, the pain of one giving birth to her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, fighting for breath, stretching out her hands, saying, Now sorrow is mine! for my strength is gone from me before the takers of life.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Go quickly through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and get knowledge, and make a search in her wide places if there is a man, if there is one in her who is upright, who keeps faith; and she will have my forgiveness.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: And though they say, By the living Lord; truly their oaths are false.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: O Lord, do not your eyes see good faith? you have given them punishment, but they were not troubled; you have sent destruction on them, but they did not take your teaching to heart: they have made their faces harder than a rock; they would not come back.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: Then I said, But these are the poor: they are foolish, for they have no knowledge of the way of the Lord or of the behaviour desired by their God.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: I will go to the great men and have talk with them; for they have knowledge of the way of the Lord and of the behaviour desired by their God. But as for these, their one purpose is a broken yoke and burst bands.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: And so a lion from the woods will put them to death, a wolf of the waste land will make them waste, a leopard will keep watch on their towns, and everyone who goes out from them will be food for the beasts; because of the great number of their sins and the increase of their wrongdoing.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: How is it possible for you to have my forgiveness for this? your children have given me up, taking their oaths by those who are no gods: when I had given them food in full measure, they were false to their wives, taking their pleasure in the houses of loose women.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: They were full of desire, like horses after a meal of grain: everyone went after his neighbour's wife.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: Am I not to give punishment for these things? says the Lord: will not my soul take payment from such a nation as this?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: Go up against her vines and make waste; let the destruction be complete: take away her branches, for they are not the Lord's.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: For the people of Israel and the people of Judah have been very false to me, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: They would have nothing to do with the Lord, saying, He will do nothing, and no evil will come to us; we will not see the sword or be short of food:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: And the prophets will become wind, and the word is not in them; so it will be done to them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: For this reason the Lord, the God of armies, has said: Because you have said this, I will make my words in your mouth a fire, and this people wood, and they will be burned up by it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: See, I will send you a nation from far away, O people of Israel, says the Lord; a strong nation and an old nation, a nation whose language is strange to you, so that you may not get the sense of their words.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: Their arrows give certain death, they are all men of war.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: They will take all the produce of your fields, which would have been food for your sons and your daughters: they will take your flocks and your herds: they will take all your vines and your fig-trees: and with the sword they will make waste your walled towns in which you put your faith.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: But even in those days, says the Lord, I will not let your destruction be complete.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: And it will come about, when you say, Why has the Lord our God done all these things to us? that you will say to them, As you gave me up, making yourselves servants to strange gods in your land, so will you be servants to strange men in a land which is not yours.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: Say this openly in Jacob and give it out in Judah, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 21
text: Give ear now to this, O foolish people without sense; who have eyes but see nothing, and ears without the power of hearing:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 22
text: Have you no fear of me? says the Lord; will you not be shaking with fear before me, who have put the sand as a limit for the sea, by an eternal order, so that it may not go past it? and though it is ever in motion, it is not able to have its way; though the sound of its waves is loud, they are not able to go past it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 23
text: But the heart of this people is uncontrolled and turned away from me; they are broken loose and gone.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 24
text: And they do not say in their hearts, Now let us give worship to our God, who gives the rain, the winter and the spring rain, at the right time; who keeps for us the ordered weeks of the grain-cutting.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 25
text: Through your evil-doing these things have been turned away, and your sins have kept back good from you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 26
text: For there are sinners among my people: they keep watch, like men watching for birds; they put a net and take men in it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 27
text: As the fowl-house is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit: for this reason they have become great and have got wealth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 28
text: They have become fat and strong: they have gone far in works of evil: they give no support to the cause of the child without a father, so that they may do well; they do not see that the poor man gets his rights.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 29
text: Am I not to give punishment for these things? says the Lord: will not my soul take payment from such a nation as this?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 30
text: A thing of wonder and fear has come about in the land;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 5 Verse 31
text: The prophets give false words and the priests give decisions by their direction; and my people are glad to have it so: and what will you do in the end?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: Go in flight out of Jerusalem, so that you may be safe, you children of Benjamin, and let the horn be sounded in Tekoa, and the flag be lifted up on Beth-haccherem: for evil is looking out from the north, and a great destruction.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: The fair and delicate one, the daughter of Zion, will be cut off by my hand.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: Keepers of sheep with their flocks will come to her; they will put up their tents round her; everyone will get food in his place.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: Make war ready against her; up! let us go up when the sun is high. Sorrow is ours! for the day is turned and the shades of evening are stretched out.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: Up! let us go up by night, and send destruction on her great houses.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: For this is what the Lord of armies has said: Let trees be cut down and an earthwork be placed against Jerusalem: sorrow on the false town! inside her there is nothing but cruel ways.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: As the spring keeps its waters cold, so she keeps her evil in her: the sound of cruel and violent behaviour is in her; before me at all times are disease and wounds.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: Undergo teaching, O Jerusalem, or my soul will be turned away from you, and I will make you a waste, an unpeopled land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: Everything will be taken from the rest of Israel as the last grapes are taken from the vine; let your hand be turned to the small branches, like one pulling off grapes.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: To whom am I to give word, witnessing so that they may take note? see, their ears are stopped, and they are not able to give attention: see, the word of the Lord has been a cause of shame to them, they have no delight in it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: For this reason I am full of the wrath of the Lord, I am tired of keeping it in: may it be let loose on the children in the street, and on the band of the young men together: for even the husband with his wife will be taken, the old man with him who is full of days.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: And their houses will be handed over to others, their fields and their wives together: for my hand will be stretched out against the people of the land, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: For from the least of them even to the greatest, everyone is given up to getting money; from the prophet even to the priest, everyone is working deceit.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: And they have made little of the wounds of my people, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: Let them be put to shame because they have done disgusting things. They had no shame, they were not able to become red with shame: so they will come down with those who are falling: when my punishment comes on them, they will be made low, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: This is what the Lord has said: Take your place looking out on the ways; make search for the old roads, saying, Where is the good way? and go in it that you may have rest for your souls. But they said, We will not go in it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: And I put watchmen over you, saying, Give attention to the sound of the horn; but they said, We will not give attention.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: So then, give ear, you nations, and ...

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: Give ear, O earth: see, I will make evil come on this people, even the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not given attention to my words, and they would have nothing to do with my law.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: To what purpose does sweet perfume come to me from Sheba, and spices from a far country? your burned offerings give me no pleasure, your offerings of beasts are not pleasing to me.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 21
text: For this reason the Lord has said, See, I will put stones in the way of this people: and the fathers and the sons together will go falling over them; the neighbour and his friend will come to destruction.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 22
text: The Lord has said, See, a people is coming from the north country, a great nation will be put in motion from the inmost parts of the earth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 23
text: Bows and spears are in their hands; they are cruel and have no mercy; their voice is like the thunder of the sea, and they go on horses; everyone in his place like men going to the fight, against you, O daughter of Zion.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 24
text: The news of it has come to our ears; our hands have become feeble: trouble has come on us and pain, like the pain of a woman in childbirth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 25
text: Go not out into the field or by the way; for there is the sword of the attacker, and fear on every side.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 26
text: O daughter of my people, put on haircloth, rolling yourself in the dust: give yourself to sorrow, as for an only son, with most bitter cries of grief; for he who makes waste will come on us suddenly.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 27
text: I have made you a tester among my people, so that you may have knowledge of their way and put it to the test.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 28
text: All of them are turned away, going about with false stories; they are brass and iron: they are all workers of deceit.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 29
text: The blower is blowing strongly, the lead is burned away in the fire: they go on heating the metal to no purpose, for the evil-doers are not taken away.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 6 Verse 30
text: They will be named waste silver, because the Lord has given them up.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: Take your place in the doorway of the Lord's house, and give out this word there, and say, Give ear to the word of the Lord, all you of Judah who come inside these doors to give worship to the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: The Lord of armies, the God of Israel, says, Let your ways and your doings be changed for the better and I will let you go on living in this place.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: Put no faith in false words, saying, The Temple of the Lord, the Temple of the Lord, the Temple of the Lord, are these.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: For if your ways and your doings are truly changed for the better; if you truly give right decisions between a man and his neighbour;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: If you are not cruel to the man from a strange country, and to the child without a father, and to the widow, and do not put the upright to death in this place, or go after other gods, causing damage to yourselves:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: Then I will let you go on living in this place, in the land which I gave to your fathers in the past and for ever.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: See, you put your faith in false words which are of no profit.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: Will you take the goods of others, put men to death, and be untrue to your wives, and take false oaths, and have perfumes burned to the Baal, and go after other gods which are strange to you;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: And come and take your place before me in this house, which is named by my name, and say, We have been made safe; so that you may do all these disgusting things?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: Has this house, which is named by my name, become a hole of thieves to you? Truly I, even I, have seen it, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: But go now to my place which was in Shiloh, where I put my name at first, and see what I did to it because of the evil-doing of my people Israel.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: And now, because you have done all these works, says the Lord, and I sent my word to you, getting up early and sending, but you did not give ear; and my voice came to you, but you gave no answer:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: For this reason I will do to the house which is named by my name, and in which you have put your faith, and to the place which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I have done to Shiloh.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: And I will send you away from before my face, as I have sent away all your brothers, even all the seed of Ephraim.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: And as for you (Jeremiah), make no prayers for this people, send up no cry or prayer for them, make no request for them to me: for I will not give ear.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: Do you not see what they are doing in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: The children go for wood, the fathers get the fire burning, the women are working the paste to make cakes for the queen of heaven, and drink offerings are drained out to other gods, moving me to wrath.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: Are they moving me to wrath? says the Lord; are they not moving themselves to their shame?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: So this is what the Lord God has said: See, my wrath and my passion will be let loose on this place, on man and beast, and on the trees of the field, and on the produce of the earth; it will be burning and will not be put out.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: These are the words of the Lord of armies, the God of Israel: Put your burned offerings with your offerings of beasts, and take flesh for your food.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: For I said nothing to your fathers, and gave them no orders, on the day when I took them out of Egypt, about burned offerings or offerings of beasts:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: But this was the order I gave them, saying, Give ear to my voice, and I will be your God, and you will be my people: go in all the way ordered by me, so that all may be well for you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: But they took no note and did not give ear, but were guided by the thoughts and the pride of their evil hearts, going back and not forward.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: From the day when your fathers came out of Egypt till this day, I have sent my servants the prophets to you, getting up early every day and sending them:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: But still they took no note and would not give ear, but they made their necks stiff, doing worse than their fathers.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: And you are to say all these words to them, but they will not give ear to you: you will send out your voice to them, but they will give no answer.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: And you are to say to them, This is the nation which has not given ear to the voice of their God, or taken his teaching to heart: good faith is dead and is cut off from their mouths.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 29
text: Let your hair be cut off, O Jerusalem, and let it go, and let a song of grief go up on the open hilltops; for the Lord is turned away from the generation of his wrath and has given them up.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 30
text: For the children of Judah have done what is evil in my eyes, says the Lord: they have put their disgusting images in the house which is named by my name, making it unclean.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 31
text: And they have put up the high place of Topheth in the valley of the son of Hinnom, burning their sons and their daughters there in the fire; a thing which was not ordered by me and never came into my mind.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 32
text: For this cause, the days are coming, says the Lord, when it will no longer be named Topheth, or, The valley of the son of Hinnom, but, The valley of Death: for they will put the dead into the earth in Topheth till there is no more room.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 33
text: And the bodies of this people will be food for the birds of heaven and for the beasts of the earth; and there will be no one to send them away.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 7 Verse 34
text: And in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, I will put an end to the laughing voices, the voice of joy and the voice of the newly-married man and the voice of the bride: for the land will become a waste.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: At that time, says the Lord, they will take the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of his rulers, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the people of Jerusalem out of their resting-places:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: And they will put them out before the sun and the moon and all the stars of heaven, whose lovers and servants they have been, after whom they have gone, to whom they have made prayers, and to whom they have given worship: they will not be put together or placed in the earth; they will be waste on the face of the earth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: And death will be desired more than life by the rest of this evil family who are still living in all the places where I have sent them away, says the Lord of armies.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: Further, you are to say to them, This is what the Lord has said: Will those who are falling not be lifted up again? will he who has gone away not come back?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: Why do these people of Jerusalem go back, for ever turning away? they will not give up their deceit, they will not come back.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: I took note and gave ear, but no one said what is right: no man had regret for his evil-doing, saying, What have I done? everyone goes off on his way like a horse rushing to the fight.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: Truly, the stork in the heavens is conscious of her fixed times; the dove and the swallow and the crane keep to the times of their coming; but my people have no knowledge of the law of the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: How is it that you say, We are wise and the law of the Lord is with us? But see, the false pen of the scribes has made it false.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: The wise men are shamed, they are overcome with fear and taken: see, they have given up the word of the Lord; and what use is their wisdom to them?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: So I will give their wives to others, and their fields to those who will take them for themselves: for everyone, from the least to the greatest, is given up to getting money; from the priest even to the prophet, everyone is false.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And they have made little of the wounds of the daughter of Zion, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: Let them be put to shame because they have done disgusting things. They had no shame, they were not able to become red with shame: so they will come down with those who are falling: in the time of their punishment they will be made low, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: I will put an end to them completely, says the Lord: there are no grapes on the vine and no figs on the fig-tree, and the leaf is dry.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 14
text: Why are we seated doing nothing? come together, and let us go to the walled towns, and let destruction overtake us there, for the Lord our God has sent destruction on us, and given us bitter water for our drink, because we have done evil against the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 15
text: We were looking for peace, but no good came; and for a time of well-being, but there is only a great fear.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 16
text: The loud breathing of the horses comes to our ears from Dan: at the sound of the outcry of his war-horses, all the land is shaking with fear; for they have come, and have made a meal of the land and everything in it; the town and the people living in it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 17
text: See, I will send snakes and poison-snakes among you, against which the wonder-worker has no power; and they will give you wounds which may not be made well, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 18
text: Sorrow has come on me! my heart in me is feeble.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 19
text: The voice of the cry of the daughter of my people comes from a far land: Is the Lord not in Zion? is not her King in her? Why have they made me angry with their images and their strange gods which are no gods?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 20
text: The grain-cutting is past, the summer is ended, and no salvation has come to us.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 21
text: For the destruction of the daughter of my people I am broken: I am dressed in the clothing of grief; fear has taken me in its grip.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 8 Verse 22
text: Is there no life-giving oil in Gilead? is there no expert in medical arts? why then have my people not been made well?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: If only my head was a stream of waters and my eyes fountains of weeping, so that I might go on weeping day and night for the dead of the daughter of my people!

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: If only I had in the waste land a night's resting-place for travellers, so that I might go away, far from my people! for they are all untrue, a band of false men.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: Their tongues are bent like a bow to send out false words: they have become strong in the land, but not for good faith: they go on from evil to evil, and they have no knowledge of me, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: Let everyone keep watch on his neighbour, and put no faith in any brother: for every brother will certainly be tricking his brother, and every neighbour will go about saying evil.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: Everyone will make sport of his neighbour with deceit, not saying what is true: their tongues have been trained to say false words; they are twisted, hating to come back.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: There is wrong on wrong, deceit on deceit; they have given up the knowledge of me, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: So the Lord of armies has said, See, I will make them soft in the fire and put them to the test; this I will do because of their evil-doing.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: His tongue is an arrow causing death; the words of his mouth are deceit: he says words of peace to his neighbour, but in his heart he is waiting secretly for him.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: Am I not to send punishment for these things? says the Lord: will not my soul take payment from such a nation as this?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: Give yourselves to weeping, crying out in sorrow for the mountains; and for the fields of the waste land send up a song of grief, because they are burned up, so that no one goes through; there is no sound of cattle; the bird of the heavens and the beast are in flight and are gone.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: And I will make Jerusalem a mass of broken stones, the living-place of jackals; and I will make the towns of Judah a waste, with no man living there.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: Who is the wise man able to see this? who is he to whom the word of the Lord has come, so that he may make it clear? why is the land given to destruction and burned up like a waste place, so that no one goes through?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: And the Lord said, Because they have given up my law which I put before them, giving no attention to my voice and not being guided by it;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: But they have been walking in the pride of their hearts, going after the Baals, as their fathers gave them teaching.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: So the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said, I will give them, even this people, bitter plants for food and bitter water for drink.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: And I will send them wandering among the nations, among people strange to them and to their fathers: and I will send the sword after them till I have put an end to them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: Take thought and send for the weeping women, so that they may come; and send for the wise women, so that they may come:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: Let them quickly make cries of sorrow for us, so that drops may be flowing from our eyes till they are streaming with water.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: For a sound of weeping goes up from Zion, a cry, How has destruction come on us? we are overcome with shame because we have gone away from our land; he has sent us out from our house.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: But even now, give ear to the word of the Lord, O you women; let your ears be open to the word of his mouth, training your daughters to give cries of sorrow, everyone teaching her neighbour a song of grief.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: For death has come up into our windows, forcing its way into our great houses; cutting off the children in the streets and the young men in the wide places.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: The bodies of men will be falling like waste on the open fields, and like grain dropped by the grain-cutter, and no one will take them up.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: This is the word of the Lord: Let not the wise man take pride in his wisdom, or the strong man in his strength, or the man of wealth in his wealth:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: But if any man has pride, let it be in this, that he has the wisdom to have knowledge of me, that I am the Lord, working mercy, giving true decisions, and doing righteousness in the earth: for in these things I have delight, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: See, the day is coming, says the Lord, when I will send punishment on all those who have circumcision in the flesh;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: On Egypt and on Judah and on Edom and on the children of Ammon and on Moab and on all who have the ends of their hair cut, who are living in the waste land: for all these nations and all the people of Israel are without circumcision in their hearts.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: Give ear to the word which the Lord says to you, O people of Israel:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: This is what the Lord has said: Do not go in the way of the nations; have no fear of the signs of heaven, for the nations go in fear of them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: For that which is feared by the people is foolish: it is the work of the hands of the workman; for a tree is cut down by him out of the woods with his axe.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: They make it beautiful with silver and gold; they make it strong with nails and hammers, so that it may not be moved.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: It is like a pillar in a garden of plants, and has no voice: it has to be lifted, for it has no power of walking. Have no fear of it; for it has no power of doing evil and it is not able to do any good.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: There is no one like you, O Lord; you are great and your name is great in power.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: Who would not have fear of you, O King of the nations? for it is your right: for among all the wise men of the nations, and in all their kingdoms, there is no one like you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: But they are together like beasts and foolish: the teaching of false gods is wood.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: Silver hammered into plates is sent from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the expert workman and of the hands of the gold-worker; blue and purple is their clothing, all the work of expert men.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: But the Lord is the true God; he is the living God and an eternal king: when he is angry, the earth is shaking with fear, and the nations give way before his wrath.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: This is what you are to say to them: The gods who have not made the heavens and the earth will be cut off from the earth and from under the heavens.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: He has made the earth by his power, he has made the world strong in its place by his wisdom, and by his wise design the heavens have been stretched out.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: At the sound of his voice there is a massing of waters in the heavens, and he makes the mists go up from the ends of the earth; he makes the thunder-flames for the rain, and sends out the wind from his store-houses.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: Then every man becomes like a beast without knowledge; every gold-worker is put to shame by the image he has made: for his metal image is deceit, and there is no breath in them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: They are nothing, a work of error: in the time of their punishment, destruction will overtake them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: The heritage of Jacob is not like these; for the maker of all things is his heritage: the Lord of armies is his name.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: Get your goods together and go out of the land, O you who are shut up in the walled town.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: For the Lord has said, I will send the people in flight like a stone from the land at this time, troubling them so that they will be conscious of it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: Sorrow is mine for I am wounded! my wound may not be made well; and I said, Cruel is my disease, I may not be free from it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: My tent is pulled down and all my cords are broken: my children have gone from me, and they are not: no longer is there anyone to give help in stretching out my tent and hanging up my curtains.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: For the keepers of the sheep have become like beasts, not looking to the Lord for directions: so they have not done wisely and all their flocks have been put to flight.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: News is going about, see, it is coming, a great shaking is coming from the north country, so that the towns of Judah may be made waste and become the living-place of jackals.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 23
