text: O Lord, I am conscious that a man's way is not in himself: man has no power of guiding his steps.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: O Lord, put me right, but with wise purpose; not in your wrath, or you will make me small.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: Let your wrath be let loose on the nations which have no knowledge of you, and on the families who give no worship to your name: for they have made a meal of Jacob, truly they have made a meal of him and put an end to him and made his fields a waste.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: Give ear to the words of this agreement, and say to the men of Judah and to the people of Jerusalem,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: The Lord, the God of Israel, has said, Let that man be cursed who does not give ear to the words of this agreement,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: To the order which I gave your fathers on the day when I took them out of the land of Egypt, out of the oven of iron, saying, Give ear to my voice, and do all the orders I have given you: so you will be my people, and I will be your God:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: So that I may give effect to the oath which I made to your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey as at this day. And I said in answer, So be it, O Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And the Lord said to me, Give out these words in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Give ear to the words of this agreement and do them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: For I gave certain witness to your fathers on the day when I took them up out of the land of Egypt, and even to this day, getting up early and witnessing and saying, Give ear to my voice.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: But they gave no attention and did not give ear, but they went on, every man in the pride of his evil heart: so I sent on them all the curses in this agreement, which I gave them orders to keep, but they did not.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: And the Lord said to me, There is an evil design at work among the men of Judah and the people of Jerusalem.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: They are turned back to the sins of their fathers, who would not give ear to my words; they have gone after other gods and become their servants: the people of Israel and the people of Judah have not kept the agreement which I made with their fathers.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: So the Lord has said, I will send evil on them, which they will not be able to get away from; and they will send up a cry for help to me, but I will not give ear to them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: Then the towns of Judah and the people of Jerusalem will go crying for help to the gods to whom they have been burning perfumes: but they will give them no salvation in the time of their trouble.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: For the number of your gods is as the number of your towns, O Judah; and for every street in Jerusalem you have put up altars to the Baal for burning perfumes to the Baal.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: And as for you, make no prayers for this people, send up no cry or prayer for them: for I will not give ear to their cry in the time of their trouble.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: About Judah. What have you to do in my house? is it your thought that oaths and holy flesh will get you out of your trouble? will you make yourself safe in this way?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: You had been named by the Lord, A branching olive-tree, fair with beautiful fruit: with the noise of a great rushing he has put it on fire and its branches are broken.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: For the Lord of armies, by whom you were planted, has given his decision for evil against you, because of the evil which the people of Israel and the people of Judah have done, In moving me to wrath by offering perfumes to the Baal.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: And the Lord gave me knowledge of it and I saw it: then you made clear to me their doings.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: But I was like a gentle lamb taken to be put to death; I had no thought that they were designing evil against me, saying, Come and let us make trouble his food, cutting him off from the land of the living, so that there may be no more memory of his name.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: But, O Lord of armies, judging in righteousness, testing the thoughts and the heart, let me see your punishment come on them: for I have put my cause before you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: So this is what the Lord of armies has said about the men of Anathoth who have made designs against your life, saying, You are not to be a prophet in the name of the Lord, or death will overtake you by our hands:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: So the Lord of armies has said, See, I will send punishment on them: the young men will be put to the sword; their sons and their daughters will come to death through need of food:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: Not one of them will keep his life, for I will send evil on the men of Anathoth in the year of their punishment.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: You are in the right, O Lord, when I put my cause before you: still let me take up with you the question of your decisions: why does the evil-doer do well? why are the workers of deceit living in comfort?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: They have been planted by you, they have taken root; they go on and give fruit: you are near in their mouths but far from their thoughts.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: But you, O Lord, have knowledge of me; you see me, searching and testing how my heart is with you: let them be pulled out like sheep to be put to death, make them ready for the day of death.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: How long will the land have grief, and the plants of all the land be dry? because of the sins of the people living in it, destruction has overtaken the beasts and the birds; because they said, God does not see our ways.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: If running with the fighting-men has made you tired, how will you be able to keep up with horses? and if in a land of peace you go in flight, what will become of you in the thick growth of Jordan?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: For even your brothers, your father's family, even they have been untrue to you, crying loudly after you: have no faith in them, though they say fair words to you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: I have given up my house, I have let my heritage go; I have given the loved one of my soul into the hands of her haters.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: My heritage has become like a lion in the woodland to me; her voice has been loud against me; so I have hate for her.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: My heritage is like a brightly coloured bird to me; the cruel birds are attacking her on every side: go, get together all the beasts of the field, make them come for destruction.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: The keepers of sheep have been the destruction of my vine-garden, crushing my heritage under their feet; they have made my fair heritage an unplanted waste;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: They have made it waste; it is weeping to me, being wasted; all the land is made waste, because no man takes it to heart.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: Those who make waste have come on all the open hilltops in the waste land; for the sword of the Lord sends destruction from one end of the land to the other end of the land: no flesh has peace.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: Though good grain was planted, they have got in thorns: they have given themselves pain without profit: they will be shamed on account of their produce, because of the burning wrath of the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: This is what the Lord has said against all my evil neighbours, who put their hands on the heritage which I gave my people Israel: See, I will have them uprooted from their land, uprooting the people of Judah from among them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: And it will come about that, after they have been uprooted, I will again have pity on them; and I will take them back, every man to his heritage and every man to his land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: And it will be that, if they give their minds to learning the ways of my people, using my name in their oaths, By the living Lord; as they have been teaching my people to take oaths by the Baal; then their place will be made certain among my people.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: But if they will not give ear, then I will have that nation uprooted, and given to destruction, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: This is what the Lord said to me: Go and get yourself a linen band and put it round you and do not put it in water.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: So, as the Lord said, I got a band for a price and put it round my body.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: And the word of the Lord came to me a second time, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: Take the band which you got for a price, which is round your body, and go to Parah and put it in a secret place there in a hole of the rock.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: So I went and put it in a secret place by Parah, as the Lord had said to me.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: Then after a long time, the Lord said to me, Up! go to Parah and get the band which I gave you orders to put there.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: So I went to Parah and, uncovering the hole, took the band from the place where I had put it away: and the band was damaged and of no use for anything.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: The Lord has said, In this way I will do damage to the pride of Judah and to the great pride of Jerusalem.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: These evil people who say they will not give ear to my words, who go on in the pride of their hearts and have become servants and worshippers of other gods, will become like this band which is of no use for anything.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: For as a band goes tightly round a man's body, so I made all the people of Israel and all the people of Judah tightly united to me; so that they might be a people for me and a name and a praise and a glory: but they would not give ear.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: So you are to say this word to them: This is the word of the Lord, the God of Israel: Every skin bottle will be full of wine; and they will say to you, Is it not quite clear to us that every skin bottle will be full of wine?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: Then you are to say to them, The Lord has said, I will make all the people of this land, even the kings seated on David's seat, and the priests and the prophets and all the people of Jerusalem, overcome with strong drink.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: I will have them smashed against one another, fathers and sons together, says the Lord: I will have no pity or mercy, I will have no feeling for them to keep me from giving them to destruction.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: Give ear and let your ears be open; be not lifted up: for these are the words of the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: Give glory to the Lord your God, before he makes it dark, and before your feet are slipping on the dark mountains, and, while you are looking for a light, he makes it into deep dark, into black night.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: But if you do not give ear to it, my soul will be weeping in secret for your pride; my eye will be weeping bitterly, streaming with water, because the Lord's flock has been taken away as prisoners.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: Say to the king and to the queen-mother, Make yourselves low, be seated on the earth: for the crown of your glory has come down from your heads.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: The towns of the south are shut up, and there is no one to make them open: Judah is taken away as prisoners; all Judah is taken away as prisoners.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: Let your eyes be lifted up (O Jerusalem), and see those who are coming from the north. Where is the flock which was given to you, your beautiful flock?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: What will you say when he puts over you those whom you yourself have made your friends? will not pains take you like a woman in childbirth?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: And if you say in your heart, Why have these things come on me? because of the number of your sins, your skirts have been uncovered and violent punishment overtakes you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: Is it possible for the skin of the Ethiopian to be changed, or the markings on the leopard? Then it might be possible for you to do good, who have been trained to do evil.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: So I will send them in all directions, as dry grass is taken away by the wind of the waste land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: This is your fate, the part measured out to you by me, says the Lord, because you have put me out of your memory and put your faith in what is false.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 26
text: So I will have your skirts uncovered before your face, in order that your shame may be seen.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 13 Verse 27
text: I have seen your disgusting acts, even your false behaviour and your cries of desire and your loose ways on the hills in the field. Unhappy are you, O Jerusalem, you have no desire to be made clean; how long will you be in turning back to me?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 1
text: The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah when there was no water.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 2
text: Judah is weeping and its doors are dark with sorrow, and people are seated on the earth clothed in black; and the cry of Jerusalem has gone up.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 3
text: Their great men have sent their servants for water: they come to the holes and there is no water to be seen; they come back with nothing in their vessels; they are overcome with shame and fear, covering their heads.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 4
text: Those who do work on the land are in fear, for there has been no rain on the land, and the farmers are shamed, covering their heads.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 5
text: And the roe, giving birth in the field, lets her young one be uncared for, because there is no grass.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 6
text: And the asses of the field on the open hilltops are opening their mouths wide like jackals to get air; their eyes are hollow because there is no grass.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 7
text: Though our sins give witness against us, do something, O Lord, for the honour of your name: for again and again we have been turned away from you, we have done evil against you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 8
text: O you hope of Israel, its saviour in time of trouble, why are you like one who is strange in the land, and like a traveller putting up his tent for a night?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 9
text: Why are you like a man surprised, like a man of war who is not able to give help? but you, O Lord, are with us, and we are named by your name; do not go away from us.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 10
text: This is what the Lord has said about this people: Even so they have been glad to go from the right way; they have not kept their feet from wandering, so the Lord has no pleasure in them; now he will keep their wrongdoing in mind and send punishment for their sins.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 11
text: And the Lord said to me, Make no prayer for this people for their good.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 12
text: When they go without food, I will not give ear to their cry; when they give burned offerings and meal offerings, I will not take pleasure in them: but I will put an end to them by the sword and by need of food and by disease.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 13
text: Then I said, Ah, Lord God! see, the prophets say to them, You will not see the sword or be short of food; but I will give you certain peace in this place.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 14
text: Then the Lord said to me, The prophets say false words in my name, and I gave them no orders, and I said nothing to them: what they say to you is a false vision and wonder-working words without substance, the deceit of their hearts.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 15
text: So this is what the Lord has said about the prophets who make use of my name, though I sent them not, and say, The sword and need of food will not be in this land: the sword and need of food will put an end to those prophets.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 16
text: And the people to whom they are prophets will be pushed out dead into the streets of Jerusalem, because there is no food, and because of the sword; and they will have no one to put their bodies into the earth, them or their wives or their sons or their daughters: for I will let loose their evil-doing on them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 17
text: And you are to say this word to them, Let my eyes be streaming with water night and day, and let it not be stopped; for the virgin daughter of my people is wounded with a great wound, with a very bitter blow.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 18
text: If I go out into the open country, there are those put to death by the sword! and if I go into the town, there are those who are diseased from need of food! for the prophet and the priest go about in the land and have no knowledge.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 19
text: Have you completely given up Judah? is your soul turned in disgust from Zion? why have you given us blows from which there is no one to make us well? we were looking for peace, but no good came; and for a time of well-being, but there was only a great fear.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 20
text: We are conscious, O Lord, of our sin and of the wrongdoing of our fathers: we have done evil against you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 21
text: Do not be turned from us in disgust, because of your name; do not put shame on the seat of your glory: keep us in mind, let not your agreement with us be broken.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 14 Verse 22
text: Are any of the false gods of the nations able to make rain come? are the heavens able to give showers? are you not he, O Lord our God? so we will go on waiting for you, for you have done all these things.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 1
text: Then the Lord said to me, Even if Moses and Samuel came before me, I would have no desire for this people: send them away from before me, and let them go.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 2
text: And it will be, when they say to you, Where are we to go? then you are to say to them, The Lord has said, Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are to be in need of food, to need of food; and such as are to be taken away prisoners, to be taken away.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 3
text: And I will put over them four divisions, says the Lord: the sword causing death, dogs pulling the dead bodies about, and the birds of heaven, and the beasts of the earth to take their bodies for food and put an end to them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 4
text: And I will make them a cause of fear to all the kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh, the son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, and what he did in Jerusalem.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 5
text: For who will have pity on you, O Jerusalem? and who will have sorrow for you? or who will go out of his way to see how you are?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 6
text: You have given me up, says the Lord, you have gone back: so my hand is stretched out against you for your destruction; I am tired of changing my purpose.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 7
text: And I have sent a cleaning wind on them in the public places of the land; I have taken their children from them; I have given my people to destruction; they have not been turned from their ways.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 8
text: I have let their widows be increased in number more than the sand of the seas: I have sent against them, against the mother and the young men, one who makes waste in the heat of the day, causing pain and fears to come on her suddenly.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 9
text: The mother of seven is without strength; her spirit is gone from her, her sun has gone down while it is still day: she has been shamed and overcome: and the rest of them I will give up to the sword before their haters, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 10
text: Sorrow is mine, my mother, because you have given birth to me, a cause of fighting and argument in all the earth! I have not made men my creditors and I am not in debt to any, but every one of them is cursing me.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 12
text: Is it possible for iron to be broken; even iron from the north, and brass?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 13
text: I will give your wealth and your stores to your attackers, without a price, because of all your sins, even in every part of your land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 14
text: They will go away with your haters into a land which is strange to you: for my wrath is on fire with a flame which will be burning on you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 15
text: O Lord, you have knowledge: keep me in mind and come to my help, and give their right reward to those who are attacking me; take me not away, for you are slow to be angry: see how I have undergone shame because of you from all those who make little of your word;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 16
text: But to me your word is a joy, making my heart glad; for I am named by your name, O Lord God of armies.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 17
text: I did not take my seat among the band of those who are glad, and I had no joy; I kept by myself because of your hand; for you have made me full of wrath.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 18
text: Why is my pain unending and my wound without hope of being made well? Sorrow is mine, for you are to me as a stream offering false hope and as waters which are not certain.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 19
text: For this cause the Lord has said, If you will come back, then I will again let you take your place before me; and if you give out what is of value and not that which has no value, you will be as my mouth: let them come back to you, but do not go back to them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 20
text: And I will make you a strong wall of brass to this people; they will be fighting against you, but they will not overcome you: for I am with you to keep you safe, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 15 Verse 21
text: I will keep you safe from the hands of the evil-doers, and I will give you salvation from the hands of the cruel ones.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 1
text: Then again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 2
text: You are not to take a wife for yourself or have sons or daughters in this place.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 3
text: For this is what the Lord has said about the sons and daughters who come to birth in this place, and about their mothers who have given them birth, and about their fathers who have given life to them in this land:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 4
text: Death from evil diseases will overtake them; there will be no weeping for them and their bodies will not be put to rest; they will be like waste on the face of the earth: the sword and need of food will put an end to them; their dead bodies will be meat for the birds of heaven and for the beasts of the earth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 5
text: For this is what the Lord has said: Do not go into the house of sorrow, do not go to make weeping or songs of grief for them: for I have taken away my peace from this people, says the Lord, even mercy and pity.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 6
text: Death will overtake great as well as small in the land: their bodies will not be put in a resting-place, and no one will be weeping for them or wounding themselves or cutting off their hair for them:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 7
text: No one will make a feast for them in sorrow, to give them comfort for the dead, or put to their lips the cup of comfort on account of their father or their mother.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 8
text: And you are not to go into the house of feasting, or be seated with them to take food or drink.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 9
text: For the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said, See, before your eyes and in your days I will put an end in this place to the laughing voices and the voice of joy; to the voice of the newly-married man and the voice of the bride.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 10
text: And it will be, that when you say all these words to the people, then they will say to you, Why has the Lord done all this evil against us? what is our wrongdoing and what is our sin which we have done against the Lord our God?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 11
text: Then you will say to them, Because your fathers have given me up, says the Lord, and have gone after other gods and become their servants and their worshippers, and have given me up and have not kept my law;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 12
text: And you have done worse evil than your fathers; for see, every one of you is guided by the pride of his evil heart, so as not to give ear to me:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 13
text: For this reason I will send you away out of this land into a land which is strange to you, to you and to your fathers; there you will be the servants of other gods day and night, and you will have no mercy from me.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 14
text: For this cause, see, the days are coming, says the Lord, when it will no longer be said, By the living Lord, who took the children of Israel up out of the land of Egypt.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 15
text: But, By the living Lord, who took the children of Israel up out of the land of the north, and from all the countries where he had sent them: and I will take them back again to their land which I gave to their fathers.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 16
text: See, I will send for great numbers of fishermen, says the Lord, and they will take them like fish in a net; and after that, I will send for numbers of bowmen, and they will go after them, driving them from every mountain and from every hill, and out of the holes of the rocks.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 17
text: For my eyes are on all their ways: there is no cover for them from my face, and their evil-doing is not kept secret from my eyes.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 18
text: And I will give them the reward of their evil-doing and their sin twice over; because they have made my land unclean, and have made my heritage full of the bodies of their unholy and disgusting things.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 19
text: O Lord, my strength and my strong tower, my safe place in the day of trouble, the nations will come to you from the ends of the earth, and say, The heritage of our fathers is nothing but deceit, even false things in which there is no profit.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 20
text: Will a man make for himself gods which are no gods?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 16 Verse 21
text: For this reason, truly, I will make them see, this once I will give them knowledge of my hand and my power; and they will be certain that my name is the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 1
text: The sin of Judah is recorded with a pen of iron, and with the sharp point of a jewel it is cut on their hearts of stone, and on the horns of their altars for a sign to them:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 2
text: Their altars and their wood pillars under every branching tree, on the high hills and the mountains in the field.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 3
text: I will give your wealth and all your stores to be taken away in war without a price, because of your sins in every part of your land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 4
text: And your hand will have to let go your heritage which I gave you; and I will make you a servant to your haters in a land which is strange to you: for you have put my wrath on fire with a flame which will go on burning for ever.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 5
text: This is what the Lord has said: Cursed is the man who puts his faith in man, and makes flesh his arm, and whose heart is turned away from the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 6
text: For he will be like the brushwood in the upland, and will not see when good comes; but his living-place will be in the dry places in the waste land, in a salt and unpeopled land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 7
text: A blessing is on the man who puts his faith in the Lord, and whose hope the Lord is.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 8
text: For he will be like a tree planted by the waters, pushing out its roots by the stream; he will have no fear when the heat comes, but his leaf will be green; in a dry year he will have no care, and will go on giving fruit.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 9
text: The heart is a twisted thing, not to be searched out by man: who is able to have knowledge of it?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 10
text: I the Lord am the searcher of the heart, the tester of the thoughts, so that I may give to every man the reward of his ways, in keeping with the fruit of his doings.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 11
text: Like the partridge, getting eggs together but not producing young, is a man who gets wealth but not by right; before half his days are ended, it will go from him, and at his end he will be foolish.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 12
text: A seat of glory, placed on high from the first, is our holy place.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 13
text: O Lord, the hope of Israel, all who give you up will be put to shame; those who go away from you will be cut off from the earth, because they have given up the Lord, the fountain of living waters.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 14
text: Make me well, O Lord, and I will be well; be my saviour, and I will be safe: for you are my hope.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 15
text: See, they say to me, Where is the word of the Lord? let it come now.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 16
text: As for me, I have not said; Let the day of trouble come to them quickly; and I have not been hoping for the death-giving day; you have knowledge of what came from my lips; it was open before you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 17
text: Be not a cause of fear to me: you are my safe place in the day of evil.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 18
text: Let them be put to shame who are attacking me, but let me not be shamed; let them be overcome with fear, but let me not be overcome: send on them the day of evil, and put them to destruction twice over.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 19
text: This is what the Lord has said to me: Go and take your place in the doorway of Benjamin, where the kings of Judah come in and by which they go out, and in all the doorways of Jerusalem;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 20
text: And say to them, Give ear to the word of the Lord, you kings of Judah, and all the people of Jerusalem who come in by these doors:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 21
text: This is what the Lord has said: See to yourselves, that you take up no weight on the Sabbath day, or take it in through the doors of Jerusalem;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 22
text: And take no weight out of your houses on the Sabbath day, or do any work, but keep the Sabbath day holy, as I gave orders to your fathers;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 23
text: But they gave no attention and would not give ear, but they made their necks stiff so that they might not give ear and might not get teaching.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 24
text: And it will be, that if with all care you give ear to me, says the Lord, and take no weight through the doorways of this town on the Sabbath day, but keep the Sabbath day holy and do no work in it;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 25
text: Then through the doors of this town there will come kings and princes, seated on the seat of David, going in carriages and on horseback, they and their princes, and the men of Judah and the people of Jerusalem: and this town will keep its place for ever.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 26
text: And they will come from the towns of Judah, and from the places round about Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin, and from the lowlands, and from the mountains, and from the South, with burned offerings and offerings of beasts and meal offerings and perfume and offerings of praise, to the house of the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 17 Verse 27
text: But if you do not give ear to me, to keep the Sabbath day holy, and to let no weight be lifted and taken through the doors of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day: then I will put a fire in its doorways, burning up the great houses of Jerusalem, and it will never be put out.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 1
text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 2
text: Up! go down to the potter's house, and there I will let my words come to your ears.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 3
text: Then I went down to the potter's house, and he was doing his work on the stones.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 4
text: And when the vessel, which he was forming out of earth, got damaged in the hand of the potter, he made it again into another vessel, as it seemed good to the potter to make it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 5
text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 6
text: O Israel, am I not able to do with you as this potter does? says the Lord. See, like earth in the potter's hand are you in my hands, O Israel.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 7
text: Whenever I say anything about uprooting a nation or a kingdom, and smashing it and sending destruction on it;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 8
text: If, in that very minute, that nation of which I was talking is turned away from its evil, my purpose of doing evil to them will be changed.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 9
text: And whenever I say anything about building up a nation or a kingdom, and planting it;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 10
text: If, in that very minute, it does evil in my eyes, going against my orders, then my good purpose, which I said I would do for them, will be changed.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 11
text: Now, then, say to the men of Judah and to the people of Jerusalem, This is what the Lord has said: See, I am forming an evil thing against you, and designing a design against you: let every man come back now from his evil way, and let your ways and your doings be changed for the better.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 12
text: But they will say, There is no hope: we will go on in our designs, and every one of us will do what he is moved by the pride of his evil heart to do.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 13
text: So this is what the Lord has said: Make search among the nations and see who has had word of such things; the virgin of Israel has done a very shocking thing.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 14
text: Will the white snow go away from the top of Sirion? will the cold waters flowing from the mountains become dry?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 15
text: For my people have put me out of their memory, burning perfumes to that which is nothing; and because of this, I will put a cause of falling in their ways, even in the old roads, and will make them go on side-roads, in a way not lifted up;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 16
text: Making their land a thing of wonder, causing sounds of surprise for ever; everyone who goes by will be overcome with wonder, shaking his head.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 17
text: I will send them in flight, as from an east wind, before the attacker; I will let them see my back and not my face on the day of their downfall.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 18
text: Then they said, Come, let us make a design against Jeremiah; for teaching will never be cut off from the priest, or wisdom from the wise, or the word from the prophet. Come, let us make use of his words for an attack on him, and let us give attention with care to what he says.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 19
text: Give thought to me, O Lord, and give ear to the voice of those who put forward a cause against me.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 20
text: Is evil to be the reward of good? for they have made a deep hole for my soul. Keep in mind how I took my place before you, to say a good word for them so that your wrath might be turned away from them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 21
text: For this cause, let their children be without food, and give them over to the power of the sword; and let their wives be without children and become widows; let their men be overtaken by death, and their young men be put to the sword in the fight.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 22
text: Let a cry for help go up from their houses, when you send an armed band on them suddenly: for they have made a hole in which to take me, and have put nets for my feet secretly.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 18 Verse 23
text: But you, Lord, have knowledge of all the designs which they have made against my life; let not their evil-doing be covered or their sin be washed away from before your eyes: but let it be a cause of falling before you: so do to them in the time of your wrath.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 1
text: This is what the Lord has said: Go and get for money a potter's bottle made of earth, and take with you some of the responsible men of the people and of the priests;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 2
text: And go out to the valley of the son of Hinnom, by the way into the door of broken pots, and there say in a loud voice the words which I will give you;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 3
text: Say, Give ear to the word of the Lord, O kings of Judah and people of Jerusalem; the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said, See, I will send evil on this place which will be bitter to the ears of anyone hearing of it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 4
text: Because they have given me up, and made this place a strange place, burning perfumes in it to other gods, of whom they and their fathers and the kings of Judah had no knowledge; and they have made this place full of the blood of those who have done no wrong;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 5
text: And they have put up the high places of the Baal, burning their sons in the fire; a thing which was not ordered by me, and it was never in my mind:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 6
text: For this cause, see, a time is coming, says the Lord, when this place will no longer be named Topheth, or, The valley of the son of Hinnom, but, The valley of Death.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 7
text: I will make the purpose of Judah and Jerusalem come to nothing in this place; I will have them put to the sword by their haters, and by the hands of those who have designs on their life; and their dead bodies I will give to be food for the birds of heaven and the beasts of the earth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 8
text: And I will make this town a thing of wonder and a cause of surprise; everyone who goes by will be overcome with wonder and make sounds of surprise, because of all its troubles.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 9
text: I will make them take the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters for food, they will be making a meal of one another, because of their bitter need and the cruel grip of their haters and those who have made designs against their life.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 10
text: Then let the potter's bottle be broken before the eyes of the men who have gone with you,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 11
text: And say to them, This is what the Lord of armies has said: Even so will this people and this town be broken by me, as a potter's bottle is broken and may not be put together again: and the bodies of the dead will be put in the earth in Topheth, till there is no more room.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 12
text: This is what I will do to this place, says the Lord, and to its people, making this town like Topheth:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 13
text: And the houses of Jerusalem, and the houses of the kings of Judah, which they have made unclean, will be like the place of Topheth, even all the houses on whose roofs perfumes have been burned to all the army of heaven, and drink offerings drained out to other gods.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 14
text: Then Jeremiah came from Topheth, where the Lord had sent him to give the prophet's word; and he took his place in the open square of the Lord's house, and said to all the people,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 19 Verse 15
text: The Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: See, I will send on this town and on all her towns all the evil which I have said; because they made their necks stiff, so that they might not give ear to my words.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 1
text: Now it came to the ears of Pashhur, the son of Immer the priest, who was chief in authority in the house of the Lord, that Jeremiah was saying these things;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 2
text: And Pashhur gave blows to Jeremiah and had his feet chained in a framework of wood in the higher doorway of Benjamin, which was in the house of the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 3
text: Then on the day after, Pashhur let Jeremiah loose. Then Jeremiah said to him, The Lord has given you the name of Magor-missabib (Cause-of-fear-on-every-side), not Pashhur.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 4
text: For the Lord has said, See, I will make you a cause of fear to yourself and to all your friends: they will come to their death by the sword of their haters, and your eyes will see it: and I will give all Judah into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he will take them away prisoners into Babylon and put them to the sword.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 5
text: And more than this, I will give all the wealth of this town and all its profits and all its things of value, even all the stores of the kings of Judah will I give into the hands of their haters, who will put violent hands on them and take them away to Babylon.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 6
text: And you, Pashhur, and all who are in your house, will go away prisoners: you will come to Babylon, and there your body will be put to rest, you and all your friends, to whom you said false words.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 7
text: O Lord, you have been false to me, and I was tricked; you are stronger than I, and have overcome me: I have become a thing to be laughed at all the day, everyone makes sport of me.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 8
text: For every word I say is a cry for help; I say with a loud voice, Violent behaviour and wasting: because the word of the Lord is made a shame to me and a cause of laughing all the day.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 9
text: And if I say, I will not keep him in mind, I will not say another word in his name; then it is in my heart like a burning fire shut up in my bones, and I am tired of keeping myself in, I am not able to do it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 10
text: For numbers of them say evil secretly in my hearing (there is fear on every side): they say, Come, let us give witness against him; all my nearest friends, who are watching for my fall, say, It may be that he will be taken by deceit, and we will get the better of him and give him punishment.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 11
text: But the Lord is with me as a great one, greatly to be feared: so my attackers will have a fall, and they will not overcome me: they will be greatly shamed, because they have not done wisely, even with an unending shame, kept in memory for ever.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 12
text: But, O Lord of armies, testing the upright and seeing the thoughts and the heart, let me see your punishment come on them; for I have put my cause before you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 13
text: Make melody to the Lord, give praise to the Lord: for he has made the soul of the poor man free from the hands of the evil-doers.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 14
text: A curse on the day of my birth: let there be no blessing on the day when my mother had me.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 15
text: A curse on the man who gave the news to my father, saying, You have a male child; making him very glad.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 16
text: May that man be like the towns overturned by the Lord without mercy: let a cry for help come to his ears in the morning, and the sound of war in the middle of the day;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 17
text: Because he did not put me to death before my birth took place: so my mother's body would have been my last resting-place, and she would have been with child for ever.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 20 Verse 18
text: Why did I come from my mother's body to see pain and sorrow, so that my days might be wasted with shame?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 1
text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur, the son of Malchiah, and Zephaniah, the son of Maaseiah the priest, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 2
text: Will you get directions from the Lord for us; for Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, is making war against us; it may be that the Lord will do something for us like all the wonders he has done, and make him go away from us.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 3
text: Then Jeremiah said to them, This is what you are to say to Zedekiah:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 4
text: The Lord God of Israel has said, See, I am turning back the instruments of war in your hands, with which you are fighting against the king of Babylon and the Chaldaeans, who are outside the walls and shutting you in; and I will get them together inside this town.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 5
text: And I myself will be fighting against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even with angry feeling and passion and in great wrath.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 6
text: And I will send a great disease on the people living in this town, on man and on beast, causing their death.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 7
text: And after that, says the Lord, I will give up Zedekiah, king of Judah, and his servants and his people, even those in the town who have not come to their end from the disease and the sword and from need of food, into the hands of Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, and into the hands of their haters, and into the hands of those desiring their death: he will put them to the sword; he will not let anyone get away, he will have no pity or mercy.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 8
text: And to this people you are to say, The Lord has said, See, I put before you the way of life and the way of death.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 9
text: He who keeps in this town will come to his death by the sword and through need of food and through disease; but he who goes out and gives himself up to the Chaldaeans who are shutting you in, will go on living, and will keep his life safe.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 10
text: For my face is turned to this town for evil and not for good, says the Lord: it will be given into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he will have it burned with fire.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 11
text: About the family of the king of Judah. Give ear to the word of the Lord;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 12
text: O family of David, this is what the Lord has said: Do what is right in the morning, and make free from the hands of the cruel one him whose goods have been violently taken away, or my wrath will go out like fire, burning so that no one may put it out, because of the evil of your doings.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 13
text: See, I am against you, you who are living on the rock of the valley, says the Lord; you who say, Who will come down against us? or who will get into our houses?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 21 Verse 14
text: I will send punishment on you in keeping with the fruit of your doings, says the Lord: and I will put a fire in her woodlands, burning up everything round about her.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 1
text: This is what the Lord has said: Go down to the house of the king of Judah and there give him this word,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 2
text: And say, Give ear to the word of the Lord, O king of Judah, seated on the seat of David, you and your servants and your people who come in by these doors.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 3
text: This is what the Lord has said: Do what is right, judging uprightly, and make free from the hands of the cruel one him whose goods have been violently taken away: do no wrong and be not violent to the man from a strange country and the child without a father and the widow, and let not those who have done no wrong be put to death in this place.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 4
text: For if you truly do this, then there will come in through the doors of this house kings seated on the seat of David, going in carriages and on horseback, he and his servants and his people

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 5
text: But if you do not give ear to these words, I give you my oath by myself, says the Lord, that this house will become a waste.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 6
text: For this is what the Lord has said about the family of the king of Judah: You are Gilead to me, and the top of Lebanon: but, truly, I will make you waste, with towns unpeopled.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 7
text: And I will make ready those who will send destruction on you, everyone armed for war: by them your best cedar-trees will be cut down and put in the fire.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 8
text: And nations from all sides will go past this town, and every man will say to his neighbour, Why has the Lord done such things to this great town?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 9
text: And they will say, Because they gave up the agreement of the Lord their God, and became worshippers and servants of other gods.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 10
text: Let there be no weeping for the dead, and make no songs of grief for him: but make bitter weeping for him who has gone away, for he will never come back or see again the country of his birth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 11
text: For this is what the Lord has said about Shallum, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who became king in place of Josiah his father, who went out from this place: He will never come back there again:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 12
text: But death will come to him in the place where they have taken him away prisoner, and he will never see this land again.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 13
text: A curse is on him who is building his house by wrongdoing, and his rooms by doing what is not right; who makes use of his neighbour without payment, and gives him nothing for his work;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 14
text: Who says, I will make a wide house for myself, and rooms of great size, and has windows cut out, and has it roofed with cedar and painted with bright red.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 15
text: Are you to be a king because you make more use of cedar than your father? did not your father take food and drink and do right, judging in righteousness, and then it was well for him?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 16
text: He was judge in the cause of the poor and those in need; then it was well. Was not this to have knowledge of me? says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 17
text: But your eyes and your heart are fixed only on profit for yourself, on causing the death of him who has done no wrong, and on violent and cruel acts.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 18
text: So this is what the Lord has said about Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, king of Judah: They will make no weeping for him, saying, Ah my brother! or, Ah sister! they will make no weeping for him, saying, Ah lord! or, Ah his glory!

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 19
text: They will do to him what they do to the dead body of an ass; his body will be pulled out and placed on the earth outside the doors of Jerusalem.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 20
text: Go up to Lebanon and give a cry; let your voice be loud in Bashan, crying out from Abarim; for all your lovers have come to destruction

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 21
text: My word came to you in the time of your well-being; but you said, I will not give ear. This has been your way from your earliest years, you did not give attention to my voice.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 22
text: All the keepers of your sheep will be food for the wind, and your lovers will be taken away prisoners: truly, then you will be shamed and unhonoured because of all your evil-doing.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 23
text: O you who are living in Lebanon, making your living-place in the cedars, how greatly to be pitied will you be when pains come on you, as on a woman in childbirth!

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 24
text: By my life, says the Lord, even if Coniah, the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, was the ring on my right hand, even from there I would have you pulled off;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 25
text: And I will give you into the hands of those desiring your death, and into the hands of those whom you are fearing, even into the hands of Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, and into the hands of the Chaldaeans.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 26
text: I will send you out, and your mother who gave you birth, into another country not the land of your birth; and there death will come to you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 27
text: But to the land on which their soul's desire is fixed, they will never come back.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 28
text: Is this man Coniah a broken vessel of no value? is he a vessel in which there is no pleasure? why are they violently sent out, he and his seed, into a land which is strange to them?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 29
text: O earth, earth, earth, give ear to the word of the Lord!

title: Jeremiah Chapter 22 Verse 30
text: The Lord has said, Let this man be recorded as having no children, a man who will not do well in all his life: for no man of his seed will do well, seated on the seat of the kingdom of David and ruling again in Judah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 1
text: A curse is on the keepers who are causing the destruction and loss of the sheep of my field, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 2
text: So this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said against the keepers who have the care of my people: You have let my flock be broken up, driving them away and not caring for them; see, I will send on you the punishment for the evil of your doings, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 3
text: And I will get the rest of my flock together from all the countries where I have sent them, and will make them come back again to their resting-place; and they will have offspring and be increased.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 4
text: And I will put over them keepers who will take care of them: never again will they be overcome with fear or be troubled, and there will not be the loss of one of them, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 5
text: See, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will give to David a true Branch, and he will be ruling as king, acting wisely, doing what is right, and judging uprightly in the land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 6
text: In his days Judah will have salvation and Israel will be living without fear: and this is the name by which he will be named, The Lord is our righteousness.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 7
text: And so, truly, the days are coming when they will say no longer, By the living Lord, who took the children of Israel up out of the land of Egypt;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 8
text: But, By the living Lord, who took up the seed of Israel, and made them come out of the north country, and from all the countries where I had sent them; and they will be living in the land which is theirs.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 9
text: About the prophets. My heart is broken in me, all my bones are shaking; I am like a man full of strong drink, like a man overcome by wine; because of the Lord, and because of his holy words.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 10
text: For the land is full of men who are untrue to their wives; because of the curse the land is full of grief; the green fields of the waste land have become dry; and they are quick to do evil, their strength is for what is not right.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 11
text: For the prophet as well as the priest is unclean; even in my house I have seen their evil-doing, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 12
text: For this cause their steps will be slipping on their way: they will be forced on into the dark and have a fall there: for I will send evil on them in the year of their punishment, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 13
text: And I have seen ways without sense in the prophets of Samaria; they became prophets of the Baal, causing my people Israel to go wrong.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 14
text: And in the prophets of Jerusalem I have seen a shocking thing; they are untrue to their wives, walking in deceit, and they make strong the hands of evil-doers, so that a man may not be turned back from his evil-doing: they have all become like Sodom to me, and its people like Gomorrah.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 15
text: So this is what the Lord of armies has said about the prophets: See, I will give them a bitter plant for their food, and bitter water for their drink: for from the prophets of Jerusalem unclean behaviour has gone out into all the land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 16
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: Do not give ear to the words which the prophets say to you: they give you teaching of no value: it is from themselves that their vision comes, and not out of the mouth of the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 17
text: They keep on saying to those who have no respect for the word of the Lord, You will have peace; and to everyone who goes on his way in the pride of his heart, they say, No evil will come to you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 18
text: For which of them has knowledge of the secret of the Lord, and has seen him, and given ear to his word? which of them has taken note of his word and given attention to it?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 19
text: See, the storm-wind of the Lord, even the heat of his wrath, has gone out, a rolling storm, bursting on the heads of the evil-doers.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 20
text: The wrath of the Lord will not be turned back till he has done, till he has put into effect, the purposes of his heart: in days to come you will have full knowledge of this.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 21
text: I did not send these prophets, but they went running: I said nothing to them, but they gave out the prophet's word.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 22
text: But if they had been in my secret, then they would have made my people give ear to my words, turning them from their evil way, and from the evil of their doings.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 23
text: Am I only a God who is near, says the Lord, and not a God at a distance?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 24
text: In what secret place may a man take cover without my seeing him? says the Lord. Is there any place in heaven or earth where I am not? says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 25
text: My ears have been open to what the prophets have said, who say false words in my name, saying, I have had a dream, I have had a dream, I have had a dream,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 26
text: Is (my word) in the hearts of the prophets who give out false words, even the prophets of the deceit of their hearts?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 27
text: Whose purpose is to take away the memory of my name from my people by their dreams, of which every man is talking to his neighbour, as their fathers gave up the memory of my name for the Baal.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 28
text: If a prophet has a dream, let him give out his dream; and he who has my word, let him give out my word in good faith. What has the dry stem to do with the grain? says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 29
text: Is not my word like fire? says the Lord; and like a hammer, smashing the rock to bits?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 30
text: For this cause I am against the prophets, says the Lord, who take my words, every one from his neighbour.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 31
text: See, I am against the prophets, says the Lord, who let their tongues say, He has said.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 32
text: See, I am against the prophets of false dreams, says the Lord, who give them out and make my people go out of the way by their deceit and their uncontrolled words: but I did not send them or give them orders; and they will be of no profit to this people, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 33
text: And if this people, or the prophet, or a priest, questioning you, says, What word of weight is there from the Lord? then you are to say to them, You are the word, for I will not be troubled with you any more, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 34
text: And as for the prophet and the priest and the people who say, A word of weight from the Lord! I will send punishment on that man and on his house.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 35
text: But this is what you are to say, every man to his neighbour and every man to his brother, What answer has the Lord given? and, What has the Lord said?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 36
text: And you will no longer put people in mind of the word of weight of the Lord: for every man's word will be a weight on himself; for the words of the living God, of the Lord of armies, our God, have been twisted by you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 37
text: This is what you are to say to the prophet, What answer has the Lord given to you? and, What has the Lord said?

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 38
text: But if you say, The word of weight of the Lord; this is what the Lord has said: Because you say, The weight of the Lord, and I have sent to you, saying, You are not to say, The weight of the Lord;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 39
text: For this reason, truly, I will put you completely out of my memory, and I will put you, and the town which I gave to you and to your fathers, away from before my face:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 23 Verse 40
text: And I will give you a name without honour for ever, and unending shame which will never go from the memory of men.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 24 Verse 1
text: The Lord gave me a vision, and I saw two baskets full of figs put in front of the Temple of the Lord, after Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, had taken prisoner Jeconiah, the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the chiefs of Judah, and the expert workmen and metal-workers from Jerusalem, and had taken them to Babylon.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 24 Verse 2
text: One basket had very good figs, like the figs which first come to growth: and the other basket had very bad figs, so bad that they were of no use for food.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 24 Verse 3
text: Then the Lord said to me, What do you see, Jeremiah? And I said, Figs; the good figs are very good, and the bad very bad, and of no use for food, they are so bad.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 24 Verse 4
text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 24 Verse 5
text: This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said: Like these good figs, so in my eyes will be the prisoners of Judah, whom I have sent from this place into the land of the Chaldaeans for their good.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 24 Verse 6
text: For I will keep my eyes on them for good, and I will take them back again to this land, building them up and not pulling them down, planting them and not uprooting them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 24 Verse 7
text: And I will give them a heart to have knowledge of me, that I am the Lord: and they will be my people, and I will be their God: for they will come back to me with all their heart.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 24 Verse 8
text: And like the bad figs which are so bad that they are of no use for food, so I will give up Zedekiah, king of Judah, and his chiefs and the rest of Jerusalem who are still in this land, and those who are in the land of Egypt:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 24 Verse 9
text: I will give them up to be a cause of fear and of trouble among all the kingdoms of the earth; to be a name of shame and common talk and a cutting word and a curse in all the places wherever I will send them wandering.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 24 Verse 10
text: And I will send the sword, and need of food, and disease, among them till they are all cut off from the land which I gave to them and to their fathers.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 1
text: The word which came to Jeremiah about all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah king of Judah; this was the first year of Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 2
text: This word Jeremiah gave out to all the people of Judah and to those living in Jerusalem, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 3
text: From the thirteenth year of Josiah, the son of Amon, king of Judah, even till this day, for twenty-three years, the word of the Lord has been coming to me, and I have given it to you, getting up early and talking to you; but you have not given ear.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 4
text: And the Lord has sent to you all his servants the prophets, getting up early and sending them; but you have not given attention and your ear has not been open to give hearing;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 5
text: Saying, Come back now, everyone from his evil way and from the evil of your doings, and keep your place in the land which the Lord has given to you and to your fathers, from times long past even for ever:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 6
text: Do not go after other gods to be their servants and to give them worship, and do not make me angry with the work of your hands, causing evil to yourselves.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 7
text: But you have not given ear to me, says the Lord; so that you have made me angry with the work of your hands, causing evil to yourselves.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 8
text: So this is what the Lord of armies has said: Because you have not given ear to my words,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 9
text: See, I will send and take all the families of the north, says the Lord, and Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, my servant, and make them come against this land, and against its people, and against all these nations on every side; and I will give them up to complete destruction, and make them a cause of fear and surprise and a waste place for ever.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 10
text: And more than this, I will take from them the sound of laughing voices, the voice of joy, the voice of the newly-married man, and the voice of the bride, the sound of the stones crushing the grain, and the shining of lights.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 11
text: All this land will be a waste and a cause of wonder; and these nations will be the servants of the king of Babylon for seventy years.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 12
text: And it will come about, after seventy years are ended, that I will send punishment on the king of Babylon, and on that nation, says the Lord, for their evil-doing, and on the land of the Chaldaeans; and I will make it a waste for ever.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 13
text: And I will make that land undergo everything I have said against it, even everything recorded in this book, which Jeremiah the prophet has said against all the nations.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 14
text: For a number of nations and great kings will make servants of them, even of them: and I will give them the reward of their acts, even the reward of the work of their hands.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 15
text: For this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said to me: Take the cup of the wine of this wrath from my hand, and make all the nations to whom I send you take of it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 16
text: And after drinking it, they will go rolling from side to side, and be off their heads, because of the sword which I will send among them.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 17
text: Then I took the cup from the Lord's hand, and gave a drink from it to all the nations to whom the Lord sent me;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 18
text: Jerusalem and the towns of Judah and their kings and their princes, to make them a waste place, a cause of fear and surprise and a curse, as it is this day;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 19
text: Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and his servants and his princes and all his people;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 20
text: And all the mixed people and all the kings of the land of Uz, and all the kings of the land of the Philistines, and Ashkelon and Gaza and Ekron and the rest of Ashdod;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 21
text: Edom and Moab and the children of Ammon,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 22
text: And all the kings of Tyre, and all the kings of Zidon, and the kings of the lands across the sea;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 23
text: Dedan and Tema and Buz, and all who have the ends of their hair cut;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 24
text: And all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mixed people living in the waste land;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 25
text: And all the kings of Zimri, and all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 26
text: And all the kings of the north, far and near, one with another; and all the kingdoms of the world on the face of the earth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 27
text: And you are to say to them, This is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: Take of this cup and be overcome, and let it come out again from your lips, and from your fall you will never be lifted up again, because of the sword which I will send among you.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 28
text: And it will be, if they will not take of the cup in your hand, then you are to say to them, This is what the Lord of armies has said: You will certainly take of it.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 29
text: For see, I am starting to send evil on the town which is named by my name, and are you to be without any punishment? You will not be without punishment: for I will send a sword on all people living on the earth, says the Lord of armies.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 30
text: So, as a prophet, give out these words among them, and say to them, The voice of the Lord will be sounding like a lion from on high; he will send out his voice from his holy place, like the loud voice of a lion, against his flock; he will give a cry, like those who are crushing the grapes, against all the people of the earth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 31
text: A noise will come, even to the end of the earth; for the Lord has a cause against the nations, he will give his decision against all flesh; as for the evil-doers, he will give them to the sword, says the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 32
text: This is what the Lord of armies has said: See, evil is going out from nation to nation, and a great storm will come up from the inmost parts of the earth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 33
text: And at that day, the bodies of those whom the Lord has put to death will be seen from one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth: there will be no weeping for them, their bodies will not be taken up or put to rest in the earth; they will be like waste on the face of the land.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 34
text: Give cries of grief, you keepers of sheep; give cries for help, rolling yourselves in the dust, you chiefs of the flock: for the days of your destruction have fully come, and I will send you in all directions, and your fall will be like that of the males of the flock.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 35
text: There will be no way of flight for the keepers of sheep, no road for the chiefs of the flock to get away safely.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 36
text: A sound of the cry of the keepers of sheep, and the bitter crying of the chiefs of the flock! for the Lord has made waste their green fields.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 37
text: And there is no sound in the fields of peace, because of the burning wrath of the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 25 Verse 38
text: The lion has come out of his secret place, for the land has become a waste because of the cruel sword, and because of the heat of his wrath.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 1
text: When Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, first became king, this word came from the Lord, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 2
text: This is what the Lord has said: Take your place in the open square of the Lord's house and say to all the towns of Judah, who come into the Lord's house for worship, everything I give you orders to say to them: keep back not a word;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 3
text: It may be that they will give ear, and that every man will be turned from his evil way, so that my purpose of sending evil on them because of the evil of their doings may be changed.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 4
text: And you are to say to them, This is what the Lord has said: If you do not give ear to me and go in the way of my law which I have put before you,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 5
text: And give ear to the words of my servants the prophets whom I send to you, getting up early and sending them, though you gave no attention;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 6
text: Then I will make this house like Shiloh, and will make this town a curse to all the nations of the earth.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 7
text: And in the hearing of the priests and the prophets and all the people, Jeremiah said these words in the house of the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 8
text: Now, when Jeremiah had come to the end of saying everything the Lord had given him orders to say to all the people, the priests and the prophets and all the people took him by force, saying, Death will certainly be your fate.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 9
text: Why have you said in the name of the Lord, This house will be like Shiloh, and this land a waste with no one living in it? And all the people had come together to Jeremiah in the house of the Lord.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 10
text: And the rulers of Judah, hearing of these things, came up from the king's house to the house of the Lord, and took their seats by the new door of the Lord's house.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 11
text: Then the priests and the prophets said to the rulers and to all the people, The right fate for this man is death; for he has said words against this town in your hearing.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 12
text: Then Jeremiah said to all the rulers and to all the people, The Lord has sent me as his prophet to say against this house and against this town all the words which have come to your ears.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 13
text: So now, make a change for the better in your ways and your doings, and give ear to the voice of the Lord your God; then the Lord will let himself be turned from the decision he has made against you for evil.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 14
text: As for me, here I am in your hands: do with me whatever seems good and right in your opinion.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 15
text: Only be certain that, if you put me to death, you will make yourselves and your town and its people responsible for the blood of one who has done no wrong: for truly, the Lord has sent me to you to say all these words in your ears.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 16
text: Then the rulers and all the people said to the priests and the prophets, It is not right for this man to be put to death: for he has said words to us in the name of the Lord our God.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 17
text: Then some of the responsible men of the land got up and said to all the meeting of the people,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 18
text: Micah the Morashtite, who was a prophet in the days of Hezekiah, king of Judah, said to all the people of Judah, This is what the Lord of armies has said: Zion will become like a ploughed field, and Jerusalem will become a mass of broken walls, and the mountain of the house like the high places of the woodland.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 19
text: Did Hezekiah and all Judah put him to death? did he not in the fear of the Lord make prayer for the grace of the Lord, and the Lord let himself be turned from the decision he had made against them for evil? By this act we might do great evil against ourselves.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 20
text: And there was another man who was a prophet of the Lord, Uriah, the son of Shemaiah of Kiriath-jearim; he said against this town and against this land all the words which Jeremiah had said:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 21
text: And when his words came to the ears of Jehoiakim the king and all his men of war and his captains, the king would have put him to death; but Uriah, hearing of it, was full of fear and went in flight into Egypt:

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 22
text: And Jehoiakim the king sent Elnathan, the son of Achbor, and certain men with him, into Egypt.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 23
text: And they took Uriah out of Egypt and came back with him to Jehoiakim the king; who put him to death with the sword, and had his dead body put into the resting-place of the bodies of the common people.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 26 Verse 24
text: But Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, gave Jeremiah his help, so that he was not given into the hands of the people to be put to death.

title: Jeremiah Chapter 27 Verse 1
text: When Zedekiah, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, first became king this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

title: Jeremiah Chapter 27 Verse 2
text: This is what the Lord has said to me: Make for yourself bands and yokes and put them on your neck;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 27 Verse 3
text: And send them to the king of Edom, and to the king of Moab, and to the king of the children of Ammon, and to the king of Tyre, and to the king of Zidon, by their servants who come to Jerusalem, to Zedekiah, king of Judah;

title: Jeremiah Chapter 27 Verse 4
